column4: Wonderful place to visit with interesting events, such as Canada Day, the Christmas light show and many more, happening throughout the year. In the heart of downtown Ottawa, it is easily accessible and worth spending time to enjoy.

An excellent option for people of all ages and interests. For people interested in history, art, architecture, woodcraft, government, geology, bibliophiles and for kids to see where real government happens. I've enjoyed every tour I've taken over the years. The guides are very knowledgable and each tour seems different.
you need to lineup early in the morning for tour tickets. we were there during march break. a bit of a zoo
Our visit to Parliament Hill was inspiring. It is definitely worth taking the time to go for the tour and walk around the grounds.

The tour of the parliament building is fantastic. Our guide was very knowledgeable. The building itself is amazing. The view from the peace tower was stunning, although I guess the clear blue skies helped on that front

I have a personal fondness for Parliament, having worked inside for 25 years. I just feel the history, who has been in those halls, those rooms. What laws have been discussed and passed in that building. Making a better Canada. Every kid should visit, in hushed awe!

Parliament Hill is a limestone outcrop measuring 88,480 square meters on the southern banks of the Ottawa River in downtown Ottawa and home to the Parliament of Canada. Originally, the site of a military base in the 18th and early 19th centuries, redevelopment of the Crown land began in 1859 after Queen Victoria chose Bytown as the capital of the...
It was wonderful to take the teenagers to the hill to see the buildings in person. They really enjoyed felt like part of our nation!
The parliament is wonderful with allot of history and you learn allot about how the government is run and see the actual house floor and go behind the scenes. The gift shop is amazing also.

When visiting Ottawa you must visit the Parliament Buildings just because it is so massive. The artwork and time that went into building this is incredible. You can take a free tour of the inside which is interesting but just standing outside and looking at the grounds is worth the visit.

Kids fought us to not go on the tour but they loved it all. Great tidbits of information about the government, and the history of the buildings (library is gorgeous!) and clock bells play out over noon if you're there. Tickets for tour are first come first served and you access them across the road from the hill.
Nice place to walk around! Walked all the way to the back side of the buildings and got a nice view across the river to Hull. Didn't go in this trip as there were long lines due to March Break.

There is so much Canadian history scattered around the Parliament buildings. We made it a point to visit our nation's capital just to visit this site. When you walk the grounds there are statue exhibits around illustrating some key moments in our history. There are typically tours inside as well, however we did not get to go in because of...
The buildings are soo well preserved and very well organised free tour of the building. You could even see the House of commons discussions. Overall a wonderful experience.

Great sight seeing from outside - the buildings, the grounds, the statues are a must see. We didn't arrive in Ottawa until late afternoon by which time the free inside tours had all gone. If you want to add the inside visit to your itinerary then head early (by 9:00am) to 90 Wellington for the free tour tickets or you...
So lovely a great place to make family tradition. Looking at all the Christmas lights downtown and on parliament hill
Very informative and organized. Wheelchair friendly. Security is very present and considering it is a government facility I still felt very comfortable and welcomed.

Came with my family on a trip to Ottawa, vast history with many things to learn. You can watch laws be passed in the gallery, pay for a tour of the place, get lovely souvenirs, and even lounge on the grass for a picnic.

A must see. Allow at least half a day as you can only go in with a guided tour. Ned to see the centre block, the peace tower and the clock, the library (which did not burn down during the 1916 fire) and the east block. Visit now as they will start major renovations next year and it could take...
Get ready for a nice walk around Parliament Hill, make sure you have enough space for lots of photos. Enjoy Parliament Hill in all seasons 27/7 and 365 days.

The Peace Tower is in the center block of the Parliament Building, during the summer they have tours through the building and the grounds. There are many famous statues of Canadian Hero's on the grounds as well as the Eternal Flame another tourist attraction. You can see the Gatineau hills from the back of the building as you walk around...

Beautiful city. Our parliment buildings are a must to see as well as a walk on the Readeau Canal.The Govenor General's house is very interesting. Book ahead but even if you just walk the gardens it is lovely. You may even get a surprise and see our Prime Minister coming and going.The Gleeb is a wonderful artist area...
Such a gorgeous edifice! The changing of the guard was exciting. It's well worth spending the time. It is a visit that would be enjoyed by all ages.
Breathtaking tours and a walk through the history and contemporary governance of Canada. Weekend tours are best for all access to the building.
Do book these free tours in advance. You can go to their website. Tours are offered in many languages and for groups.

Parliament Hill and the Parliamentary Buildings are well worth a visit - even for those individuals not very interested in history and politics. Parliament and its grounds are the epicenter of Canada, our identity as a people and the representation of our values of inclusiveness, decency, tolerance, compassion and openness.When visiting Ottawa - no visit would be complete - if...
Neat to think of all the politicians that have shaped our country, gathering here, but nothing exciting to see.
Worth a look if in ottowa for the day, seem well maintained and architecturally interesting , city is pretty "visitor friendly" compared to say Montreal
Seeing the Canadian Government's place of action. Lots of statues and buildings to see. Good place to check out for sure.

the buildings are beautiful and I think its important for every Canadian to take it this site. the only issue was the chaos around parliament hill with the crashed ice event. they were dismantling the event after the weekend it just made the area a little confusing and some areas blocked off. generally there was lots of construction every where,...

When we saw the parliament buildings it was during the replacement of their roofing, so all the construction vehicles took away from the atmosphere.However it was still a great experience to see the old buildings and architecture. The buildings looks amazing and the statues of the prime ministers are a great sight as well.I'd recommend this for families...

Great opportunity to take in what is Canada the old architecture is very impressive with so many picture opportunities. You can sense the Canadian pride in this area and the friendliness of all the visitors. Everyone is so helpful to make sure everyone gets the pictures they want makes you proud to be part of such a great country with...
Not to be missed ~ Spectacular show and very informative ~ one of the must-see highlights of our Canadian City Tour Holiday
Whether you love history or present-day politics, you'll be fascinated seeing where it all happens. It's also a great location for walks along the river and the canal.

Visited for the first time during Winterlude. The parliament buildings are a must for anyone visiting our nations capital. The artwork, architecture and historical features are incredible. We look forward to visiting again!
If you be at Parliament Hill before, you don't need to dropby every yr or every every other yr because nothing changes.
The Parliament guided tours are super good! They are so worth it but make sure to go and get tickets early as they fill up quickly.
We were lucky to have fantastic weather on the day we visited. We were able to explore Parliament Hill and the trails near it. It is definitely a must-do for a visit to Ottawa.

The rich and historic parliament buildings are an amazing attraction. Rich in history and the seat of Canada's Federal Government. Whether you want to visit the Peace Tower, sit through question period at the House of Commons, take a guided tour, sit through a sound and light show or watch music concerts on Canada Day, this is definitely for you.

I have three things to say about Parliament Hill. First of all, if you're in Ottawa, you're probably going to visit. It's pretty much the main attraction in town, and very easy to get to if you're downtown. I'm not sure why anybody would visit Ottawa without a stop on The Hill. Some people take a tour, I did a...

When I first saw the buildings on Parliament Hill, I noticed the copper roofs, gargoyles and other adornments. Being from California, I kept thinking of the buildings in the Mary Poppins movie. But what I found most interesting was the tour of the insides of the buildings--the seat of the Canadian government. Yes, there were Mounties in their red uniforms,...

The Parliament Buildings Tour should be #1 on your must-see list in Ottawa. It's free and well worthwhile. Bilingual guides provide a memorable experience. The view from the top of the Peace Tower is awesome.

Parliament Hill and Buildings are really nice for walk with or without kids, if you have time you have to see excursion to the Parliament, it is very nice building. You will see lots of statues and buildings, nice park good for picnic or yoga, kids can run freely there too.

I've been here many times before and always enjoy the view of the river... there are trails all around the Parliament Building some of the trails lead to areas you can sit at as well as well maintained gardens in the summer. The Parliament Building also hosts concerts and is the protesters place to smoke marijuanna on 4-20. A great...
Wonderful historic and majestic property. The South Block is still under renovations so it is surrounded by scaffolding but it did not detract from the splendor of the "Hill"

Free tour of the parliament building is provided. There is a security check.Make sure you don't carry swiss knives or things of that sort.Architecture is just wow and so is the history.A well preserved room which is where books are stored is still intact(not affected by the fire)Potrait of Queen Victoria is really beautiful . Find...
I would highly recommend the tour to tourists as it has the history of the nation. Inside the parliament buildings has photo of all the prime ministers since confederation.
The buildings are beautiful and the security was extremely friendly ..great ambassadors to anyone visiting the parliament !

The tours are interesting and fun to watch Parliament in session! Lots going onincluding Yoga Wednesday's on the hill. However take the time to walk around and seethe view of the Ottawa River from behind the buildings very beautiful in ever season!

These buildings are so pretty. It is a nice place to walk around. Unfortunately we got our tour date wrong to go Inside parliament and there were no openings available for the day we showed up so prepare ahead of time if you want the tour.
We went at 11am and all the tours were sold out for the day. I wish we would of known this that they reach capacity so early in the day!

We had the most wonderful tour guide to take us around the Parliament buildings and to the clock tower. We even got to sit into a live parliament session! Would highly recommend to anyone to pop in, take the free tour, and learn about the Political system in Canada, and see the beautiful view from the top of the Clock...
Question Period was interesting if you are there when it's happening. Very interesting to see a Parliament running both in English and French. Best part of the tour was the library!

As the parliament of Canada it is a must see for everyone visiting or living in Ottawa/Canada/North America. The tours are very informative. The exterior is beautiful to look at. The tulip gardens are amazing (in season). And the statues are a walk through Canadian History.

Highly recommend visiting Parliament hill on your trip to Ottawa and booking a tour.. Make sure you get there before 9:00am to book your tour on 90 wellington street.. Very beautiful and historic tour.. Really enjoyed seeing the Library of congress

What a beautiful place to visit. I was born and raised in Canada, but have been living in the US for some time now. Going to Ottawa for Christmas was an amazing experience, especially seeing my nation's capital and the Capitol Hill buildings.Parliment and the surrounding buildings were beautiful stone buildings, and the lawn in front was covered with...
Nothing like being around an eternal flame in the dead of winter. Great view of surrounding monuments to boot.
The Parliament grounds are beautiful. Very interesting place. Wish we could have gone inside but we missed the ticket time (free/9am) Maybe next time.

I chaperoned a group of young nordic skiers on an exchange to Ottawa. Of all the highlights of our nations capital we were exposed to, this was my favourite. So beautiful and so much history. Made us proud to be Canadian.
It has been years since being to the Parliament Buildings in Ottawa, and I was impressed at how nice they were and how many tourists were visiting. This is a place that should be cherished.

I strongly recommend when visiting Parliament Hill to take a tour. It is free, and as long as it is a quiet day in Parliament, the tour lasts about 1 hour. You can still go into the Parliament building, but if you want to learn a lot about the government and purposeful designs throughout the building, take the tour.However...
Sunshine and warm winter weather made for an enjoyable trip. We just missed four tour buses, that were loading back on as we arrived. Plenty of lunch spots a short walk south afterwards.

Have not been here in two decades so it was special to be be able to revisit and appreciate all over again what our Capitol has to offer.The views from the Peace Tower were incredible. Huge police presence but everyone was very friendly and helpful.Be sure to stop in the Information building across from the Parliament to get...

I don't even know where to start with this - I had no idea this show even existed....and then last summer as we were passing through Ottawa for a couple of days we heard that there was a show put on every night in front of the parliament buildings.Wow! I'm so glad we went to this. It was such...
These buildings are beautifully structured. I love the history and a great place for anyone to visit.
We were impressed by our first visit to Parliament Hill. The place isn't as big as I thought but it is incredibly ornate. Nice to see what we buck up for.

So there it is, the Parliament Building, with its amazing architecture, located by the Ottawa River. This is where policies, which impact Canadians, are made. This is where the government operates from. I was grateful for having the opportunity to visit this place finally. I felt proud to be Canadian when I saw this building.It was busy when we...
Had the pleasure of showing my son parliaments question period and the offices I once worked when I was younger. Such a beautiful building. Stop and look at the details and architecture.

We had a wonderful visit to The Hill.We walked the grounds and enjoyed the views of the Rideau Canal and Ottawa River. We made a point to visit each statue and the Cat House to meet some of the more friendly wild cats and a caretaker.The history and architecture of the buildings is incredible. Our guide was very...

When I arrived in Ottawa, the first place I wanted to see was Trudeau's place of employment. Apparently, I wasn't alone in that. Parliament Hill is an awe-inspiring collection of magnificent architecture that's more than stood the test of time. You'll find that if you want to see the buildings up close, you'll run into big crowds on the grounds--especially...

No trip to Ottawa would be complete without a stop at the Parliament Buildings. Here interpreters will walk yiu through the history of these iconic buildings. The architecture is amazing! As is the history.
History, culture, tradition all in one place. Proud to be Canadian. Spectacular view from the peace tower. Go for it.

A beautiful and historic building. Very much worth visiting if you can. It stands on the banks of the Ottawa River, and here decisions are made which affect all our lives.If you can attend a question period it is a fascinating glimpse into our history being made.
Free guided tour, Emilie was great and very knowledgeable... what a place... makes you feel proud to be Canadian... well worth the time
What i remember most were the books of remembrance and ..... the clock was made in Croydon, which is close to where I live in England.

Ok so it was New Years Eve, but all things considered when taking a free fireworks show it superb. I can't wait for the Canada Day show, it will be awesome since it's the 150th Anniversary. Can't wait!!!

Parliament Hill and building have some spectacular views which will leave you with memories forever. Right in the middle of Ottawa downtown you will not miss anything.Inside building visits are free but within visit hours which takes you in 1900s era.
Book a tour to visit the Parliament Buildings in Ottawa and learn about the history of the building and the Canadian Government and systems of parliament.

Our family drove to Ottawa last weekend from west of Toronto. We visited Parliament Hill on Friday afternoon. There is understandably about as much security as you would have boarding a plane. We went to the visitor's gallery in parliament, but there were hardly any MPs in the house, maybe a dozen at most. I guess most of them had...
Sat in on Question Period !Great experience!Politics in actionLots to learn and seeing the prime minister was interesting

Under the sun, this place is so pretty! The parliament is impressive, do not hesitate to do the visit, but be early because the places are limited! If you don't have the ticket, it's is a good place to walk, especially around rideau canal..

An awesome sight as we were wandering around in the snow. We didn't go for a tour inside but walked all around outside looking at the various statues etc. The fountain with the fire shooting out of it was very interesting and very warming on a cold day. Beautiful old buildings so took lots of photographs. It is worth spending...

We often enjoy visiting, and walking the grounds. We often enjoy the light shows in the summer and were disappointed that the Christmas light show doesn't play for the same time that the lights are available. The Ottawa Tourism site says light are on until Jan 7th but the light show on Parliament Hill was not and we went all...

Not many people realize that now is the time to visit this amazing building. It will be draped up on the exterior as they repair the stone work in probably twice the time it took to build the place. But Hey, what's the rush? Great place to visit - no question. Go for a walk down by the Canal too....
Great view in winter. Took about 40 mins to get to elevator on a Saturday. Worth the wait. Did not have time for full tour just tower. Moving memorial chamber

Overwhelming experience..to see the Canadian Houses of Parliament..and it is just like ours in the UK..FANTASTIC Tour guide we had..I think his name was Jeremy..me..And all free aswell..Never forget this experience..If you ever cone to Canada..please visit..AMAZING
Went summer 2016 and it was very fun! Loved walking a seeing so many things. And I loved that they had beaver tails! So fun and I want to come in the winter next time! Definitely recommend!

we went on a guided tour of centre block. The tour was very informative. unfortunately the peace tower was closed and the Senate. The tour took 20 minutes. It was short and sweet. it is free which is perfect. if you haven't seen inside parliament I recommend going.
You must visit this place, if not you didn't visit the Capital of Canada. Are only government buildings and you don't have access, but the architecture and the plaza is very nice to visit.
Very interesting to learn how the Canadian version evolved; good guides and nice buildings. Thoroughly recommend a visit and its easy to book in the office opposite.

Try to visit before Centre Block closes for at least ten years. This building is magical, full of hidden passageways, nooks and crannies. Yes, of course it is haunted but who knows whether the ghosts will remain after the extensive renovations! Love, love this building!
Definitely recommend this as a must see, it gives you a glimpse of the history and its particularly worth a visit during the evening when the building is lit up
Gorgeous building with a beautiful external green area. Lots of history here. Tours available and recommended.
No elevator to the top of the Peace Tower but it's worth the climb.Stunning masonry, Victorian attention to detail, no fireworks or fanfare...until you get to the library!

We did a tour of the peace tower and then sat in the viewing area. We arrived after q&a and basically witnessed the announcements of two people leaving so there was tons of applause and 20 solid minutes of hugging.It really was amazing to watch things in action even if nothing overly pressing was being discussed. Everyone should witness...
Definitely a "Must Do" when visiting Ottawa. Go across from parliament hill and you can get a free ticket for the parliament tour. They are offered both in English and French.

We went on a Saturday of the weekend and had the opportunity to go into many of the rooms. I had never been to Parliament even as a kid and really enjoyed the opportunity to look into rooms and hear some of the appointed history. Our tour guide was Catherine. she was very informative friendly and made people feel comfortable.

We were honored to be part of a guided tour of our National Parliament buildings. Make sure you check the website and Parliament is IN SESSION so you go to the gallery and see the action. Also make sure you go up the peace tower. Great views and great history..

It was very interesting to see the inside of the Parliament and Peace Tower buildings. The gothic structure and architecture are a stark contrast to the US neoclassical style government building found in Washington DC. I really enjoyed hearing the stories of their political branches and learning about the building and its use. Great place for adults and teens.
We took a very nice 45 minute guided tour of the Canadian Parliament last week. An engaging and personable tour guide showed us the highlights and provided a lot of interesting information.
highly recommend visiting parliament, its free for a great tour. our guide was knowledgeable and able to show and explain the history and architecture.
There's free guided tours during the day which you'll need to pass through security to participate in. It's worth a visit while in the nations capitol.
Try to visit at noon as there is a 15 minute playing of bells. The view from the Peace Tower is awesome. A beautiful building not to be missed

Parliament Hill is definitely worth seeing, being not only the government hub of Canada but also a very pleasant park. The walks around the sides by the canal and around the flame out the front are very nice and a good way to spend a chilled afternoon. Unfortunately I didn't manage to visit inside the parliament buildings due to time...

Take the time to walk around the outside of the complex and admire the majesty of the setting - the stone used is majestic and the setting by the river is inspiring! The Eternal Flame punctuates the Vista. The tour guide for Parliament was very knowledgeable and witty.

The tour itself was alright.You have to get a free ticket for the tour from an office across the road before you actually go on the tour. That said, you can choose what time you want to go and get a ticket ahead of time and go do something else for a while. Leave time to go through security. Our...

With students using the room for mock parliamentary stuff, we weren't able to get so much as a peak at this historic room. A window into that room should be a bare minimum. Great tour, but a bit rushed. Despite this, every Canadian Travel Monger should include this free tour on their to-do list while in Ottawa. Surprise, surprise, not...

This was really the best part of my visit to Ottawa.There were some stairs to climb, and a fair bit of walking, but barring that, it was amazing.The tour guide was really informative and the architecture alone is really breathtaking.You must go up to the Peace Tower and admire the views.
A must see to understand the nation and feel the history. The hill forms a nice scenery especially in the sunset and at night when all lights are on.

You will fall in love with the architecture. Few recommendations: Take the free tour tickets from the front gate opposite to the building. Arrive 20 mins before the tour start time as you will have to go through airport style security check. Once the tour guide starts speaking you will get in the groove. My guide Zach was the coolest...

If you're traveling to Ottawa, this is one of the spots you must see. It's a beautiful building surrounded by nice scenery. They sometimes have late night light shows, you'll have to check the time online
Great free tour. Get tickets early for more time choices. The trip up the tower was worth the wait. Great view from the top!
I went with my family that lives in the USA and it was just beautiful, i little cold but non the less just amazing. I recommend at least once
We took the guided tour of the parliament buildings. It was very interesting and well presented. It was nice to see where our government works.
The light show at Parliament Hill is really great. So nice to see it shows some of the history throughout our country.
Great history lesson for every member of the family. Especially good for Teenagers. Would recommend during spring or fall when in session if possible

Canada's Parliament buildings are a must see for anyone visiting the nation's capital city of Ottawa. Excellent tours are offered and take the time to walk around and admire the statuary. In the summer, Yoga is offered on Parliament Hill during lunch hour on Wednesdays. Very popular and a lot of fun. Stunning views of the buildings are offered from...

The Parliament Hill is so beautiful in any time of the year, day or night! We loved the beautiful Neo-Gothic architecture of the buildings, beautiful views of the city, interesting monuments. There are free tours available 9-3:30 on the weekdays and they are quite informative and allow you to see the senate chamber (when there is no session), hallways, memorial...
Aside from the beautiful building and grounds this is a wonderful place to see people including other Canadians of every background and visitors from other countries.
This was my first time to visit the Parliament buildings, and I have lived in Ottawa most of my life. The only thing that I wasn't able to do was go up the Peace Tower because the line was so long.

We toured the Parliament Buildings on a cold, snowy day in January. It was a fabulous day. The tour guide was very knowledgable and was able to answer all the questions posed. It was fascinating to see where our government meets - it is a very impressive building. Don't miss going up the Peace Tower - the view is spectacular....
It's beautiful, from every angel. The colors , the infinite fire, the guards.. the history. Amazing ! Must see !

So much history and beauty in the Parliament Hill and Buildings. It is truly a magical place. I recommend going to visit in the summer time during the day, and also visiting at night when they have their beautiful light shows!
had a guide to take me around inside and visiting most of the rooms the Parlament. A visti is indeed worth and get to know the history

Why wouldn't you trek up the Hill to see Parliament while in Canada's Capital city? Best on a hot day in summer. TIP: Go to the back, behind the Library and Senate side, above the confluence of the River and Canal. Awesome breezes waft upward like a natural air conditioner. Always a pretty, historic site with tons of beauty and...
Enjoyed a winter Wonderland around the parliament on new years eve. Brought in the new year celebrating Canada's 150th birthday. Worth the time to hike down to the river and scout around.

Strangely enough, if someone asks me to list my favorite natural experiences in Canada, the Parliament Hill and Buildings makes the list. It is somewhat uniquely located by world standards right next to a decent sized and perfectly blue river, and the pathway along the river almost makes one forget that they are the middle of a city. The buildings...

We were there on evening of Monday, January 2nd on a bitterly freezing cold night. City workers were taking down and dismantling scaffolding that had been used over the weekend for the New Years festivities. The parliament buildings were lit up and were beautiful and there were surprisingly a lot of other people out just walking around like us in...
Always a delight to visit Parliament Hill anytime of the year! Quite majestic! The light show is a must do!
history site, beautiful building. the tour of the parliament is very interesting. not very fun place, but enjoyed by the history.
very nice place must see if you are in ottawa, very nice to walk around the building, great to take photos from the park looking towards the building

Judged simply by its external look and location in the downtown core of Canada's capital, Ottawa - this is a rest place to go with family for a walk/stroll and watch fireworks to celebrate either NYE in the winter or Canada Day in the summer. The ability to be within steps of the government's main building is a stark reminder...

I went on a sunny day when the sun reflected diamonds in the snow, the river was still and the sky was bright. Loved walking around each building, seeing the sculptures and glimpsing Quebec just across the river. If you are in Ottawa, go here even if just for a stroll, it's well worth it :)

We enjoyed our visit and tour of Parlament. Make sure you have your tickets and time before you head over to hill. Scheduled times help -- you can visit the area while you wait!! Great photo opps are in the back overlooking the river!!Out tour guide was excellent -- shared history and unique facts without being boring!!Complete tour...
The guided tour is short but it gets you into the library which is awe-inspiring. Question period is a hassle but if you can, it is worth the effort. The views from the tower are incredible.
Its a prety place. Definitely have to go. The view from that are are beautiful _especially with all the snow. Great place to walk with kids or just exercise.

We were looking forward to visiting this place the most on our travel to Ottawa. It's an iconic scene and easy to find. Lots of people were around and they were setting up for a New Years event but still a great atmosphere.

This was worth a visit to say I had been but other than the history it is not hugely exciting. We went on a day when parliament was sitting so went via back stairs and fleetingly into various rooms. The guide was good and put the flesh on the bones. Glad I went and would recommend friends go but would...

From June 30th-July 2 we celebrated Canada along with many of or fellow Canadians around The Parliament Buildings. It was a wonderful experience. Hundreds of thousands of visitors in front of The Parliament Buildings enjoying music, food and entertainment. Saw the Prime Minister and His Family too. This Building is truly a symbol of our nations Government.

I took a tour of the main parliament block which was very interesting. It was fast paced because we had to stay on schedule for the other tours but it was definitely worth it. The tour guide was very energetic and engaging and made sure there was time for questions and pictures. It was nice getting to see the house...
The lights and the concert were great. I was amaze about the fire on the water, never see that might actually work

There was a Christmas light show on at the parliament buildings everyday from early December to Christmas day. The show started daily at 5 and ended at 11pm running on 15 minute intervals until Christmas day.
Parliament buildings is something to see .the historic value is breathtaking .and if you can go see it you should

We wanted to show our Parliament Hill to our kids for the first time. They were really impressed by the grandeur of our Parliament and all its buildings.All proud Canadians must visit this place as once in its life and visit our democratic place.The charm and English background is really superb. A must-see when you are in Ottawa!
The Parliament Hill tour was good. I would have liked to see more of the Parliament buildings. The library was beautiful. Very interesting and I did learn a few more things about Canada.
a good contrast from the modern surroundings and the parliament building with its history shown during the sound and light show with parliament building as screen. quite a busy place

You really must get tickets for the tour of Parliament which includes visits to both houses and the library. Then at the end you can ascend the Peace Tower for a spectacular 360 view of Ottawa.Tickets are free which makes it even a huge must. We were treated with seeing inside both chambers and it is a fantastic way...
I really enjoyed the tour around the Parliament House, it was really interesting. I also got to go in the Parliament House and attend question time which was also very interesting .

They provide historical valuable free tour inside the Canadian parlemant, really amazing place!It's really beyond expectations!The hill and the building outdoor are very beautiful, however it's not comparable when you have the tour inside the building!

A very beautiful building. Especially the library . Made from wood of every tree native to Canada . Also edcatioal , a look at how parliament works. In the summer there is a projection of Canada's history on the centre block and a Christmas light show during the holidsys

From the inside Canada's parliament buildings offer an inside view of the halls of power and an overview of how the country makes decisions. The Parliament buildings themselves provide a unique perspective on the history of Canada, written in stone. The view from the Peace Tower and the Parliamentary Library are two must-sees.From the outside, the open grounds are...
get your tickets the day before it's easier, though it's free you need to get a free pass & they give you time slot available.
light shows to music ON the buildings themselves is a must see. dont try to park near there unless your an hour early.
Very nice building specially with the Christmas decoration in this season. Can't wait to see the decorations during 2017 for the anniversary.
These iconic buildings are well worth the visit... even a walk around the property to see the honour statues is enjoyable. Picturesque views and history together.
I travelled to Ottawa with my Daughters, we Loved it inside and outside. It is an old and Beautiful Building.
Finally got to Ottawa for Canada Day; it is a journey every Canadian should try to experience.Really a lot of activities in surrounding area and the Parliament buildings are beautiful to see.
Took a tour of the buildings. Went up in the tower and saw Ottawa. Can see the eternal flame. Interesting to walk around and see other attractions.

If you ever get a chance, sit in on Question Period. It's such a cool experience. We were able to obtain tickets from a local MP. The Prime Minister wasn't there but that was the only disappointment. We ran into MP Tom Mulcair in the rotunda and he offered to take a picture with us. Very cool!

We visited Ottawa in December and took the free tour of Parliament. My husband's idea, but I was equally pleased. Our tour guide was knowledgeable, answered many questions, and it really was a highlight of our trip. The Library is, in a word, spectacular. We got to see the rooms where the Senate and House of Commons meet, glorious spaces...

I love to see the changing of the guard and experience it through a child's eye. I wouldnot recommend it for children under 3 as its loud and they loose interest quickly.It is great to see this but when it's hot it's kind of scary as they do sometimes faint.

So popular is this site it's almost impossible to gain a ticket for the tour. I didn't see the interior.Being greeted by the Eternal Centennial Flame is brilliant & is worth spending time at to read the displayed information . before proceeding to the buildings which are attractive & ornate.Sculptures to see are Women Are Persons?, Queen Elizabeth...
My husband and I were visiting friends in Nepean, ON and they took us to Parliament Hill to view the laser show. This was a neat opportunity to learn about Canadian history and local culture.
Parliament hill light and sound show ! A must see for all the family during Christmas time . Brings magic to the holiday

Take the tour (tickets across the street-just silly).The building is only a hundred years old but that's ancient in Canada.Beautiful architecture and stone that will leave you very impressed.See the senate and commons but the best part is the library, the jewel in the crown, so to speak.The tour is short and the guide we had...
We went in the evening to see the animation projected onto the Parliament..it was spectacular..color music...fire..just dress warm the Canadian weather is brutal.
In the centre of Ottawa stand the Parliament buildings! All lite up for Christmas. Try to get a pass inside. The grounds are spacious and accessible.

Naturally this is a must see when in Ottawa but make sure you go inside and get a tour. You will have to go through an airport type scanner. If the House is sitting, a few days before you go call your MP's office and ask them to get you tickets for question period. This will give you access to...

I went on a tour of the parliament and it was wonderful to learn of the incredible history of Ottawa.The staff were incredibly pleasant and very knowledgeable about all aspects of the history. There was nothing that they did not know and presented the tour very wellIf you are coming to Ottawa ensure you go on a tour...
Nice gardens all around and great views of hull quebec,you can even go in buildings,fantastic to be there Canada day what a party.
A must see for anyone that visits Ottawa. To walk around the Parliament buildings and observe the architecture alone is worth the visit.
If you're going to visit Ottawa, plan to visit Parliament Hill and the surrounding buildings. The architecture is fantastic. This is Ottawa at it's finest.
I was quite excited as a Canadian to finally see the Parliament buildings. It was a very enjoyable venture and a joy to actually see where the leaders of my country do their job.

its typical tourist must see place, but it's very beautiful. if im not mistaken light show starts at 9 and it's about canadian story. if you want to get in tower it's free, but i strongly recommend arrive here early like 8 or 9 am, because free tickets are given away so fast, thats why i had to take french...

I only got to visit outside because they have a quota of free tickets -don't just turn up because the attraction is free like I did!*get tickets early*Good atmosphere out on the grass of Parliament Hill though!

The staff are friendly and courteous. There is lots of security but you are still allowed to visit as Canada carries on its business and democracy. The building itself is beautiful inside and buzzes with activity like a beehive.
Went there after a business meeting downtown Ottawa. Great walk and very nice view on the river. I learned a lot about the history of Canada.

Parliament Building surprised me with an interesting contrast of ancient traditions and modern technology.Carvings below the ceilings had some plains in them, which was very interesting to me, since in Europe, I've seen lots of them, but never with anything from modern world.The bibliotique was amazing too, very beautiful and almost made me feel like travelling in time,...
Get a spot in the schedule early. The tour is free but we waited until 11am and couldn't get in until 3pm. Security lines are slow.

This was such a great investment of our time and Jamie was just fantastic in doing the tour. We also went up to the peace tour and sat in the house of parliament listening to the discussion. Would do it again!

We went on a free tour of the Parliament building and enjoyed it. We got to see the library, senate and peace tower, but the tour could not go in the house of commons as parliament was in session.I did go and sit in the House during the session, but it wasn't part of the tour. I think that...

Get your tickets early for guided tours at the visitor centre across the street from Parliament Hill. the guard ceremony is definitely worth seeing. Guided tours are very well done and available in French or English.

It had been 15 years since I last visited these buildings. Our guide was very informative. We were able to visit all the rooms since it was a weekend. these buildings are full of history and makes me proud to be a Canadian.

The Canadian people are rightfully proud of their impressive Parliament. Some may be surprised at how small it is, but remember more people live in California than live in Canada. It's a good tour, neat to see.Big note here is to the people who run the tours. This was one of the worst managed events I've ever seen in...

The Parliament Hill and Buildings is a must to activity if you are in Canada. During the day you can enjoy places to have a drink and eat something. Also, there are a lot of souvenir stores so you can grab something on the way out. At night is where the magic happens they project the history of the place...
Great to know Canadian history and enjoy amazing view of Ottawa from the Peace Tower. It is a free attraction, very organized.

I loved visiting Parliament! Coming from the UK, it was interesting to see the similarities!You need to allow yourself plenty of time to see tickets (specific times) and go through the scans into the building as this is a workplace!Even better, it was free and the tower gave stunning views of the city!
No visit to Ottawa should be completed without a visit to Parliament. Just to stand there an appreciate the beautiful structures and all they represent to Canada.

Even if you are no interested in politics or history the architecture alone is worth the visit. I loved the library! The tour is good and I would definitely recommend it. The Christmas light show is absolutely beautiful. My favorite time to visit.

Get your tickets early for guided tours at the visitor centre across the street from Parliament Hill. The lines can be quite long. Especially in summer after the changing of the guard ceremony which is definitely worth seeing. Guided tours are very well done and available in French or English.
A must see when in Ottawa. Will not disappoint but line up early to get free tours in English or French, as the tickets run out fast. Light show in the evening is the best culmination of this visit.

Tours of the Centre Block are free, but you have to get tickets. This is to avoid long line ups and crowds all showing up at the same time. The tickets are also necessary to go up the Peace Tower or to see the Memorial Chamber. The ticket office is only 50 yards from the front gate, but you have...

Note that you can get free tickets to tour the Parliament buildings across the street but they do run out so plan this one. The tour was educational and interesting, going up the Peace Tower is a bit slow as the elevator takes 7ish people at a time - be patient, it is a lovely view.

Got our tour tickets early ( they are free) and headed to our Parliament. Tour took about a hour and was very well done. Zachery was our tour person and he made the time fly by with humor and interesting tidbits that you can't find in a book. Learned a lot of our history and how our government makes the...

Visiting Ottawa, this is the first picture that comes to mind. The location is strategic with the Ottawa River, Gatineau Park and Quebec in the background and the heritage site; Rideau Canal to the right. That is just a few famous sites, what about the By Ward Market, Museum of History, War Museum and Supreme Court not far.The Parliament...

We toured the Centre Block of Parliament. Security is tight -- a bag search outside, then a second search inside, so come early to avoid the lines. You also need to pick up a free tour ticket across the street at 90 Wellington Street (first come, first served). Because Parliament was in session and it was caucus day (typically Wednesdays...
The Canadian Parliament is a gorgeous place to visit. Queues can be long at times and security is understandably very tight. Good guided tours of a most interesting place.

Unlike many countries capital city, Ottawa's "seat of government" [when not under construction] is quite accessible.In addition to the "three part building", it also serves as a backdrop to a free "sound and light show' in the summer months.On July 1, it will also host an amazing musical and fireworks extravaganza celebrating Canada's 150th anniversary of its found...

Every time I visit Ottawa I make a point to go to the parliament buildings and take the tour. Hearing the history and the many stories always reinforces my Canadian pride. A must visit for every Canadian, and an interesting visit for all tourists to the city.
went up to Parlament Hill with my love and kids,,it is such a beautiful piece of art! love looking at it from the bridge!

If you are leaving in Ottawa or just passing through the Capital, at any age, any time, Canadian or not, Parliament Hill is The Destination.Listen to the young, excellent guides, admire the buildings(mind you, some are under renovation), or just wait on the front lawn for the change of the guard. You never have enough of it. Don't forget...

The grounds have so many statues and fantastic views. Spend the time looking and reading about all the monuments and statues. Check out the views from the Parliamentary Library at the back of the buildings.

You can visit the parliment buildings, take the guided tour and learn about canadian history. the buildings with their gothic look are impressive. You can climb up into the peace tower, see the senate or the house of communs if they are not in session you could even witness question period. You might meet the PM. then stroll the grounds...

It was a cold day but we took the kids out to see our capital's buildings. It was neat that there are tickets to get a tour inside for free and we were sorry that we didn't know about them earlier - apparently somewhere across the street from the main bldg - they were all gone. War memorial and all...
Beautiful historical building, make sure you book your tour as early as possible. Cameras are allowed but you do have to go through security screening. Not to be missed if you're visiting Ottawa..

Yes, Canadians are known (or used to be) for their politeness. The same extends, mostly, to Parliamentary proceedings. While visiting and if you are lucky you may be able to sit in the press gallery during Question Period. At this time, ministers are 'grilled' by the opposition on diverse matters. Many ae eloquent and others...well, you will be the judge....

We enjoyed our visit to Parliament Hill, some construction and re-facing of the buildings but did not hamper our visit. A great place to walk around and enjoy the architecture, a must see if you are in Ottawa
We strolled around enjoyed looking across the river and at the buildings. It is a must see if you are in town.

Seeing Canada's young idealist prime minister and watching a British style parliamentary fight with cabinet ministers is a thrill just 2 minutes' walk from Ottowa's central tourist office. we were walking around the gorgeous building and noticed there was a sign saying "No tours.....Parliament in session". Each time I'm in Ottawa a stroll up to the parliament is top of my list. A modern city with that much of nicely restored old palaces impresses me each time.

Loved the free tour - guide was informative, professional and handled the tour at a good pace. High security for the tour and to sit in the Commons (to be expected). Stay to listen to the bells on the hour and don't miss the elevator to the top of the Peace Tower. The War Memorial room was also a good...
Walked around and enjoyed the view. There is a lookout over the river and the park is well maintained.
The location is great, a nice walk to several nearby attractions, and most important you can visit the building from inside.

Visiting Parliament Hill was very interesting. The buildings inside and out are beautiful, the architecture is fantastic. The history is fantastic, and tours are very informative. Every Canadian should visit if given the chance.

I recently brought 8 youth for a tour while we were in Ottawa. I felt like its a must for every Canadian. I still feel like that. We can be proud to have such a wonderful, beautiful and most important buildings in Canada. Lots of information about government, Incredible view from Pace Tower...

Once again, as in the case forty years ago, my favorite two place on the tour were the Library (expansive and stunning) and Memorial Chapel). Every Canadian should visit the Parliament Buildings and take the tour. Get there first thing!

Absolutely fantastic!!! the Parliament buildings are gorgeous and the statues are in amazing condition. This being my first time to Ottawa I left with memorable impression.Tip* Visit in the fall beautiful colours and no lines!!

Great place to take a tour on a rainy day. Make sure you get to 90 Wellington (building directly across the street from Parliament) EARLY to get your tickets - we were there about 9:30am. It's so nice to learn about the origins of this beautiful country. It makes me proud to learn of my adopted country's rich history and culture.

Took the guided tour, which was extremely interesting. Rich in history, and a great view from Peace tower. Highly recommend. Stop in early across the street to get your tour ticket, which has a designated time.

We visited just a few days before Remembrance Day. The Canadian Legion can be justifiably proud of their light display of poppies cascading down from the tower and the slide presentation. We spent an emotion hour standing with many others in silent remembrance. MJL

It is worth having a tour of the parliament buildings which are beautifully kept. Monuments and stained glass windows are often renewed to give the place a contemporary feel. The library is stunning having survived a major fire in 1916 and a display in the library charts what happened. It is possible to get a ticket to watch in the...

Great place to visit in the summer. You and your camera will be busy. There is a lot of historical statues and monuments here. Tour guides to answer any questions are available everywhere. Beautiful views of the river behind the Parliament. Once inside you must go to the gold room in the clock tower. The views are amazing. Can be...

So beautiful from all angles. Did yoga on the front lawns Wed morning at 11 am and hundreds cam out to enjoy. Architecture is incredible! At night they do a light show of the history and making of the country and is projected on the wide expansion of the entire main building. It was awesome!

We arrived in Ottawa just after 3pm, took a cab to our hotel, the Fairmont, checked in and dropped bags and headed out. we drove to Ottawa for the day, the buildings are amazing architecture , so busy, and so much to see, we spent the day here, not nearly enough time, we went around most of it but going back next year, so will finish the sights.

We took the free tour of Centre Block. The inside is beautifully finished and in pristine condition. The library, the oldest part, has several stories of idecorated wood galleries. A great Free tour shown by excellent guides. Focusing on the history of the buildings, the architecture and leaders from the past. The view from the Clock Tower is outstanding! Bring a camera!

We enjoyed walking around the grounds on a warm and bright fall day. The magnitude of the buildings is impressive and there always seems to be a buzz of activity. We were too late in the afternoon to get a tour but tickets are free and available first thing each morning.
Beautiful buildings. I bumped into a groupwise yoga-exercise in front of the buildings. A lot of policemen outside and control at every entrance.

I went on a couple guided tours of parliament in August 2016. It was interesting to learn about the history of Canadian politics, the structure of how things are governed, and the architecture of the actual buildings itself.The tour guides were friendly and very knowledgeable. If you have time, go and visit it. The view at the tower is great but the security line (which I understand) was just too long and too slow.
We tried to get into the main Parliament building but it closed at 4:00 p.m. Our advice would be to book a tour as soon as you get to Ottawa. We did meet a very nice guard.

We got there but didn't get our tickets across road at the first place. Later we decided to visit inside and found out we need to have a ticket for that. Given running out of time to scheduled visit, we end up not going inside. I will try go inside, if I visit Ottawa again.
If you come to Ottawa you have to go to Parliament Hill and the buildings. The Senate is the often overlooked tour

My wife and I took the guided tour of the Parliament buildings. As a Canadian, it was really neat seeing the place where our country is governed and laws are passed. I definitely think every Canadian needs to visit the Parliament at some time in their life. The craftsmanship in the stone carvings that litter the interior of the building...
The area is gorgeous. The buildings are impressive. The tour was very helpful. I learned a lot about Canada's history.It was a great experience.
Absolutely loved it. Got many pictures. Beautiful Architecture and art. Found out many things I didn't know.

Didn't do a tour of Parliament proper but walked the grounds and surrounding areas and really enjoyed the beautiful architecture and statues. Great place to go while in Ottawa! Free Wi-Fi in surrounding area, also enjoyed the war memorial and the woman's memorial nearby.

I visited parliament building number of times. Recently they relocated ticket office just across the Wellington street. Tickets are free but you must get them it's only way how you can access building now. Guided tour is interesting and of course you do not want miss library. We lined up to get tickets off site for a tour of the Parliament but unfortunately there where no English tours left that day so we opted for a trip up the bell tower & a brief look inside the Parliament. The architecture of the buildings is stunning and full of history, and the site offers a beautiful view of the Outaouais river. When you are up in the peace tower, the view of Ottawa is superb. However, the guided tour is a bit too short and you won't see much of the inside part of the parliament, but since it's...
Taking a guided tour is a good idea. They are free and very informative. This is a must see for anyone visiting Ottawa.

The Parliament buildings did not disappoint. However, if you want to view and take a tour of the Parliament building you should get your tickets first thing in the morning. I couldn't get tickets the first day I tried and decided to stay another night so I could take the tour. It was worth it. There is currently no charge...

They're free, but different numbers every day, so get there early (before 9am) to get in line, directly across the street from the Parliament. You might see the PM come out or go into his office, across the other street from the ticket office.

Visited the parliament buildings with my class in October. The guide was excellent and our tour lasted just over an hour. We went inside the library which is breath taking. The peace tower is slo's worth the visit.

Kind of like the Grand Canyon. You stand there in awe, then 1/2 later you are ready to go. Strongly suggest a tour as it makes the stay so much more enjoyable. Plan for long lines getting into the buildings themselves, and if you get a chance visit the library as it looks like something straight out of Harry Potter.
Just walking around this impressive site and seeing all the history connected with this place makes it a place that must be visited.
Stunning building & history, definitely take the tour & hopefully the tower will be open for some amazing views of the city!

Excellent and informative tour.Please note that you need to queue for tickets (free) at the Tourist Information so get there early.The tours would benefit from being dual language rather than language specific.
Beautiful buildings to have a quick look at and some photos, don't forget the centennial flame as well for a picture! Not easy to find parking nearby, lots of roads with meters.

We had a great tour that was guided by a knowledgeable young lady. Being a Sunday it was not in session but we still saw the key spots. Great architecture and attention to detail make this a worthwhile visit.
Very friendly staff, very busy about 1/2 hour wait in line, good directions, beautiful Library worth the wait, the architecture amazing always wondering how everything was built.

Tour was free and excellent. Allow plenty of time to get through security, they are thorough and also have to give priority to business visitors over tourists. Staff were all friendly and helpful. After our tour, we sat in the Visitor's Gallery and watched some debate and question period.

Look for a budget parking space. It doesn't matter if you have to walk, as long as your car won't be towed.We took the time to appreciate the landmark and architectural design of the building.Wear comfortable shoes, have a bottle of water and ensure to have your camera always ready.Had fun!

You must get ticket first from 90 Wellington St for the guided-tours or the Peace Tower visit only. Tickets are first come first serve so be there early. if time is an issue for you, i suggest you do the Peace Tower only which offers a gorgeous view of the city.

This is a must see every time we go to Ottawa. It's such a beautiful sight, and brings a lot of joy to my heart. I love the history of Canada, and seeing these buildings is almost nostalgic. There is so much history to see and learn about. You can't go to Ottawa and NOT stop at the Parliament buildings....

We went to the free ticket office at 8:45 (it opens at 9:00) and obtained tickets for the (7) of us and lots of information. The tour guide was very good, speaking clearly and loudly as needed, with an excellent knowledge of Parliament history. Thoroughly enjoyed it and learned a lot of background too.

We visited recently and turned up just after 9am at the Tourist information office across the road from Parliament buildings, and were lucky toget places on the 9.20 english tour.Our guide was well informed and made the tour interesting with many facts, even though we were unable to see the Main chamber which was in session.The building is...

What an amazing place to visit, if you are a history buff or simply love the old buildings this place will amaze you.If you want to visit inside the buildings you have to get your free tickets across the street.I could spend hours there just walking around looking at everything. If you wish to go inside the Parliament building you will need to get free tickets from 90 Wellington Street, it's well worth while. We arranged to do 2 tours, Peace Tower and Parliament Building. Chaotic arrangements getting through security. Many tours waiting to depart We are all squashed in together. We didn't go inside the buildings, although they do offer tours. We explored the grounds and appreciated the architecture. There was lots of space to sit on the yard, and we noticed they do activites on the lawn i.e. public yoga

This is a place which should not be missed if you are in Ottawa. This was our first time seeing the Parliament Hill and buildings and the centennial flame. It's absolutely breath taking.

Each time we bring someone new to the Nation's Capital, Parliament is always on the list of downtown fun. The statues grounds and history is always breathtaking and continues to remind us why Canada is such an amazing place to live. Take the few minutes to just wander the grounds. There are many hidden gems to find. Pieces of our...

It's great to visit parliament hill in summer. I walked up to the hill, walked down to the bank of Ottawa river. It's in the heart of the capital, easy to go entertaining, shopping, food, and sight viewing. You can spend a hour to entire day there.

The hill is surrounded by trees which are currently in their full autumn colours making for great photos. The statues on the hill are interesting and there is a guide available that tells you all about them
Best walking place, building is impressive, from the hill you can have a fantastic view on the river as well as downtown. Very easily accessible, walknig distance from any place.

Parliament Hill is definitely one of my favourite places in Ottawa! Beautiful buildings and grounds, interesting statues, and close to restaurants and other interesting locations, such as the Rideau canal and the Fairmont Chateau Laurier. You can take tours of parliament, or sit on the lawn and enjoy the sunshine. There are also events throughout the year, so keep an...
Do not miss the 1st July celebrations on the Hill. They are epic! The Centre Block is a stylish and unique structure that will be memorable for any and all visitors regardless of age or gender.

Don't miss the Parliament Building tour, it's great. You'll need to get you free tour tickets at the tourist office across the street. Tours are given in both English and French. Allow about an hour for the comprehensive tour. Be sure to see the evening laser show, it's really good.

Well worth the visit located next to the Fairmont hotel. Get your free tickets early across the street. Limited number of tours per day.You your the senate the parliamentary libraryAnd if not in session the house of commonsVery much worth the visit
Interesting walk around the Parliment buildings. You are next to the Ottawa river ,cruises available.
I went to the peach tower and you get a really good view from there. The parliament is a pretty old building but that's what it is. The main thing here is definitely the tower and the view from there

If you are thinking of visiting the Canadian Capital City this year DON"T. Almost everything is under construction, renovation, closed or difficult to access. Located on the edge of the ottawa river, this is one of the landmarks of the city.In the summer time you csn watch the guard changes on the front lawn. Parliament Hill is quite impressive. The buildings are so similar to the architecture in England. The view from the park across the canal is very striking.

Canada's Parliament Hill and Gothic Revival Style Buildings stand against Ottawa the sky inspiring a sense of peace, order, and good government. The majestic site of the Canadian Parliament Buildings is spectacular. There are amazing, historic buildings everywhere you look...& there are newer, modern buildings sprouting up in between! Ottawa is a must-see city in Canada!!!

While in Ottawa on a recent vacation, we had the opportunity to visit and tour the Parliament Buildings. The actual tour of the buildings was free. Was able to sit in the gallery and watch parliament in session for question period. Seats are tight and it was warm so don't dress to heavy. Had a tour after the session and there is a ton of beauty and interesting history.

I always enjoy visiting Parliament Hill and am so very proud of it and of most of our history as a nation. Lots of beautiful items and rooms to get to know. Great guides. A real sense of joy that this is the heart of our nation! So grateful that I am a Canadian

A striking and photogenic building in the more sedate city of Ottawa. Well worth a walk around the building and surrounding area as there are several statues of interest including the Queen and various Canadian Prime Ministers.

Took my friend from China to Parliament Hill during his trip to Canada. Got there during the evening and he was so impressed we ended up going back the next day. Beautiful interior, interesting and informative tour. The inside of Parliament was a bit warm for me and we visited in mid-April. The views from the tower are incredible and spans 360 degrees around the city of Ottawa and across the river into Quebec.

Visiting the parliament buildings gave me a whole new perspective on being Canadian! It is a beautiful building and all Canadians should visit it at least once in their lifetime!The tours are free but you do need to get tickets in advance - same day availability only-ticket office opens at 9 - get there early! We decided to get the free tickets for a guided tour of the main block , and it was certainly informative. A beautiful Canadian site....and important landmark to visit. See the Changing of the Guards, See the eternal flame and throw a coin in the fountain...

It was a huge building and beautiful one, as We expected. Surrounded by other European style buildings. We went in October so it was nice to see Fall colors. If you're going to be in Ottawa, make the time to see Parliament-first off its free -you do have to make reservations by that I mean book a time for your tourIt's awe inspiring the sheer size of everything as well as the craftsmanship and detail everywhere you look-you're literally walking in and on the history of this great...

This centrally located area is a beautiful park that allows you to enjoy the best view in town of the Parliament. It is a short walk distance from the Notre Dame Cathedral and the National Gallery (parking available underground). If you are in town for the beautiful leaf change season, you will enjoy a particularly beautiful scenario.

Everyone should visit our centre of government, if they are lucky enough to get the chance. History abounds in this architectural beauty. Awesome to see the rooms as we do on television. Security is tight, as it should be. Proud to be a Canadian.
A must see place when you visit Ottawa. Beautiful architectures. Impressive. We have been here a few times and never get bored.

Any visit to Ottawa Canada's national capital must include a visit to the parliament buildings. It is the seat of the national government but also a beautiful building. Wow! So impressed. The building on the outside is so impressive. Wish I would have had more time in Ottawa to tour the inside but glad I had a chance to see it.

Worth taking the time to get a little inside story into Canadian history. We arranged a one-night trip to Ottawa in the middle weekend os our fortnight in Montreal. This building is inspiring. We shall return some other year.

Parliament Hill has some of the most beautiful buildings anywhere. I love Ottawa!!! There's so much to see and do. Big city amenities with a small town feel. Parliament hill is a must see, especially if you are a political buff like myself! The history and architecture are exemplary, and I would totally recommend this to all visitors in the Ottawa area.

If you are into old Canadian buildings. This is one you would like to see, inside and out. Book an inside tour or just wonder around on your own outside. The eternal flame will greet you as you come of the street. Make a wish and toss your coin in. The canal runs along side the hill, so stop by...

So much Canadian history, beautiful buildings and grounds and so educational! The tour guides are wonderful , very enthusiastic and knowledgeable! The light show every evening is spectacular! Every Canadian should be proud of our heritage shown in theses buildings!

Nice place to take a lie surely stroll. The bldgs and tours are great. There is a lot of construction going on at the moment. Great place to take pictures.

A must see for tourists world wide and Canadians alike. Ottawa is definitely a bustling city - very similar in feel to Washington, D.C., USA. The Parliament building and the surrounding buildings are very cool to look at. We were not able to do a tour as tickets were sold out (get there early!), but there's lots to see outside.
Free tours of our Parliament - Very cool to see what happens and the history. Very educational and you get to see many of our MP's walk around.

We took the FREE guided tour of the East building and the Parliament building itself and really enjoyed all the info and beautiful architecture! The Nothern Lights show offered in the evening on Parliament Hill was simply amazing!!

We did a Centre Block tour and really enjoyed it. It had been years since I'd visited Parliament - I'd forgotten how beautiful the building is. The architecture is impressive. Brought the family to visit Ottawa and one of the major goals was to get on the tour of the Parliament Buildings. Any visit to Ottawa would not be complete without visiting Parliament Hill. Tickets to tour the building can be purchased near by and are free. Great tour to have a look into the Canadian democratic system. The building itself is remarkable while the highlight of the tour is the library.

It is a fantastic tour about a hour which provided free of charge in French or English. You can get know the history of Canada. The most impressed me is the Centennial Frame which is the water and flame Union The tour guy is friendly.
Ottawa you keep it upGreat Showpiece of ArchitectureIndeed it is memories of lifetimeMust see if one is in OttawaSurroundings should not be missedOpen Market etc
This was my first time to the parliament buildings, the staff was friendly and the tour was interesting.

Definitely make the trip to visit the Parliament buildings. There is a show at night called the Northern Lights. It's recommended to visit it at night as well

From almost every angle the buildings are beautiful, although some were being restored on our visit. Take a walk around the well tended grounds and be sure to visit in the evening for the light show

I worked here from 89 to 95 but every time I'm in Ottawa I go. Inside..outside you can see The Hill a million times and not see it all. Interesting visit for us and glad we did it. Tours of the Center and East block were Free, but the English ones fill up early.Construction in the area and part of the building was closed to public because of Page training at the time of our visit.Northern Lights show in evening a must and is free!
very cool - the tour into the tower - guide was very friendly and knowledgeable. Enjoyed visiting the bell tower especially.

Fantastic light show !! Wow they really did an awesome job and our kids were also impressed. Don't miss the chance to see it ... you won't be disappointed.We also did centre block and peace tower tour .. Tuesday afternoon at 2 o'clock. Anabel was our guide and she was great.

Visited Ottawa last week. Happened to watch the sounds and lights show (9:30 pm every night till Sept 10).What a awesome experience to see Canadian history in this manner. Don't miss this if you're in the area. You'll love it. Sound is a little low but still a great experience.

Wow place must see if u visit OttawaNice sound and light showsSo much space to easily see and enjoy???????

Stopped here with 8 & 10 year old boys on the way through Ottawa. Was a nice walk around east and west block. Didn't have time for any of the tours but the boys thought the buildings were pretty cool.

A 'must do' when in Ottawa. Very interesting free tour by enthusiastic guides. Ensure you get tickets early in the morning to avoid disappointment.
Did not get to tour because a ticket was needed, which you had to get in the morning for tour in the afternoon

We lined up early to get the exact time we wanted. Would recommend going early if you want to avoid large tour groups. Super knowledgeable tour guides. Awesome way to learn about Canada history. Make sure to go back in the evening for the light show.

We were visiting family and visited this impressive place again.We also went to see the free light and laser show which was incredible. If you want some place to go and hat is budget free, this is a place where you can visit! We went with family and they loved every minute of it!
The Parliament Buildings are such a wonderful place to visit. There is so much history there that every Canadian should go at least once in their lifetime.

Good to do, for all Canadians and visitors. We were fortunate to overhear others talking about tickets for the tours. At least in the summer months, you must line up for tickets, starting at 9am. Enjoyed visiting the grounds and the night light show. Beautiful buildings! Recommend a stop over for those visiting Ottawa.

I don't have words to describe the tours we did of the Parliament buildings!!! We chose to do the East block and Centre block as well as the Peace Tower!! Waiting to go through security required a bit of patience but the tours are something we will not forget. Amazing.

Love Parliament Hill in the summer or in the winter time. I always feel glad to be a Canadian on the Hill. I particularly love the Suffragette Monument along the canal. It is official, Women Are Persons!

We visited on a Friday and walked around the buildings. It was a great place to relax and enjoy the history.Recommend a view from the park

I live in Ottawa and this is defiantly the place to visit. Just the exterior look stunningly nice. If you time it right you can see the flag change, changing of the guard and much more. Lovely to tour around. Walking. We stayed outside but have been in in the past.Son wanted to know if he could have pic taken with Justin T.

The architecture in the buildings are spectacular. It reminded me of the houses of Parliament in London. They do a light show at 9.30pm at night which we missed but I'm sure it would have been good to see.

Lovely square with great architecture all around. Get there before 10am to see the changing of the guard. Tickets to see Parliament building are first come first served every am from the building across the road. Get there early so you are not disappointed.
Went to the parliament buildings at night and caught the 30 minute free light show alt 930....it was very worth the 45 min wait...buildings were awesome as ever.
Great looking buildings and grounds, definitely worth a stop. If you're there in the evening there's a terrific light show, well worth the time.
Make to get you tickets before. It's across the street. The visit is interesting and staff very nice

Absolutely worth a visit. Imposing structure.We took the free walking tour of the four key points outside the bldg. our tour guide was s young student Phillipe. In 45 mins we got a good idea if Canadian history.

Although, Parliment Hill and downtown Ottawa are busy with construction and renovations, it is still a great place to walk. There is Canadian music playing on speakers, and the parilment building has a light show around 10:PM nightly. The buildings are old and and still great to look at.

"Ottawa" is synonymous to this view of the water, Parliament structure and surrounding buildings. Beautiful in summer. A step away and you are in Quebec!
Great place to walk around - beautiful buildings, statues and loads of information about Canada to read about.

We took the tour (it's free) inside the Parliament and it is a beautiful building. The library is the best thing of all , its really gorgeous . You can go up the tower and have a great view of the city..

My friend took me here the building is amazing !! They don't make buildings like this anymore !!! It's a great place to bring the family !!

This is a must see for travellers to Ottawa. See where our parliament sits and discusses the laws. Full of rich history, tapestries, paintings and some amazing stonework.

A must for travellers to the Nations Capital and for all Canadians. A wealth of history and stunning architecture in the House of Commons and Senate rooms. I was very pleased with the show. Attended with out of town guest, all were pleased with the show. It was great to see the hill alive with visitors from young to old

First time visiting the Nations capital, I had to see the parliament buildings. Very impressed had an amazing light show outside, as I visited two weeks before Christmas. Centrally located close to all the major downtown hotels, a must see for anyone who visits Ottawa.

Wonderful place, a must-see if you are in Ottawa. Would recommend a guided tour to get the full appreciation of the Hill.

Did the 10PM light show... great history mixed with entertainment. Saw changing of the guard, get there by 945AM to see them marching in for 10AM .
