There are different Parlaiment tours, we went on Center tour,...

This is a must see! The buildings are beautiful and the tour of the center building is worth it. Just make sure you go early to get tickets. They are free but sell out quickly. Also get there a bit before 10 for the changing of the guard. Great experience to see.

Fortissimo is a special evening event held each year for three days, this year July 21 to 23.We attended last night's production which began at 7:00 PM. The evening was warm and the "Hill" was crowded. The opening event started off with a parachute demonstration by the Canadian Forces skydiving team the "Sky Hawks". This began with a pass...
Enjoyed watching debate in house. Looked for activity that would interest visitors and we decided to do this tour. Would return.
Absolutely a place to visit. A beautiful building full of history. The tour is free. Great views of Ottawa river from rear of the centre block.
If you're in Ottawa, this is absolutely is a must see! Make sure you see the "northern light" lightshow at 10pm!!! There is also a free guided tour in the buidlings but only before 4pm

Government buildings can either be very boring, or they can make a statement. The parliament buildings make a statement. Beautiful old world look on the outside, Canada's history told with art on the inside. The library, the only section to survive the great fire, is absolutely amazing in it's beauty. Do remember though, it is a government facility and you...

Even though everything is under some type of restoration for the 150 year celebration next year, it is still beautiful. The buildings that make up Parliament are amazing, don't forget to watch the changing of the guard on Parliament Hill, well worth seeing.
This tour made me proud to be a Canadian. The tour guide was knowledgeable and fun. Do not miss the opportunity to go up the Peace Tower - the view is spectacular from up there.

They gave a great talk on the history of the building and a light show, it was very informative and it was lovely how they gave the talk outside of the building so that you were always facing the building. a platform was erected and seats were available. It was well thought out and executed. I enjoyed it.
Although the buildings and site is very nice, the ongoing construction really spoils the view. Cranes and trucks are everywhere. Not a single picture without a crane on it.

At 10pm there is a "Lazer Light Show" on the face of the parliament building. Locals told us that they do a new show every year, and I believe it is for just the summer months. This year 2016 it was about the achievements and important figures of Canadian history. The show goes for 30 minutes and you can sit...

When I had a tour of the Parliament Buildings there was no trouble getting a tour. Now I had to line up at 7:30 am for the tickets to be handed out at 9am in order to get a tour. The lineup was long by 9 am for free tickets. Only 9 tickets can be received at once so if...
Take in the night light and music shows on the hill when they are available. They are usually 7-8 minutes long so kid friendly. Check out the statues and centennial flame.

Tickets for tours are given out starting at 9 am. Get in line early. We waited 45 minutes in line. Great tour and I am American. The light show at night on the front of the Parliment Building last about 30 minutes. Very good. Take chair if possible otherwise you set on the lawn.
if u go to ottawa u need to see parlement hill , nice view and nice art work around , must to seeinside is amazing and u can acces for free during the week

We were within a few blocks of Parliament Hill and so after a full day of visiting museums and walking, we almost decided to call it a day, but then rallied to take in this one more place of interest. We arrived about 8:30 pm with a notion to watch the sun go down and then return to our room....
Get in line before 9 for great free tours inside the parliament buildings in English or French. The 45 minute tours of the east and central blocks are informative and just the right length!

This is my third visit and I finally made it there!Okay so the frustrating thing is to visit the Peace Tower or get a Centre Block tour you have to go get tickets first thing in the morning and it's first come first served and you can't get tickets for the next day, only that specific day, so if...

The Gothic style centre block building with a copper top stands tall and impressive. Parliament Hill covers a large area.Admission is free. There is also a free tour inside the building. This worth your trip to the capital of the Canada.
Changing of the guard worth watching. Tour was fine and very informative. Good for any history pr political buffs
Lot's of walking , they had many places to rest there tour of parliament was very interesting beautiful building .a must see have to go through security so don't bring anything you shouldn't .

Had to queue up early to get free tickets. The earlier you queue the better chance you have of getting the time you want. We queued for an hour from 8.30 to get tickets for 11.05 but then went to watch changing of the guard before tour. Security check before entry. Tour guide friendly and informative but group size too...

I last visited more than a decade ago and was proud of the gracious building, tasteful rooms, carvings and portraits. I was proud of the easy access that I thought was a good reflection of our open approach to government.On this recent visit with out-of-town guests, I found the security inefficient and intrusive. We lined up at 8:30 a.m....

I love Parliament Hill and buildings around, it is very nice and good for families with the kids. The view of the Rideau river is beautiful, you can also have boat tours. We like the tour of the parliament, it is very interesting and fascinating.
We visited Parliament Hill and watched the changing of the Guard. A must see while in Ottawa!! Kudos to the young men and women serving are country who participate in this event !!!
The Parliament visit including tour was excellent. The show at night of lights and sound was outstanding. In addition I recommend the change of guard show. Wonderful!!!
Our tour was rivetting. Did not find my attention wandering at all! I found emotions bubbling up that I did not expect. Pride mostly.

Highly recommend taking a tour if you're staying in Ottawa. It is about an hour long. Tickets are free however, you need to pick them up the morning of your tour and they sell out fast! Very informative and interesting.

The Parliament Hill and Buildings was beautiful the walking was amazing!!! Not far from there were the locks for boats we stood and watched that. You have to buy tickets to go through the Parliament buildings.
Fun to visit, lots to see. All is free. Nice place to sit quietly and have lunch. Good for lovers of history.

The architecture is one thing that is just beautiful. We heard however, that the inside was where all the beauty is. The problem is getting the tickets to get the inside tours. We were unsuccessful twice. You have to be there early (Around 9 AM) to secure tickets. The lines are much worse than ever dreamed of at Disneyland. We...

Beautiful building but just my luck that all Ottawa even the Parliament building is under construction and the grass of front of the building is dead. As Canadian I was little upset about all this ugly view. I understand that this is preparation for 2017, 150th birthday for Canada but this huge companies can manage something with more clear view.

An excellent tour well run. Friendly. Lots of information. Line up for tickets across street in the morning. Highly recommended.Go in the evening in July and August for a sound and light show projected on the parliament center block. Worth it

I had the opportunity to participate in a sponsored tour as part of a conference. I was amazed by the library, paintings, and architecture. The docents were knowledgable, warm and friendly. Highly recommend taking time to tour.

This was magnificent. I was super impressed with all of the people they had on the sidewalks who had the sole purpose of helping and answering questions. They were so nice and informative. I don't think I talked to a single person who was grouchy or impolite. We got in line across the street at 8:15 on a Sunday morning...

We didn't tour Parliament on this visit, as the buildings aren't open on Canada Day (Canada's national holiday, celebrated similarly as the U.S.'s Independence Day), but tours are always interesting. If possible, get to Parliament for the daily changing of the guard (the bearskin-hatted Canadian Grenadier Guards) ceremonies. Go early, get close to the fence around the parade grounds (or...

The buildings are extremely beautiful and the plaza too. The big problem is that tickets are free but limited and you have to get them in front of the buildings in an office building. I went at 3pm and I Couldn't get in because they were out of tickets for the rest of the day.
We could only see a limited portion of the buildings since all the rear sections (library, statue of Baldwin-LaFontaine & others) were blocked off (no public access).
Brought some out of town guests to see the parliament buildings and they absolutely loved it! The grounds are so well kept!

Make sure you set some time aside to walk around Parliament Hill! If you want to take the free tour, be sure to get there early (9 am) to get your passes. They generally sell out by 11am.The clock tour played some beautiful music as well as chiming in the half hour.The buildings are so beautiful and the...

In order to tour parliament, you must secure (free) tickets in advance, across the street in the building behind the Terry Fox statue. Tours are available in both English and French. Show up by 10am to ensure you get tickets for that day, we chose 2pm.Our tour guide, Margot met our group next to the flag pole outside parliament....

So glad I got to show my children the Parliament Buildings as they are being closed:( LOTS of crowds/crazy lines/and waiting!!! And that was in MAY! But now we can stay been there done that....and check...Hooray for Canada Eh!!!

Take the tour of Canada's Parliament to view the stunning architecture, paintings, and to learn about Canada's political history. If you are there in the morning, view the changing of the guard. Late in the evening you can see the wonderful light and sound show. It is well worth your time to visit Parliament.
This place is amazing. The view from the top of the tower is excellent. Very friendly guides, the place is stunning.
This area I so marvellous, it perfect if you enjoy walking. They area is under construction at the moment likely due for our 150th celebration.
Very stoic, you know it is parliament! Building great history great. I wouldn't do it twice but once for sure. The Fairmont is next door. And the byward market is great for food and people watching.
Parliament Hill changing of the guard is a Must see when you're in Ottawa Ontario Canada. It starts at 10:00 on sunny days. It is about an hour long. Get there early it is a great spectical.
You can't visit the Parliament building without booking a free tour across the street at the tourist bureau. Consider getting tickets the day ahead as the tours are often fully booked.
I have been there many thime. They are renovating the buildings now. But still beautiful buildings by the river.
Great about canadian history. Staff was friendly. Nice to meet random people also on tour. Close to many other attractions.
It is part of the Canadian identity, it are not beautifull buildings. What was impressive was Canada Day, we were at this inpressive ceramony 1-7

At the moment there is allot of construction around the area and HOWEVER its still a magnificent building. Parliament is open to visitors free of charge, directly opposite on Wellington at the Tourism office. There is of course security which you will need to go through it does move quite fast but I would advise the earlier the better. The...
The buildings are beautiful to see. The tours are great. Love going up the peace tower. Seeing the library on the tour is spectacular.
I think it is important for every Canadian to see where government happens. Take the tour, listen to the history---sit in on question period if you can.

A great place to visit: the buildings - the Peace Tower including the view, the magnificent library, both houses (Commons and Senate); the grounds - the centennial flame and the very colorful changing of the guards ceremony; and more importantly Canada Day (July 1) - the noon show, the flyby of the Snow Birds and the half a million visitors...

We were there the day before Canada Day and the Hill was hopping! We went on a guided tour of the Parliament Buildings. Our host was a student doing this job in vacation time. She provided a rather mechanical commentary. The buildings were nice and changing of the guard was cool to watch, it was a little too hot to stand up for a while though.

Although the place has a very visible security presence, it does not feel intimidating and is, on the contrary, quite friendly and welcoming.Tickets for the free tours of the Parliament buildings can be obtained at the Visitor Information Center across the street but they go very fast so line up early. We were only in Ottawa for one day but spent some time at Parliament Hill. The buildings are fantastic. Wish we had been able to go on the tour. We back next morning for the Changing of the Guard. Really enjoyed Ottawa!
The hill itself is beautiful, the buildings around it are worth the visit. If you want to go in the parliament, it's about an hour to go through the security checks.
Was nice to see the buildings you hear about and see on tv and in books all the time. We were to late to go in and will be back to go inside another time.
Come at the holiday weekend, the building is closed but still a place to take alot pictures and walk around the place.
Love to set foot on the soil and hang out on the lawn. Very secure and peaceful. Wish I could stay longer. I recommend you.go and enjoy the view also

Absolutely the highlight of our time in Ottawa! We loved the tour and seeing all the history within the halls. I would do this again in a heatbeat!FYI: Tickets go on sale at 9am...

It is amazing in this day and age that Canadians can get this close to our government, and the best value in town. Refresh or learn you Canadian civics with a tour through the parliament of Canada. See where your MPs and Senators do their work.Line of up early for your free ticket at 90 Wellington. We visited the parliament on the outside to watch the change of guard and at the end of the day just to sit on the grass. The place is amazing. I wanna to tam pictures all time. My kids loved it.

Seeing our nations finest infrastructures was mind blowing to say the least. If you enjoy staring at green buildings as much as i do then this is the place for you. Very cool walks with family and friends.

I took the East Block Tour and Centre Block Tour.East Block was my favourite! Our guide Nick was fantastic, he has a true passion and enjoyment for this place which added to this tour. Not only the fireworks which are exceptional but you must tour the building as the history in them is something you wouldn't want to miss.

Was very nice, but we arrived on June 29 when Obama was in town. Barricades and restricted access everywhere so that Three Amigos could pump out some B.S. hot air. Also, one of the three main Parliament Buildings surrounded by scaffolding and a huge stage set up in front of main building blocking view. (Canada Day). Would be nicer if...
These majestic Parliamentary buildings were spoilt by so much scaffolding and also the huge stage set up ready for Canada Day celebrations.

The buildings and square are very nice to walk around to experience the history of Canada. The views from the top are spectacular. Behind the building are walking trails along the river and canal. Also, dynamic of the guard during the summer months.
We thoroughly enjoyed the pomp and ceremony of the changing of the guard. The March past and the band was great.

Not our first time in Ottawa, but first time there for Canada day, not a bad place for some weekend fun, great if your staying around the byward market( lots to do,see and restaurants, bar, ect)Want to go back when it's not Canada day just to walk spark st and other areas
The visit to parliament is the best part of a travel to Ottawa. The place is incredible. The architecture is beautiful, and its a free tour. Arrive early for not wait too much for the tour.

A wonderful part of Ottawa and a must see. Unfortunately the queues for (free) tickets to visit the parliament buildings are very long - get there 08.30 latest. nice historic buildings very good architecture. There are free tours every day, and pass for same are given out at building opposite to main building across the road. But you will have be in line to get that well before 8 AM.

Super cool to see inside. Get there early for tickets - ticket booth opens at 9 but by 830 there's plenty of people in line. We got there 845 on a weekday and took a 945 tour. It was super interesting (though being quiet is hard with toddlers!) and the view from the peace tower was really neat! Our tour...

This is a must see place when in Ottawa. Its a free tour, and tickets are available on the day of the tour only. Be early to take tickets, and expect for a 30 minutes line up. But its worth it. A must-do activity when visiting the city of Ottawa. The tickets for tours of the Centre Block and Eastern Block are offered free each day. Amazing day until it rained and we got soaked. Was great to see Justin Trudeau and his wife. Always enjoy the celebrations on Canada day can't wait for next year. Canada 150

The tour guide "Sarah" was great. Unfortunately security took long as VIPs get ahead of everyone. Also we didn't even get to see house of commons because of Presidents Obama's and Enrique Pea Nieto Visit the day prior :( disappointing to say the least. My husband and I took in the Centre Block tour. We were told to arrive by 8:45 to stand in line for tickets but we arrived just before 8:30 and found over 100 people in line already. Very, very interesting.In my opinion, it is a must see when in Ottawa. Our guide was very funny and the amount of history is amazing.The library was the best part.My only complaint is that it was too quick at 45 mins.Save some extra time for the Peace Tower.Make sure you get in line for tickets...

Changes in the way tours are done, meant we couldn't get inside. Tours are first come, first serve. We arrived just after 10:30 am and the first available tour was 4 pm. We couldn't come back for that as we had made supper plans with family. Disappointing, as I had been telling my husband how much he was going to...

The parliament and surrounding buildings are beautiful. Perhaps the best is the east block building. On the grounds are various sculptures and monuments of interest. Only negative is that many of the buildings are being renovated with scaffolding and cranes everywhere. My review of the parliament centre block tour is under parliament hill.
We walked all around the parliament buildings and it was gorgeous! Next time we go we will be doing the tour!

We visited Parliament Hill on June 30 - a day before Canada Day. SO, if you are lucky you will catch the free 3D mapping laser light show "Northern Lights" which is amazing. Basically goes over the super interesting history of Ottawa and Canada, while projecting visuals on the Parliament building. Should not be missed. Great for everyone.Read all about it and how to have the perfect day in Ottawa at my...

It is necessary to get your (free) tickets in advance, generally that morning. Sometimes they are sold out by 9 am. We got there about 9 am and missed the boat - had to be satisfied by seeing the Parliament building only from the outside. That complex is quite impressive, but seeing the inside would have made it better.

Beautiful day in Ottawa for the day. So historic and beautiful. Parliament and capital hill very impressive. Grabbed a walking tour map and visited all the must land marks . Worth 2 hours drive from mount Tremblant !

The Houses of Parliament is a fantastic building. Unfortunately is in repairing period and the were some stage for Canada Day Show that we could not see the architecture in a hole.The rear view from the lake is fantastic.

Free tour but have to arrive early to pick a time to tour. We picked a tour a few hours in advance and had time to walk down to the Royal Canadian Mint for a tour there as well. Tours offered in English or French. Well presented, beautiful architecture, very informative.
Exploring this magnificent building and its rich history made me feel proud to be a Canadian.A must do for every Canadian.

If you come to visit Ottawa, then this is a must stop for any visitor. Guided tours are offered and throughout the year they offer a variety of different events daily. From the changing of the guard during the day. To light shows projected on the Parliament buildings. You will not be disappointed.

We did the parliament free tour which was great and very informative. Tour tickets are given out on a first come, first served basis directly across the road from the parliament building it's self. We lined up for 10 mins and opted for an afternoon tour. Saw both inside the parliament and senate and the library is a real wow...

If you visit Ottawa you should do the tour of the parliment buildings. I really enjoyed the actual tour and going up the Peace Tower. What was dissapointing was the long wait to get through security. This place is lovely although it can get pretty touristy. Bring a camera to take cool pictures. The buildings themselves are pretty photogenic and all in all beautiful. Awesome place to visit while in Ottawa.

this was so cool. loved it. the buildings look so different in person. the grounds were beautiful I went during tulip festival and the flowers were spectacular.so many different colors. beautiful weather and not loads of tourists so was a perfect walk about day.
A mix of old and new! The parliament buildings sit amongst the new Ottawa, with a little imagination you can drift back to a bygone era.
The Parliament is gearing up for Canada day. It was great to see the changing of the guards and tour the buildings. Love the few from the Peace Tower and seeing the bells on the way up and down.
Going up the Peace Tower is a must. Impressive library, and the kids were very interested in the history of the library.

Just in town fir one night so not having been here for nearly 50 years thought I'd take a walk around parliament hill.Preparations were under way for Canada day celebrations unfortunately I won't be here for that.A very diverse crowd was relaxing on the lawn, truly Canadian .Everyone should come here to experience some Canadian history.

Fantastic building, very good guide, the 'awesome' Brianna. (Sorry but it was her favourite word!) parts of the building take your breath away. Trip up the tower is included. Get there by 8.45 as the queues REALLY build up.
On a recent visit with my daughter in Ottawa, we decided to visit Canada's parliament buildings. Very impressive ... and a pleasant experience ... a must-do for anyone visiting Canada's capital.

We were in Ottawa for a day and couldn't do a tour inside because we were travelling with our four-legged furry pal. But we thought a walk around the grounds would be nice. free of charge and excellent building to see it has its own charm and nice to see castle and where our governments work.

Just strolling around the Hill, round the back of the Parliement building to the river views and library building, shows you what beautiful buildings these are. Go early in the morning for the changing of the guards. Walk around and see all the statues, take your camera.

The conical library at the rear of the parliament buildings is an impressive structure, highlighted by fantastic wood carved features. It is the only original structure to survive the fire in 1916. (one theory has the fire started by WW1 German saboteur) The tower is much higher than the original and affords great views of the Ottawa River and area....
Beautiful history in the capital of Canada. Visiting Parliament Hill is a must when in Ottawa. Gorgeous views and scenery all around.

I live in Ottawa and this has to be your 1st stop when visiting here. This is right downtown so everything is close by. My daughter and I enjoyed our visit to Parliament Hill!We actually took part in the Yoga on the Hill! It was totally amazing! Hundreds of participants enjoying the beauty of the surroundings while taking part in a well delivered yoga session.I would recommend this for anyone visiting the city!

The parliament buildings in Ottawa is in a beautiful spot along the Ottawa river and is really cool to go and see. This is a must for your bucket list if you come to Ottawa. July, is the best month. Flowers in full bloom, enjoy the sounds and light show on the Hill in the evening, and take part in a tour during the day. Things to do for the whole family.
Under going some work so lots of scaffolding but still nice to see, and the surrounding area is lovely

Awe inspiring amenities and architecture. Historically and politically significant. It is wonderful to feel welcomed in the centre of a country's political arena, security is effective and reasonably trouble-free, very informative tour.

Arrived at the visitor center about 10:30 and was able to get tickets for 12:50 tour. They suggested that we could tour the Supreme Court building while we waited. Did both tours and really enjoyed learning about the Canadian government and law system. Tour guides were very informative at both locations. Great walk for any Canadian or visitor to Ottawa. Under some construction at the moment for Canada Day and the 150 but always a nice walking place to visit

You can get a free tour of the Canadian Parliament buildings just get your ticket at the office at the bottom of the hill. Go ear.y as they get very busy, we went about 11.00am and couldn't get a tour until 4.20pm. Very good tour informative, lively and good insight into Canadian history. Highly recommended.

Liked the aspect of security clearance at the entrance. View from the Peace Tower was superb. And to be able to walk the halls of government and see the architecture on the walls and pillars was great
My girlfriend and I came to Ottawa on vacation in June, although it was the week before Canada and there was major set up for the Canada day celebration the views and experience were amazing.
It is a little-UK in the middle of Ottawa... I feel like visiting London! It is a must in your visit to Ottawa.

These buildings are the heart of Canadian democracy and the quintessential figures of Ottawa's downtown. The iconic green roofing is a sight to behold. If politicians didn't work here, this might be a five-star review.

I visited with my daughter it was a great tour we had James as our tour guide who was very informative and knew his job well. We went through security which was fine and also went up to the clock tower and sat in on a parliament meeting.

The entire area is beautiful and very clean all around. Get tickets for a tour of the Parliament Building at the information center and spend 45 very informative minutes learning about the architecture and symbolism of the various portraits, emblems, stone, etc. The library is stunning.

We only had a day to see anything and there was nothing to see! Because the 150th birthday of Canada is next year everything is under scaffolding getting a facelift. When you are at the Parliament Hill you fell how great is Canada, its institutions, values and people

Parliament hill is a beautiful landmark in Ottawa. What I particularly enjoyed was the heritage staff available to answer any questions visitors had on the building or surrounding area. I also really enjoyed learning about the women having tea statues - significant for the changing of regulations allowing women to vote! Remarkable!

A key visit on the tourist trail for all ages with good optional trip up clock tower for excellent view down to the city.availability was excellent as there were many different slots at 2 hours notice . I always enjoy the environs of Parliament Hill. Although I believe the Victoria parliament buildings are nicer, it was very exciting to be able to see where the federal government operates. The hill was great, having an older person using a cane is difficult getting up the driveway to the hill is crazy. Like being in Paris, France the grand old buildings are a sight to behold. Unfortunately they are covered in scaffold while repointing is being done. Thus photography and entering were not as good to do as might otherwise be expected.

the stone work inside is very lovely, and you should go see it this year, as it is closing for 10 years for repairs.When it gets open again I hope the tours are better then the one we went on, as there was no where near the amount of information on this tour and we only went to see...

Have visited twice in 2 years. Did a lovely guided tour of Parliament and went into the Peace Tower. Beautiful architecture and history in this building. The library is stunning. Beautiful 360 views from tower of Ottawa and Quebec.

Amazingly, you can actually hang out on the lawn of our nation's Capitol. They even have yoga on Wednesdays at noon. Tours are guided and limited in number so come early to get a free ticket.

We spent the day walking around and taking in all the sights. Everybody should try to visit at least once and we are happy we had the opportunity. We went on a Saturday and didn't find it overly busy/crowded.

Munro (our tour guide) was exceptional: passionate, well-informed, thoughtful and encouraged questions. Also, the library was "out-of-this-world." Finally, we enjoyed attending the public galleries after the tour to hear the Senate and House debate "Right to Die" and TPP legislation, respectively.

The first time I visited the Parliament Buildings was in 1992 when I attended a session of Question Period in the House of Commons. When the session was over, the first thing I could think of was... We were really happy we went. Did the tour and we sat in the gallery for question period. Got our MP to get a pass for us. The whole set up is not great. You have to turn up for tickets. We showed up at 10 and the earliest tickets were for 2:50. Really limits what you can do during the day. The tour itself was great. There is a great view of parliament from the park behind the art museum.

To visit Parliament Hill and it's buildings is a must. We had no problem getting our free tickets to the Parliament Buildings tour and had the most wonderful experience being guided round the most amazing Parliament. The guide was knowledgeable and helpful, but I still want to know what wood is used for all the doors etc. The library was...

There are so many old buildings here- but there is also lots of building works going on too. There are many places to stop and eat and lots of photo opportunities. Be sure to try the"Beaver Tails" on sale in the market

Everything is amazing! To see these beautiful building of our history up close is breathtaking! Unfortunately, the building are being renovated, so there is a lot building materials around but they will be even more beautiful when finished! Love Ottawa!

A must see in Ottawa! Why would you come here and not see Parliament? The gothic architecture is wonderful, and you can take tours that include going up the Peace Tower. But, even if you are not into that, a picnic on the lawns is a great way to spend the afternoon. If you are up and about; try seeing...

While at Parliament Hill we sat in on Question Period at the House of Commons. Quite interesting and I would recommend attending. We also had the opportunity to watch the Senate at work and it was even more interesting than Question Period. The tour was very informative and the tour guides are open to asking questions and explaining anything that...

Accessing and enjoying this site has never been harder. Be prepared for many obstacles to get to the building and its grounds t-- go early if possible. Iconic as it is, you might consider visiting Parliament and the entire downtown core another year - like 2018! After all, it won't disappear but the new and improved version may be worth...

The tour is really worth it! It's beautiful on the inside and the peace tower gives you great views of the city. Arrive there early to get tickets (its free but you have to sign up for it every morning from 9am on)

I've taken to walking every day at lunch, and this walk often brings me up to Parliament Hill. There is always something new to see every day. Sometimes it is seeing what group is having a protest, people doing yoga at lunch on Wednesdays in the summer, the MPs leaving a parliamentary session, or some foreign dignitaries.Those who live...

The free tour is great! Our tour guide Nick was animated and made the tour very engaging and had answers for some tricky questions posed by members of our tour group. The tour allows you to go up the Peace Tower and to sit in the house if the Members or Senate are still sitting.

It was my daughter's first visit to Ottawa and I was her your guide for the day. We explored around the grounds and fire monument, locks and tulips. We took the free tour of parliament buildings. This tour never ceases to amaze me. The architecture us stunning. Your guides always do an awesome job relating building architecture and political stories....
You'd think the nightly light show would be tacky. It's not. It's a good history lesson and tastefully done.
The buildings are very attractive and we also undertook the tour of Parliament - the tour guide was excellent.

It was hard not to feel patriotic while visiting our Parliament Buildings. They are ornate and beautiful. The tours were great and the tour guides informative. I understand why security is serious, but yelling at a woman using a walker to "hurry up" was rude and inappropriate.We took a group of 110+ students and believe it was so valuable...
Architecturally interesting and adjacent to the big river and Rideau canal, which is kind of fascinating.
I have lived in Ottawa for the bulk of my life and would highly recommend all visitors to visit Parliament Hill, for each season there is something interesting to see.

Parliament Hill is beautiful, outside and inside. The tour of the centre block is free, and given by great guides. We got to see the inside of both chambers as well as the library. Across the street at the tourist information you could get pamphlets describing everything worth seeing outside and in the surrounding downtown area, perfect for a self...

Take your tour in French. There is an office across the street where you can get tickets. Go early in the morning to get tickets to see the parliament buildings. These offices are across from the parade grounds and are for the free tours I believe. Something different since the last time I was here to do the same thing....

If you find yourself in the nation's capital you have to go see the Parliament buildings. You may even catch the Prime Minister. You can also get tickets for the free tour across the street, just look for the Terry Fox statue, the building is right behind it. Don't forget to see the Centennial Flame like I did, and there's...
We walked to the building and received our tickets across the street. The tour is free. It is a great tour. See The House & the Senate. The building itself is amazing. Would recommend.
Loved walking the grounds during the tulip festival. There are always many groups gathered to preach their beliefs. If you can look at it as entertainment value, it makes for an entertaining day

We took the Parliament tour. Its free so go early as we got there at 10 am and the only tour left was for 5:20 pm. We waited at least an additional 45 minutes to get through security for and approximately 15 minute tour with the library being the highlight. We could go up the tower afterwards, where there were...

Actually, the Peace Tower was the only tour we took (self guided) Wearrived in Ottawa at 2:00 and the parliment tours were sold out (free but limited) by noon) ByJuly I expect they will run out early in the morning, Not to be discouraged, we proceeded with tickets to the Peace tower and it was more than fulfilling. The views...

You got to get tickets for the free tour across the street and depending on the day you could be waiting a long time. They run tours every 10 mins alternating between French and English. Once your tour begins you got to go through secure to have bag checked and airport style search. This was the worst part as you...
Under construction so we couldn't walk around the buildings outside. Kind of boring for the little kids but really awesome to see!

You absolutely cannot go to Ottawa without visiting the parliament! The architecture is impressive and reminds the Westminster palace in London! There is the flame of the confederation at the entrance where often tomes there is a mountie in ckassic uniforme ready to take pictures with visitors. You can even sit in the grass and take a break in your...

Loved the grandeur of the buildings and was amazed that we could actually sit on the grass right outside the parliament building. Lots going on, protesters making their point - all peacefully, a group of Scottish country dancers on the day we visited. Beautiful architecture and history. Really helpful guides through out the city who were happy to engage with...

These beautiful old buildings on Parliment hill are under go construction. Scaffolding everywhere. A shame to see while visiting, but I know this needs to happen. Still the buildings depict buildings in England and are very beautiful.

Great time with our 4 and 8 year olds. Very enthusiastic tour guide who knew how to engage young children and make the tour relevant to them as well as the adults. Worth it to take trip up peace tower.
Really good tour of the Peace Tower. The chiming clock/bell is amazing and the views from the top outstanding
It's free and available for anyone to walk around. It has beautiful grounds and is very picturesque.
Great location, fantastic view from the hill.It is the heart of the city. Everyone shall walk there, even if it is only a 1-2 day trip.
Ottawa is a beautiful city with many green areas, parks and buildings. From the Parliament Tower you can have great views of the city.

My family visited Parliament Hill on our trip to Ottawa. Getting tickets involves a trip across the street to the information centre for a set time.The guide was knowledgeable and seemed to enjoy her job. We enjoyed the trip up the Peace Tower and the views.Recommend for families, as a free tour it's worth the slight hassle for...
Parliament Hill is always nice to see in the late spring. Best is to walk around back and view the river and Hull-Gatineau.

It's no doubt a master piece from even a layman point from its sheer scale and design. Only after walking round the compound, I realised that it is impossible to appreciate the whole structure without taking a helicopter. The best most visitors can do is just to stand in front to appreciate it from far. Breathless indeed.

I really enjoyed going here and walking around especially even behind the Parliament buildings along the canal is beautiful, I love being proud of Canadian history however my boyfriend didn't think it was all that exciting. It's great for typical tourist photos especially since you're in the capitol.

The tour is free. Make sure you queue before 9am to get one of the early tickets. I arrived at 0855 and the queue was long enough to mean the 0920 and 1020 English speaking tours were already full.English tours run hourly 20 past with a break in the middle some times. I think they run French speaking ones...
An amazing architectural building and vibrant tourist crowd. There were a lot of tours being done around the area amidst the usual Canadian weather.
Parliament Hill offers a perfect place to bask and enjoy the beautiful buildings and grounds which are the heart of Canadian democracy. A must see for visitors to Ottawa and/or surrounding areas.

A lot of people there last week during the nice weather. Plenty of construction/ restoration work being done on all parliament buildings and the war memorial was completely blocked off from view due to ongoing restoration. All this is understandably required, but unfortunate as we were only in Ottawa for a few days.

I highly recommend going here. My experience was a Canadian political junkie's dream. I started off at about 9AM lining up across the street for free tour tickets. I got a ticket for the 12:30 tour. You can stow your bags for free where you get your ticket and I highly recommend doing that as it means less security hassle...
Very interesting and lots of history, go across the street to the information bureau and get free tickets to the balcony inside.

If you intend going into the buildings on a tour get to the ticket office on Metcalfe Street early to pick up free tickets, they give you a time slot and there are limited tickets for each. Once you have the tickets you can go off and explore until the allocated time. I would warn you that security take their...

The buildings are more impressive on the outside than the inside. Get a timed ticket at 9am at 90 Wellington across the street from Parliament. I was annoyed that the changing of the guard and the light show only happen after July 5 until the beginning of Sep't. The tour was fine but didn't give me much of a sense...

Beautiful structure with great view of river and Gatineau from the backside. I have been part of a group that has booked in advance so I would highly recommend doing so in order to get a tour. Our tour included a look at the library (beautiful), a view of the Canadian Senate building, and we sat in and listened to...
Interesting indoor activity, learning about the parliment and history of Canada. There is a beautiful view at the top of the houses of parliament must see!

It was my husband's first time in Ottawa so we did a quick walkabout. There is construction and scaffolding around so it detracted from the overall experience. The buildings are stunning and you feel the history but overall everything seems lacklustre. This area should really shine, sparkle and pop! People were commenting on the lack flowers etc. There are student...

Was a bit frightened by the RCMP Officer with the 'ready to shoot' assault rifle, on Parliment Hill.Is was a Saturday, so not able to get inside the Parliament buildings. The War Memorial was closed, as well, for renovations. Disappointing.

We got our tickets just after the morning opening and were able to get in for the 11am guided tour. Our guide was very informed and provided an interesting tour. The halls were lined with portraits I would have liked to have viewed, however they did not allow you to stop and look at the art works in the hallway....
All Canadians have to come to Ottawa to visit the Parliament buildings. It's your duty to do so and besides you can see your tax dollars in action.

Didn't do a guided tour, however there were quite a few on the grounds and we were there around 10ish. Good to have a walk around and take a look at the architecture. Once the building work is completed there will be plenty of good views over the ontario river. Additionaly the are a number of sculptures on the ground...
Was really fun and great for touring. Pretty tulips, the staircase was amazing for group photographs, and the fire was warm on a chilly day. I also love that you can play on the grounds!!
The library is the highlight...also if you can stick around for Question Period it is also memorable.

This was probably the highlight of our stay in Ottawa. Entry is free but you need a timed ticket so go to the information centre across the road to get your ticket early.. They are only issued on the day of use.

Amazing view, amazing country, amazing shows for all family... best of all.. it is FREE!! Canada's capital is a beautiful place to visit and Parliament Hill is the best location to learn about politics, to share cultural events and shows, plus a great open space to relax or raise issues in the Canadian way.. peacefully.

Nice visit if you both want to learn about the history of the parliament and Canada of course. Reservation on the other side of the road. Free commented visit. I suggest to take the French one, less people.

You get tickets for both across the street from the Parliament Buildings...corner of Metcalf.Need to get there early as line up gets long and tickets run out. Top of Peace Tower gives one great views, esp on a clear day. Don't miss the beautiful Library on the Guided tour.If you have a wait beforehand...walk behind East Block Buildings to...

Given the events of 22 October 2014 and the age of the building, the security and construction are necessary but do mar the experience somewhat. Enjoyed attending a couple of sessions of parliament and going up the Peace Tower. If you time your visit for a Wednesday during the summer you can take in a free Yoga session on the...
Many area are out of limit for general public. Lack of entertainment/engagement may not be everyone's cup of tea.

Sadly, was only able to spend around 30 minutes outside the parliament building. All I know is I NEED to come back for a longer, multi-day visit. The historic buildings are impressive, many of which are within walking distance of each other. The river gives opportunities for photo-ops from either side. NEXT TIME!

Fantastic tour guides take you through the buildings. Beware of when Parliament is sitting as limits tour times.Tour guide was very informative and really knew her stuff. Because we went in late May, group size was small and managable but in summer months size can be larger.Was absolutely fascinated by the stone carvings on the outside of the...

This is your place! You will find so much history and so much politics! Try going on a tour of the Parliament building, and see what and who is hiding inside. You never know who you will run into while visiting so have your camera handy! There are also many activities occurring in the park (usually free), so make sure...

Lovely architecture on these antiquated buildings. We didn't take a tour but walked around the outside which is very accessible for the public. Some interesting bronze statues where you can be photographed alongside for a bit of fun and a fire pit at the entrance of the approach. Not sure of the significance of these - apart from Johnny Mc...

The Hill is the home of the Canadian Parliament, and thus the political and cultural heart of Ottawa.With a guided tour of the Centre Block, you can visit the House of Commons, the Senate, and the Parliament Library. With a guided tour of the East Block, you can visit restored heritage rooms.I was most impressed with the intricacies...

These building are stunning, visits are free and lots of guides there to answer any questions ,even though we were a few days early there is a light and sound show that is at night sounds like fun. Will have to go back to enjoy.
This is the most historic and iconic place in Ottawa. A must visit place if you are planning for a trip to Ottawa.
Just a beautiful edifice. Excellent view for picture-taking. But better when you can have a peek inside or way even better if you can have a tour.

I've seen many photos of the parliament buildings, but was not expecting the size and grandeur that I saw when I got there. A must see, must do when you get there. The library is amazing, even by European standards.
Lovely walk around the Parliament buildings. Only one guard, cute place. Lovely view across the river.It's worth a visit.

As a proud Canadian this is a must see. Tickets are free and they start giving them out at 9am. There are only 30 or so tickets available for each time slot so you have to go line up before 815 or 830 to get in front of the line, otherwise you will likely be left with some odd time...

Parliament Hill in Ottawa is definitely a must-see if you are visiting Ottawa. The grounds are beautiful, and at night there are small bonfires going on the grounds, and occasionally they put on laser shows that are free and open to the public.

Despite the construction, and long security queues this is well worth a visit. There is a lot of renovation and construction planned, so make sure you allow time to be able to relax and enjoy everything there is to see.

This review is a bit biased because we are Canadians who had not been back since we were children. Nevertheless, for the relative cost (free!) and importance to the country, it was an excellent visit.We lined up for tickets quite early (easily 40 minutes prior to opening), and managed to sneak in ahead of crowds that began lining up...

You get a timed entry ticket across the road, from an office. The guide meets you just outside by the flagpole, 5 minutes before tour starts. You go through airport type security. The experience once in there is excellent. You see quite a bit, can take photos and the information received is excellent. I wish I could remember the name...

Ottawa is a huge and beautiful garden, you will like every corner in it. You should visit the parliament area during Canada Day on July first to enjoy the fireworks.2017 will be the 150th year anniversary, July first will be a great day so I will make sure to be there.

When in Ottawa, well, this is the thing to see. I had a couple hours free during a conference so went up the hill to see if I could catch a free tour.All the English tours were sold out, unfortunately, so I chose a French tour even though I would have no idea what they were saying. Then I...

This was my second visit to Parliament Hill. I didn't go inside the buildings or do any tours during either visit, but I did explore the grounds and admire the beautiful architecture. If I'm being honest, it is the architecture that drew me in to begin with. It is a beautiful sight to see and I would recommend a quick...
All of the parliament buildings were beautiful. We walked down by the canal on a beautiful morning. The buildings seemed to go on and on and on.

This Parliament building is beautiful. The stonework is incredible. The library is awesome, reminded us of the Harry Potter movies. The paintings of past Prime Ministers are exceptional. Take the elevator to the Peace Tower for a wonderful view of Ottawa. Don't forget to checkout the bells on the way up.

It's everything I expected on this visit. I'm very impressionable when it comes to Gothic revival architecture on this side of the pond. Free tours in French or English are offered on a first-come, first-serve basis. A trip up to Peace Tower is also part of the tour admission. For me the highlight of the tour was the library rotunda....

The interior of our Parliament Centre Block building is stunning. As you walk through the corridors take time to observe the magnificent details carved in the Tyndall stone. Maybe you will find a fossil or two in the walls. The visit to the Library of Parliament alone is worth the tour. Like stepping back in time. You have to see...
The Parliament Building in beautiful. It was easy to get tickets for a tour - a must - no independent wandering. The guide was informative and friendly.

Love the architecture and pride of place at the Centre Block of Parliament Hill. It never gets old even though we have been there many times. We wanted to watch the Senate in action given all of its recent attention. Check the Parliamentary Calendar on the Parliament of Canada website for dates and times for House and Senate sitting days...

If your in Ottawa even just for a day, you need to set aside 2-4 hours and get right downtown. The Parliament Buildings are huge and just so stunning to see. There are tons of monuments and great photo ops. I did not do the tour inside however outside has tons to see. It's a great free attraction. Also there...

My organization was fortunate e ought to have been able to host an event on Parliament Hill this past April. Even though going through security was a bit of a time consumer, once we were in, we almost had the run of the place. The room that our event was in was fabulous. Paintings around the room showcased Canadian history...

The Parliament Hill and surrounding buildings are beautiful. Too bad it seems we have chosen a not very good time to visit Ottawa since there is so much construction/renovation going on.You see cranes and scaffolds all around.

Canada's Parliament Buildings are the best! Visitors have the freedom to walk right up to our buildings, take pictures, talk to the staff that are walking around and there to answer any questions people might have. 'Yoga on the Hill' at noon on Wednesdays show that our country is open to all and that we are friendly in spirit. If...
The Parliament hill is a majestic place! The view from the other side (Gatineau, QC) is amazing. Be sure to go in a sunny day to enjoy it

This is where the work of government happens and is great to see where it happens. It should also be an education for Americans and others on the parliamentary system. It is by no means perfect but wouldn't want to replace it. Well worth the time.

The grounds around the Parliament building are beautiful. Lots of statues to see. The tulips in May are stunning.Unfortunately, we didn't get inside. As per advice, we lined up early on Sunday at 7:30am to get the free tour tickets. At 7:30 there were at least a dozen people ahead of us in line. We waited an hour and...

Tickets for tour are free but I was to late every day so they run out, I was there for question period but was so busy missed the interesting parts. And had to wait for all the important people and media to leave before I could go into public gallerie
It was really cool to be able to take a tour of the parliament buildings and the gorunds. I would highly recommend stopping by this attraction when in Ottawa.

It is impressive to see all those old building dated in the 19th century and think about the history of the country. Did not get the chance to visit the parliament as the tickets are free and very well in demand.

I look forward to returning to Ottawa when Parliament is actually visible. The entirety of Parliament Hill was under construction and extremely congested. I'm sure it's lovely and I wish we'd been able to really see it.

Get there early at the visit center to get your pass for the visit. While waiting for your time to go in you can explore the grounds . If your time is a couple of hours away you will be able to visit the Supreme Court right down the road and that is also free. No viiting between 12 pm...

We had a reservation for the 11:20 tour. Actually got into the Parliament building around 1pm after standing in line for the entire time. Tour lasted about 15-20 mins. Parliament was sitting and so was the Senate so you don't get to see them when they're sitting. After the tour since we were in the building already we went to...

Think of this as Washington DC in Canada. Everything Parliament and beyond.Recommend a guided tour of the entire facility.Beautiful blocks and blocks of historic buildings while all of the nation's MP's are in the area doing their job.About a 15 minute walk uphill from the Byward Market where we were staying. Tickets are free for the tour but they will all be gone by about 10am. They open doors for tickets at 9am (when I was there in May 2016) and give out tickets for two english tours and two French tours every hour. It is first in first served and there was a line for tickets from about 8:15am. So...

This property belongs to the people of Canada. There is always something going on at Parliament Hill. Either mass Yoga or Tae Bo. Tour Parliament building for free (you have to get a ticket) or just spend time on the lawns. Consider a bike ride along the Rideau Canal below the Parliament buildings.
Parking and traffic is hectic in and around the Hill and Byward Market. Take the bus and avoid the hassle. Lots of people watching. Crowds everywhere.
Interesting tour of the Parliament Buildings. I wish the tour had been longer and had showed more things. Security is high. Lots or tradition here!
Interesting tour and great view from Peace Tower, but took 2:20 with all the security checks and other lines plus an hour earlier at the ticket booth

The construction along O'Connor Street marred what could have been a great frontal photo-shoot of Parliament. Instead, renting a bike by Sussex (Major Hill's Park facing the National Art Gallery), we rode along the Confederation Discovery Trail by following the river to the right of the park. By crossing the wooden bridge at the bottom of the Canal locks, we...
Stopped in early evening; slanting sun on red & white tulips very pretty.Well worth just walking around to see your capital!
Very busy during the Tulip Festival but we enjoyed the architecture and the sculpture. Undergoing some reno as seen in photos.

This is it. The home of Canadian democracy and occasional elbowing incident. Plus it's a really cool building. Get the full experience and do 'Yoga on the Hill' every Wednesday weather permitting. Really it's Ottawa and that should be your first stop... Unless you're a communist.
The Parliament Hill and Buildings are a treat for the eyes. They are well maintained and easy to access.

I thoroughly enjoyed walking around Parliament Hill. I remember as a child when the centennial flame was lit. Whether you have time to tour the buildings or just see them from the outside, Parliament Hill is a must-see when in Ottawa.
Down Town is gorgeous all of downtown is like Yorkville in Toronto lots of people and quaint nut its not, hard to describe, but beatiful

I wrote a prior review of the Parliament Buildings on this site in May 2014 (which see). This is an update. I'm a resident of Ottawa, and a former guide in the buildings in question -- so I know my way around the place. BTW, the only way you can visit the interior of the main building is on a...

Interesting building with lovely architecture unfortunately didn't get to see entire tour as senate and house of commons were in session. Amazing looking library. Fabulous views from peace tower. All for free definite recommend a visit. Book your tickets early though to ensure a place

A tour of Canada's Parliament buildings is a must for anyone visiting Ottawa. However, the powers that be seem out to make it as difficult as possible. The tours are free but tickets must be purchased at the ticket office across the street from Parliament. As they are popular it is best to get in line at least 1/2 to...

The Parliament Buildings in Ottawa, Canada's capital are a must for tourists and locals. You will go through a security check which is very similar to the airport security checks. This was a private tour that we had through a friend. There is so much history in the buildings; whether it's about the architecture, a painting or stain glass windows,...

Lots of events to see and do around the area, other than parliament tours.In the summer there's free yoga on the hill (Wednesday's at lunch). There's the change of guards at 10am everyday from May - August. There is a sound an light show. etc.

We only had 2 days in Ottawa and almost missed our chance to visit the parliament buildings as we were not aware that you need a tour ticket to enter the parliament building. Tickets are free but you must get them at the office directly across the street from the parliament buildings on the day of your visit. The ticket...

The architecture is stunning. We had a great tour guide, Louis who had a wonderful sense of humour. You have to get there at least a 1/2 hour before the ticket booth opens to get tour tickets if you want an english speaking guide. They run out fast. Because it was Saturday we got a full tour which was great....
Worth seeing, You can take a long walk over there and head to the Byward market wich is pretty nice and charming. The views are nice
It's always nice to know the history of the old building and the heritage associated to it!! Our free country with an historical architecture
Our tour of the Parliament Building was awe inspiring. So beautiful and so interesting to see part of our Canadian history first hand.

Any trip to Ottawa deserves a visit to Parliament Hill. I've been several times, however, I found that there was a lot of construction going on this year. It didn't make for great photos this time around.
Lovely grounds of green grass and tulips. My dog chased a wild rabbitIIt was educational reading the plaques by the statues commemorating our nations hero's
Great visit to Canada's Parliament. The flame in pool was a beautiful site. Lots of tourists and you definitely now notice the police presence. But not in Negative way.
Very informative. Beautiful architecture. Lots of statues to take photos of. View from the Peace Tower is far stretching and breathtaking. Line up early to get tickets for the timed tours.

Our first trip to the Canada and we head straight to Ottawa. The Parliament and the surrounding buildings were very picturesque even in the heavy fall of snow. It was a beautiful setting all throughout, the inside of the Parliament was even better. The intricacies does not stop at its facade. It's very visible especially with the background history just...

We enjoyed our day visiting the Parliament Buildings, every Canadian should take the opportunity to see them. There is so much history to enjoy and staff around the grounds are very helpful. You can take several tours if time permits, but be sure to add this into your itinerary because there is so much to take in.
Go early. We went on friday to take my sister, and tickets were gone. Its first come first serve and are free. Its worth the visit, specially go up the tower.
This is one of the places that should make you a proud Canadian. The place has an attractive vibe and its architecture is splendid. A must see for those visiting Ottawa!!
Beautiful site, plenty of green, and some of the most visually striking buildings in Ottawa. There are tours available. Plenty of sculptures, so expect lost of cheesy tourist posing!
Beautiful views along the trails of the buildings and of the river, leading back out to the canal. Would definitely do again!

I can find parking in London England far easier than here...ridiculous lack of signs and help for those coming in from out of town and FYI the Information Centre is difficult to find also, went around in circles trying to find it. Make it easier people of Ottawa...be helpful ....we want to see the sights.

The Parliament buildings are a very important structure. Parliament Hill is free to visit and so are most of the outdoor grounds. Visiting areas inside vary in relation to whether Parliament is sitting or not. In the summer months there is also a light show called Northern Lights where the history of Canada is projected directly onto the Parliament Buildings....

"Peaceful Protest" shut down the tours today. Construction is rampant around the Capital in 2016 as the country gears up to celebrate 150 in 2017. The Peace Tower still stirs the soul. Amazing to see yoga classes and a pick up football game being played on the front lawn while elected representatives walk by without a care. Such a safe...

We simply walked through the lawns.... Admiring the Flame of Peace fountain, a live demonstration of Robotics and the local Astronomical Society on the front lawn. Beautiful Statues, and a nice statuary commemorating women's right to be recognised as persons under the law.
Pick up free tickets across the street from parliament. Be prepared to wait an hour to get through all the security. I would recommend d this tour for older children.

Especially nice when you're a bit interested in politics / history. Tours are free and informative and end (optional) with stunning views from the Peace Tower.Only remark: why always comparing with your neighbour's system? Of course the PM is not chosen directly but normally the leader of the largest party in government. Like for example in the Netherlands ?

The building itself has a lot of history, it suffered a fire and had to be rebuilt, only the library was saved from the fire, and still maded by wood, the rest is made by stone. Pay for the guided visit in the front of the parliament, across the street, and check the schedule, it's always full, so take it...

40 yrs ago I was in Ottawa and did stop at the Parliament Bldg but somehow they all look more impressive. So proud to be a Canadian and to have our coutry showcased so Wonderfully. Too bad there is some construction going on but I was still just happy to be there.

did the guided tour-free tickets at office on street facing the building. Excellent tour guide-very friendly and knowledgeable. Taken to both Houses of Parliament and the fabulous Library. Be sure to take lift to clock tower.
Beautiful spot that all Canadians should visit and see. I love the history and feel of parliament. Check it out.
The pictures taken in front of this building are amazing and a must for anyone visiting Ottowa. Very very close to several other picturesque spots

We enjoyed our visit to Parliament Hill. It was fun and interesting to see the library which is different from the other parts of Parliament. You need to get tickets for the free tour and be ready for airport style security prior to the tour.

The government was not in session so we were able to see both the house and the senate rooms. The tour guide was knowledgeable and presented a nice mix of history and current events. Be sure to end your tour by going up the Peace Tower -beautiful views of the city.
Parliament Hill is a great place to walk or bike....there is some major construction going on at the West building.

Well appointed hotel close to all neccessary amenities. Lovely large lounge with balcony TV and computer. Included is a fully functional kitchen which can be blocked off.Nice bathroom and shower. Small but ample bedroom with large TV.Bathroom has all neccessary amenitiesReception staff very helpful.Breakfast whilst continental includes items such as bacon sausage and boiled/poached eggs as...

take your time to visit and make sure you stop at the parliament library which is the jewel of all building. if you want a nice view at the city of Ottawa stop at the peace towel which give you a nice view of the downtown
Really nice and peaceful place, where you can enjoy the view and relax for sometime. Quite and away from city noise.

Exceptional views and French-architecture everywhere. The Parliament Hill and Buildings are near the locks, the Canal Rideau and in walking distance from the lots of restaurants and bars. Bring your camera!

The parliament hill and surrounding are beautiful to walk around. We visited on a bright sunny day so there were lots of crowds. We walked up and around the magnificent buildings. Unfortunately the daily tours which are free were fully booked so we couldn't go inside. However just walking on the grounds was great.
Parliament Hill and Buildings, are the perfect example of the distinguish architecture of the Capital City.Impeccable.DON'T miss the free daily guided tour!!
i love the stone buildings and good to see the city and government spending the money it takes to make this place beautiful

Beautiful architecture stunning views, bridges and steps to the locks. Majestic yet welcoming at the same time. Lots of people lots of places to walk and see. The wonderful thing to do for couples weekend away.

Nice grass around building. Perfect place for some rest on a sun. Good place for making pictures. In Ottawa there are not so many places to go so this Governmental quarter is quite popular among tourists, but really nothing special as Ottawa by itself by whole.

A great place to visit. Great free tours. Peace tower can have a long wait. The library is awesome. Always many people around to answer questions.
Well, it's a pretty building. The best part is the statue outside of the Famous Five. Not all the old white guy statues. The cluster of (old white) women. Funky. Chunky. Having tea. Join them.

We walked around the area without going inside. It is a good experience. The architecture is worth a good look and the place has an old world charm. close to byward market , so this is a good place to walk by on your way to the market

Beautiful architecture and a great place to visit and explore. Tour guides were great and answered most questions.

I would make a point of seeing Parliament, There you will see the centennial flame, Royal Canadian Mounted Police etc,,,It is one place You should definitely see?

Parliament Buildings are a beautiful and historical sight. You can see the government of our country from inception to current history still being made. Touring the gorgeous grounds and buildings is educational and moving. Well worth the visit.
Great scenery! Nice architecture to look at and lots of walking options and picture spots. I liked so many buildings around downtown as well as many eateries to choose from.

I love the gorgeous and distinctive green patina on the roof of the Parliament buildings aka The Hill which overlooks the Ottawa River. It's a beautiful ground and place for anyone to visit. Decent from British tradition, the parliament divided into House of Common and House of Lord. You will definitely live the ice covered parliament. The picture is just perfect.

Got to watch the Senate, and the House of Commons. The book of fallen soldiers (not the exact name) in the peace tower was most moving. The library is the most beautiful room I've ever seen. Try to spend 2-3 hours there. Take a more exclusive tour, if they even offer that.

Had a delightful and engaging tour of the Parliment building, with spectacular views of the city from the Peace Tower. The memorial room to Canada's war dead was sincere and solemn, and contains the names of all the nation's war dead. Pages are rotated in the thoughtfully designed death registers once every 24 hours.
It was a privilege to visit Parliament Hill. It makes me proud that we are able to allow our citizens access to such a place, and showcase that place for others from around the world.

Really enjoyed the tour of the Parliament Buildings today. The tour guide was excellent and all the staff in security made us feel welcome and safe.A beautiful building and very well worth an hour to tour it.Wear comfy shoes. The Marble is hard on your feet.

Being history nerds, a walk around downtown Ottawa is like a step back in time. Tour of Parliment Hill and buildings is a must . It's free. We were able to see the beautiful architecture, learned a lot about Canadian history and had a great view of the city . A must do . Also very near to Rideau Canal
it is something that every canadian should see once in there life. If you plan on going, contact your Member of Parliament and try to arrange a tour or a visit.

Nice to walk all around and many attractions are near by in walking distance. A lot of security all around.

It is something to see the history of parliament hill on television but when you are in front of it, it is magnificent and the architecture is stunning. Right east of it you have the locks and that is fascinating as well! Ottawa is a beautiful city!

Beautiful, historical buildings specially the library, very scenic exterior in spring,summer and fall; the light show in summer is superb and history telling in a great style!

Always a nice learning experience for any age group. Beautiful inside and out. Especially love the library.

Ottawa Parliament is a nifty looking element to the downtown area of Ottawa. . But aside from that, the Ottawa for seems like it has been in a coma for 30 years.

I have visited Parliament Hill numerous times. Each time I appreciate the experience. I love the activities that occur on the front lawn. The light show at night is great. Every Canadian should visit at least once.

Parliament hill is a very nice and worth to visit place. You can go on a guided tour inside the parliament -tickets are absolutely free!! You can pick up the tickets across the street. There are English-speaking and French-speaking tours every 20 minutes

Great tours, professional guides. Love to see Canadian history upfront an personal. Take all my guest to the Parliament if time allows!

As a US citizen, was amazed one could get so close to Parliament building. Could sit on the steps if you wanted. US has everything fenced off. Large grassy area in front of building. Winter or summer - Parliament Hill in our nations capital is always beautiful and inspiring. Almost 150 years old, still a marvel of construction and beauty.

I learned a lot visiting the parliament buildings history and political views are now more clearer , general locals were helpful to navigate a couple of visitors which makes your trip even more memorable

Great to just drive around and admire. There was a lot of construction going on when we visited and it was just after a snow storm so we didn't get a chance to park and walk around.

I had a chance to walk around the buildings at night. None were open to go into but the grounds were crowd free. If you are in Ottawa for a short period of time I would recommend at least a short walk around the buildings and the canal area. Felt safe to walk around after dark.

The building is spectacular and the access is pretty amazing. There is a real process for getting in as you would expect, but the security although very present was still extremely nice. This place is such a beautiful site everyone should come and see parliament hill .at back of it is the Ottawa river.

Canada's national parliament is a gracious, copper roofed comples that indicates the rich heritage of this beautiful nation.

Extended a business stay in order to see a bit more of the city. I have been to Ottawa often but never found the time to visit Parliament Hill. Highly informative and something for which all Canadians should make time. Besides, it's free.

A great place to see the past Prime Ministers and members of Parliament.
