Although we have visited Ottawa and the Parliament buildings several times, we had not attended Question Period for many years. This visit we did and found it extremely interesting. We would recommend that Canadians and "political junkies" make an effort to attend QP. For all others, go on a tour of the buildings for their sheer beauty and grandeur.
Recommend you see the changing of the guard at noon every day on the eastern lawn in front of the buildings. So beautiful with the bagpipes!
Although tha weather was cold during our visit, the parliament building was very impressing.the guide very nice and the view from the clock tower amazing.
I go to Ottawa a lot for business as well as pleasure and I never get bored of parliament hill love the walk enjoy the views

This was such a great tour. Very informative and interesting. This is a huge part of who we are as Canadians. I think everybody should go and visit at least once in their lifetime. I loved everything about the tour. The Bell Tower has an amazing view of the city.

Our group of 4 took in a tour of the parliament buildings. They are amazing to see. The architecture of the buildings themselves is amazing but what's even nicer is to see the House of Commons and the Senate Chamber where decisions are made that affect the lives of all Canadians. The library is so very unique. There is a...
Awesome tour guide was very nice and knowledgeable and took us on a great tour. One of the most exciting places in Ottawa.
My first time seeing the building and it was just so amazing.. I just wish it was the coldest day of the year so we could of enjoyed it a little more

I live in Ottawa and worked in Parliament. Every day I felt privileged to be there. So much history, and the vibrant heartbeat of a nation. Walk these halls when you take a free guided tour and you too will learn about the history of the nation of Canada. When Parliament is in session you can sit in and observe...

If you are visiting Ottawa, you must go see the Parliament buildings. I would recommend visiting in the summer so that you can enjoy what downtown has to offer as well. Booking a tour of Parliament is probably the best way to go but if you prefer sightseeing on your own then that's fine too. The library is beautiful and...

There is no better picture than seeing your loved ones standing under the 30 foot high and 33 feet wide bronze spider (mama with 20 marble eggs in her sack) and the peace tower and parl buildings dwarfed in the background. what a pix,,, and so close to the market, the world heritage site of the rideau canal, (man built...
I enjoyed the tour around the building and great views from the gardens plus I met what I think was an MP along with lots of friendly staff.

Parliament Hill is a beautiful and scenic setting for the government of Canada. The grounds are lush and well maintained, and the accessibility is far greater than that of our native US. A number of buildings were under renovation during our visit, marring the outside by scaffolding, but this is necessary to maintain the beauty of the architecture. The front...
We love living in our nations capital! A tour of the Parliament buildings is well worth the time. They offer English & French tours. Love the library the best!
Beautiful area, very pedestrian friendly. There are a number of attractions within walking distance. The parliament buildings are historically significant sign of European colonization.

The visit of the Parliament Hill is a must when visiting Ottawa. The guided tours are free and well worth it. The buildings are beautiful and so full of history. Also, the Library of Parliament has been voted one of the ten most beautiful libraries in the world. Canadians should be so proud of their heritage.

This was definitely a great place to go and visit whether you're touring or you live in the city. It is rich with history. The reason I cannot give this place a 5/5 is the poor planning that went into setting up the tours for the peace tower and the building itself. We walked up to the building and waited...

It always strikes me as odd, anywhere we travel, that the Government Buildings put so much money into the Dcor. I'm always left to wonder how many poverty-stricken People they could have housed/fed instead. It was interesting to learn all the history and the Library Building was above all, the most fascinating.
The Parliament is a Canadian icon and is a must-see when in Ottawa. Tours are free, frequent and educational. Keep in mind the Parliament is going to close in 2018 for 10 years of renovation.

Free tour! Do not ever pay for this tour. Marie, our guide was fantastic and knowledgable, very professional and full of energy! Eventhough the tour is short, there is a lot of see and learn about. This tour focused on the positives, not the negatives of Parliament. Will take this tour again!

The building is beautiful and historical. You can see the exterior of some buildings black because there was a fire 100 years ago.It is worthwhile to go inside the parliament and take a tour. The visit is free. One just needs to go to the visitor centre across the street and get a free ticket. The ticket tells you...

As an citizen of the USA, it was fascinating to get this up close and personal to the campus, buildings and a tour highlighting the country's national government center. The history, the resources and parliament chambers were very interesting to see and to learn from. And the view of Ottawa from the top of the tower was breath taking!
Parliament Hill is a place that I think every Canadian should see at least once if they have the opportunity. There are nice views in the back of the river and Quebec as well.
Loved strolling through Ottawa and seeing Parliament Hill. Beautiful in February but would recommend visiting in the summer.
If you are in the Ottawa are this is definitely an iconic site to visit! Beautiful views and amazing pictures just waiting to be taken on the grounds!

I always enjoy this free tour every time I am in Ottawa. The building is so beautiful, the rich history within the walls, the library especially. If you ever have a chance to visit the parliament and walk around the area, I strongly recommend it. Keep in mind that there is huge security there now. The same as if you...

We enjoyed watching the changing of the guard which occurs daily in summer, not sure of the dates. They marched up the streets and then on to the huge expanse of grounds in front of Parliament House. Also the sound and light show at night, depicting the history of Canada, was very good
It's relaxing to just stroll and watch and read the status, buildings and history. Enjoy a nice sunny day.

It is very easy to reserve to take the free guided tour ( the building is across from parliament and open 7 days almost year round). Make sure to take the elevator to the top of the tower to see the city view! The library and senate are also worth visiting.The next time I might opt for the option...

This is a very beautiful historical building that does a free tour and also has a changing of the guard on the front lawn. We all enjoyed the tour and took tons of pictures throughout buildings and we even went up in the Peace Tower. Would recommend for anyone who has never been, very cool and educational.
I takes more than a day to visit all buildings. Comfortable shoes helps. A lot of walking. Small kids get tired after hour or two.

The architecture, the furnishings, the decor, the art, the Peace Tower, the Library (already renovated) and the Books with names of Canada's fallen soldiers all make this a must see. If you're lucky (?) you could see a session of Parliament or the Senate. The Centre Block will be closed in a few years for a ten year renovation so...
Excellent place to visit considering the history and the various people that have walked in its hallways. Beautiful architecture. Outside of the building in undergoing renovations at the moment.
I did a guided tour in french that was really nice, the guide explained everything so well, also the parliament is impressive, my favorite spot was the library.
Fantastic place to visit again - Essential for a view of Canadian democracy. Wow. Go there when Parliament sits! PS Skip the Senate

Friendly guides, short but informative tour. This month the focus is on the 100 years of the fires which puts a good focus on the building rather than the politics. Be prepared for security checks and a few lines before your tour time on weekends.

Did this tour again for the first time in many years and still enjoyed the walk through the breathtaking architecture and history. Out tour guide Mathilda was well informed and interesting, making this tour quite informative. Also, the cost is free, you just need to book a ticket for a certain time slot.

This a very beautiful building as it should be.I love great architecture and this edifice certainly qualifies.It does follow some of the stylish buildings you would find in London , England.It is obvious that the minds who designed this wanted to build something impressive.It is !The craftmanship is also visible everywhere . Our guide was very knowledgeable and entertaining.I could...
You have to do the tour of the parliament building. It's free and you sign up across the street. At the end of the tour go up the Peace Tower - another must for a great view from the tower

In Ottawa on a quick business trip I had the chance to head to the Parliament Buildings and attend question period. At first you might think this to be a boring outing, but put in to perspective, it is a uniquely Canadian experience. The buildings themselves are incredible, rich with history and fascinating architecture. Question period was only an hour...

Ottawa Parliament buildings are interesting espcially from outside. I usually visit with family coming from abroad and try to avoid going inside tours. For me once you`ve seen the inside once your done. Although if you have an interest in old Leglislative buildings and history going inside might be for you. I always like walking outside and enjoying the buildings...
Brought out-of-town guests up to the Hill over the holidays, they loved the sound and light show, and the ambience!

There are many tours walking through the buildings regularly. You simply wait under a large tented area until a guide gathers you together and walks off. My friends and I happened to be led by a french speaking guide, so I translated for them and the guide did not give us a hard time for this.We really enjoyed all...
it was Sunday January 31 when we visited this beautiful place. Although it was cold we enjoyed taking a stroll around The Parliament of Canada.
I was so excited to sit through a question period at the House of Commons. I am so happy to see the Liberal team that represents our fine country

The buildings are gorgeous, the tour was excellent. Make sure you go across the road to get your free (yay!) tickets. The tour lasted for about 45 minutes and we saw the main open spaces, both chambers and the library which was sensationally beautiful.After the tour concluded you were welcome to head up to the Peace Tower (do that,...

I recommend visiting very much. The guides are excellent, knowledgeable and friendly. I have been several times and have yet to say that I have not learned anything new. You must take in the library. It is beautiful. I wish I could just sit and breathe it in. As a teacher but also as someone who loves to read. The...
This is a historic must see. Ottawa is a beautiful City that doesn't get much press. The architecture is striking and the people are the friendliest I have met in Canada so far.
Canadas Parliament Buildings are home to the federal government in Ottawa. Designed in a gothic revival style, the buildings officially opened on 6 June 1866, about a year before Confederation

I wanted to go to the Parliament center block on a Thursday afternoon. The hotel staff reminded to stop by the tourist center located on the front side of the block across the street to get a free ticket. When I got to the tourist center, it was 3pm and there was only one Peace Tower ticket left. I took...

Great to visit (the tour explains the history of Canada). Around Christmas it's lit up with lights and there's a sound and light show that is just beautiful to look at (July-Sept). Also there's great restaurants near by.
Nice piece of Canadian history. Visit behind the big clock for free. The view is beautiful. Then have a picnic behind Parliament in Major's Hill Park.

This visit was for business so had more of a chance to look around at some places off limits to tourists. The meeting rooms are beautiful so don't pass up an occasion to visit on business. The corridors are fascinating architecturally. Despite the work being done on the Hill, always worth a visit.

My brother took us on our first trip to Ottawa to Parliament Hill and gave us all the history on the building the statues etc. My kids loved it as they knew American History but not so much Canadian at that point. He gave us all the backgound info too. Beautiful view and lovely buildings, I will return soon to...

This is a very good place to go. There is a guided tour, when you learn a lot about Canadian history, and in the end you can go up the tower, where you have an amazing view of the city.(I visited in may 2014)
Fantastic views of the city and its parliament.With easy access.I was lucky to be snowing and enjoy a fantastic landscape.I strongly recommend.

These historic buildings are are exceptionally beautiful, especially when illuminated at night. Summer or winter, it's worth it to walk around outside and see the grounds. Inside is interesting and offers guided tours of the different sections of the buildings. Certainly worth the visit.

A free short tour (45 minutes) has given me so much about Canadian history. This was the best part of my Ottawa trip. Must go !You can also go to the observation deck as well. If you are lucky, you will hear the tower bells ring.
We went on the guided tour and really enjoyed it! You get to see all the major highlights of the building and its stunning architecture. A nice way to kill an hour or so.

This is such a beautiful area to walk around. We ended up walking down by the locks and over the bridge to Gatineau. We were surprised to be in the area during the anniversary of D Day celebrations. It was spectacular.

The Parliament Building and the grounds surrounding it are beautiful. There are these cool statues on the grounds, which have been set up for visitors to take pictures with. A tea party with an empty seat for you to sit in and be part of the picture. Bronze statues who are standing with their arms open in an embrace for...
Wandered around a bit, beautiful location, lots of history and great architecture here. Security was a bit stifling, but after the attack last year, certainly understandable.
You need a ticket from the building across to visit parliament though it is free . A must see place. The tour guide is in english and in french and these tour guide has lot of information.
Excellent the tour is a must doWould recommend it for everyone who visits ottawa. Very informative and parliament buildings are beautiful.
maybe would be better to visit during the summer or fall, but it was just breath taking to walk around and see snow , blue sky and beautiful buildings. definitely must visit in Ottawa
it is suitable place especially to those historical people. there was a guide who shows you the symbols and to explain the Parliament and its parts.
Always lots to see & do on Parliament Hill. July 1 is the best time to join the celebration Canadianism. History surrounds you. Go on an inside or outside tour both offer much.
Totally worth it to go up the Peace Tower and see the incredible view! (it's free!) The wait can be long for the elevator, but it's a beautiful view. Head to the library as well!

Tours are free which is something I think is great. Definitely go in the winter as that's when there aren't as many tours going through- only thing is if it's snowing that day the view from the peace tower isn't that impressive, so pick a clear day to go. Our tour guide was personable and informative. All around great.

Spending a few hours here on a cold snowy Ottawa day was a real treat. The staff and the officers were great, the tour including the library just amazing and the Peace tower is a must.One tip get your tickets opposite the Parliament building before walking across or else you will need to double up on the trip.. Not...
Took a tour of Parlement Hill and enjoyed it! Lots of history and great facts about our country. Went up to the Peace Tower and enjoyed the views of Ottawa and Hull.

Visiting the parliament building is great to do anytime. December there is a wonderful Christmas light show on the building. In summer get something to eat at the Byward Market and sit on the grass behind the Parliament Buildings. (La Bottega has awesome sandwhiches for a great price) I would recommend a tour of the building too.
Parliament hill is absolutely fantastic, at any time of the year. I fall in love with the place everytime I revisit and I wouldn't go to Ottawa without visiting it!
Most attractions on the hill unavailable due to construction. Police memorial etc. The light show for the holiday season was extremely enjoyable. (They run one in the summer as well).

The tour through the nation's parliament house and grounds is a must not miss on your trip to Canada. The buildings surrounding the parliament house change as the sun passes over. You will need a ticket for the parliament house tour and these are available from the information office directly across the road from parliament house (near the Terry Fox...

If you miss parliament hill you haven't visited ottawa.The tour is worth the wait but almost as nice is a walk around the back for beautiful views of the ottawa river and the gatineau hills. I live here and I never get tired of the view.

My husband and I decided to try the "self-guided tour" of Parliament. Unfortunately the self-guided option didn't leave us with much to view once inside the building however. We were able to read a little bit about the building once we entered into the initial lobby, visit the gift shop, war memorial on the second level and then take the...

Although about 150 years old it is well preserved due to on-going restoration work. Very accessible by public transportation and within walking distance of the Quebec/Ontario border. Definitely worth while to visit for anyone.

Good tour for you to find out about legislation procedure in Canada. At night time, the lighting show is very very beautiful, it starts from 530pm ans runs for around 15 minutes each session till 1130, so you need not to rush too hard for the show as it shall rerun in every 15minutes
We visited of Jan 1 so everything was closed but we could tour the grounds. They offer daily tours but we weren't staying long enough to be able to take one in.

Free tour tickets are available every morning at 90 Wellington Street (across from Parliament Hill) on a first come, first served basis. Because it is first come, first served, there is a chance of not making it on a tour, and I therefore recommend making it one of your first stops on a visit to Ottawa (in case you have...

Visited during winter holiday's,. They had an excellent light show for the holiday ,that showed up on the parliament buildings bit of advice stand by the flame for heat .Only downfall soldier walking around with machine guns in hand, but understandable with what happened this Summer

We are fairly new to the city. It's always lovely to visit the parliament hill. We love the lights and sound show and the changing of the guards in summer. The christmas light show in 2015 was our first, loved it!
This building is closed in holidays and there is a fire in front of it that you can go and make wish. People send coins there and do wish:)
Inspiring--Always great to be there. But for me a work space when I am in Ottawa--i love the history of the place and the great stories that go with it.

Pick up free ticket at the info center across the street of parliament hill. I went with earliest tour at 9:20(pick up ticket at 9:00 cuz you need to walk back to the central block to start the tour with security check) not many ppl. Friendly and sophisticated guide showed us around the inside of parliament, also told us some...
Enjoy the incredible view of the parlement or the Ottawa river (at the back) and bring your soccer ball, your lunch, your yoga mat, etc. There's a ton of possibility here!

Went on a free tour. Need to pick up tickets in the info centre across the road from the Parliament. Tour went for about 30mins. Learnt about the history of the building and the Canadian govt. Saw the house of commons, senate and the library. The exterior and interior of the building is stunning and I especially loved the library....

The light and music show on the Parliament facade was magical!Being with all these people from around the world, close to a great water-fire installation, the kids with stars in their eyes...A wonderful moment!
My wife and i were in Ottawa on the night of the recent 2015 election, police, military and locals out everywhere. Perfect for photos and paintings.Must visit!!!

We came on a bad day, or this would get five stars. The Parliament Buildings are fascinating, and we were hoping for the free tour, but we went during the holidays, so they had filled up for the day. We came back for the light display that happens during the winter, but we had just had a massive snow storm,...

I hadn't taken the tour since I was a little girl. But with some friends from the UK visiting, we decided to check it out. The tour was informative and our guide answered lots of questions. It was nice to see Canada's history.

Our family enjoyed the opportunity to tour the parliament building. The tickets were easy to obtain across the street, and were no charge. Our tour guide Dylan made things as interesting as possible and even worked a few jokes in. It was about 45 minutes in length, with a chance to go up to the peace tower afterwards which provided...
A magnificent piece of architecture everybody should visit. Free tours in English and French, that also offer multilingual support.

I can add little of interest regarding the lovely block of parliament buildings that are the centerpiece of downtown Ottawa. Well, I can add one thing, I suppose. If you need to park, do so a couple blocks south at World Exchange Plaza (enter the underground garage on Queen between Metcalfe and O'Connor.)The first time I visited Parliament 13...

Parliament is very aesthetically pleasing but, if you know to walk behind it, there's a beautiful backdrop to the Ottawa/Gatineau river, a scenic view of the bridge, Rapids and even a gazebo to overlook such. Parliament hill offers changing of the guard, sounds and lights show and many activities through out the year. Fun place to check out.
I loved our visit to Parliament Hill and think all Canadians should go. We learned more then I thought we would. There is a story behind everything in the building!

We signed up for a tour across the street at 90 Wellington. It was nice that there is no fee for these guided tours! Inside, our tour guide was very knowledgeable, and showed us around the interior of the Parliament buildings. One of the highlights is the library, containing tens of thousands (I think our guide said 60,000) wood carvings,...
Lots of history...kind of boring though.Will only do the tour once as they won't be changing any time soon

The Parliament Buildings are definitely worth a visit. You can enjoy a leisurely stroll of the grounds (especially nice in the summer and fall) or take a tour inside. There are also walking trails behind the Parliament buildings along the river. The easiest approach I've found is to park behind the NAC and follow the canal down to the river.

You will find it hard to see, such interior sculpting inside any other parliament in this world, it is even more enjoyable with the Xmas decorations, between the 26th Dec to the 30th, makes the kids thinking it's Santa's castle. And it's Free to see. The view from the observation deck in the Peace Tower is sublime, mostly in the...
Very beautiful and organized place. We did the tour and it worthy the time. I would recommend and it was for free.

Enjoy a free tour in English or French to visit the Parliament building. Especially in December, with the Christmas decorations, it's beautiful. The details in the architecture are stunning. The library is a work of art! And the view from the Peace Tower is a good one!
We recently visited Ottawa and walked to and around the Parliament Buildings to see the Sound and Light show. The designs and colours were great. Certainly added to the Chrostmas spirit.
As a political junkie, this is heaven to me. I've taken all the tours, and they are thorough and informative. I'll definitely be going back for Canada 150!

It only took 13 minutes but thare was a flurry of scenes and graphics projected across the Parliament buildings.It's absolutely free. Bundle up. The wind can be very raw in the evening.Worth the trip.

You could simply join the free tour inside the parliament. Get the ticket from across the parliament building. I have a better understanding about Canadian constitutional during the tour. Awesome construction, rich of history! A MUST VISIT!
Its Historical site of the Canada, When I heard why 3Million people visit this but I understand it after watching the towers, its really amazing. Don't miss this

Very pretty and the light show in the evening was pretty. The fire in front is also a nice touch. Thought the staff inside the parliament was very unorganized! We bought tickets to go up inside the towers but when we arrived we were told it was closed. Half the staff said it was because of security, others said because...
This beautiful building left me in awe. By the Queen's gate there's the Centennial flame. You can drop a coin in for good luck. Group tours are conducted too.
We visited Parliament Hill on Christmas Eve. The statues and the whole monument is worth seeing. The visitor entrance was closed so we couldn't see inside though.
Went to see the Christmas lights show. Dress warmly but highly recommend this for adults and children.

You can have a free tour of the parliament buildings and seat of Canadian government. The architecture is stunning and the history is quite amazing. But I didn't get to hear much of it because so many of the tour participants were talking (when asked to be quiet), taking flash photos and blinding the guide, or wandering off and needing...
A must visit when visiting Ottawa. Our guide Sabine was lovely and gave us amazing details about the besutiful building! We loved it and will be back!

The grounds for of the hill is a awesome tourist place, the building are amazing but there is always some construction going on:( , they put up a great light effects of the building at night, truly amazing place!
Visited Ottawa for a day and visited their "must-see" parliament hill to be dazzled by their famous buildings. It is definitely a great sight, not to be missed if you are planning a visit there.
There is a new light show during December. 15 minutes long and worth the trip to go see. Different style than the summer show.
I have seen both the summer and for the first time the winter show. A nice short show that lights up centre block.

Finally got to see our Parliament, a must for every Canadian. We got to go into the Library (wonderful), but were unable to see House of Commons and the Senate( there were functions that day). Our guide was friendly and fun. Very enjoyable. We were also there for Light Up Canada; the evening light display on Dec 2. Loved it!...

If you have ever wondered how the seat of power functions and what it consists of, join in for numerous tours to the remarkable area. Not only you have access to parliament itself, free wifi in the area keeps you connected too allowing you let the world know the old world charm the place exudes. Recommended is the evening light...

Was here for the annual "Winterlude" Ice Carving Festival last year. The entire center of the city has a park which becomes the venue for ice and snow sculpture exhibits which is surrounded by the frozen canal. The canal is lined with small shops and restaurants which you can actually skate to and sit down and enjoy a drink or...

If you are in Ottawa you must go and visit the Parliament buildings. I especially love seeing the library. Secondly, seeing the house of commons helps to understand how our leaders operate during the parliament sitting.

You can always find different activities happening in parliament of Canada. Yoga, March, protest,....Every season also has its own. Summer light and music is the best one that shows Canada's history by lights.You might also have the chance of visiting prime minister Justin Trudeau and take a selfie with him
Impressive buildings and views from to the Quebec side and the Rideau canal. Attractive place filled with history.
Very good show. Goes nightly starting at 5:30-11:00pm .Nice music in tune to the light display on the building. Ground trees have lights as well which is nice to see.

I was able to visit Parliament Hill, very quickly, during one afternoon I had in Ottawa after a meeting. My review is simply one from an aesthetic point of view. I asked my cab driver to give me a quick tour and he was probably the most well informed cab driver, this was during taxi strike in Ottawa, I've ever...
Visiting the Canadian Parliament is worth it! Particularly in the Holiday Season, since corridors and hallways are soberly decorated with many Lights and Christmas trees!

I have been here 62 years clean city easy to get around very nice to visit very nice city lots to see you will enjoy your time here I travel a lot and don't like t get screwed all so go to the market the biggest in Canada and all free to walk through very close to this attraction

Excellent view,dramatic setting ,great inside /outside vista.Staff great help .Very historical and the clock tower a must . History buffs will adore their visit.Good for family especially teenagersOverall the star attraction in Ottawa.
The new Christmas lights display is very well done. Well worth the trip to the hill, especially if you have out of town guests or young kids.
I'd come back to visit this beautiful city and all it has to offer any time - plenty to see, do and explore. Thoroughly fabulous

You get the tickets for free and then enjoy the tour. After you pass security you are submerged in the History of Canada. Historic building, great paintings and sculptures. At the end of the tour you have to visit the clock tower for a great view of Ottawa.

A free tour (just remember to get your passes across the street beforehand) that was very low-key but informative. Questions are encouraged, and there is plenty of time to take in the many incredible architectural details. Highly recommended.

I have visited Parliament Hill various times and am always impressed by it's splendor. This time I ventured to the Peace Tower. You certainly must take the time to do so. The view of Ottawa and surrounding areas is amazing!

If you are in Ottawa it's a must. Keep in mind you go through airport style security so leave your knives at home! The guide was very knowledgeable and the main building is quite impressive. Beautiful art everywhere and the clock tower provides a great view. Tottally worth it. Was nice to see where the elected work..or pretend to work!...
We saw the light show at night on the outside of the building.It was cold outside, but we forgot about how cold it was because we were amazed at the nice show. So glad this is offered free of charge.

As a 5th generation Ottawa resident, I never really paid attention to my city's touristic attraction... shame on me! Just for the library alone, this is worth a visit: the woodwork in our nation's library is a masterpiece.
The place looks good. It is one of the most important building of the city. I suggest visiting it only if you don t have any no her things to do

The tour is free. The guides are students. Our guide was a little lack lustre but informative as necessary. This is my fourth tour... I bring family and friends on occasion when they visit. I would come again because if the historical and current relevance of parliament.

We've done this tour twice recently with visitors to Ottawa and found it interesting both times as each guide highlights a different aspect of the tour. The library is stunning. The view from the Peace Tower is well worth it if you have the time.
If you have nothing else to do shrt of jumping into the canal go visit this place, the only time i found it fun was on Canada Day.
If you're ever feeling down, this is a good place to come and take a look around. It's well kept, and you may meet some really friendly tourists like I did.

Visited Ottawa Parliament Hill Tuesday night for the light and sound show they put on for christmas. I have seen a couple other shows in the summer when in the city. There weren't many people watching, but I was transfixed on the light show. It was a story from beginning to end. If your in Ottawa go check it out!

Living in Ottawa and working close to the Parliament buildings and also working security I have visited Parliament many times . It is very secure and historically it is worth the visit. Tourists come from all over the world to visit it and tours are free. Just to see our seat of Government and to realize the Prime Ministers that...

I have driven by a couple of times recently around 6 PM. There is a great light show on the Parliament buildings and many Christmas lights along the street. Well worth the trip by.There is a dedicated light show but I have not watched it, just done a drive by.
This a great Canadian experience. It is great to see the parliament buildings and all the history of the building. Be prepared for to clear security just like at the airport. This is great free tour
the lightning festival in the summer is amazing, must see every night at 9 pmand the free visit of the parielement hill is also a must to do
Parliament Hill is a must see spot in Ottawa. Tours happen daily during the summer time. Take a ride up the Peace Tower and be on top of Canada!!! Highly recommended

We have not taken the tour inside the parliament but we have visited the grounds several times. It is worth the visit but be sure to walk around the buildings because there are overlooks to the rear that offer great views of the river.
A must see for those visiting the Nation's Capital. The tours are great and there is all kinds of things for kids to see outside and around the buildings.

We toured the Parliament Building on a Sunday morning and saw not only both Parliaments but also the library. Louie was an extremely knowledgeable tour guide and obviously enjoyed sharing his knowledge with visitors. His enthusiasm added to our enjoyment of the visit.
Well, you're visiting the Capital, the to Hill all must go. It's worth taking the tour. And, maybe yoga on a Wednesday Summer noon.
Excellent. A quick stop on way back to hotel. Short enough not to get too cold when standing, impressive enough to make the stop worthwhile.

The Ottawa Parliament buildings are gorgeous! You are welcome to have a picnic on the lawn and enjoy all the sites. There are tours daily to take part in. The Christmas Lights at night is an amazing show and they give out free chocolate! The kids will love it!

My first visit here was in 2008. We went inside and it was very nice. This time we took our time to walk around and explore the area. Very nice view and a walk around the city and near the water is also very nice. Rideau Falls is a very close drive and you should definitely check it out. Beautiful!

Toured this museum in a couple hours. My husband is in the army and especially wanted to go. Typical exhibit set ups, but a lot of original articles from history, including a piece of the Berlin wall. Would not recommend this for little children.

The Parliament building obviously an interesting building! The unfortunate thing is that the area around the building is under construction and other than walking up some stairs and viewing from afar that is your only experience. I have been to the Parliament Blds several times and nearly all the time there is some form of construction taking place. Worth seeing...

We took the guided tour and were able to visit the house of commons, the library and the senate. It was an awesome tour and our guide was really knowledgeable. The architecture are grand and the history of this country shine true out this building.

Parking on street is impossible. Lots near Wellington were full. We found parking nearby on Elgin (around the corner from the Fairmont).The buildings are beautiful, although East block is undergoing renovation.Tickets are free, and very limited, available across the street at 90 Wellington. There's the full guided tour and the self-guided trip up to the peace tower. Security...
beautiful historical building with an amazing library -- must visit in Ottawa -- to fully experience the Parliament Hill, take a free tour!

We were there December 2, 2015 for Christmas lighting on Parliament Hill. It is amazing! Prime Minister Justin Trudeau was there. No snow. Nice weather. If you ever have the chance to visit during that time.. you should.
great place to visit. lovely old building. full of history. within walking distance of all the sites

Went on private tour and it was really informative and fun. Was not allowed to view the Senate side of the building as Mr. Trudeau was there the second day after he was elected. Great visit while in Ottawa, definitely go!
Totally worth the trip. I find it more beautiful and peaceful at night with the lights one the building. Visits are available during the day
A magnificent architecture, but it is a shame that you can visit inside and the tower.... Maybe in the future it will be
Always heard of it and I've seen it in pictures, but this was my first time going. Really cool place to visit for those who are into Canadian history

Please change the title of this page. The Eternal Flame is in Arlington National Cemetery in Washington. What is pictured here is the Centennial Flame. It was installed to celebrate our Centennial year in 1967.However, wandering the grounds of Parliament Hill is wonderful. There are beautiful vistas off the cliff at the back of the buildings looking down to...

You obtain your free tickets across from parliament hill in the information centre for the tour. Make sure you double check your size of your purse, all belongings since if articles are too large they will not allow you on the tour. They have a free check in baggage area upstairs at the tourist info for your convenience. The tour...
I enjoyed the tour and learned a lot about Canada. It was free and worth every bit of our time. Will visit again!

I really enjoyed this tour. Walking these historic halls and viewing the spots where Canada's laws and policies have been formed and implemented was quite cool. The tower really topped it off being able to look over the city and over into Quebec was a lot fun.
Loved the Peace Tower and listening to the bells, What a magnificent place this is,, make sure you take the free tour,, and check out the library,,

I have visited in both summer and Winter. Summer they have tours and light and video shows on the Parliament. Canada is second to none. Live bands, Fire Works, just a BIG warm fuzzy feeling mingeling with people from around the world!
Had an interesting tour of the parliament buildings and then up the peace tower just as the bells were chiming. It was a free tour but our guide was cheerful and it was a fun 45 min tour.
It is a nice spot to see and to walk around. You get a sense of the history and it is not too security intensive like others around the world! All visitors to Ottawa should visit

I was amazed about the history of the building and facinated to learn how our government operates to make and change laws. Its best to go when the government is not working because you have greater access to areas like the senate where you can walk right in.

Very nice to see the building and all the rooms. Unfortunately I had to do the tour in French and I don't understand much French. I can only imagine what I would've learned had I been able to understand.My advice to future guests would be to grab your ticket early in the day to select a tour time in...
Like many people, I like the historic stone buildings, the green, copper roofs, and the Canadian red and white flag flying.

Across the street there is a building with a big Question mark on it, this is where you can get your entry tickets for free. There are tour in either French or English that take you around the entire building or tickets to just get you to the top of the tower. Make sure you arrive early as the tour...

Parliament Hill and the buildings are very nice on the outside, but a free guided visit in French or English of the buildings inside is also possible.You first have to reserve a ticket for a specific time slot in the touristic information office at 90, Wellington street, which is just across the street of the Parliament buildings which are...

Great free thing to do whether you're visiting Ottawa or live here, you'll enjoy the history and views when walking all the way around the Parliament buildings. Make sure to look for the fallen Bell from the Great Fire, as well as the many bronze statues. Stop by and see the Parliament Hill cats and the monument to the men...
We chose to take a walk after the lunch.. it was mid November and 2 deg... but was mesmerized by the looks and scale of this architecture...

Perched upon a hill over looking the mighty Ottawa River is our House of Commons that is beautifully kept. Passing by it is the Rideau Canal which was once used for transit to Lake Ontario but is now used for pleasure crafts.Please be respectful at the War Memorial.
The timing of our visit was the day after the Paris attack. We were disappointed that the Parliament building was not lit up with the colours of France's flag like other major cities had done.
This is one of those places that you really can't miss. Actually the place is really really beautiful.

I love this building. It looks like it belongs in a european city. The grassy outside area is open so you can go up and walk around to get a better look. It is definitely worth seeing up close and personal
Had the opportunity to take some quick walks past parliament during some downtime. Didn't have the time to take tours but enjoyed the scenery both during day and at night.
Great place with such a variety of things to see and do. Bring your camera for sure. We will go back for sure.

I was so impressed with the beauty of the Parliament buildings. And the house of commons was even under construction, but it didnt matter, it was so awesome.The buildings are so beautiful and I love the hourly clock chimes. The location has so many cool statues to see around the hills, and lots of war memorials. I would go...

Very well organized and free visit to Parliament! The tour was very easy to get tickets for. The tour itself was the right amount of time. The tour guide was friendly and helpful. It was a very pleasant experience. The simplicity and ease of planning a Parliament visit is why I highly recommend it.

Boy have things changed here!Gone are the days that you can just walk through the front door and take a self guided tour. Never the less the tour was informative even though they tell you where to stand!

I was at a conference in Ottawa and had time for just one tourist thing, and i don't regret picking the Parliament.The buildings themselves are magnificent, and the official tours are very good. You get a ticket (for free) from the office across the street. You can also store your bag there. The tours are very frequent when parliament...
Go first thing in the morning to get free tickets for tours to the peace tower and Parliament - this gives a good choice for the time you want

We joined the first tour of the morning. It was supposed to start at 9:20 and didn't start until 9:40. The group was large. We saw the 2nd group and they were much smaller. Our tour guide was great and able to answer lots of questions, but the tour is better if you ask questions. We had a couple of...
Hopefully this will remain open to the public despite the terror threats it is a mainstay for every grade 8 highschool trip. A tour is not only free of charge it is fascinating.
really loved this building superb architecture free admission although you do have to queue for tickets, well worth a trip
Wanted to see peace tower but couldn't I got upset but my daughter loved the library. Nice place though
Very educational, great for families! It's a free outing for larger families. Be sure to take the time to go up the clock! It's completely worth the wait!

You have to get tickets the day of, starting at 9:00 a.m. - the earlier you get there the more you have a choice of the time (it's directly across the street from Parliament). The tour lasts about 45 minutes. We saw the house of commons (through windows), the library and the senate. Our guide was so-so. We took the...

Beautiful place to sight see. A lot of statues around the property with great significance to Canadian history to look at. Right now there is just a bit of construction going on which takes away from some pictures. Free admission to go inside the building for a tour, just have to pick up a free ticket across the street.

Visited this great building whilst traveling around Canada. Luckily really because our hotel was next door! see other reviews. The building overlooks a flame fountain which attracts some homeless residents. 1 to keep warm, 2 to fish for coins.

My first time in Ottawa and decided to do the Parliament tour. Well worth doing as there is a lot to see, lots of great views to be had from the top and an incredible amount of Canadian history to absorb. Guided tour was great value for money and gave a good look into all the publicly accessible parts of...

Take the free tour. It is very informative. There is tons of history everywhere you turn as well as the everyday action of people working in the building. A visit to the Library of Parliament is also highly recommended. It is a beautiful structure.

From the street, the buildings are a must to photograph - the big gates are a feature in themselves, and the eternal flame is quite compelling, especially for children. Add to this the expansive green lawn and beautiful garden beds that are accessible to the public, and you have the makings of a pleasant day out with the kids.Definitely...
I always feel so proud to be a Canadian, the capital city and buildings are so beautiful. When in Ottawa a walk around this area is wonderful.
If you come to Ottawa, the parliament buildings are a must. A great way to spend a most enjoyable day.
All the old government buildings are beautiful and a real treat to see. Day or night. All within walking distance.

A lot of people may find government boring, but there is so much history and interesting facts about Parliament. It is very picturesque, but I recommend going. Walking the grounds, politician spotting, selfies with the protesters! Lot's of fun to be had for free.
What more can I say, it's the Parliament. Ok, so I live here but still, I love going down there and hanging out. People watching is fun, and let me tell you, there are a lot of those here...hahaha.

Well worth lining up for the free tour. The group tour was a little large but it was interesting to see the various areas, especially the library. Interior was more impressive than simply seeing it on tv.

Wasn't very sunny when we were there and the freebie tours from the tourist centre opposite had finished for the day - but none the less, well worth visiting and walking around. Beautiful library building tucked round the back.

Give yourself enough time to get in a tour (check the website to find times for these). You probably will want to go up the peace tower. If you have a loved one or ancestor who died in war, you might consider arriving on the day his (or her) page appears in the Book of Remembrance (check the dates online.)...

The Parliament Buildings are beautiful. Granted, they are not Buckingham Palace nor Versailles, but for our young country, they are very special. The guides are very knowledgeable and willing to answer questions. A visit to the Parliament Buildings is a learning experience not only for foreigners but also for Canadians.

Also surprisingly very, very accessible! The place is majestic and it just oozes with history. The buildings are beautiful and you feel like you are at the center of the nation's 150 yr political history. The tour guides are top notch and will inform you on the functioning of the two chambers of Parliament, Cabinet and MP functions. They have...
Must-see if you are in Ottawa. Be there early in the morning to get tickets for the guided tours. tickets are free but limited.

My wife and I visited the parliament building this summer and were impressed by the not only the architecture but also the openness of the grounds. It was great to walk through the gates past the smiling RCMP and onto the front lawn of what is basically the seat of power in Canada. The tour was interesting with knowledgeable staff...
a most beautiful place to see with its charm and historic architecture. Like nothing else!!! So much nicer to see in person than in pictures.

Don't miss this opportunity when in Ottawa. So beautiful and elegant. Make sure to take the tour it's a must to see the best of Parliament! Staff is very knowledgeable and simply great at what they do! Enjoyed it so much.

I highly recommend the free tour as it's a great way to see the beauty inside the parliament building itself as well as learn a bit of history. Our guide Megan was knowledgeable and made the tour fun while keeping it educational. The peace tour has great views and is well worth visiting as well
Beautiful buildings amazing view. Tours available if required, you get a real sense of Canada's history here. Worth a visit.
Very interesting, guides are nice, must do! So interesting to hear all the history here. You definitely wont be disappointing

It's a cool place to go while walking in downtown Ottawa. Lighting at night is beautiful too. Make sure you also check out the view behind the old building which was honestly my favorite part about the hill. You can see Ottawa river between Quebec and Ontario and Alexandra bridge on it.
No charge for tickets for tour but they go quickly, especially in warmer weather. View from Peace Tower was amazing. Beautiful details and artwork
Ottawa has incredible classic architecture to behold at every turn. The CRA headquarters looks like a castle. Parliament buildings are iconic.

A tip of a friend brought us to sit down on the lawn in front of the Parliament and enjoy a half an hour Sound & Light Spectacle on the history of Canada. What a cool way to spend the night. The story was interesting, both in French and English (if you speak both, it's fun comparing what is said...
Beautiful view from the back of the parliament buildings. Lots of area to walk and take photos of the buildings and hull across the water.

Parliament Hill and its buildings are a must-see for visitors to Canadas capital. The Hill, as it is affectionately known, is like Canadas front lawn, a place where Canadians come together to celebrate and to mourn. Loved going here and seeing everything!!! I found out after you can go on a booked tour, you just have sign up and is free. The tour of parliament was excellent. It was really neat seeing the House of Commons and the Senate. The architecture is beautiful. A photographers dream. The tour was free. Be prepared for enhanced security but well worth it.
Great views & a fabulous old e for photos. If possible, take a tour of the inside, it's very informative.

We love the parliament buildings. We walk around every time we are in Ottawa... During the day, at night, any season, they are amazing symbols for Canada and they represent so much more than just being some of the most awe inspiring buildings in Canada.Currently under serious construction but still really worth walking around!!

In addition to the ground in front of the parliament building being a great place for sightseeing, there's a beautiful trail behind which starts from the canal and goes towards Portage bridge. It's specially nice in the fall when the maples turn red.

Lots to see, interesting shops, walkable. The fLl colours are breAdth taking. You need time, may be 2 or more days to see the main attractions. There is any number of restaurants to choose from. It's extremely unfortunate that these iconic buildings were given brand new copper roofs rather than strategically being replaced with oxidized green. Scaffolding is distracting and disappointing.
We took the tour of the Parliament buildings - very interesting and we even got to go up the Peace Tower - great view.
There are public tours of the parliament building but I find that just walking around the grounds and reading all of the placards great exercise and educational at the same time.
A tour of the Parliament House and buildings were outstanding!!! The history, the architecture, the symbolism are all absolutely wonderful!! I would highly recommend it!!!!

When you first get downtown, go get you free tour tickets. Right across the street from the fire pit on the grounds. The tickets are usually for an advanced time on that day. Make sure to walk around the back of the Parliament Buildings to see the statues, and cross the canal to take excellent pictures. The tour is worth...

I've seen pictures of Parliament Hill, but seeing it in person is amazing. We took a free tour and it was very interesting. The Security checks were time consuming, but necessary and worth it. As part of the tour we saw The House of Commons (Empty), the Library (Amazing) and we got to go into the Senate. If you're Canadian...

Be sure to get tickets for tours across the street at the ticket office, as recent events have shut this down to walk-in self-guided tours. Best time to get tickets? During the changing of the guard ceremony, when the ticket office is deserted.

Great information, funny and informative! Our guide managed to make the tour interesting for the kids on the tour. I lived in Ottawa years ago but never got a chance to tour the main tourist attractions. What a treat this was...very proud to be a Canadian after this tour!

Even if you only have time for a short picture stop of the buildings it is worth the visit. Its probably the main attraction of Ottawa and there is a reason for it. The buildings are impressive.We waited in line early in the morning for some tickets for a guided visit to the inside and we had a great...
A must do it Ottawa-and it is free! Get your tickets across the street. The library is amazing as is the view from the peace tower.

Book a tour,it's worth it. Very informative,beautiful . Amazing feeling to be able to see where the debates are held,seeing all the seats. The architect inside and out is beautiful. Going up to the clock tower was fun.Make sure you gave a good 3 hours so you can take everything in.The Supreme Court is only a 10 minute...
A must see when you visit Ottawa! Nice to walk around and enjoy some amazing views. Don't forget your cameras!

We were lucky enough to take a tour when Parliament was not in session, so got to see the House of Commons, Library and Senate Chamber. You get your free tour tickets at 9 a.m. just across the street from Centre Block. Be there early and you can pick your time. The tour guide was wonderful. We had a tour...

Stayed in Ottawa Saturday night. Got up in the morning and decided to go for a walk to the Parliament Building. Was the best. Didn't get inside the building, but what an amazing building and surroundings.

This is a great location to just visit and admire. Rules have changed now so to enter the building you need to purchase a ticket from the Tourism offices located across the street. The parliament buildings are a must for any tourists who come to Ottawa. Just walking around the outside and checking out all the statues can be nice, especially if you have good weather. The tours inside are okay, but not worth the hours in line and going through security. Go during a quiet time (first-thing in the morning or between...
A must see for visitors and residents! Inspiring and impressive in grandeur! The Parliament Buildings themselves are the heart of our Democracy. Detail and workmanship are reflected in every aspect.

I remember going up the big front steps of Canada's Parliament buildings when I was a kid. No more. It's blocked off to the public. No visit to Ottawa is complete without a visit to Parliament Hill. It's the heart of Canada's Capital and definitely worth a look around.
very impressive construction in centre of Ottawa,Big land sorunded by the canal beautiful parc lots of activits,fun to visit with hole family,kids can see where it is Canada leadership
We have done the buildings in the past..great history and info. The walk around the grounds and the river are lovely.
we were walking distance from our hotel to Parliament Hill, our kids want to visit and we did, it was very nice, definately a must see if you go to Ottawa.
a must for Canadians and out-of-country visitors as well.... tours are free and interesting... the view from the Peace Tower is amazing.

I took my family (2 adults, 2 kids under 3) for our first Parliament Hill tour that lasted 45 minutes. The tour was great, a lot of information was shared but I felt like we moved too fast. Recommend this to everyone who visits Ottawa. Great tour. Go early to pick up tickets from the Visitor center.The guide was knowledgeable. Do not miss the Tower - Great view of downtown.
We were there the day after the election. Trudeaumania was in full swing, with TV crews a most junctions. On a previous occasion, we visited the parliament buildings and were impressed.

I had been to the Parliament buildings when I was a child. Now that Im a parent, it was time to bring my own kid. We had a blast. The architecture is beautiful. The view from the tower is amazing. And the staff there was very friendly.

The change of guard is very nice and not as crowded as in London, it has it's own charm as I found a bit of a mix between the French and the British style with the amazing Canadian essence. I Beautiful
we had a wonderful tour of our Parliament building it is absolutely beautiful in side. So much history.
Take the tour of the building and enjoy the surrounds. It is set in a unique position overlooking the Ottawa river.

We also watched the night light performance at the Parliament. Definitely beautiful and inspiring. You have to go to get the ticket early in the morning and we failed to do so. Have to plan a trip to visit the library of this building in the future.
Visit here every time in Ottawa. Beautiful grounds especially during the tulip festival. Great place.
A must have to see, and a person must take a tour! It really is an impressive place to visit, the architecture is outstanding

Booked for an early tour of Parliament but had to wait for quite a time after we had passed through the security checks. Worth the wait. Superb architecture despite all the renovation work that is going on inside and out.The sound and light show at night was excellent but get a position near the centre to get the best...
I'm a born Canadian & this was my first visit to parliament hill which was well appreciated & much enjoyed!!! Looking forward to our visit tomorrow.

The parliament is great for tourists because with the architecture, art and history it's perfect for the whole family. If you want to get a nice view of Ottawa you can go up the Peace Tower and see the city. Even better the guides are great and tours are completely free

We never got inside the buildings but enjoyed walking about and took a few photos. We went on a Tuesday morning and it wasn't crowded. Lots of police presence which is to be expected. If you're in Ottawa it's a must-see spot. Bonus: it's a quick walk from Byward Market.

Plan ahead if you want to get on the free tour of the Parliament Hill - even in the low season the places (especially for the English speaking tour) fill up really quickly. It's a good idea to head there early in the morning to get one of the first tours or to book one of the afternoon ones and...

This was one of the highlights of our trip. Our tour guide was very interesting and the buildings are gorgeous! I learned so much about our government - and it's free! Get there early to select your time slot.

Tour is for free (but get tickets in the ticket office in front of the parliament). Very tight security and very good tour explanation with lots of details and lots of space for questions/answers. The building inside is beautiful and in particular the library is astonishing. Go also to the top of the peace tower where you have beautiful overview...

Been there during the election campaign so the House of Commons was not in session. However, the building is a very nice piece of architecture and everyone interested should do the tour. The library is just great. Apart from that, the insight on how legislative power in Canada is working was interesting and the view from the Peace Tower is...

The parliament tour and it's all free granted you get a ticket from across the road at the information point. Very beautiful view and would definitely recommend, especially if you like architectureGreat guided tour, very friendly staff.

The grounds of Parliament Hill offer some of the best views of Ottawa, and are a prime vantage point for the Labour Day Weekend balloon festival over in Gatineau; if the wind is blowing just right, the hot-air creatures fill the view.The squirrels in this park are BLACK! Being in Ottawa always makes me feel even more Canadian if that is possible. This visit had an extra feeling knowing that one of our own was killed so tragically in the line of duty. We love Ottawa and enjoy showing the Parliament Hill when we have family visiting from overseas. It does make us feel proud to be Canadian. In order to tour the buildings, you need to arrive at the visitor's center across the street early in the day. Tickets for the entire day were gone before we arrived so we opted to take the tour of the grounds instead. It was incredibly interesting to learn about Canadian history, especially when it pertains to events covered in American...

A walk up to Parliament Hill and buildings is a must do when in Ottawa, the Parliment is set in beautiful gardens. Take a tour for more information. There is a very high police presence there but they are vey friendly.

My friends and I enjoyed our tour of the Parliament Hills. It is one awesome place that you can enjoy and respect at the same time. Guards and policemen are everywhere and I find that cool because the peace, cleanliness and respect of the place is maintained that way.

You must get your ticket across the street at 90 Wellington St. The ticket will have the tour time on it. Do not throw it away because it is needed for your entrance before security and then again before the tour.

The history of Canada lies here and the government works inside (in canadian people words). The architecture is beautiful and the place is full of meaning for canadians, and the view over to the city and over the Rideau Canal is gorgeous.Beautiful visit in every season, and the light show in the wintertime is lovely.

Seeing our Nation's capital has been on our bucket list and so glad we came. We took the tour of the parliament buildings and the clock tour. Very interesting and enjoyed all the architecture in the parliament buildings. Brilliant. A building to remember. Police around the building is friendly and professional. It was 6pm and at the entrance there were large signs ponting to the "visitors entrance" to the right. We walked in this direction and walked around the building just to find out that the signs are wrong. The visits to the parliament are only until 4.30pm....

My husband and I were in Ottawa in late June, we couldn't get in to a tour during our way East but we lucked out on our way back home West and made it to a tour but it was in French. We didn't mind and were happy to have a tour. This is a must see in Ottawa, I...

Incredible architecture. The trees were just turning so lots of photo opportunities. There are often small protest groups there and they are happy to share views with you. All very civilised and gives another side to media coverage

This was my second visit to the Parliament building and I was stunned again by the fantastic interior and design.The Parliament offers FREE tours which is great and I believe every other national parliaments in the world should offer the same - to bring locals and visitors closer to the center of politics.Our tour guide (who was from...

I am Canadian, and I live near Toronto only 3 hours away from the capital yet I had not been there. So finally I went down this past week for a trip to see Ottawa. It is beautiful. The parliament building is massive as it looks in pictures and the best part is - the tour is free. We skipped...

You need to get a (free) pass by going to 90 Wellington (right opposite Parliament). We got there twenty mins before it opened at 9am and joined the queue. Thankfully we managed to get tickets for the 9.20 tour. Be aware that this means the time you begin queuing again at Parliament to get through Security.Once in, the tour...

We had to get to the ticket counter across the street from Parliament early to get tickets for the same day tour. You can also pick up tourist info while there. I got a primer/guide to the Canadian government there that was very helpful. The place opens at 9, so we joined the line at 8:45 one chilly Saturday and...

We took our 7 year old son on a tour of the Center building. The tour guides are very knowledgeable. We went on a Saturday during the buskers festival and so the line ups were a bit longer. Our son was great but if you have kids that are challenged with waiting around don't do the Peace Tower. The tour...
Nice walk, good light, and some fun buildings to look at. The Changing of the guard and the statues and markers are a fun read for those of us who could know more about Canadian history.
The tour was extremely interesting and infomative. The peace tower line up took a while but again worth the wait. Tickets are free but well worth the effort to go and get them.
Parliament is a must visit. Once renovation is done it will be even better! Love the flame that always burns.

An October visit to Ottawa is beautiful! The old Parliament buildings and downtown is like a visit to Europe. The leaves are gorgeous this time of year and the weather is still wonderful. Lots of shopping downtown and locally made items to purchase. Great time to get some early Christmas shopping done!

I did this tour today, Monday 14th September 2015. It is one of my favorite places in Ottawa. It is beautiful! If you have chance do the tour inside the parliament and visit the amazing library building.

Taking a tour of the parliament is really interesting, I especially love the library. Go up the bell tower, you will be rewarded with beautiful views! In the summer, there is free yoga on the lawn on Wednesdays at noon, it's a lot of fun.

In order to get tickets you need to go to another buikding located on Wellington Street, the line up on Sat morning was about 30 mins, we could only find tours for 1 pm and later.The tour itself is good. The guide was fine, but because we took an afternoon tour she looked tired and like she wanted her...

Good tour. Large group, so that was a bit unfortunate. They've really stepped up security since the last time I visited: you are only allowed in with a tour group, which was a bit disappointing as we would have liked extra time to look at the exhibits. Worth the time when in Ottawa though and free of charge to visit.
So Awesome for any Canadian to visit this historic site. A must if in Ontario on vacation or business. Good security presence, but helpful and friendly.

Beautiful architechture with a lot of history. I loved everything...You are only allowed to bring only one bag if visting inside. Tickets are on the first come bases otherwise you will have to wait for the next round.

While travelling around Canada we stopped in Ottawa for the day and decided on the parliament tour, which was even better as it was free!All the English tickets were gone so we had the tour in French (I dont speak french!), not a massive issue and was still a great experience.
Tour good but could not hear most of the presentation. I would have liked to better understood the basic political process.
We were on a Sunday on Ottawa,unfortunately it was close so we could visit it only outside. Very beautiful view over city.
Lots to learn on the guided tours, the guides are full of info and seem to know everything. Oh Canada!!!!

We were able to have a few experiences with Parliament Hill: first, the fireworks on Canada Day, which we watched from Jacques Cartier Park in Gatineau, at the foot of the Macdonald-Cartier bridge. This is the number one thing to do in Ottawa. It is rich in history, contemporary politics and beautiful buildings and views. We loved the architecture here. Our guide told us that the original building was gutted by fire and only the library was saved. It is a round structure and is a feature of the building that still fits in with the newer building. Sitting in a prominent position, it is visible from many areas of the city.
This free show is really worth the effort, if you decide to go. The lawns are spacious.. and the story telling is good, the laser show is great.
Great tour and very informative. Our tour guide was very knowledgeable and had a great sense of humor.
Security was noticeable and construction kept us from seeing everything, but the grounds are spectacular and the area is clean and welcoming.

This was the first time we had visited our nation's capital since our honeymoon 41 years ago. Our grandchildren joined us on the free tour, which was well worth the time spent.
