The Parliament complex in Ottawa is a must-see. We took a guided tour of the central block, and it was worth every minute. The presenter was enthusiastic and knowledgeable, and the building itself was majestic. The library inside, in particular, is charming and stately. We also went back in the evening to watch the magnificent sound-and-light show, "The Northern Lights"....

This is a very impressive hill and buildings. Unfortunately a lot of construction going on at the moment, but very impressive. A huge lawn expanse and one could stay for hours enjoying the scenery. The Parliament tour was okay.

Architecturally significant historic building. A perky young tour guide led us to the House of Commons and to the senate, and to the beautiful library watched over by a marble statue of Queen Victoria. Everything in the facility was photo worthy. We also saw the peace tower with it's 360 degree rooftop views of the area, and the memorial which...

You can see pictures and read reviews but this is a tour that needs to be experienced to fully appreciate those grand buildings. Book your free tour ticket early from across the road. Security check is as stringent as airports so definitely don't have any inappropriate items in your bag or check them in to a locker at ticket site....
A great visit and it is free. Make sure you go for tickets early in the day as even the afternoon tickets go early.

Have had friends visit and we always take them for a walking tour of Parliament Hill and around the Buildings. Much restoration work under way, but still a beautiful spot.Plenty of people and gardens are beautiful. A must see in Ottawa

This is a very good free tour which you must get tickets for across the road from the parliament buildings. There are English and French tours and best to get there around mid morning to get your tickets. All tours are timed and lay about 45 min. Definitely go to the peace tower, great views and with the extra time....

We enjoyed just being around this part of town for a couple of days. It's an experience that givens feeling to being a Canadian. The tour of the Parliament Building is well done, and especially going in late September as we did it's very easy to get the time slot you want. Of course the security is a drag, though...

The parliament buildings in Ottawa are so impressive! We toured the tower and a memorial room. The achitecture is amazing and the location on a hill overlooking the river is serene. Canadians must be so proud of their national capitol!
Taking this tour is well worth it. The tour is free and very well worth the time. The tour guide was also excellent and very friendly. A great piece of history to visit.

Took a tour of the Parliament building today and I recommend this tour to anyone. The tour is free but you have to get tickets and they may sell out. We went to the ticket place around 1pm and they were sold out already so we went the next day at 9:15am and got the last times lot for 10am....

At about 12 noon, on a weekday in late September, the earliest English language tour was at 3.20 pm. Within moments of my taking 2 entry passes, the balance few were also grabbed. There were two English tours slotted for that day, one at 1.20 pm and the other at 3.20 pm.We were there at 3.15 pm at the...
We were there during the Battle of Britian celebration, which was an added bonus, at night the building was lit up with a special show, excellent. Without these attractions, it is still worth a visit

The Canadian Parliament Buildings are symbol of our great nation. They were built in the Gothic Revival style apparently to contrast the neoclassic style of the American capital. Construction of the original buildings started in 1859 after Queen Victoria designated Bytown (Ottawa) as the capital of the then Province of Canada. The present form of Parliament Hill (The Hill) was...

The imposing and Parliament Hill of Canadas Capital, Ottawa, sit on a small mound backing on to the Ottawa River and overlooking this very traditional looking city are reminiscent of the Parliament Buildings of London. A great place to spend Canada Day, July 1st!

Stayed at Residence Hill, Ottawa, great for families as well as individuals, spacey enough that you dont feel smothered if youre sharing. Walking distance to parks/restaurants/nightlife, Parliament Building is very close to the Hotel. I did a tour of Parliament building and also saw the changing of the guards that occurs from late June to late August, this starts promptly...
Camelle was an excellent guide with an ability to get us involved and curious. Security seemed a bit over the top but better that than the absurdity of TSA.

We did the free tour of the Parliament which was excellent though security ( understandably) is tight and takes a long time. The views from the peace tower are fantastic. The memorial chapel is beautiful and poignant. Outside the staues of the women who were instrumental in getting women recognised as 'persons' is very well done.
We walked around on a beautiful Fall day. We did not go inside but simply walking around the grounds you get a feel for the amazing architecture. Check it out.

Such beautiful pictures. History, glamour, stunning flowers. Just amazing place to visit...you can felt walk the grounds.Police are fun, informative, and willing to share their country's government center with visitors. Just beautiful!

If you can build in an hour into your travel plans, I would definitely recommend booking onto a tour of the Parliament Buildings in Ottawa.The 50 minute guided tour is free of charge, however you will need to book tickets at the tourist information centre from 9am in the morning.Tours are held in English and French and get...

I took my friend from Australia to see the Parliament buildings. We got there just after 4:00 p.m. and when we went to get free tickets, they advised it was closed for the day. We did however walk around the outside of the buildings. My friend had just came from NYC and Washington D.C. and was very impressed with the...

The parliament area is a nice area for strolling around, but the building itself is a tremendous feat of architecture. I saw it many times, but after seeing many parliament buildings around in Europe I came to appreciate it very much.

So much history presented in a very distinguished way. There is an office at 90 Wellington that you will need in order to get on the free tour.Recommend this. But people with baby carriages might have second thoughts.

This is a beautiful area to walk around, the buildings are impressive!. What is not impressive is the amount of protestors, with the most ridiculous causes to support. It is great that the buildings are free to the public, and the historical significance of the structures. Be a proud Canadian!
Take a guided tour. House of Commons was under construction due to expanding number of members, Security, like most places today, is insanely over the top. Most is for show and ineffective.

Interesting tour. Some parts are under a big reconstruction but we got to see the Senate and the library, both pretty impressive. You can also go by elevator to the top of the peace tower for some nice views. And it's free. But make sure that you pass by early to book it, tours will sell out quickly.

My wife and I have been to Ottawa several times and we have yet to see the east or west block open for visitors. The main building is interesting and beautiful but internally a visitor has to go though tight security and must stay very tightly bundled with the group and therefore must do the groups pace. Keep in mind...
Found the visit very interesting. Our guide was very knowledgeable and knew her subject. The peace tower and memorial room were very moving. Glad we went.

Pre election time so a really good time to view Parliament. Both Senate and House of Representatives were open for viewing. Such an impressive Gothic building. Highly recommend a visit when visiting Ottawa. Very strict security, similar to USA airport controls. Get there early and book a tour time at the information centre opposite the entrance to the Parliament building....
Taking a tour of our Parliament is a must for all tourists to the Capital. The view from the Peace Tower is great, the buildings are full of history.

During our stay we visited Parliament Hill and took the Parliament tour. The tour guide was very thorough in her information shared with the paying public. French, British and Canadians are all represented in this beautiful place. To our delight there was a light (luminere) show projected onto the Parliament building later in the evening. The light show depicted the...

Queued from 8:30 am on a Saturday to get tickets for the 1st English speaking tour at 9:20 that morning. The outside of the buildings (West, central & east) are very beautiful. Unfortunately the west building has scaffolding up due to maintenance. The tour guide took us through very tight security and then began the hour or so tour of...
This hour long tour was very informative about the government system in Canada. It was quite an experience.

Great Tour of buildings. If you like history and architecture then this is a must see.It was overcast and rainy that day, so it was the ideal attraction. Within walking distance of most hotels in the area.
Excellent Tour of the Parliament Buildings .... ReallyTower and the Memorial Chamber. The architecture is phenomenal! It was really cool to be visiting with people from all over the world!
An absolutely magnificent building!! Definitely a must see! Superior architecture throughout...a grand marvel in my eyes! The great library and the views from the Peace Tower are simply breathtaking!
Great place to just walk through the parliament yard was beautiful. My only complaint is when I was there the construction on the roads and buildings in the area was a bit unbearable

A trip to Ottawa would not be complete without a visit, or two, to the Hill. From early morning the pomp of the changing of the guards is well worth getting up and out for, to the later evening light and sound show available through the summer months, enjoyable for young and old.Centre block is open year round and...

I went on the tour of Parliament on a Saturday which is the best day to go as you get access to all of the Center Block. The tour guides are very knowledgeable and engaging. You go through airport-type security to enter after you have bought your ticket across the street. The first tour is at 920 am. Security is...
Spent the morning on the hill watching the Police Memorial this last weekend. What a great turn out. The hill is a great place to visit and get some wonderful photos.

There is a lot to see. lots of people milling about on the lawns near the cauldron and inside taking tours. There are many statues that depict individuals from our history. Take the "Peace Tower" tour is you can as it takes you up to the top just under the clock. There is usually a line up for this so...
A must when visiting Ottawa. tickets can be picked up at the information centre at 9am everyday. tickets are free and you must have a ticket.
Visit the Peace Tower for great 360 degree views of the City. It's free! Pick up the free tickets at 90 Wellington Street. Everyone that works in the tower are friendly and knowledgable.

The tickets for this tour are on the other side of the road next to the tourist information office. The tours are time sensitive. Catherine our guide was very clear spoken, the main areas well explained (the members place where they have the debates, is built on a similar style to Westminster) is undergoing repair and 30 new seats are...
You have to see Parliament Hill if you come to Ottawa and it does have some very impressive buildings and statues.

Superb buildings (some under renovation) The grounds are very well kept. The library is fantastic. Make sure you take a guided tour. Hopefully you'll visit it when the parliament is in cession. It's worth spending some time listening to the debates.

I am not sure how anyone could visit Ottawa and not go see Parliament Hill. Even if you're not into politics or history, the buildings and grounds are beautiful and offer great views of the area. It's also FREE!The tour inside is great and if you want to experience Canadian (Westminster) government, check out a session of Question Period...
Beautiful architecture and grounds. Central to understanding our country. You can't visit Ottawa without a visit.
Every citizen should visit the Parliament buildings at least once in their life. Great to see where our representatives work. Beautiful buildings, great architecture, wonderful pictures to be taken.

We did the free tour. Chloe our tour guide was excellent. You can tell she had a passion for her job. After the tour, we went up the peace tower and memorial hall. Definitely recommend for anyone visiting the capital

There is a massive restoration project going on all over Parliament Hill, so access to some buildings may be restricted. I didn't have time to tour inside the buildings on this particular visit but would come again.
A beautiful September day spent strolling along the Parliament grounds enjoying the beauty from our Nation's Capital. Being my first time in Ottaw it was a real treat.

Make sure to see the parliament building, tickets are free but go early and you can get them at the visitors centre from 9 am I think, hop on hop off tour was not very good, maybe it was just our tour guide

We were there at 9am to get the guided tour ticket. It was definitely worth it; with tour of the library etc. The view from the Peace Tower was mesmerising. Also, not to be missed, the memorial room for the fallen. We were suprised by the light show at night as its supposed to be available only during summer but...

As Canadians we should be proud of our Parliament Hill facilities, our Nations Capital. We toured through the Peace Tower, House of Commons, the Library and Senate chamber; truly an education into our government and Canadas history. It is a great education for children/young people.You must get tickets and book your tour times; the tickets are free and obtainable...

We visited her whilst touring through Canada, this was a great location for pictures, its a lovely site full of history. I loved the fountain at the from with the flame, beautiful in the evening, From here went down past the locks to take a boat trip.

This is a lovely place to visit,when we were there they had a fantastic light show focuses on the parliament building, lots of places to sit and watch. We didn't go inside but just walked around the outside but it was still interesting and took lots of pics.m

So worth the visit! You need to pick up tickets for the free tours of the Parliament buildings at a location across the street - number 90 Wellington. You then meet at the designated time on Parliament Hill under the Canadian flag. You are taken through 2 security check stations and then met by the tour guide.

What a stunning looking building, set in get grounds, a must see destination for visitors to Ottawa. There are official tours, which are free, on a first come first served basis in the offices on the opposite side of the street.

Very different from the imperial feeling of Washington DC. Security is very tight and helpful. THe guides are friendly and very open to all questions. It is worth the time to learn and experience the Canadian legislative experienece.

Definitely worth your time to see the Parliament Hill and Buildings. The statues are beautiful! Enjoyed reading the plaques explaining the history. The architecture of the buildings is amazing to see in person. Lots of photo opportunities!
When in Ottawa .I was lucky to be there when a remeberance of World War so it was very interesting .Being part of a short visit to the city didn't have time for a guided tour .
We were very lucky to see them celebrate the 1940s with all kinds of military "stuff" (old airplanes from the 2nd world war, a speach, dfile of the veterans, military and the bagpipers...

One of Ottawa's best attraction, happening on evenings during the summer. The light show is free, done on the parliament building itself, while you seat on the huge lawn in front of the building. Recommended to bring lawn chairs or some rug or blanket. The show start quite late - at 9pm, however you have to come at least a...

I only passed by the Hill and its buildings during a pit-stop in Ottawa. A friend and I stayed for a couple of hours only, on our way to Montreal in October 2013, and tried to see as many typical "Ottawa-things" as possible during that time. Parliament Hill counted as such. It wasn't that special, but pretty indeed. If you...

Great if you get to see the outside and all the statues and lay on the grass but amazing if you take the tour.Senate wasn't sitting so unfortunately some of the rooms were under construction but if they had been sitting we wouldn't have been able to see those rooms anyway so I'll take it!Free tours with so...

We were impressed with our tour of the parliament buildings. Our tour guide was very informative and shared a few great stories. Very interesting to see the hallways that we see on news programs,the house of commons(although the room was under major renovation) and the senate. The parliament library was soooo impressive.....a truly great room.

I recommend going early and doing the tour. I normally would not do tours but It's free and insightful and is less than an hour. It also allows you to get into parts of the building you wouldn't otherwise see. The library was incredible to see and the peace tower gives a great view of the city. Families with small...

Gorgeous location with a perpetual fire pit and actual guards. The area is beautiful with beautiful gardens, tourist trips being sourced at the gateway. The locks are an exciting to watch with soldiers on the banks acting out skits with the audience and a nearby museum to visit.Beautiful statues. Must see when visiting Ottawa.

The best part about my visit to the Parliament hill was the Northern Lights show. It looks like the show is put up for a couple of months in summer and if I was couple of days late I would have missed it. It is a pretty impressive show with light projects on the parliament building itself and it narrates...
Great tour. Very interesting. Beautiful building and history behind it. I would recommend for anyone
Go firat to the visitors center for a free ticket. There you get the time for the tour. Very interesting.

Key points to cover, the peace tower, senate, house of commons and of course the beautiful rich library. Don't forget to collect the 2 passes at the info centre during the early part of the day to start with. In summer, they host the fire cracker show and the night laser show. Don't miss that. All the above are free...
I have been to the US Capitol and Washington DC. I have seen the Capitol building in Rhode Island and Annapolis --this was at least equal no=e better no worse
Great tour with a great guide. A must see when you are in Ottawa. An hour trip and once done, you will learn a lot.

Get there early if you wanted a guided tour of the inside. The grounds are very cool, too, lots of historical statues and some nice viewpoints of the river. You can also get a guidebook across the street.
Beautiful building with free guided tours, very interesting and well organized.The daily sound and lights show at night is amazing! The story of Canada in 30 minutes.

1. Take the tour - awesome fun and very interesting2. Get early to get the free tour tickets - this is especially applicable if you are there in the summer months. - the booth opens at 9 am, however the queue starts outside as early as 7:45 am. If you go past 10:30, you may not get any tickets...
No trip to Ottawa would be complete without visiting here. The buildings are great to look at on the outside and possibly even greater on the inside, so make sure you get a free tour ticket too.

We attended this year's night time show entitled Northern Lights. It is a good 35-40 minute light and sound show that uses the Center Block for the backdrop for the show. It is a synthesized history of Canada designed to show us events that have contributed to our wonderful national pride of our country. It is an excellent way for...

We were a bit late for the changing of the Guard, so hopped to the building directly across from the Parliment buildings, to the tourist information which has loads of pamphlets and the tickets, they are free and you have to specify times so choose wisely and don't be late (or early). The guides for the tours were excellent and...
A must to visit. Extremely comprehensive security checks upon entry handled efficiently. Our tour guide was very professional and knowledgeable. It was quite an experience and educational

Because of renovations and security, the grounds are mostly inaccessible. We wanted to see the beautiful library which can only be seen from the back and we could not do so. We tried going down to the riverside path but the view was obstructed by trees. You can still wander around the front lawns and see the eternal flame and...
We attended the sound & light show and enjoyed it very much. Make sure to have bug spray though, I was the feast for the mosquitos!

The guides are fantastic (and bilingual), the ground and buildings are beautiful, and its a place full of Canadian history. There is also usually something going on and its nice to sit and have a picnic lunch in front.

Wow being Canadian my whole life and never been to parliament. I think every Canadian should have a chance to see it and experience it at least once in their life. I only wish it was in session but so much ch history plus they have the whole northern lights show going on in the evenings. A show that brings...
peace tower and centre block tour is fabulous and free! Also don't miss the Northern Lights show - it was really wonderful!!

when our parliamentarians are not locking horns, this piece of architecture is a national treasure worth visiting. If you get a chance, please visit the building especially the Library and the grounds. The eternal flame will be burning 24/7

As a born and raised Ottawan, and someone who attended the 1967 Centennial Party on the Hill, I've seen it from every angle.But, something is happening now that doesn't happen all to often, and that is the copper re-roofing.Specifically the West Block which is under a major retrofit at time of writing. So if you can, visit Parliament...
It's great to show fellow Canadians and travellers some history of Canada. The light show last night showed us about Quebec and history. It was amazing.
We enjoyed the new Northern Lights show on the lawn of the Parliament Buildings. It's a beautiful and educational show. Well worth the time.

TAKE THE TOUR. MOST BEAUTIFUL GOVERNMENT building. decision makers sit here in this decision making center. This is referred as "THE HILL". It houses, House of Commons, Senate and Library of Parliament. Also Peace tower at the top. Pleasant colours and intricate animations are in the hill creating the canadian art and culture.Lots of sculptures, paintings,wooden panels, huge pillars,...

Love going to parliament when I visit Ottawa... It makes me smile to feel welcomed.I walked out of a bar when I was younger visibly light, but not in bad shape and decided to take a walk...Within a few steps an RCMP car pulled up, I smiled and said 'guess we aren't allowed to be here huh?'The...
Amazing trip through history - for free and really interesting - bring your own chair or blanket and sit back- relax and enjoy the show
We took in Fortissimo and the Northern Lights show at Parliament Hill this past summer and would highly recommend it to anyone visiting the area or even more so those that live in this area.

Our Parliament Hill tour was fabulous. The reason for our trip was to visit the nation's capital and the associated buildings. Make sure to get a tour, which grants access to Parliament Building and the Peace Tower. Also, be sure to return for the Northern Lights show, which was our favourite part of our trip.
Takes a while to get through security, but well worth a visit. Don't forget to go up into the peace tower for an awesome view of Ottawa.

Parliament Hill and the buildings surrounding it make for an interesting walk. Unfortunately. when we were there this year there was a lot of renovations happening so trying to get pictures of these historic buildings without scaffolding in them was a little difficult.

Parliament Hill has lots to see and is great to visit - don't miss it. BUT... don't expect to be able to take a tour and see the inside. If you're lucky and get to the visitors centre VERY early in the morning you may be able to get a ticket to take a tour inside Parliament. We've tried many...

Andrew was excellent guide for the tour. One needs to get the tickets early in the morning... was lucky to get on last day of summer season to enjoy the tour. Architecture is so beautiful and rich. Donot miss the light and sound show at night.

We (family of 4, with two boys 8 and 11) took advantage of the free tours that they offer (pick up tickets across the street near the Terry Fox statue -- I recommend getting there early as we were only able to get french speaking tour of Centre Block).The tour guide was very knowledgable and the tour was great....
The history is amazing to see all the old buildings and what they stand for. The architecture is fabulous. We also took the tour around the buildings by boat which I much preferred (capital cruises).

This is one of the most significant buildings in Canada, and well worth the time to visit and tour. They are magnificent - take time to look at the many interesting details that really add character and history. Enjoy.
Awesome place to get mix of history present day parliamentary happenings. The library is amazing with the beautiful architecture.
Free show. Bring a lawn chair or blanket and watch from the grassy area in front of the Parliament buildings. Starts at 9 pm.

For someone who is seriously lacking in knowledge about the Canadian political system and government, I sincerely enjoyed the tour of Parliament. It was thoroughly interesting as it weaved entertaining stories into the descriptions of the history and current governmental functions. I would highly recommend the nightly light show. Sure, it is a bit of exaggeration of history with sprinklings...

Great to see, sadly tours were given out for the day ( first come first serve). But grounds interesting and especially the "persons" statute was worth visiting. Other statues good for history but not as fun to interact with, in fact the persons statues are the most I' very ever seen people interact with public art.

Took both guided tours. Loved them both. The tour of the East wing is only available during the summer.Being from Denmark, this was a great opportunity to learn about the structure of Canadian government.Being free, I would say they are far above value for money.

I did a tour of the East Block; very unique and neatly done rooms of parliamentary history. I had to inquire about wheelchair access for this building when I got the ticket; glad I asked when I did and I was able to go on the tour. I had tour guide going through the security check point with me; less...

The Parliament Hill,seat of Canada's national government and the setting for pomp,ceremony and celebration,along with other buildings,were amongst beautiful surroundings and lush green lawns and trees.The silver grey buildings and their lovely architecture makes for a regal environment.

The tour of the centre block of the parliament includes the senate, library and the halls of the parliament building. If you are lucky enough, your tour cost will also include a trip by elevator to the peace tower. (Unfortunately the elevator broke down the day we were there.)

This place is a must see for any visitor to Ottawa, the architecture is phenomenal and the grounds and monuments very beautiful and interesting. Highly recommend this and if you can attend the sound and light show in the evenings, really nice to experience.

My fourth-grader and I were in town for the World Cup and were looking for a way to spend a Saturday afternoon. The Parliament Hill area is beautiful. For the tour of Parliament, you have to get tickets across the street - we didn't find this intuitive and had to ask what to do. The tour was interesting, if a...

You have to go, it is just such a part of Canadian history, if there are doing the light show in the evening even one more reason to go. Ottawa rocks great city summer for biking and winter for the ice skating on the Rideau

If you come to Ottawa for sightseeing this is pretty much why you came, so you can't miss it.If you want the free tour go early as there was a line up already at 9am on a Sunday. (Location of tour booking is directly across the road from parliament building)---A side note --- I found both the Taxi...
The walk up Wellington is just gorgeous. .. but as soon as you get to Parliament Hill the view of the building is amazing .... take lots of pics

I do enjoy this tour but it is shame because of the age we live in security is so strict. I still remember my first tour in the early 90s of Parliament Hill and we could walk in the front door with no screening, but over all very informative
We took a tour of the Centre Blocks and went up the Peace Tower.The tour was so informative, the guide very congenial and knowledgable. The Library is NOT to be missed. Fantastic architecture
Get tickets early prior to changing of the guard at 10am. there is a long wait to get through security. Guide was very knowledgeable. Go to the clock tower at end of tour.
I went on a free tour of the East Bloc & Center Bloc buildings. It was interesting and the tour guides were well informed about the history and and the current workings of Parliament.
The free tours of Parliament Hill were interesting and the tour guides were knowledgeable and friendly. Get your tour tickets early in the day! We really liked the light show at night as well.

We did a tour of the centre of parliament which included the peace tower, senate and House of Commons. The tours are timed and it is a good idea to get to the ticket office early to get a tour. The ticket office is located directly across the street from the parliament buildings.The guides are very informative and the...

Free to visit. You should get to the ticket center early though.We first visited the East building and then the center. Leave a one hour gap between the two visits, or you'll have to rush to the next one. (like we had to)

Being here is an awesome experience. Esp seeing it up close and personal.We were there around 9PM and we heard the clock's loud gong. It was an eerie feeling. I consider it like the Big Ben of Ottawa.The city is nice and quaint. Very clean and I love the brick structures. It made me feel like I were...
What a lovely surprise! These buildings are beautiful & well maintained. Nearby there are evening light shows in summer - a worthwhile visit!

This is a must! We were told at our hotel that there was a light show in the evening at the Parliament building but didn't know what to expect. There were hundreds of people sitting out in front of the building and the light show told the history of Canada. It was fascinating and wonderful the way it was all...
Very nice to see our capital. It is nice to people playing on the front lawn and being able to walk around and right up to the buildings is a nice feeling being a Canadian.

This tour is something you simply cannot miss, it's really what Ottawa is all about. The tickets are free but after walking up to the parliament buildings I find out I need to walk back to Wellington St as that is where you get the tickets. Security is tight so leave pocket knives and such in the car. The guides...

This is our second time on the tour. The last time was over 15 years ago when the world was a safer place and security wasn't at every corner. We arrived at the ticket office across from Parliament shortly after 11 and only had to wait until Noon for our FREE tour. We walked around outside and took in the...

This is a really interesting tour. You need to book a time ahead as the tours quickly book up. We picked up tickets first thing in the morning for a mid afternoon tour. If you want to visit the peace tower you need to be on a tour before 2.50pm. The peace tower gives brilliant views of the city.
Don't miss the Northern Lights happening at the Parliament building nightly from July -September. The 30 minutes is well worth the experience!
Fantastic and very interesting tour of the Canadian House of Parliament. Many parallels to UK system. Knowledgeable and friendly guides. Get there early to avoid ticket queue. All FREE!

Enjoyed the guided tour of Parliament buildings, very knowledgeable guide who answered any questions and did not feel rushed. Took lots of pictures and interesting to see the British connections in their parliament dcor and the way it all work.Tour was free. A number of tours a day, can check with the information centre across the road for more...
I was very lucky that I got the change to see the Northern Lights Show at the Parliament House! That was definitely the highlight of my trip! :)
Very interesting site to see. A great deal of history happened here and we had a great guide who was able to answer all questions. The library itself is worth the whole tour.
One of the country's most beautiful monuments. Home to the federal government and the police memorial, you will love the beautiful landscapes.

When in Ottawa you have to come to Parliament Hills and visit Parliament Buildings (it is free but you have to obtain tickets (at the location -as the visits are limited per day)Be sure to go to the library it is a beautiful building (inside and from the outside as well)

We are so lucky to have such a beautiful Parliement hill. In August there is a Light show every evening from 9h30 to 10 PM, bring a chair or towel sit back and enjoy the history lesson. Great for all ages.

The buildings are indeed beautiful and have a very rich history behind them. You can get a free tour of inside the Parliament for free which in my opinion is a great opportunity to learn about the history and politics of Canada. Tour tickets are offered daily cross the street from the parliament and I suggest you go there early...

Great visit to the parliament buildings. Walked the grounds and saw all the statues. We went back at night to see the awesome light show called northern lights projected in the parliament building. It was informative and spectacular. Worth the drive to Ottawa.
Had a great tour with Adam, he was very informative and funny! My kids enjoyed it, we also did the light show in the evening that was very well done.
Every Canadian should try to visit our Parliament. It is a building, an institution, a historical icon of our past present and future.

This tour is just very interesting and educational... The building is just very attractive and very english... It is very similar to the one which is located in London.... Even though i learned a lot about canadian political system ... If i were you i would not miss it
We did a self guided tour of buildings and lawns. Beautiful architecture, great statues with a lot of history to be learned. It was a nice way to spend an hour outdoors.

We arrived on a sunny day in April, where it was warming up around Canada - we lay on the lawn for about an hour soaking up the sun, and then headed in to take a tour of the Parliament building. Ethan was our guide, and he was extremely knowledgeable and gave a very fun, interesting tour. Beautiful interior with...

My family and I got the free ticket to tour Parliament hill from the building across the street from Parliament building. We arrived there 30 minutes before the building opened but there were no less than 100 people already waiting in line. Beautiful scenery at the back with the Rideau Canal locks, then you come around to the front to see the actual buildings. Lots of security now especially after the shooting that happened in 2014. You'll see RCMP driving around in unmarked cars from pickups to minivans and little hatchbacks. Visited in the afternoon, then came back again at night for...

Attended the Sound and Lights show last night. Just an AWESOME display of both technology (Sound and Lights) and Canadiana! Bring a lawn chair. The show starts at 9:30 PM and runs for half an hour. The crowd was already starting to form at 9 PM, so get there at least half an hour early to get a good seat...

I had a very memorable and enjoyable time with my family when we went Downtown to watch the Northern Light show, it was very well planned, and very creative. It was Free so that was a huge bonus and it's not too long (about 1/2 an hour ) so if you couldn't find seats you could stand but not for...
Beautiful building and our tour guide was great. It was a very informative experience, but what I love the most was the beautiful architecture of the building.

Excellent tour that is well worth the security. (They take your selfie sticks, will return them). All guides are so well trained and knowledgeable. Beautiful architecture and history. Can't say enough about the entire experience. Free tickets, scheduled times, and all glorious.

We went to the light show at parliament hill, it was amazing! ! If it hadn't been raining the next night we would have gone again. Its a great way to see and hear Canadas history, the light effects are awesome!

The tour of Centre Block was excellent. Our guide Sarah as knowledgable, friendly and well spoken. Over the course of our hour long tour we saw both chambers (House of Commons and Senate) as well as the Parliamentary Library and Peace Tower. While tickets are required for this tour, they are free and available on a first come, first served...
Good way to learn more about the history of Canada. Amazing how much rich history will surround you there!
If you go to Ottawa this is a must do! The buildings are gorgeous and the history quite interesting.Go early in the day to avoid crowds.
We loved the light and sound show in the evening at the parliament buildings! Wonderful family activity!

Did the english tour for Central block of the Parliament. Took a long (30)minutes to get in through security. Took a while to get through and up to Peace Tower. Not so informative re the structure or the history. Docent was nice but not so enticing. The wait was not worth it and the kids on the tour were well...

We enjoyed a double helping of Parliament Hill and its administering buildings today - it was awe inspiring! We enjoyed a Free Guided Tour of the Central Building and Peace Tower. Our Guide was very passionate about his job and his Heritage and really made you feel you were part of the process. I was so impressed, I almost felt...

Our first time in our National Capital. I was really impressed with the parliament and the buildings. They started restauring one and if they do the whole job, the result will simply be stunning. We did not take the inside guided tour because our daughter would have made too much noise. I would be curious to know the price though....

We called at the tourist information place at 90 Wellington and found that timed tickets are given out from there on a first come basis for guided tours of Parliament buildings. We got a ticket for the central tour. Security is very tight and I had my bag searched and then had to go through a screening. This took about...

Get your tickets first at 90 Wellington. I wandered around Parliament Hill for a while before I figured out where to get the tickets. I saw both the East Block and the Centre Block in one afternoon. The architecture and historical stories made this really interesting for me. Don't bring a large bag, as security will not let in anything...

I've probably been to the Parliament 100 times in my life (I live in Ottawa) but I never get tired of coming here. Truly, one feels the sense of "The True North, Strong and Free" while you're out here. The building is grandiose from the outside. It's full of history, art and architecture from the inside. The Library of Parliament...

column3: South Brunswick Township, New Jersey, United States
column4: An Excellent tour into the Canadian Parliament. When collecting the free tickets from the ticket center, also request for Memorial chamber and Peace tower. All are in the same building so plan accordingly so you can have go through the security check once. Worth watching the sound and light show at night.

Iconic and important to all Canadians. The East and West Blocks predate present day Canada. The Centre Block was built during WW1 to replace the older building which burned down. The Library Rotunda survived.

Just being at the Parliament Buildings was overwhelming! The buildings are magnificent and history and character of them amazing. The free tours offered are very informative and the library breathtaking! And make sure you go up the Peace Tower for the 360 degree view of Ottawa - also breathtaking! And you don't want to miss the light show in the...

The architecture of the Parliament Hill and buildings is stunning. There are ongoing renovations, but you can still enjoy the area and appreciate the history of Canada's Capitol. On the August day of our arrival, 3,000 Canucks joined together to have a yoga session....very cool!

Visually appealing,a must see in Ottawa. Tickets for tour available for same day visit, office opens at 9am, across from actual buildings. This visit we didn't do tour but enjoyed the nightly light show from 9:30pm. The kids enjoyed.

Get your ticket (free) across the street from Parliament Hill, same day only. Opens at 9:00am, get there around 8:30 if you want early tour. We were told they run out of tickets around 11:00am, so plan ahead.You go through airport like security before actually get into the building, but nothing too bad. I remember going as a kid,...

We went here to tour the buildings with some friends from Ottawa!! The tour being free, they give an excellent insight into the Canadian political system and the history of our country. I learned plenty on the trip!! It's free, do the tour!

Did a tour of the main center Parliament building. The tour guide was well spoken, and well informed with many interesting facts about various rooms and specific pieces of art. Interactive in that he asked and answered questions. Many beautiful, magnificent, and interesting things to see in this tour.The view from the Peace Tower was amazing, and a great way...
Even though it is undergoing extensive renovation, the buildings on Parliament Hill are well worth a visit. The architecture is stunning. We especially enjoyed the tour of Memorial Chapel.

The light show was amazing. The tour was very interesting and was free. They start giving out tickets at 9 am across the street. We arrived at 8:45 and there was quite a long line already but we still got tickets for 10:15. The inside of center block is unbelievable, so beautiful. The library is too incredible for words. A...

First time visitor to the nations capital, and was not disappointed at all! The buildings are spectacular and the history is engaging. The light and sound show in the evening on the parliment building was outstanding.

The free tour of the Parliament Buildings was great. Very interesting. The Light Show was absolutely amazing. Loved it. It told the history of Canada in pictures projected on the buildings. Again free, sit on the grass or take a chair. A must do.
A great part of Canadian history. The light show at night was wonderful as well. Well done, and very enlightening.

A "must see" when in Ottawa. It is spectacular.If you see young persons in blue uniforms - they are there to assist and very helpful. We were approached while trying to get a family photo. The young lady (Heather) attended to us and took the photo. She also provided helpful information about the area and "changing of the guards". A...

Every Canadian should take the opportunity to see part of Canadian history. Buildings are beautiful and the tours are free. Where else will you get free tours? Only disadvantage you need to come early to get tickets but otherwise its great.

Highly recommend the parliament tour. It provides alot of information. It is a beautiful building. You need to get tickets beforehand in a building across the parliament. We went at 11 am and only 3 pm tickets were available.

I agree with others who say that the Parliament tour and light show are well worth the trip. We also saw the changing of the guard in the morning which was also good. You are not allowed to bring backpacks into the building but they do provide a check in service in the info building across the street.
Didn't take the tour but the evening half hour light show was not to be missed, taking you through Canadian history
Ottawa's Parliament Hill is beautiful and seeing the Changing of the Guard was such a treat! At the visitor Entrance at the base of the hill there are even free tours available!

We enjoyed a nice walk around the Parliament buildings. If you want to take a tour definitely plan ahead - tickets are free but were gone by 1pm. Great to see the buildings and walk along the canal. Be sure to walk down to the War Memorial to see the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier.

Ottawa parliament building and memorial. Beautiful buildings in a courtyard setting, with the perpetual flame burning in the centre. RCMP staff were very approachable and friendly, with a particular mention needed for Officer Herb Waye, whom made our kids day and was very knowledgeable and patient. A must see.
In my opinion this nation's legislature is more impressive than that of the US and the UK. It inspires confidence and respect. The evening light and projection show is awesome.

Interesting and worth doing once. Go to the tourist center across the street for tickets for the tour. If you want tickets in the summer, go and line up early. The line up starts at about 8am for the 9am opening!

Free tours but you have to get tickets from the office across the street from Parliament Hill. Summer is the busy season so you need to plan ahead. The ticket office opens at 9AM and you can only get tickets for the same day. Line up early if you want the best selection of tour times. We lined up at...
Saw the light show. Very creative well done.A romantic setting. Relaxing. Show was 9.30. Free. Parliament hill lawn. Got very very busy so get there early.
A lovely experience to lounge on the lawn, watching a very impressive and wonderfully patriotic light show on Parliament Hill. A nice mini history lesson for the kids too! Well done!

We were two grandparents with a 19 year old granddaughter who visited the East Block and then the Centre Block. The information gathered from our two guides was invaluable for learning or relearning about the foundation of our Nation.Once one comes down from the Peace Tower one has the opportunity to visit the Memorial Book Room (I may have...

From the changing of the guard, light shows and fireworks to a simple evening stroll this is a great location. You can even download an app with a tour guide or the printed tour guides are really well written and informative.

Made it a point to view the morning Changing of the Guard Ceremony. Not to be missed! We took a free tour of the Centre Block of Parliament. Our guide was very knowledgeable and personable. In the evening, there's a Northern Lights show. We brought a blanket and sat on the grass. It was a sound and light journey through...

this place is the best at 9:30 there is a laser show every night! if its rains it still will be on! There are going to be tents! This place is for little kids! every moring there is a tourism for kids and family! u have to pay$ 3.00 for person to go to see the tourism!
You will need guided tours in order to get in the buildings. And it's worth it. Try to line up at 90 Wellington as early as 9am. We got morning tours for both centre and east blocks.

We spent a couple of hours in Parliament Square enjoying the architectural details of the building's construction - see how many faces you can find hidden in the carvings - and watched the changing of the guard. The pipe and drum corp was excellent and the hour long ceremony provided enough military splendor to keep our attention to the end.

We joined the light- and sound show, which is held in July and August in front of theparliament building. It starts at 9:30 p.m. In French and English the history of Canada is explained and illuminated to parliament building. It is a high professional and amazing show.Every day at 10:00 a.m. you can visit the change of the...
Even with all the trouble we may have and all the issues we may face, it always feels good to visit our capital and be reminded that we live in a great country.

Highly recommend this free tour of the parliament building. Particular highlight was the library. Not suitable for young children who were impatient and not amused by the tour, but interesting for adults.
Wonderful tour ! Our tour guide was very knowledgeable . It was amazing to step inside the parliament building to learn about our heritage.

If I remove the abundant patriotism and good feeling that accrues from attending this interesting and thankfully free event, there are several things that really need to be improved.First, the arbitrary and unexpected pushing back of the event 15 minutes due to the fireworks display behind the parliament buildings when we were there last night. True, we probably saw...
Not worth the parking hassle. Was super busy. Nothing really to see. I suppose if you are really into our government, it would be fun. Didn't really enjoy.
This historical building impressive,the tours amazing well organized excellent,Sound and light show well done,strongly recomend this stop who visiting Ottawa.

Had a great time visiting Parliament Hill. Wonderful guided tour through this beautiful building. Had a chance to see the House of Commons, but the Senate was called in session for a vote while we were there so we were unable to see that chamber. The best part of the tour is the library. Nothing short of magnificent.

Get your free tickets early in the day in Tourist Information Office which is located other side of road from the Parliament (moved there recently?) we took them a bit after noon and there were only a few for the French speaking tours of Parliament. Not that long (one hour all "included"), but very interesting to see the buildings and...

We especially loved the East tour that is offered in the summer that presented a lot more history than the central tour. The tour guide shows you the actual privy council room, PM MacDonald's room. The tour guide was excellent. The tours are free, but only available on the same day. We went at 3:00 on a Tuesday, but they...

You can't argue with free, and don't let the lineup for tickets (at the visitor centre on Wellington across the street from the Parliament buildings) put you off. It moves pretty quickly. You pick a time for your tour that day (from what's available) and show up at the appointed time outside Parliament. The almost hour-long tour covered the House,...
nice but a wee bit of construction so not so nice pictures.everything within walking distance and close to hotels

The tour tickets gave you the exact time for each tour which were excellent and allowed you to plan our day. The guides were most friendly and knowledgeable, able to answer all questions.The Sound and Light show was a great way to learn Canada's history. Very well done and well worth seeing!I would most highly recommend this stop...
Although part of the building is under renovation, it is stil so impressive. Comparing it with Washington DC, where we come from, DC is too crowded for so little.
Impressive, of course. Elegant tourist stop. However, the light show at night is not impressive at all - uses the parliament building as the backdrop. Fireworks is amazing though.

The light show was exceptional on the Parliament Building itself. Then in the morning the changing of the guard was actually better than that at Windsor Castle. These are both very beautiful and very educational as well. Ottawa was the best of all the cities we visited along the Windsor-Quebec rail line using the VIA 21 day rail pass.
The library was impressive and the guide was knowledgeable. The staff were pleasant and helpful. The Senate was red, the Commons green, the neatest place that we have seen.
Well worth visiting, learnt so much about the Canadian Parliament and the building itself. There is a cat sanctuary behind the Parliament building which is also worth a visit.

Light show was amazing! Starts at 930 and is really worth the wait. How proud to sit on the grass on a hot summer night enjoying the stars and the beautiful breeze, watching families enjoy their children running in pjs before the show. Wow and singing O'Canada to finish the night. yes I did cry! I am Canadian
Why not explore the Parliament building-insightful tours, light tour, souvenir shop, and great customer service.
The Northern Lights display is very good. The only problem - the sound was a bit hard to hear from where we were sitting.

There aren't that many places in North America that look or feel like the Parliament buildings in Ottawa so it is worth checking out. It's probably the highlight in Ottawa and probably the main reason for visiting the city. You can walk around freely in the area, unlike many capital buildings on this planet, and everything is free. Check to...

Fantastic tours of the Parliament Buildings are available by obtaining a free tour ticket across the road in the tourist office. I was glad to visit on a Saturday when the buildings are closed for business and access to the beautiful library and the Peace Tower are included in the tour. I would rate this as the #1 tour in...
Saw the Northern Lights show. Amazing! Walked the grounds a little but didn't have time to go in this time.
Beautiful historical buildings. A lot of Canada's history there. Free tours. You have to get tickets across of street in visitor center.

We really enjoyed our experience at Parliament. The Changing of the guard is excellent to see. I've seen the changing of the guard at Buckingham, it is very much similar however in Ottawa there is a lot more room for spectators to see the whole show.For the tours you need to get there early as they are free and...

Was disappointed we didn't have time to (go early, our guide told us) sign up for the 'free' tour inside Parliament and its impressive library but it is an imposingly beautiful series of buildings in the heart of Ottawa w/ nice grounds from which one can watch the changing of the guard. They do a most impressive (free) light show...

Parliament Hill was inspiring , from the light show projected against Center Block nightly in the good weather ( check the website if you think it may be cancelled due to weather ) , to the tours of the building itself . Remember that you now must book a tour time , since the shooting episode in October 2014 ,...

Great part of Ottawa to walk around. From here you can get views of the city and across the river. You must visit the cats, weird as it sounds but yes the cats, with a few Squirrels mixed in. The whole area is well worth a visit.
A must see during visit to Ottawa. This parlament building is trully amazing.and a real architectual gem.
Walking distance from hotel. They had a great laser light show at night about Canadian History. It was very interesting and entertaining. Must see.

The tour was very informative (and free!). Seeing where laws are passed was very interesting. Wish we would have visited in the Fall as the grounds would have been absolutely beautiful and Parliament doesn't sit in the summer! However, during the summer months there is a sound and light show every night which is absolutely spectacular and truly makes you...

It took a friend visiting from another country to get me here, but it was definitely a worthwhile place to visit. The guided tours are well done, and ready for even the barely related questions. The architecture is definitely worth examining, particularly for the stunning library - if only the old books could tell tales!! As a Canadian who is...

The buildings are beautiful! There are free tours of the buildings, but you have to be at the ticket office early! There was already a long line before the ticket office opened. The grounds are nice to explore too. The changing of the guards is in front of the buildings.
If you want to tour Parliament Hill be prepared to get free tickets early in the day or they'll be gone.
This stunning place just feels so Canadian. Beautiful grounds and a stunning building. Be sure to go inside and take some time to enjoy the grounds.
A must see if you visit Ottawa. Tickets are available across the street and you need to get them early as they sell out.

Overall great, brief, concise tour. Our tour guide was friendly and informative. It's worth waiting early in line to get tickets (be there no later than 8:30) for a Saturday tour. We were not permitted to go inside the House of Commons which was too bad but we could see it through windows. It's worth going up to the Peace...
It's like a cartoon when you look at these buildings in Ottawa. I couldn't stop from taking pics of the parliament Hill buildings there.
The northern lights on the hill are very well done. It gives a nice quick review of Canadian history. Bring a chair
My kids are 5, 10 and 13 and we all enjoyed this tour. You do need to get there early to get tickets, we got there at 9:15 and the line was long.
Great spot to walk around and the architecture is pretty grand. There is many memorials and statues everywhere and lots of photo ops.

So I have not been on a tour of the Parliament buildings since I was a kid. We had some family come in from out of town and we thought this would be a good option. We arrived in the morning and lined up to get tickets (they are free and you get them in the building right across the...
Great for family's. Historic buildings, Laser show every evening, changing of the Guards and fireworks in evening. Free tours of buildings done daily. Over all wonderful experience for everyone.

It was an amazing night at the hill. Watching the lights and the Canadian history through beautiful art projection. We watched the fire works before that and was amazing. Packed with people and full of joy. This place us blessed for its nature and historical value. The parliament hill is wonderful. You feel the luxury and power and beauty st...

There is no point visiting Ottawa for the first time and miss Parliament. The buildings are 'secure' but clearing that bit of a hassle is worth it to see firsthand how Canada's democracy works. Visit the House of Commons, Senate and Library of Parliament; Canada's Hall & Book of Honour; check the pageantry and tradition of the Changing of the...

The Light Show is offered every summer. We sat on the parliament hill lawn in front of the parliament building. There was a 30 minute fireworks display before the Northern Lights Show began at 9:45pm. The show was 30 minutes long and transversed the history of Canada. The show itself is amazing and jaw dropping. It is awesome how the...

The Canadian gov't uses their Parliament Building as a massive screen to show an amazing and technically sophisticated light show which highlights the history of Canada. One of the most interesting things I've ever seen. My teens loved it too! If you do one thing in Canada, this should be it.

Decided to go watch the light show that was advertised on sandwich boards near the parliament buildings. We were pleasantly surprised to get a whole fireworks show as well as the incredible light show! Great event for free.

You can't visit Ottawa without going to Parliament Hill. Ottawa is the capital, these are the capital buildings. You can view the buildings from the main lawn and see the fire fountain. You can also go around the main parliament building. If you walk behind the parliament, you will get a nice view of the river and the Quebec side...
Excellent opportunity to see how and where government operates.Tour guide was good but could have been more knowledgable about the building
Take time to walk the grounds and admire our Parliament Buildings.Also make sure to attend the evening light show at 10:00, runs for about 30 minutes, very, very well done!!

The best time to visit is July 1 , along with 300,00 of your closest friends. A red and white party that is unmatched. The excitement of the day on Parliament Hill and the surrounding area is bone chilling!! But come a few days early and take the tour of the Parliament buildings - see the chambers , climb the...

This was my second time to Parliament Hill. I was fortunate to walk around the front of Parliament Hill during the evening. The eternal flame is quite a sight. There is something to say about each of Canada's great Provinces. The lights are also very beautiful. It is a must to see.
Always proud to visit our nation's capital and the house of commons and associated buildings.Even with heightened security, the area is still rather accessible/open to the public!
Nice tour. If you want to see international government offices this is the place. Very beautiful on the outside and in the middle of everything in Ottawa

I'm a little bias this being my hometown, but to this day I still love seeing it from a tourist point-of-view. So much history. Check out See Our City tours and Haunted Walk of Ottawa to hear both the historic and haunted histories of the city.

The Parliament in Ottawa is in my opinion the most beautiful building in all of Ottawa ! The architecture the history and the location are all breath taking. I recommend this for everyone as they have something to offer for everyone and its Free !!! There are tours in the house of commons and in the senate with great guides...

Great to see what we see on TV in person. Good to go on the free tours to get a sense of the history and what goes on in the parliament. You get the tour times and tickets across the street from the parliament buildings. Must go for the change of guard in the am (it lasts a good 30...

One of our highlights for a two day trip to Ottawa. Get in line for your free tickets early...like 8:30 AM. The Library is exceptional. Fund it interesting that the entire House of Commons has to be elected each time the Parliament closes its session. Quite different that the old USA.

Mark was our friendly and knowledgeable guide and the kids and adults alike enjoyed the tour of the Parliament. Being immersed in Canadian History was a great experience for the children! They liked all the stories, fossils, and I especially loved seeing the library. Don't miss the light show at night.

Been there to visit the buildings, historical rooms, landmark and clock/towers and wall fixtures with my family - great experience and everyone need to do it once at least, please ask questions to your guide, it makes your visit even better!

We enjoyed our tour of the Parliament Hill & Buildings. We did an inside tour of the main center building. Our tour guide, Phed, was outstanding (pleasant, informative & enthusiastic). We were allowed to take pictures (except of the Security personnel).Would definitely recommend,. Right after our tour, the Changing of the Guard ceremony took place on the lawn. The...

This is always a very busy place. In fact so busy while I was there that all of the tours booked very quickly in the morning. Do stay to watch the changing of the guards, it take 45 minutes, but it is worth it.

The tour of Parliament buildings less than satisfying because we could not enter some places, like the public gallery or indeed the House of Commons.major presence of security and RCMP staff......all visitors need to go through an airline type security procedure..scanners etc.However given recent events, it is understandable.
It is a wonderful place to visit at the nation's capital city. It is definetely a must-see, and it is a place where (with a guided tour) you can learn about Canadian history.
We watched the light display on the buildings at night. It was definitely a highlight of our vacation.
Historic. We took the guided tour through the building. It was very interesting and worth it. Beautiful architecture.
You need to go to the top of the tower, for sure - amazing view, incredible library, great history, a must go place if you are in Ottawa - besides, it is Free!!!!
Worth a visit. Get tickets for tours early. Many who arrived thinking they could get tickets on the spot were disappointed.

We watch the light show for a bit while we walked the strip. I have to say history on buildings in a light show amazing for you and night time love to see and cherish. Digital fireworks is good for a kiss of the moment. Ok this is my real point if you like warm feelings when you with anyone...

The Parliament Buildings are very striking in appearance. The only negative thing would be that for added security now you must line up to obtain tickets early in day for that day. We came twice and the line up was so long. We had two young boys aged 11 and 6 and were not prepared to stand in line. Next...

We had no idea what to expect from the Northern Lights light show and WOW! what an amazing tribute to our country's history and heritage. What really capped off the expereince was when Oh Canada played at the end and people started standing. Truly magical! Proud to be CANADIAN!
The history of the Hill is amazing, and that we can still go into the Library is great. Get there early as they fill up quickly. The portraits themselves are worth the tour!!

Spent most of one day hanging around the hill. The changing of the guard just before eleven was moving but even more so was the light show at nine thirty pm ending with everyone singing Oh Canada. It was indeed very moving and I highly recommend it.
Very nice place to stroll. Changing guards was something to enjoy. The bilingual explanations were very nice. Free tour was well done and the observatory was worth to visit.
Great tour and it's freeWould have liked to be able to see more especially the peace towerSaw House of Commons, library and senate chamber
We went there in the winter so the change of guards didn't happen. Still, it was interesting to take a peek inside the Canadian government and our tour guide was very knowledgeable and interesting.

We didn't wait in line to get tickets to visit the inside of Parliament. A walk around the grounds was pleasant. Don't miss the changing of the guard in the morning and the history light show at night. Very well done.

I live in Ottawa but had never gone to see the light show at Parliament Hill. I'd go see it again, though. At this time of year the show starts at 9:30pm and runs for 30 minutes. I believe it moves to 9pm in September. The show is displayed on the front face of the centre block. Though concept may...

Full disclosure: I am literally a "flag-waving" Canadian with an unbridled love for our country, I am also a politics geek! That said,...you MUST make time to take a guided tour of our House of Parliament. The history, information, humour, and pride that you get from a guided tour is priceless. In addition to taking the official tour, make sure...

Although current building works limit what you would otherwise normally be able to see, don't be put off by the recent terrorist attack here. Security has obviously been stepped up but not intrusively. We were amazed to see hundreds of people turning up for a yoga session on the lawn in front of Parliament (apparently held every day at midday...

We took both the tour of the main building and east building. The tour guides were friendly (Olivier & Julia) and informative. We enjoyed seeing the 'mini' house of parliament & going up the peace tower. There were great views from the top. We queued at 8.30am to ensure we got morning tickets.

I'd rather go to Cuba was my thought before deciding to go to Ottawa on vacation. I was wrong again. The Parliament Hill and the buildings, and thier splendor blew me away. There is something magical about Canada, something very special about being Canadian and the awesomeness of this great land is centered on Parliament Hill. I would encourage every...
Arrive half hour early for changing of guard and light show. Light show was excellent, made my husband tear!! Proud to be Canadian!!!
Enjoyed the history aspect of this. The memorials to the queen and the women's rights activists were enlightening. Also, get a tour, I would've like some more history.

Hopefully, the buildings renovation will be completed soon as it seems to go on for years now. This year, a full circle around the premises is impossible due to the scaffolding and construction site fences. The former Cat-house on the Hill is nowhere to be found and part of the place's glamour is covered in dust.However: I cannot fathom...

Located right on the water, and right next to the downtown, it is in a great location and has great views. All of the government and historic buildings are close by, for the most part, so you can just walk around and explore and see a lot of things in a short amount of time.
We spent a day and night in Ottawa downtown and toured the parliament building grounds. They are lovely and full of history. The statues and monuments are breathtaking
the laser light show at 9:30 pm every night is very good. last for about 30 min. A lot of people too. Go earlier.

Great place to visit. This was my first time here and my wife's 3rd. Very informative and beautiful place to visit. The clock and bell tower is a must see. They don't tell you that it's at the end of your tour but DON'T miss it. A beautiful view of Ottawa and surrounding area. Make sure you and get in...

The Parliament is very impressive. We saw the changing of the guard there in the morning. At 9:30 at night we sat on the lawn and watched the projected show about the history of Canada...projected on the building, On the grounds is also the eternal flame. We also got free tickets and toured the Parliament building.
Had a wonderful stroll around the grounds and enjoyed the the tour. Long wait to go up to the peace tower though.

Tour round parliament is free. Ticket office opens on the opposite side of the road at 9am. We went on a long weekend it was really busy. We queued from 8:30 and got our tickets at 9:30. They said it was not nearly as busy normally.It's a good tour and well worth the queue. Centre block has the houses...
Went to Paliment Hill and saw the Christmas light show. Amazing! Loved every second. The trees around the hill were all decorated & the projection on the peace tower was magical.

this free of attraction is a must if you are in central Ottawa . well worth a walk round the views over the river from the back of parliament hill are breath taking . there was a cats hotel also at the back which was being rebuilt when I was there . a home for strays funded by the people...

we didn't visit the inside of these buildings, but were there for the northern lights show they have every night on the main part of the parliament building and the nice thing is, it's free. If you don't know much about the history of Canada, don't miss this show. It's very nice and your kids would love it too, if...
The Parliament Hill and Buildings is beautiful at day time. But the Light Show at night on the Parliament Building is just Amazing. Unforgettable in my life.
So much heritage in one building. A perfect tourist attraction. I brought my friend there that was visiting Ottawa. Was enough to keep him busy for a few hours.
The place is so beautiful, the archicteture of the building is superb, reminds you of Europe. The place is so lean and feel safe to roam around the vecinity evenlate n the evening.
I only saw the outside of the Parliment building. It's free but you need a ticket. The lines are long. I did very much enjoy the changing of the guard ceremony and the night laser and light show.

There are free guided tours of Parliament Hill with specific time for different languages. Be prepared to go through airport style security at the entrance. After the guided tour we are free to go around the building on our own. It has the most beautifully designed library I've seen. This is only place where photography is not permitted to respect...
Nice place to visit, good tour inside the building, a lot of restaurant with delicious meals and for hang outs too
We went to visit with a Family member who hasn't been here before and to have the light show and History was great to see her so happy that she got to experience this part of the Parliament Buildings

Parliament Hill offers tours of Center Block (Parliament Bldg.) and West Block. You can watch the changing of the guard, too. All free. It is great for people interested in history, politics and/or architecture; there is something of interest for everyone. The Parliament Bldg. is beautiful with its gothic style interior. The Library is heaven on earth, especially for bibliophiles....

The Parliament Buildings are a must-see when visiting Ottawa. The architecture is amazing, the stone work is fascinating. Make sure to take the tour and visit the library which is an absolutely beautifully carved wood room, which took 35 years to do.

This was the highlight of our trip. Tickets for free guided tour are across the street. Building opens at 9 am. By 8:30, the line was long. Try to get your tour after 10:30 so you do not miss the changing of the guards at 10 am in front lawn of the Paliament building.The guided tour was very informative...

My daughter visited Parliament Hill during the day and were truly impressed by the well-kept grounds. If you really want yo be wowed, grab a blanket and take yourself to watch the Northern Lights show at 10pm on the lawn. It is amazingly breathtaking and worthwhile. It is completely free to watch the show...

Nice gothic style buildings. Been many times. Currently a lot of the grounds are under repair, and the buildings are too. Once it's done I'm sure it'll be worth it. The tour is good, and the inside of centre block is defiantly worth a look.
Very informative tour very similar to UK Parliament with two houses. Visit to top of peace tower available. Everyone very helpful.

Visited this area many times, but it never disappoints, The light show on the parliament buildings is a must see. If you don't feel patriotic after that then you don't have a pulse!! Take the time and do "the tour" of the interior. Its free and you learn a lot!! Plus the building is beautiful especially the library!!

Changing of the guard was very nice. This ceremony was well worth the IT. The marching band coming down the streets of Ottawa was emotional and wonderful to experience with my family. Viewing the inside was not possible as the tours were fully booked by 10 am - you could stand in line at 8:30 and wait for about one...

Parliament Hill and Buildings tour was a great Experience. We spend half a day there. We had couple of teen age and children with us and we all enjoyed a lot. Lots of spots for pictures outside parliament buildings. The building itself was under renovation but inside tours were available. You must first get the tickets from a separate building...

Being from the U.S., we weren't as familiar with what each building was used for, however the architecture was very picturesque and is obviously worth a stop for any visitor to Canada's national capital.Be sure to get there early to get the free guided tour tickets. We were there over 3 hours before the last available tour and they...

Guided Parliament Hill building tour offered, must pass the security check. My guide was very nice and friendly and he explained each place and answered questions kindly :) Impressed by the library with very old and expensive, valuable books! it takes about 20~30 mins, and at the end you can go up to top of the building, can enjoy the...
Very nice handled tours of these buildings. You can take tours for free, just come early in the morning for your ticket to the visitor centre. You will see and hear a lot about canadian history.
Super for history and those who delight in architecture!Get your tickets for a self-guided free tour

Walked around Parliament Hill outside. All the tickets were gone so we couldn't get in. We will try tomorrow. You have to early to get free tickets for the tour. There is a light show at night which we also missed. Very crowded tonight.

I make it a point to always visit this site whenever I'm in town.I would also suggest a walk behind Parliament Hill itself, along the Ottawa River leading up to the rideau canal where you'll get a Disneyesque view of Laurier Chateau. Stunning.Great exercise. Great walk.

Make sure you stop by the tourist information building on Wellington Street to get your tickets for the free Parliament tour. If you go early in the day you'll have your choice of times, as the tours seem to book up quickly. Tickets are only available for booking by the day.

Impressive area to look around and with excellent views over the river. We had timed it right for the changing of the guard with full band fanfare and the change done on large lawned area to the front of the buildings

We arrived downtown early for the Changing of the Guard, found our "spot" (up top of the centre stairs and on left side looking down) and I went to get tour tickets for the Centre Block tour. We managed to see the spectacular show (changing of the guard), walked along the paths behind the Supreme Court building, Parliament, and to...

Building of Parliament is though doesn't match one in London still beautiful inside and outside. Also during the tour you can find out a lot of interesting facts about Canada and it's political system. At the end of the tour they allow to visit Time Tower, and you can enjoy a wonderful view of the city.You can get a...

First of all the architecture is beautiful. There was a lot of symbolism in the construction, ranging from busts of important legislators and prime ministers built into the columns of one of the foyers to the provincial seals on display in various legislative rooms. The tour was very thorough in explaining the history of the building and the legislative process...

We enjoyed the tour. Our tour guide Andrew was very informative and relayed a lot of fun facts. If you want tickets to the free tour it is first come first serve across the street. Tickets are handed out at 9am every morning. You have to be there at least by 830am to line up.

Ottawa seems much older than DC is. Their buildings are large, stone, with cupolas and wonderful windows. The grounds are totally open to all, but if you want to tour any of the Parliament buildings you must make a reservation. When I was there (July 15), they had part of the buildings covered, since they were sandblasting to clean the...

Don't miss the Light and Sound show at night. The architecture of the building is very nice. You will go through security. Free tickets to go there. But, tickets are first come first serve basis. Be there at 9 a.m to get the tickets. You will get the tickets right across the street from the Parliament Building. Free parking on...

This tour was more fun than I anticipated! Our tour guide was very funny & very knowledgeable about the architecture of the building.
