On this tour, which lasted about 50 mins, we saw the House of Commons, the Library of Parliament & the Senate. Seeing these rooms was like being in a movie! After the tour you have the freedom...

Take the tour - it's free! Head up to the top of the bell tower and explore the city. Take in the grounds, tour the exterior, take in the stunning vistas of the Ottawa River, the locks, and the bridges. If you're here in summer, the Sound and Light show is a must see. Every night, unless it rains, at...

The Parliament is a great building to see......but it is always under construction. I was here four years ago and it was under construction.Tours are okay. The light show at night changes yearly and is a nice added touch to see.
Great experience, I've seen Parliament Hill on T.V. so many times but seeing it up close in person you see how big and beautiful it looks, it is very well kept and enjoyed our time in Ottawa.

We waited in line for 45 minutes to pick up our free tickets - be sure to arrive earlier for a shorter line. We toured the main Parliament building and the beauty inside is not to be missed! Our tour guide was excellent - Francoise - and he had many facts to tell us about the building and the Canadian...
What a beautiful city , clean and well maintained.Parliament buildings and the surrounding were so majestic with an architecture to die for

Tours or Parliament Hill are free and are offered in both French and English. I recommend getting your tickets early in the day, by 10am, since there is limited availability on every tour and the tours tend to fill up by early afternoon. You go to the capital information building across the street from Parliament Hill and get tickets for...
The free Parliament tour was informative and beautiful. After getting through security, the tour guide shows you all the important rooms. Educational for the children.

I visited the east and centre block of the parliament just a few days ago. We started with the east block as was suggested to us by the ticket counter. I was a bit disappointed with the lack of rooms to see. We focused on three people (three rooms) and I was left underwhelmed. Maybe it was because of the...
My wife and I did the center block tour and enjoyed every minute of it. WE also did the peace tower and had a great time.
Beautiful scenery, building, surrounding and nice weather too but now very crowded.I like to be there :)

First, too many fires !!Second, go now as H of Commons will close for renovation.Third, accept the security precautions, that's today.Free tour tickets across the street (corner of Wellington & Metcalfe); line isn't bad but go before 11am. Know what tour time you want; so plan your day.Just walking thru halls & rooms is enough for...

This is a must see in Ottawa. There was a light show when we went that lit up the Peace Tower. It was quite amazing to watch! If you want to go into Parliament it is free but be advised that there may be a long line for tickets. During our tour of Parliament, Ronnie provided great details and information...
Get your tickets over the road early in the day!! Had a great tour with a very knowledgeable guide called sophie who told us about the history of parliament. The library was fabulous !!

We were staying right by Parliament and wanted some pictures so we visited several times. Its a nice place to come walk, people watch, and see a show or two. While we were checking out Parliament we saw a changing of the guards and a night time light show. Both were interesting and cool.
Visited the Hill last night to take in the sound and light presentation along with many hundreds of tourists. It was a very clever and impressive show.

This is a must stop when visiting Ottawa. My kids loved it. We went by at night and there was a show on the side of the building which may have been called Mosaic. Fabulous!Great place to see old building or just people watch!

This free tour is amazing. You get a knowledgeable tour guide who takes you into the Parliament to see both chambers of the legislature and the library! Make sure to check out the woodwork the library.

This is a 'must see' if you are visiting Ottawa. You can easily combine it with the Changing of the Guard in the summer months. You want to get to the Parliament Tours ticket office early enough (8:15-8:30 am) to get your choice of tour times. You get to see the all of the highlights; guides are well-informed and views...
Saw the Changing of the Guard. Spectacular on a perfect day - it gave me goosebumps! A large crowd but no bad views. Be sure you are there by 9:45

We live in Ottawa so I thought it was time we did the touristy thing in our own town. I took the kids. They loved seeing the bells and checking out the tower. The view is amazing. If you lean out the window area and look up you can see the clock face. So cool!Tip: Go early in the...
Fairly interesting, tight security, beautiful designs within the buildings. The library was absolutely amazing.

These buildings can be seen from most places in the city of Ottawa and are mesmerising. There's so much to see here - tour, changing of the guards and the light show. We kept going back to look at it again and again. Shame there is scaffolding on some of the buildings - this is in preparation for the birthday...

Not so god for kids but the guide was excellent and the kids put up with it. Tie in with the Peace tower if you can so you only go through security once. Allow an hour for the Peace tower on busy days, once inside.

If you want to have a free tour of Parliament get to the information office early to beat the queues and get a good time slot. Then you can watch the changing of the guard before embarking on the tour, which is informative and well planned even if you cannot get into the chamber itself.Look out for the evening...

This is an interesting view of Candian government - especially if you're from the States and know little about Candian history. I was fascinated that they share the English and French heritage equally. The view from the top of the clock tower was worth the trip alone.

We started our honeymoon in Ottawa and were heading to Cape Breton on a 2 week road trip. The lazer show gave us tingles. Singing O'Canada will people from across the country was amazing. A great way to start or end any night as a proud Canadian!

While the tour is free, pick up the tickets across the street early in the morning as they fill up fast. We were able to catch the Changing of the Guard (they say 10:00, but 9:30 is a better arrival time). It was sooo interesting. The tour of the Centre Block and Library was just beautiful and awe inspiring. Maybe...
A must see for all travelers to Ottawa! Nothing like singing "Oh Canada" on the doorstep of Parliament Hill.
We walked the surroundings, very nice places although now there are refurbishing the facade of the main building and you can't get a full view of the place.

A visit to Ottawa, even for a day or two, MUST INCLUDE A VISIT TO PARLIAMENT HILL.Though originally we were not in favour of stopping in Ottawa, n our return journey from Quebec to Toronto, our neighbours from Hyderabad,India, who have settled in Ottawa sealed the issue by saying we they would never visit us when in Hyderabad (their...

I have been to the Parliament buildings a few times over the years and they are magnificent to see. I don't know if they still do tours after the shooting there this year or not. We were there to check out the free light show. The weather was warm so we brought our portable chairs and sat back and watched....

If you visit Ottawa, you have to take in Parliament Hill. Very nice site. Free tour, just get you ticket early in the morning as there is affixed # of tickets handed out for timed tours through the day. Take the trip to the peace tower, nice view. Light show after dark also a great show.

The visit is free you just have to collect a ticket at the modern building accross the Avenue. You are given tickets for a schedule visit so that you don't have to wait in line.All is well organized, there are groups for French speaking and others for English speaking. After clearing the security check you are given a visit...

The Parliament Buildings themselves are beautiful - we did not do a guided tour on this particular trip, but in the past they have been very interesting. We took in the light show at night - titled The Northern Lights - and it was stunning. On this evening, they began at 10PM - lasted for about 30 minutes. Be sure...

Every night through the summer there is a fantastic light show. We went July 23. Shows start at 10pm. There is plenty of street parking a couple of blocks away. Bring camp chairs and blankets. The show is a half hour of well coordinated bilingual light show on the Parliament Hill buildings. Bonus is that the show is FREE!

We visited Parliament Hill twice during a three-day stay in Ottawa. First for the change of the guards in the morning then for the Northern Lights show in the evening.The change of the guards was interesting, but a little long. The light show, on the other hand, was simply amazing. The story of Canada is projected on the Parliament...

I have lived in Ottawa for 16 years and didn't even know it existed. I finally got dragged there by one of my bed and breakfast guests and WOW! It blew my mind. It starts promptly at 10pm. People stand, sit on the curb or bring chairs to sit on the lawn of parliament for this extravaganza. The story of...
Always great to visit our nation's legislative building. Was a little bit sad to think of the October occurrence. But proud to see the Canadian government continues forward. We are a great country.
Easy to reach in the city & to walk around. We didn't go into the Peace tower as there was a big tour visiting at the time. We enjoyed walking around & the openess of the building to the public.

Very informative : culture,politics and arts. The sculptures are very artistic and informative. The Big Ben is much beautiful than in London. The guards are friendly and do not mind to have picture taking with them.

Several people suggested I check the light show out. It is projected images and lights shown on the Parliament building. In July it starts at 10:00 in August 9:30. I learned some Canadian history that I should have already known (I think). Canadians do say "You know nothing!" I figured they were just Game of Thrones fans but I really...

Tours are free, but make sure you get to the ticket office early in the morning to book a time as they were booked for a while when we arrived at 10:30.Excellent tour of the grounds and also of the building. Thomas was our guide inside, and I was impressed with his knowledge and his patriotism. Everybody working on...
INCREDIBLE in every aspect. Make sure you take this event in! Engaging for all ages. Show was 30 minutes. Started on time. Bilingual. Excellent show and explanation of Canadian history.

If you are visiting Ottawa and are even somewhat interested in politics and history, you should make sure to take the tour of Parliament. I would recommend visiting the Centre Block. Tickets are free from the building at 90 Wellington Street, right across the street from Parliament. A time to take the tour can be request for a same-day visit...

This attraction is very worthwhile. I learned a lot about the Canadian government. (I am an American who lived in Washington, DC for twenty years). On the tour, you will see the two houses of Parliament and the Library.

We didn't tour the building due to lack of time but we were lucky enough to watch the changing of the guards which was great fun. First the bagpippers paraded into the ground, then the brass band followed. After this was the weapon inspection and handing over of the keys. It was great fun and a lovely day to watch...

There are two free tours available. I found the east building tour (older history) more interesting and learned a lot of knowledge. However, it took too long to have two tours so I would suggest just take one.
We saw the 2 chambers but the best room was the library. The wood carving is superb throughout as is the masonry.

This building is a a true national treasure for Canada. The only thing that seems odd is how small the chairs are for those poor house of commons folks. I think Canada should reduce it's number of government officials. This would provide more funds for public works projects.

My husband and I visited on a rainy Tuesday morning and took a tour of the Central Block. Tickets for a tour are free but first come first serve. We got in line half an hour before the ticket location (90 Wellington street) opened (at 9am) and there was already a sizable line. We got the first tour of the...

Make sure you arrive on parliament hill by 10 am to see the changing of the guards. This happens everyday in the summer.But to visit the interior of the building you need to go across the street to get an appointment card. On the weekend you are able to see more rooms . make sure you go up the...
We have all seen pictures on the news but you must see the Center block for yourself. I was in awe of the beautiful architecture, artwork and grandure of the place. A MUST SEE!!

To take the free tour you have to be like 8:20 in the other side of the street, if not, there is a long line to get tickets. But it totally worth it. The guide was very kind and I learned a lot about Canada there. The Peace Tower has a great view. I was lucky and a chorus of...

We arrived just in time for the changing of the guard. The place was packed so I would advise arriving early for this spectacle. Very reminiscent of the same thing in England, but with a slightly less formal feel to it.The building is fantastic with parts of it open to the public with tours available several times a day....

Our guide was really fantastic. Get tickets was very easy, everything worked on time, the guide explained each space visited and kindly answered all the questions. The building is beautiful, breathtaking.

This was our first trip together to see our Nation's Capitol. The Buildings and area are quite impressive, Be aware that you need to go across the street to get a " free" ticket for a guided tour of The Parliament Bldgs. Even if you to in the morning your tour time may not be until 2 or 3 in...
We went on the free tour of the Peace tower and parliament buildings. It was really interesting. The kids enjoyed it.
A must in Ottawa but you need to line up early at 90 Wellington street to make sure you get a free or paid tour during the busy season.
I have visit 3 times, twice i attended my Great Uncle Page turn in the Memorial Chambers. Very emotional. Guard and Guides very helpful with a great sense of humor. Would i go again for sure
and my daughter-in-law saw the Parliament grounds for the first time. My sister and I were babysitting, so the grown up young adults had a good time.
Beautiful buildings, wish we had taken time for the tours. We only had a few hours one day, so we just walked around them.

Very interesting! The free tour was easy to get tickets. Tour guide was informative and entertaining. WE were in DC last summer and this tour was much longer. We got to go in many parts of the building. Better tour than US capital.

we took the tour ... it was a little rushed as they are trying to get a large volume of people through everyday.... I would have liked to see the galleries, but that wasn't part of the tour... we did get to see the house of commons and the senate....I was disappointed that the library was closed as that was...

I watched the sound and light show which was really impressive. Gave a potted history of Canada and was really well done. Worth staying up for even if it was a bit chilly.The following day we signed up for a free tour of East block. If we'd had time, we would have done Centre block as well. I recommend...
Be there at about 9:45 pm. You will enjoy the thirty minute Northern Lights show in the summer. Try taking the tour at midday to avoid the summer heat outside.

This was one of the highlights of my Ottawa trip, and it's free too! Others have stated how wonderful this attraction so I won't repeat it. Here are some tips instead, to help you along this journey:1. The tours may not run on some days or time slots, so the best thing to do is to check the official...

I was pleasantly surprised to see the light show this evening. A bit of Canadian history told in a very interesting manner using lights. The Parliament Buildings have never looked better at night. It is a great place to visit with the family

We use the grounds of the Parliament as a pleasant detour to the walking trails along the Ottawa River. The buildings are always photographed on our walks. We chanced to see a sign advertising a free light show so we attended that evening. The light show projects images upon the whole facade of the building. In short, it is a...
If you are in Ottawa, you have to visit Parliament. Beautiful property, history everywhere you look.

The Parliament tour is excellent and free!! Especially interesting to US citizens to see the contrast between the US system (which rejected monarchy) and this Canadian commonwealth status. The roll of the British monarchy is very interesting. Great docents.

This is a good tour to go on when you are in Ottawa. It is free but you have to get the tickets the day of, at the tourist site across the street. Line up early in peak tourist season as the tickets go fast. It is more interesting if you are a Canadian but other nationalities may be interested...
Awesome light and sound show that lasted for 35 minutes that was projected onto the Parliament building at night. Canadians are proud of their history and it shows.

Go across the street and pick up a ticket for a free tour of the central block and library. Download the Capitol Hill app and tour the grounds while you wait for your tour; look for the ever friendly and knowledgeable docents happy to answer all your questions. Be amazed by the accessibility for the public to Canada's capital.
these buildings are difficult to access because of security concerns. They are ok to see from the street, but I would not bother going closer than that

We toured the Parliament buildings on June 30. There was quite a line up to get tickets after the changing of the guard. I'd advise people to form a line before the end of the ceremony, as the line was very long if you waited until it was completely over.Tickets were nearly gone by the time our turn came,...

Starts at 9:50AM or so you can hear the bag pipes coming down the street. I made the mistake of trying to get close to the entrance where they walk on the grass. After looking around while the show was going on, I feel the best viewpoint would be on the small street on the left (while facing the Parliament).

Visited Parliament Hill on our recent trip to Ottawa. We first stopped for a quick look around and then returned for the Northern lights show. We caught the first show of the season which runs every night until Sept. Very interesting laser light show using the Parliament buildings as the back drop. We then went for the free tour the...

Visit the Peace Tower and the Library. These magnificent buildings have informative tours that have to be booked at the Tourist office across the road from the Parliament. So get there early u 09:00 in time to get tickets and to see the Changing of the Guard at 10:00
This is by far the best place tobe on 1st of July. The Celebrations are stpendous. Lots of fun and good security.
another must see if you are in Ottawa. The tour guide was excellent and the building is just fantastic. It only takes about a half hour but it is very interesting...especially the library.

My wife and I visit Ottawa on July 1. It was great. there are many people to celebrate the Canada day.s thousands of Canadians dressed in red and white. The Canada Day festivities on the Hill run from morning to nightceremonial events, shows, activities, fireworks and much more! We were very happy and love the city.

Completely splendid show in the morning - raising our flag, changing of the guard, carillon bells, then mid afternoon s wonderful musical show with many Canadian singers and groups, skits, Prime Ministers speech (nice and short). The rain held off at just the right time - the fireworks were beautiful! Great end to a great day! We had s wonderful...

Across the street of the Parliamant building you can sign up for a free tour. A very friendly and eloquent young lady took us for a great tour in the building. After the guided tour you get the opportunity to visit the tower by yourself, which offers you great views of the city and the river.
This parliament building is located right in the middle of city center, a huge and beautiful building. If you drive, then try to find car park rounds. On Sunday, some malls provide a fre car parks

One nice thing about Canada, you can walk right up the the front door of our parliament buildings and take photos. Of course there is increased security because of the night jobs out there but we can still enjoy our freedoms.

Some great historical info, the library is the star attraction.....stunning. Great attraction for kids and adults. We toured the centre block and the east block, both were great and I would do this again. The summer night show on the lawn in front of Parliament was quite nice and is about 30mins which is perfect especially if you have small...
A must see even for those local folks!! I am a bit biased since I worked in those buildings many years ago
Parliament Hill and buildings are something visitors must see in Ottawa. The visitor center across the street of Parliament has ticket for free tours.

Parliament Hill is a stately building that a must to visit while you are in Ottawa. The Library is breathtaking and considered one of Canada's most beautiful rooms. The tours are free and quite informative. The tour guides try very hard to make sure this tribute to Canadian history and heritage is meaningful for everyone. The Peace Tower was an...
Nice place to visit. Interesting facts can be found along the grounds. The tour is amazing! Well worth the visit.

Pomp and ceremony were in no short supply during the changing of the gusrd. Worthwhile to see. As the crowds grew in anticipation of the 9:45 start, the band of information students dispersed and began to explain the history. If you are in Ottawa this morning tradition is worthwhile. Free to the piblic

The significance of the structures is key to the development of our society, whether or not your are politically minded. The buildings themselves are beautiful, particularly the details of the carvings. I am particularly fond of the Famous Five statuary.
living so close to D.C. it was very interesting to see another countries capital. There is a Lot of construction going on around the buildings but still very interesting to walk through the grounds

I think this is my favorite place in Ottawa. The architecture and grounds are simply beautiful. I could stare at them all day. The Parliament tours are interesting and very informative. The Northern Lights show is awesome - telling Canada's history through images projected across the face of the Parliament building.

To visit you will need to stop off at the ticket shop immediately in front of the Parliament building situated across the main road, try to get there early to avoid lengthy waiting. They will provide you with a time of entry for later that day with your chosen language. Please be aware that following the tragic events there, you...

We were travelling from Toronto to Montreal and we stopped at Ottawa to see these buildings. These were simply spectacular. Initially it was cloudy, but then sun came out and made the whole place even more grand. This is a must see if you are travelling to and from this city.

Summer evening Northern Lights show is great! We didn't get chance to go inside as we were only there on a Saturday and it filled up very fast. You need to get to the ticket office before it opens and we arrived about half 9. Beautiful buildings all around though, so lots to see.

A very interesting tour which is free to take. All you require are tickets available in the tourist centre opposite which allocate a time. Our favourite part of the tour was the Library. All I can say is wow. A capital tour of the Capital Building don't miss it.
We went for Canada day. It was an amazing attraction. Unfortunately we could not go inside because it was Canada day. On a normal day you can tour it. It still was amazing
There is a lot of construction and renovations going on here right now, but it is beautiful to see the architecture of the buildings. Beautiful area

You have to visit this place to complete the full picture of the Parliament Hill complex. All tours are free and well organized. The only thing I'd like to mention is that the elevators inside the Peace Tower and the windows in the observation deck are dirty! Considering the importance of the place - it could be MUCH cleaner. Be...
So exciting to visit Parliament Hill on Canada Day. The City was bustling with lots of food trucks and street performers. And the fireworks were amazing.

This is a must if your travel to Ottawa. Just walking up to the ground alone is beautiful. Just make sure you get your tickets for the tour early in the day and they are across the street. We made that mistake the first day, we walked all the way up to the Parliament and was told the tickets were...

this is a special treat for our US visitors. You don't need an appointment and can actually see the house in session. History of the halls provided in the tour. family orientated and educational for everyone.
Sign up for and take the free tour! Don't skip the clock tower...great view of the city. Walk around the grounds...nice view of the Ottawa River and Gatineau.

The Parliament building is made very interesting by the knowledgeable guides. The interior is similar to the UK Houses of Parliament and has a vast amount of interesting features. There are many steps to climb during the tour but it's all worthwhile. Tickets are available from the office in Wellington Street opposite the Parliament building. You can climb up Peace...
Canada Day in the capital on the Hill is awesome to do. You will like the festivities they hold there for Canada Day

Had read that it's best to go early to get admission and we did just that. Bags over a certain size have to be left in the same building as the ticket office but are kept securely and free for you. We had a great tour guide who was very informative and we really enjoyed looking around - lots of...

Did the walking tour inside of Parliament Hill...very cool. Went up into the Peace Tower. Beautiful view of Ottawa. A must do if you are visiting the capital city! Highly recommend. No admission fee too which is also great!
Beautiful buildings and wonderful surrounding monuments and grounds. Our parliament buildings do Canadians proud.
Loved visiting the buildings on the hill but found parts difficult to manoeuvre around being disabled.

Driving North from the Seaway Skyway Bridge, we drove along the Riddeau Canal as we entered Ottawa. It was a little too early for the famous tulips that grow along its banks but the parkway was pretty anyway. Eventually, we took a left turn at the Chateau Laurier and on our right was Parliament Hill. After finding parking we walked...
BEAUTIFUL! Very European. Nice view. Fun to walk around. There is Byward market around that is very nice to see.

We really only saw the outside. We picked up free tickets immediately across the street from Parliament but by the time of our tour it was raining so hard we chose not to participate. Our bad. We should have packed rain jackets. I'm disappointed we missed this.

We toured the Centre Block and it was great. Our tour guide Jordan was very enthusiastic and knowledgeable. As an American that has done both this tour and the Washington DC capital tour, the Parliament tour is the clear winner on both substance and access. In my opinion it's a must do when visiting Ottawa.

Go early to get pass to have a guided tour. The building and surrounding grounds are beautiful and well worth visiting. I would have liked to see more of the building but what I did see was interesting.

During our stay in Ottawa we walked to Parliament Hill. Beautiful views from behind the building, within walking distance to many shops and restaurants. We did not take any tours just walked around by ourselves. Mounties were very friendly; even teased our daughter for pushing her dad.

Just a SUPERB tour of the Parliament Buildings. Visiting from Calgary I have always wanted to go to the capital to see these structures, and I was happy I finally did. The architecture is absolutely STUNNING. The centre block was actually rebuilt due to a fire, but the round gothic structure in the back, that houses the library of parliament,...
You cant visit Ottawa without visiting the Parliament Buildings. The tour was fist class and very educational. The guide made time for lots of questions and ensured we had a most informative time.

If you have to choose between visiting the East Block or the Centre Block then choose the East Block. The East Block has the offices of the Prime Ministers and Governor Generals. The tour was brought to life by Dominic, our guide, with stories, political and personal, about some of the occupants of the building.Our tour of the Centre...

Unfortunately I arrived too late to visit the main building but to see the East Block for free was still worth it. Our guide Becca was very good and the whole staff was really friendly, everyone had a few nice words for me. I would like to thank again the pretty lady who offered to take my photo with the...

We were unable to enter as the King of Jordan was visiting when we arrived. A very helpful Mountie took us past the security to the entrance and pointed out some of the interesting details there. He more than made up for the disappointment of not entering.

nice attraction for kids but given the amount of tours they could make it a little more fun for the children. Very serious tour which I understand given the parliament but they should accommodate. Tickets sold out quick and the peace tour lineup was ridiculously long. All you see is a nice view of Ottawa. Not worth it with cranky...

Someone has got to get on the Canada Day security problem. I get that we need to be safe but there has to be a better system than the one that has people line up for hours to get onto the hill to watch fireworks and listen to bands.

This structure is amazing. The pictures don't give the image of the power, grandeur, and stately structure. It is under renovation so the west wing is covered but that does not diminish the view. The history of the building is intriguing and in 2014 a new dimension was added which heightened security to protect those working and visiting the Parliament...
The free tour of the Parliament Buildings is a must do when you are in Ottawa. The tour is very informative for all ages. Note: you must have ID for the tour - even children have to have photo ID.

Go early (like 9am) to get the best choice of times - tours are free. Great way to see Centre and East blocks before they undergo renos in 2018. Guides were knowledgeable, but somewhat scripted, especially when asked questions about the incident in October and the Senate scandal. They also were not fully communicative about some of the renos going...

The buildings are worth more than just one picture. The view is impressive walking from a distance. I visited right before C Day and the big stage was set right in front of Parliament. Great photo op!

FREE,and absolutely brilliant tour of both houses of Parliament,, including panoramic views from the clock tower ,with high speed lift access. A must for all visitors.Timed tickets from information across the street from the mai entrance

We were lucky enough to go to Parliament Hill on a Saturday so the Senate and House were not in session, which meant we could tour every part of the building. The library in the Paliament building was absolutely amazing, as was the Senate house. Sadly, the Peace Tower ws closed but that didn't dampen thetour. One of the mose...

Exceptional Building representing Canadian democracy. A great experience for my daughter to learn where our laws are made and debated. The art work was very nice but the highlight of the visit was the library ... Just stunning ... Here is a link to a video of the library ... The only negative was having to wait 2 hrs to...

It's great city to challenge yr Cool Temp status! I mean this city during winter +windshield it means for -35.degree at least.! About Feb! The main camel will turn to be one of the main transportation for all skate lover ... It's so fun and beautiful to visit this parliament then go to main shopping center with yr skates. ?
This is a great place to visit while strolling in the city. The tower and parliament buildings are incredible to see and are worth stopping by while in Ottawa.

We were in Ottawa for a lunch stopover as part of our city tour. As we had some little time left, we decided to pop-in here for a visit. However, to our disappointment, all the guided tour within the Parliament area were fully booked as mentioned by the staff who manned the ? Capitol Info building which in fact is...

We were a family getting a tour, a real magnificent building. The tour was really good, up and down the stairs and access to the massive library, everyone there is friendly and it's a great place to visit.

Wonderful buildings, architecture, sculptures and statues. Although it was raining we thoroughly enjoyed our walk round this area. The older buildings are stuuning and the sculptures and statues are very interesting. There are great views out over the river and of the Tomb of The Unknown Soldier.Also very near the departure point for the river cruise and the Bytown Museum...
The combination of the new and old building surrounded by a lot of greenery is a wonderful scenery to look at...

parliment building and hill is really good architecture and scenery and it's worth the trip if your in Ottawa but make sure you go after March because the weather can be severe wasn't nice in -12 but nevertheless it was a crisp winter sunshine day so I bared with it plus you can see Ottawa river behind parliament building and...

Pretty impressive buildings in a lovely setting. We are pretty lucky we have the ability to see our government buildings, and it is definitely worth seeing. Tickets for tours are available across the street. There is lots of history to hear, and see. Afterwards you can stroll along the Rideau. Take a few hours and go for a visit when...
Beautiful place to enjoy Canada Day festivities! The celebration is worthwhile! Well organized, great security, first aid, bathrooms and water availability!
The buildings were getting a cleanup while we were in town. Not great for pictures. The lineup for free tickets was very long.

Parliament building is only allowed through guided tours, and there are limited number each hour.Tickets are free and available at the information building across the street, but make sure to go there early to pick up tickets. We went around 11 am, and all the English tours were full until 4:30 pm. So we decided to go to a...
good to see from s historical standpointthey changibg ot yhe uards always have a good howyou should see the capiyal many tp offer everybidy

We stayed at the Fairmount Chateau Laurier which was walking distance to the Parliament buildings. They were setting up for Canada Day Celebrations and lots of renovations and or restorations being made on the buildings. There were Canadian flags everywhere which generated a great patriotic feeling in Canada's capital.

We did a tour and it was nice. The library is interesting and so different from the rest of the building. We loved the clock tower, you can see everything, however, getting there is not fun. We were smushed into the smallest elevator I have ever been on.

I would call this place as heart of Canada, a very beautiful place. Takes not much of the time to fall in love with the monumental buildings in and around this area. Well maintained historical buildings, cleanliness and bike-friendly location these are the keywords. The historical ByWard Market is also not that far from here.
Love the old architecture. Able to walk around the grounds with a beautiful view from behind the building.
Beautiful surroundings and free tour is informative and well pitched. Library is worth seeing even if you are not interested in politics. Get your tickets early to guarantee a place on the tour.
Visited Parliament Hill, enjoyed the tour as well. There was not much of a lineup for the tickets. Went to Peace tower as well, breathtaking view! And its all free of cost !

I've been to the Parliament Hill and Buildings three times with my families, friends, or just my self. I say this area and the buildings are the reason Ottawa is now Ottawa. When you are in Ottawa, just go and take a look. There is a guided tour in the Parliament Building, and you can listen to the debate, which...

This was my first time in Ottawa, and when we traveled downtown to the Parlament Hill area I was awestruck. The architecture is magnificent, the city is very clean and pedestrian-friendly - it was a great experience. Several of the beautiful buildings downtown are being renovated for Ottawa 2017, so they had scaffolding and protective drapes that hid their magnificence....

All us Canadians know where it is, but have you ever spent a day at the Parliament buildings? There is so much to see and more than just for tourists; as a Canadian citizen this has to be on your bucket list of places to see at least once. I had a chance to see the changing of the Guards...

Visiting the Canadian Parliament Buildings in Ottawa is a must-do while in the Ottawa area. The grounds are open to the public for a walk around the buildings. In-building access and tour tickets are available from the information centre across from Parliament Hill. While restoration work is seeming endless on the buildings (moving section by section), the results are looking...
Lucky our visit to this beautiful building coincided with a visit by the Dutch king and Queen we enjoyed the pomp and ceremony

Despite the events of last year, our Parliamentary buildings remain very accessible - albeit with reservations. I was impressed at well they accommodated my uncle (a veteran who needed his wheelchair). In addition to the regular stops, make sure you go to the Peace Tower for its superb views and take time to take in the Room of Remembrance -...
You can enjoy a free tour and I would highly recommend going up the Peace Tower to see a vista of Ottawa and Gatineau Park

Nice to walk around. Was under construction, had a LOUD concert for July the 1st going on. Could not enter as they were not selling any tickets anymore. Although on the website I had read they were open till 7:30?? Not sure what I missed there. Disappointed we could not enter. Beautiful architecture, walked around and checked out all the...

I hadn't been inside the Parliament Building for thirty plus years and things have changed. The House (although locked) and the Senate were interesting to see on a busy Sunday in June. Of particular interest was the Library in that it was the only part of the original structure that was left standing after the fire. It seemed like the...

Amazing building and the tour is worth it for the interior decoration. Found the tour information sometimes dull and the guide was not good with questions. However tour is worth it. They is a lot to see around building in form of statue all with excellent information boards. Information guides wandering around grounds were very helpful.

The best time to go and visit this place is absolutely the First of July!! Yes I am talking about Canada Day. You're going to have lots of activities, fun and cool pictures. This place is awesome and everyone should check it out

My second visit to Parliament. I was actually in town over Canada Day in 2014, but it was nearly impossible to get in. In December (as was also the case in May 2014), the crowds are light and you can just walk up to the building and get your reservation. I was able to get a ticket with only 45...

As an American, I have been through the tour of the U.S. Capitol and the chambers of the House and Senate before. With Parliament, it's a similar deal. I went early to the ticketing and tourism building across the street in back of the Terry Fox statue. The line moved quickly and the staff on hand told you where to...
Absolutely love it here. The buildings and statues are well maintained and the tours are on point. I enjoy myself every time I go - which is every chance I get.

We got up early and left our hotel to get tickets for the Parlliament building and Peace Tower Tour. Thought we would be early but NO. A long lineup and after standing in line for 45 minutes got tickets for the noon time tour. So we just walked around the area until then. Wife loved it and I found it...

Here is a must go spot of attraction if we visit Ottawa. I have been here many times but never felt tired of it. We reserved our tickets right at the Infocentre at 90 Wellington Street directly across the Parliament Hill. There are English or French tours we can choose from. We arrived at the waiting area 5 minutes before...

Definitely take a tour of the building (get your tickets across the street). At the end you will have an opportunity to go up in the Peace Tower. Couldn't believe how nice all the people working there were and how kind they were to my 5 year old elevator loving son.

I'm from Ottawa and always take first time visitors to Parliament Hill. My biggest suggestion is if you want a choice of ticket time go a half hour before the ticket office opens. Tickets are free but demand is high. The tour is always informative and the student tour guides are excellent. Line ups for the Peace Tower can be...
Took a tour of the Parliament buildings centre block. We had a great, enthusiastic tour guide, and really enjoyed seeing the house of commons and senate.
easy to get to and easy access. It was on the weekend so we didn't see any activity going on. Ottawa is a very clean, well kept city

I wasn't to thrilled at this prospect but my partner wanted to go on the tour. I'm really glad we did we had a very enthusiastic guide who was a politics student. The history of Canadian politics was fascinating and I'm ashamed to say actually shed light on my own government. The buildings are beautiful and worth going to see...

Probably the most iconic building in Ottawa, joined the free trip inside the main building in the center, it feels great to have a chance to see a parliament building that is actually functioning. The library inside is quite stunning. A pity was that the peace tower was not accessible the day I visited.
We had an enthusiastic tour guide, Jo, who really knew her stuff and presented it in an engaging manner. Highly recommended for all visitors to Ottawa!

Such incredible history and the access is amazing. If you have any interest in Canadian history, architecture or government this is well worth time time. Beautiful buildings and such an historic place!!
Great tour, don't miss it or you're going to regret big time. Get to understand Canadian congress system and get to see beautiful library and fantastic view from Peace Tower.
The Building itself looks amazing, though we never go in since it close :( .. but the place around is good.. souviner shops are open... its worth the drop bye..

Brought a visitor from Norway to see the sights surrounding the Parliment hill and its buildings. A beautiful day plenty of sunshine and just a great day to enjoy the scenery. My Norweigan friend was completely enthralled with Ottawa, it's architecture and it's friendly people. Any time is a good time to visit Parliment hill and its buildings

It never ceases to amaze me that as an ordinary citizen you are allowed to come onto the grounds and tour the building with minimal notice and reasonable scrutiny.It is sad that after the events of the terrorist attack here last fall that security has the visible presence now that it has, understandable but a sad statement on the...

Many people take pictures of the parliament from the outside, but do take the guided tour for a look inside. I don recommend going early to get the best time slot that works for you, but best to visit when the senate and parliament are not in session.The tour will take you through a quick history for how the...
Great tour, not overly crowded. They have a good system to keep the tours small and moving.We are from the States, so it was a great history lesson.
We found that visit quite interesting and we were very impressed by the history and architecture. The guides were very helpful, welcoming and knowledgeable. This is must to see in Ottawa.
The buildings are beautiful, and the guides there are friendly and helpful. It's busy and packed with tourists at all hours of the day though, so it can be hard to actually enjoy it.
For history and architecture, it is a must see, visit, and tour! The library within the parliament building itself is a woodworking marvel.
Take a tour of Parlament building, it is very good both for adults and children. You will hear interesting facts and see how inspired architects were. Parliament library is impressive as well.

Parliament Hill is a must see for those visiting the capital, especially in the summer months. The Eternal Flame will welcome you as you step on to hill and it is a great spot from which to take in the grandeur of our seat of government. Unfortunately, the West Bloc is currently under renovation and the scaffolding doesn't make for...

After decades of of daily politic reading and comment, it was wonderful to visit the place where all of it happens, and to see the history and interesting facts of these beautiful buildings and indeed, the history of Canada. Definitely recommend it.

Out side the parliament hill building was fantastic and very beautiful. We have took the guide tour to go inside and it is very informative and free.For guide tour tickets are free and need to buy opposite to the parliament hill. There two language tours English and French. English tours sold out during our stays at Parliament Hil. In...
Seeing the buildings and learning about the political structure was awesome. Walk the gardens and take in the majestic views
Get tickets for free from across the road. An interesting tour. Visit at the weekend so you can see more.

We really enjoyed our guided tour of Parliament, especially since we came in not knowing a whole lot about Canada's system of government. It is much easier in general to negotiate Canada's capital than it is Washington, D.C.!
Parliament hill is a very interesting historical site with a beautiful look and many other monuments.

Very impressive building. Our tour guide was great. Make sure you go to the Info Centre before 9:30a.m. because tickets are limited for the tour. Going up the Peace Tower is worth it. You get a nice view of Ottawa and Quebec. Stop at Memorial Chamber before heading out. It's very interesting to see the names of the soldiers who...

I donot like the free zone tour is only open after 11 am. I must waited outside under strong sunlight for few hours. The tour made by Julia was wonderful, I learned what I want and should to know. Thanks for the nice work.

The free guided tour of the parliament buildings to the visit to the top of the clock tower was very educational. The views of Ottawa City from the hill added another dimension to the walks through the gardens with lots of statues in memory of key people and historical events. Also on the hour, was the moving ceremony of the...
This is THE must see attraction in Ottawa. See it now before they start major renovations that will see the buildings closed for close to 10 years. Incredibly beautiful historic buildings.
See the architecture and the hill behind with all the statues. The youth guides are very knowledgeable.
Despite fires in the past, the parliament and surrounds were probably the best there is to see. Restoration is still under way, however, the building is unforgettable.

An amazing place to see, a guided tour is necessary to see,the Chapel, the Library, the Senate, the House of Commons,the Peace Tower, well worth a visit, to see where Federal Government decision making takes place for the good of all Canadians!
Parliament Hill is an experience to explore the scenery, enjoy the architecture and tour the buildings. It is not to be missed on a sunny day!Bring your walking shoes, and you'll love it even more!
It was a beautiful walk to take in the scenery and hisotrical sites available. The architecture was a delight, and some buildings offer a free tour.
I had not been in the parliament hill for years and I almost forgot how beautiful it actually is! Don't forget to Schedule for the free yoga lesson on it's terrace on wednesdays at 12pm!!

When I first moved to Ottawa, I didn't know what to expect when I visited parliament hill but it surpassed my expectations! Had a great tour when I was there but definitely go up the peace tower - you won't regret that view!
Did not go inside (have been before), but still a grand building to either walk by, or view from a river cruise. Even better at night with the light show !!!!
If you make the effort to get to Ottawa, don't miss the opportunity to visit the capital. Very beautiful architecture and manicured grounds. Lots of security too.
I wasn't available for the guided tour, but walking around the grounds is quite the experience! The architecture, the Rideau Canal, the statues...It's a one-of-a-kind experience!

Tour takes you behind the scenes of parliament and gives you an insight into Canadian democracy. You need to pick up tickets from the booth across the road. We had an excellent guide called Anna who delivered an excellent commentary. Only downside was the peace tower was closed due to mechanical issues

The Parliament Hill and surrounding buildings are beautiful, and a must-see destination in Ottawa. You can book a free same-day tour of the center building in the building across the street. They offer tours in both English and French, every 30 minutes. The tour lasts about 30-45 minutes, depending on if you can visit the House and Senate floors or...
Great visible example of Canadian history. You can get a guided tour; I forget how much it costs but they take you through some of the more interesting rooms. You can walk the grounds too.

Have done this tour many times, and see/hear something new every time. House of Commons was sitting when I was there, so couldn't visit that room, but did get to see the Senate. Did know Senate only works on Tuesday thru Thursday, September thru May, but it was still good to see.The bells and the Carolinne were playing as...

Yes, I follow politics, and yes, I find federal politics to be frustrating at the best of times but the buildings are impressive.Look up and you'll notice all sorts of whimsical characters and stone that has been beautifully carved. Colours, shapes, and textures are noteworthy wherever you look.Look out and you'll see different vistas: city, river, Quebec, mountains....
The docent was a lovely young man, who led us through the building in an efficient and professional manner. The library and the Peace Tower are amazing!

The tickets for our tour were free and it took us around Center block with the choice of going up the peace tower if we wanted to. Do the tour. Not all countries have the access to the government grounds that parliament Hill gives us. It is an obvious stop in Ottawa. Take a few hours and enjoy it. We...

Those buildings are beautiful, of course, but it's not that crazy. Maybe if you take a tour inside, it can be interesting, but we didn't, and we were a bit disappointed. The location isn't great, and it takes about five minutes to see everything there.

Take the tour! They run all day.The tour guides are enthusiastic and very well informed. Whether you are Canadian or not you will experience something that will enrich your life.You might be curious as to why they chose Ottawa as the capital, a city between Canadas two major cities and cultures.Why do these very impressive buildings look like they were...
Lovely buildings, especially the library. Our guide Samantha obviously loves her job - and her country. She was enthusiastic and knowledgeable. The tour wasn't too long either. Worth doing.

As a West Coast Canadian was our 1st trip to capital of Canada ... very impressive. Make sure you get tickets early in day for tours as they sell out very quickly for entire day. The Mint is a good visit, not lineups.

The tour is fabulous and informative. When visiting the parliament buildings and grounds you realize the richness of Canada's history.The tour is free, but tickets are limited. Go early in the day to pick up tickets for later in the day.
Walking on the grounds of the Parliament Hill you learn a little bit of history. Plus the buildings are beautiful.

Free tour full of historic information from our very knowledgable guide Thomas made this a wonderful hour and gave me a lot of information I never knew. Very cool and so happy we did this. Don't go directly to the parliament buildings for the tour you have to go the the building across the street at address #90 to get...

Unlike in the U.S. you could actually go inside the buildings for a tour. Get there early because they end tours around 2 p.m. (double check though) and you could only go to the peace tower. However, if you get there before the cut off time you could tour the more parts of the building.

An absolute must see if you are near Ottawa. The grounds are steeped in history - just ignore the constant RCMP presence. It is a building to be proud of. If given the opportunity make sure you check out the library - unbelievable workmanship
This was my third time inside the Centre Block. Always a fantastic visit to learn about the history of Canada's democracy and explore the building itself.

If you drive your car you won't be able to park your vehicle on parliament hill but you can park at the World Exchange Plaza or the Rideau Centre which are both a short stroll away.I recommeend taking the free tour to visit the inside of the parliament buildings so the guide can give you a bit of history....

The Canadian Parliament is an excellent venue from which to garner Canada's history. The architecture is beautifully Gothic in style and the tour provides good understanding of Canadian history, its democracy and the valour of its soldiers in defending Canada, as witnessed by the shrine of the Peace Tower a top the Parliament.

Our family of 4 took the tour. We checked in at the info desk to get free tickets, but had to wait a while until our tour time. Just so happened that parliament was in session so the tour did not include the House of Commons or the Senate. However we were able to go to the public gallery to...

We were lucky enough to get into parliament before they close the doors for what we were told would be over 10 years to do some much needed updating and construction. I am not sure when this begins but try to make it before. Tours are free and tickets can be picked up at the information building across the road,...

To tour the buildings you have to get a (free) ticket at the building across the street. It was pouring rain. We were waiting under a nearby tree. The tour guide stood out in the rain and insisted we all go and stand by her for the introduction (no reason as she was not really orienting us to the outside...
Beautiful! Some work in progress on one of the buildings to bring it in line with others already restored, but that does not detract from the experience.

We took a guided tour through the parliament building and quite enjoyed it. Some things were quite impressive, one of them the original library. The tours do not take long but worth a visit. Free underground parking at the main square a few mins away.

If you come to Ottawa, you can't miss touring Parliament. Make sure you get your tickets early in the day from the building across the street - by the time I got there at 9:30, the earliest tour available was 11:00 and it was going fast!

We went early to queue for the free tickets and managed to get on to the first tour (~45 mins) at 9:50 am on Saturday. The tour guide was challty and entertaining, pointing out key points as we toured the House of Commons, Senate and Library (one of the prettiest that I have visited). We were allowed to tour the...

I spent many years living in Ottawa and never got tired of seeing the 'Change of the Guard' and touring Parliament buildings. Over the years things have changed where you can't have as much access as before but still worth touring. Take a picture at night near the Eternal Flame.

column3: Marsais-Sainte-Radgonde, Pays de la Loire, France
column4: Enjoyed a very interesting tour of the parliament buildings. Was very interesting to note just how much of the system and the buildings are based on the British equivalent. The library is spectacular.

we did not know that it would be closed on a Monday, or any other day that a debate is happening, I also was so disappointed to find the Mounties not dressed in their red uniform or on house back, but sat in their patrol cars.

We totally enjoyed the tour we recieved on our recent visit to Ottawa. I found it very interesting. The architecture in the buildings is incredible. We are from Manitoba and were surprised to learn that the stone that lines the walls is all from Manitoba

Enjoyed all aspects of the visit. Had a great tour guide who was very knowledgeable. Saw the House of Commons, Senate Chamber, outstanding Library and up to the top of the Peace Tower. Well worth the time, and it is free!!
A place one must go tour to see where the laws are made. They have an awesome library. Great view from the Peace Tower.
i live in Montreal ad have been to Ottawa several times never having visited these buildings. a must see for every Canadian regardless of political views.

Our tour guide, while informative, clearly had repeated the same tour a billion times. The info was there but we felt a little rushed. The building and history is spectacular but not much info was given about the details or the when where and how etc. Overall we are glad we saw it but wouldn't do it again. It was...

We had planned to visit the Parliament buildings, but when we finally got around to going, we had missed the last tour. We decided to instead visit the Peace Tower. It was a great experience for our kids. Next time we visit Ottawa, we will be sure to time-manage better.

It's always interested me that governmental buildings in the U.S. are all Greco-Roman, Imperial classicism, while Canadian buildings like this are in highly detailed Gothic Revival. (The difference is between round and semicircular forms with classical weightiness, in the U.S., versus pointed, stretching forms like arches and windows, a profusion of interesting details, and a general sense of emotional enthusiasm...
Very nice.very busy.bery beautiful downtown ottawa.Worth the trip .....Especially in the summer.xoxoxoxxix

I must admit, I thought that the experience would bore my small son out of his mind, but he was captivated throughout. A visit to the Parliament Buildings is an engrossing and oddly moving experience. The tours are well-facilitated, the architecture (oh, the library!) is lovely, and the guards/staff are friendly and helpful. Take the extra time to go and...

Short distance from the Sheraton. We just walked to it and took lots of pictures of all the old buildings. Then walked to the marketplace and enjoyed a nice dinner. I think you will enjoy the experience.
You must visit this Awesome Castles, there's no fee to get in and you will be transporter to a different dimension of what this type of buildings look like from the inside.

The Tomb of the Unknown Soldier is located near the Parliament Buildings in Ottawa. Remains of an unknown soldier who died in France during World War (1914-1918 was brought back to Canada by the Canadian Forces May 25/2000. The remains laid in state for 3 days at the Parliament Buildings, then following a solemn ceremony the casket was buried at...
We went to the parliament with a huge line at 9:00 on victoria's day and at 10:30 we could get free tickets for 3:00, the building and the tour information were awesome.

excellent attraction and management. they give you free tickets, keep you bags for free and free tour. the architecture is marvelous and the library is amazing. overall a good experience and not to miss attraction
get on top of the Peace Tower to get a nice view of the center of Ottawa, visit the Parliament library with a history of the Canadian flag

ottawa, which capital of canada, has a big parliament hill. last year there was an assassin so many tourists refrain from going there but don't worry. there has been some police officers near around as protecting security.
beautiful area, enjoyable views, clean and friendly people. I went for a walk around it and the park. All have great views.

If you do visit Ottawa, then the Parliament building would be one of the places you have to go if just to say you've been there. The only way to get into the building itself is to book a free tour in an information centre just opposite to the Parliament building itself (large ? sign, hard to miss!). My friends...

Spend half of a day watching the changing of the guard, doing a guided tour of parliament and walking along the Rideau Canal. Do not have any scissors, etc in your purse at parliament as you will have to check them in before tour.

Visiting Parliament is like taking a step back in time.. we have a long history to the Commonwealth and you feel it here. I have been to London and visited the Peace Tower.. in my view, our Parliament Buildings beat it! And don't miss the Changing the Guard!
Should have woken up early to get tickets! They were sold out for the tour when I went at 1pm but I was still able to look inside at a few areas.
Take the tour! You'll learn so much! You'll hear about the gargoyles, little man faces inside, and the great fire. Teach yourselves and your kids about Canadian history.
A must see if you are in Ottawa. I recommend at night when the Parliament is lighted. Also the guided tour seems interesting.

I think what you really need to know about this place is since the shootings in October 2014, security is really amped up, and it appears how they determine the size of the bag you can go in with is not an exact science. A bag that fits in the measuring box at the ticket office is no guarantee it...
They have a cool light show/historic story-telling going on in the evening which was nice to watch but the sound quality was poor.

The visit was a free tour and the tour guide knew a lot of information about the building and its history. The inside of the building looked very nice. There was a small gift shop as well. We only got to tour the main building. It looked like they were freshening up the buildings as there were platforms and people...
Excellent tour. Guide was interesting. This building is rich in history and no trip to Ottawa is complete without a visit to the hill.

You have to go across the street to get a free ticket for the tour. It's only 30 minutes but gives you a great overview. we actually got our tickets and went over early to watch a bit of discussions in the house. Check ahead of time and try to go when they are in session. When we went from...
Very informative tour of the house chambers of the Canadian government, which included the library and bell tower. A must see tour.

Great tour and many statues and monuments to see on the grounds. The Peace tower is a must to do as well. Solid gift shop. Guides were excellent. Several tips-tickets are sometime given at the building across the street and sometimes at the Parliament entrance itself. It depends on the time of year. Go early due to tour groups getting...

The tour was quick. I would have liked to linger a little longer in some areas. However with that being said it was a great tour and we were able to see both the House of Commons and the Senate Chamber. The only recommendation I have is to go early and beat the security line up! The Peace Tower self...

I was in Ottawa for the Scotiabank 1/2 Marathon and decided to visit Parliament. Because I had another tour booked at 1:30, I opted for the 4pm tour. Our guide was very personable and knowledgeable, and the building is beautiful. The only negative was with a tour of probably 3:30 or later you won't be able to go up in...

Worth the time to go on the tour of Parliament and peace tower. You need to get a tour time ticket across the street first. Also be prepared for airport like security. May be too much for toddlers but from school age up its interesting.
Despite the serious restoration work going on the Parliament Buildings are definitely worth a visit.
We were inside with the guided tour some time ago. It was very interesting to see everything real as we can know it watching TV. Last week we watched amazing lights show.

The grounds and buildings are spectacular. However be prepared to stand in line for a few hours if you want to take a tour. We got there first thing in the morning and there was already a long line up and we gave up hope and had to be satisfied with the exterior views.

There is no need to go inside to appreciate the beauty of the whole area. The buildings are amazing, the grounds are equally as breathtaking.There is no cost if you just show up to the grounds. I was not interested in going inside, I just wanted to revel in the beauty of the area. I am told that Canada...

How else do you describe the place where all laws are passed and where the people of Canada represented? We may not agree with what gets passed but we should all agree that this is a very powerful site.Getting tickets for a free tour of the building on a long weekend and one that coincides with an American long...

We only walked around the outside of Parliament Hill as the lines were quite long and didn't want to wait, we had so many other things to do that day and only had a few days in Ottawa. Nice views across to Gatineau from the grounds. The grounds were under construction but what we saw were very nice.

This is a must see for all Canadians at least once, and not just for a school tour. This place represents not only the seat of power in Canada, but it also presents a continuous flow of history as the tour guides spell out our growth as a nation.Our roots are critical as a country to maintain a sense...

Parliament buildings are majestic and beautiful. The Library is an architectural gem. The galleries of the House and the Senate are complementary to the history they have witnessed and the daily decisions that are made there. Every Canadian must visit at least once in their lifetime.

Visited the Hill with a friend from Japan. Hadn't been there since I was a school child. Definitely worth seeing again as an adult. The amazing architecture and the history of the building is explained by your guide in a tour that never feels rushed. I'd suggest you get your free tickets before noon at the building across the road...

Many events take place here throughout the year; Canada Day concerts and fireworks, Winterlude activities, New Years Eve, changing of the guard, Christmas lights etc. The architecture and history is wonderful and you are minutes from so many other attractions in Ottawa
Tours of the parliamentary buildings are worthwhile and without charge -- in English or French. Conducted by enthusiastic university students.
Interesting architecture and lovely grounds offering great views of Ottawa River and beyond. Worth a tour inside too as you get the history.

Parliament Hill is a place that needs to be visited on your trip to Ottawa, no matter what season you arrive.Summer and Christmas season there is the festival of light .The entire building are lit up with thousands of lights that seem to dance.The Eternal flame that sits in the middle of the property and never goes...
It is very interesting to walk the halls of house of power and see all the history (in Architecture and legislative) and the memorial to the military dead is also quite breath taking .

Beautifully located by the river. The building and ground are well maintained and well worth the trip. Take special note of the library at the back of the Parliament Buildings as it is a stunning piece of work well worth the visit

The parliament buildings are a must see for every Canadian. The library is an amazing piece of architecture. I especially enjoyed the stroll behind the buildings. The view of the river and bridge is astounding.
Great building, rich in architecture and history, view from the piece tower is fantastic...very knowledgeable tour guide.

Parliament hill is not only the building but everything surrounding it. You need to walk around the building and see the library and have a beautiful view of the river and the Qubec side. The parliament building is surely a must see.

Took my cousin here from England to see the changing of the guard and explore the parliament buildings. Apart from the mandated security and access it was a very interesting visit. Used to visit as a child so very different as an older adult.

If you're going to Ottawa then you have to take a tour of the Parliament Buildings at least once. Daytime take a tour inside. History and architecture abound. make sure to see the House of Commons, the Parliamentary Library and go up and see the Peace Tower. Outside there is the eternal flame, a walk around the back by the...
Great tour of Parliament. Some wait re security but worth it. The library is amazing. Tour guides are information re history of Canadian government.
Learn about Canadian history and its politics, as well as the history of the building itself. Go up the clock tower and admire the beautiful view!

You wanted to see Canada, get the feeling what it's all about? Must see for everyone visiting Canada and every Canadian. Every time I walk by this place I think how far we've come as a society and then news reminds me how fragile it all really is.
The summer will offer more access to the building than the winter months plus holidays. Check in advance when they are open and what is available to see.

Beautiful to visit any time of year! Lights at Christmas time are spectacular and if you visit in summer they may have lights or a video projected on the building which is a must see. Great to walk around inside and outside. Follow the walking paths behind Parliament Hill to walk along the River banks and make your way towards...
A fantastic tour with lots of history about Canada. Attend Question Period and watch the Government in action !
Loved hearing about the history of parliament from the guide and walking around the centre of Canadian politics was very interesting

The building is a must see. We went to see it a couple times during the day, once in the early morning at sunrise, in the afternoon, and at twilight. It looked stunning every time. You can get a good view of the backside of the building from across the canal, which is also nice. Definitely worth checking out.

Along with the Rideau Canal, all visitors to Ottawa must see Parliament Hill! Going up the clock towers affords a great view, so don't miss this. Also, once you have been inside walk around the the grounds. Out back there are statues and cats.
Main Canadian landmark in the Capital city. Free guided tours available.Don't forget to look at the Library, from outside!

A fantastic, fun, free location to attend. It captures a slice of Canadian history and provides a unique look at part of what makes us Canadian. The House and Senate tours really put some of the political process in perspective. The library has just been re-newed and captures the imagination.
The tour guides are great, and there is such a rich history here. Would be a disadvantage to miss. Families wit all ages can go see this.

The Parliament buildings are extraordinarily beautiful and the setting, overlooking the Ottawa river is breathtaking. What is particularly nice is the unfettered access to the grounds, at any time ofnight or day.
Very beautiful ....constructed from stones...It has colourful lights which makes it more beautiful in the evening ...Its very quite during winters..
I love visiting Parliament Hill when I go to Ottawa. I don't necessarily go in. I just like to be on the Hill. This time, the west wing was under scaffolding.
It was okay if you enjoy walking in a group listening to a guide talk. Beautiful building but really there is so much more to do in Ottawa.

If you never have gone to this area, it's truly Canadian. The buildings are huge. If you can make it in the summer when the mosaic is on, they project canadian history onto the buildings and it's really nice. There are sometimes protestors on the lawns which are a pain in the butt however they seem to stick to themselves....

I had a great experience with my visit to Parliament Hill. The building is a classic and fit for a King and Queen. The tour of the parliament building was very informative and we loved the interior architecture. Views from the Peace Tower was breathtaking.
Just go, you have to when in Ottawa. The library is actually beautiful. Find out why Ottawa was chosen as a capital.

These are the buildings talked about in our textbooks and featured on our currency. Seeing them on tv over and over again does not do them or the views justice. I think every Canadian should come to Ottawa at least once during their lifetime to check out Parliament Hill.

Gearing up for Canada Day there is a lot going on at the hill, better to go after when the daily parade onto the grounds takes place. Get there early in the morning to book your tours and tour times as there is limited space. Plan to be in the area all day between tours, there is a lot to...

Atmospheric buildings which are in superb condition. They reflect the relaxed and friendly atmosphere of the nation. We enjoyed the fact there were large number of staff available to ask any questions we had. A must see on any visit to the capital.
The building is great!!!I love been there when tulip bloom! So beautiful!It's a good place to go with your family and friends

Parliament Hill is situated right by the canal and easy to spot. There are free tours throughout the day. We did a tour and security was very tight upon entry - as it should be. Love the parliament hill area. Beautiful view, lots to take photos of and see. Some construction that seems to be taking a while to complete...but doesn't hide all the beauty here.Makes you proud to be Canadian.
buildings are beautiful and tour guides are well educated. I enjoyed Q&A with the guide. parliament is large and tour takes a bit long for me, but overall it was fun
Our guide (Catherine) was excellent, and had been giving the tours for 4 years. The tour included Parliament Library and the various meeting rooms.
While we did not go inside the buildings themselves we did get to hear a little about the government and see the Parliament itself.

The views from the top of the tower are worth the wait, there is also a tour which again is free but I wasn't too bothered so skipped it. Building is nice to walk around, security is heavy after what happened last year.
This place was at the bottom of our least to see. I can't even think that we could miss this beautiful sight! The area and building are very historical and great however it's even better inside.

Parliament Hill is great to visit any season. We visited it on a weekday during summer, on Canada Day and in the evening during winter (just before Christmas). this is where our great Canada is run from.. head office ! we all need to see where the adminstration happens.

I love Ottawa! For a national Capitol it is a very manageable and walkable city and majestic Parliament Hill is right in the middle of it all! Walk by the building any evening in December and be dazzled by the beautiful light show played out on the buildings. You can watch it and never tire of the changing colours, shapes and narratives displayed. Bring a camera and try to capture this art on film.It is worth your time to walk and watch this festive treat.
This ground is great to walk through. Enter the building and arrange a guided tour. During the tour everything will get explained.

Although there seems to often be constructions, it is a great location. In the parliament one can have a free tour which is well worth it. I cannot help but compare Parliament Hill and its tours to those in my US home. I realize it might be apples to oranges to some, but I cannot sing the praises of the Canadians and their capitol buildings enough. Last year I did a tour of the Parliament which was very enjoyable. This year, we just walked by the buildings in the evening. No picture could capture these scenes.
these are amazing structures - really gives you a sense of pride just looking at them. I was there a couple of weeks after the shooting so security was tight - but certainly worth it.
The tour takes you through the Parliament building and you get to see both Chambers and the library- very informative and surprisingly easy to get tickets. Probably not for very young children

A must-see when in Ottawa!Passing through security takes a bit of time, so leave extra time for that.Tour was great. Our guide was very knowledgable and loved answering our questions. Visiting Parliament Hill, with the many monuments and history, was a great experience with our 6 and 4 yr Olds, even though they aren't fully taking it in yet. Located in center town near several other attractions within walking distance: Rideau Canal, National War Memorial, Chateau Laurier, Supreme Court, Bank of Canada, National Archives, Rideau Centre & Sparks Street (shopping malls).
No place in Ottawa displays more hot air than this place. Other places on earth have great geysers that emit smelly Sulphur gases, but Ottawa has the Hill.

Winter light show projected on Parliament buildings is unique and worth taking in.Visited on New Year's Eve and loved huddling around the confederation flame to warm up and reflect on past year. Just wish there had been some fireworks on the hill.

The tour was fascinating seeing where both the House of Commons and the Senate sit when they do their business. Lovely tour, nice folks and very little security. Canadian history at it's finest. Highly recommend!

Such an interesting hour. Our guide was incredibly knowledgeable security takes a while so leave lots of time to get in. The peace tower is worth a visit but elevator a little slow just be patient ! Staff very helpful and friendly.
A must see any time of the year. Take a tour of the building as well. Marvelous piece of architecture!!!

I love visiting Ottawa and the parliament hills. Beautiful architect. It's great to be in our beautiful capital and seeing part of our history. Every Canadian should go once in their life. I have been a few times now, and I love it every time.
