The good location of the building. Hilly and good sight seing. Founder and fathers of modern day Canada's statues were mounted outside the building

Every Canadian should visit!Historical building where very important decisions are made!Even if your not into politics once you visit you might change your mind and get involved to better your future and your families future.

Only time we can go there is at night and we heard its also the best time when we visited because of the Christmas lights. Never thought I would say what a beautiful Building. It was cold, but we enjoyed just looking outside and watching the Christmas lights.

Myself and my girlfriend visited the buildings and toured Peace Tower. You will need about 2 hrs to see everything. It was a sombre, respectful place but informative and uplifting. Every Canadian citizen should visit at least once and its a must see for anyone coming through Ottawa.

Especially after the attacks in October, it felt really sombre and important to come here during our weekend in Ottawa. Obviously cold December is not an ideal time to walk around, but at nighttime...the Christmas lights are amazing!!! Make sure to have a nice hot chocolate in hand though.

The Parliament buildings are worth a free visit often. First time visitors will definitely want to take the tour. The views are incomparable even with the construction going on. Weather was a bit rainy but warm enough to be comfortable. Literally minutes from the front of the hotel

It was June 6; I have visited Bangladeshi high commission at Ottawa, the capital city of Canada. I got the opportunity to visit the Capitol Hill, the parliament building of Canada. When you are in Ottawa, take three hours and tour the capital building of Canada. A lot of history there for the taking. Free tour.
We visited briefly while we were in town and it's definitely worth a visit if you have the time. It's just to see it in person and I would also recommend going up in the tower. Beautiful view.

A tour of the Canadian Parliament Building provides a detailed history and background on the buildings, an overview of how the Canadian government legislative process functions, and a history of politicians who have impacted Canadian history. Guides are well versed and tickets are free. In July and August there is a changing of the guard ceremony held on the grounds.
One building being covered in plastic was disappointing but obviously necessaryThe parliament buildings were particularly poignant given the recent atrocity in Ottawa

Marie was amazing in giving our group a guided tour of Parliament Hill...especially for a group of young boys. She made it highly entertaining and educational at the same time.

It is always interesting to visit the headquarters of a country. Canada's is steeped in history, beautiful buildings, and friendly people
this is a spectacular setting overlooking the Ottawa river,the Champlain point etc.Inside you need 1-2 hours especially the library and tower..great visit..andre

I work in the shadow of Parliament Hill, and have the good fortune of being able to walk those grounds whenever I want. I was in Ottawa for a conference and took a tour of the Pariament Buildings. It was really informative and it has amazing architecture. We also caught the House of Commons in session which was pretty interesting.

I once toured the US Capital (before 9/11) without a guide. I needed a guide. Our Parliament Buildings are spectacular! You can see the history ingrained in every block...It is still a reflection of our proud heritage.To see the Changing of the Guards is amazing. I feel sorry for the Guards when the temperature is extremely hot.

A worthwhile visit, even for someone who has been to Parliament Hill before. Seeing the buildings lit up in the early evening was incredible. An amazing experience for Canadians and visitors from abroad.

Parliament Hill is a most impressive sight--beautiful buildings in a lovely setting along the river, with a sense of history and pride. After 45 years I chose to revisit my Ottawa Parliament Hill & Buildings. Only a few things have changed. Security is the biggest difference in light of recent tragedies. I visited the Parliament buildings with my a student leadership group I am involved in, we got to go in and watch question period which was more fun than it sounds. If you go to Otawa and you don't visit the Parliament Hill....well... it's like you have never been there! It's a marvellous building and the guided visit is FREE! Due to a recent tragedy in Ottawa the Parliament building was closed. But, we were able to walk around the outside and admire the many statues and the building's architecture.

Incredible grounds and an amazing building. The staff were more than happy to help in our speedy visit and were accommodating of my travel with a small suitcase. I didn't even see the Peace Tower in the short amount of time I had and yet the 2nd floor hall was a showcase enough. A must see!

The architecture is just amazing. We found ourselves moving so slowly to take everything in. So much detailing and symbols - very cool. We were there in the summer and they had a nightly show that provided history of the country projected on the outside of the Parliament building. It was modern, historical and make one proud to be Canadian.
Though the tour was hot and very crowded, this is Victorian architecture at its best. It's stunning inside and out, well worth waiting in line to take the tour.
It is worth while to line up to visit the Peace Tower. After a few security checks and an elevator ride, you get a great view of Ottawa.
Easily the most memorable part of our trip to canada. Plus it started snowing while exiting parliament, we are from texas, so we had only seen snow once before.
The security has certainly increased and with good reason.The buildings are so beautiful and so worth visiting.

This is the most visited attraction in Ottawa  the Capital of Canada. Nothing nicer than a stroll around a Parliament on a sunny day. An impressive set of buildings with unique gothic architecture! It's hard to find something that matches its style in North America. Plus there are free tours around parliament, so one would be foolish not to visit this if one were in Ottawa.

The building is very beautiful, full of objects closely related to Canadians history and institutions. The library is particularly stunning. I stopped in here on November 9th so a few days before 11/11 and not too much after the violence that occurred. The grounds and the building are so amazing, I came in pretty late so no tour but I was able to self guide to a few spots, the soldiers were a bit jumpy but everyone was super nice...
Perfect place, with a wonderful view of Gatineau (QC) and the By Garden. The internal visit is very nice, we did the free one (only because the time) and it was very cool.
Nice for a day trip. Good to know the history of Canada, and our parliament. This is a free excursion and great for the family.

Come early to get a ticket for a tour, as availability is limited, and tours are offered in either English or French. Was very proud to see so many rom other countries there to tour our Parliament. It was a so interesting to see the Parliament buildings! I had never seen them before and it was surreal to see the big peace tower and question period. The building itself it beautiful, the character of the rooms and hallways is very interesting. Would visit again if I'm ever in Ottawa again.

I really hope that this tour remains open to Canadians and tourists alike after recent events, because it is such an excellent tour and provides a real insight into democracy at its best. It is beautiful, but we couldn't see much since there were a governmental festivity and we weren't allowed to go in.

Canadas most iconic buildings...Interesting architecture,though still under renovation,nice area and views on the Quebec side.Free tours available in side the center block building most days,though you will need an extra hour for the tour.Probably Ottawas most famous tourist stop.

Given we visited only a week after the tragic events here it was tremendous to find the authorities determined to keep this building accessible to Canadians and tourists alike. Beautiful buildings and setting along the river. I was visiting during the time in which Parliament Hill was closed to the public so I was only able to view them from the fence but still worth it! Looking forward to another visit when I can go back and see everything

Easily accessible the Parliamentary Precinct hosts the traditional changing of the guard each day. Try to time your visit to see it either before or after your tour. Great to explore! A must see if you cone to Ottawa. Helps you understand how things work in Parliament.

This is where Ottawans take their visitors. Lots of history, arcitecture, and just plain interest. Now there will be more security due to recent events, but still available. This is Canadas Parliament, visit if you are here!

A visit to the Canadian parliament buildings is a must when you are in Ottawa - not only can you see spectacular architecture but also wonderful paintings and the amazing Royal Mounted Police in their red outfits. Proud that this is my hometown and would recommend a visit here. Make sure to walk around the building as the view behind is spectacular, looking out over the Ottawa River. To bad for the waiting on line of security check, but that is everywhere today. The building, architecture, history and view of the city are truly amazing. Everyone who visits Ottawa should try to visit these buildings.
With the onset of fall and a backdrop of Rideau river ,the whole place looks like a flower garden !With the whole visit being around 2 hours ,the view from the top made it worthwhile.

The tour guides we experienced were well informed, cordial and very professional. Ask for Julie as she is witty and always has a smile while keeping everyone organized. We visited the week following the killing at the War Memorial and Parliment Buildings. The security was great, and the staff courteous.

The Parliament Buildings in Ottawa are a must see when travelling to the nation's capital. The splendor and majesty of the architecture are surpassed by the intrigue of the politics that occur within it's walls. Contact your MP for a vistor's permit.

Must see place. Amazing architecture and historical place. The architecture is mid-Victorian, beautiful, something we do not see that often. It is an attraction that pele of all ages can enjoy. I have met visitors from around the world who were impessed with this site

If you are visiting Ottawa, you have to take some time to visit Canada's Parliament Hill. Spend a few minutes at the Centennial Flame, created in 1967 to commemorate Canada's 100th birthday. I went on the tour of Parliament. It was informative but wasn't what I expected. I grew up in Ottawa. Ontario, and worked for over 30 years on Parliament Hill. The center of power and influence.The Parliament Buildings, are rich in architectural splendor. The daily tours are excellent and very informative. Recommendations are very high.

Very nice historical location for individual or family visits. Grounds are great and the changing of the guard is impressive (summer months only). If your lucky (or not) Parliament will be in session :-)

Take the time to take a tour. The walk through the halls and the descriptions of what the symbols mean and how they reflect Canada's history are wonderful. The architecture is wonderful, and the Parliamentary Library is a real wonder. Don't miss this.
Great place to see, then mosey on over to the Sparks St Mall. There is a historic Bar Brixtons, Jack Layton of NDP it was a favourite hang out.

During our short stay in Ottawa, walking along the hill and visiting the Parliament was in our "must-do" plans. We visited the parliament and the soldier memorial monument. We were in awe. The buildings alone are amazing to look at. We were there a few days after the tragedy that happened with the soldier. It was definitely something I will remember for the rest of my life. ..so sad. Must see.
Monuments are the buildings alone tell quite the history story. A must see while visiting Ottawa, for sure.

We were so impressed with the free tour of the Parliament. Our guide was very friendly and knowledgeable. Our experience with the Parliament staff was positive. The tours run frequently the whole when there is no parliament sessions. Backpacks are not allowed during the tour but are stored for you at the reception are.The view from the Peace Tower was...
It was a bitter-sweet visit due to the recent attacks there. Quite a large police presence. There is a lot of construction there so to avoid crowds go early in the morning.

our 1st time in Ottawa. the server at our hotel advised us to go during question period. we contacted our m.p. office to get 2 passes. told we needed to go to the buildings to pick them up. there was only1 line up for all of us to get in, those that had timed tour tickets etc. a very heavy...

As we were walking around, it was the same day as the President of the Ukraine was addressing Parliament Hill. So there was Restricted Access on the backside of the building.The Eternal Flame was very visible unlike on Sunday when it was difficult to see.A must see when you go to the National Capital Region.
Take a trip to the top of the Peace Tower and enjoy a birds-eye view of the city. A great option on your first day of the trip to get your bearings and see all of Ottawa.

This is a must see for any visit to our nation's capital. Beautiful historic buildings - fantastic grounds and an amazing view along the river. Take a picture by the Centennial Flame.If you have time take the tour of the buildings and learn about Canada's history and government. Well worth it!
Where are are the cats have they been located ? This was one of the attractions for me besides the buildings.

Great tour of the parliament 2 weeks ago - can't believe the events of yesterday. Incredible building and impressive guides who know their stories. Amazing how similar to Australian government systems, and the general attitude and vibe it is. Fantastic to visit and the view is worth it. Highly recommend a visit for the history and process. The library is...

Although we visited back in June, I am writing a quick review as the tragedy that took place yesterday is largely on my mind. Ottawa, in general, is an absolutely beautiful city, and I would love to return! My husband and I ended up taking a walking tour of the main points of interest, and learned so much! Parliament Hill...

We were in Ottawa Sept 22nd; one month prior to the tragic events of yesterday. To stand in the Peace Tower and see the National War Memorial ( and all of Ottawa) was wonderful. I was so proud to be Canadian. I am STILL proud but profoundly sad. Please, as a Canadian or a visitor in our wonderful country, please...

Unfortunately we arrived late afternoon and had little time for sightseeing. Beautiful! The guided tour is very informative and worth your time. It is free but you need to get tickets and go through security. The guide is very informative. Wait until you see the library.....stunning

Even though we had been to Ottawa before, we had never been to Canada'a Parliament Buildings. We visited a week ago, and today there was the shooting, so we probably were one of the last people to have such easy access. Loved the bilingual young guides who were of Asian and Black Heritage. Perfect example of young Canadians.
Very thorough tour and very interesting. Our tour guide for humorous and informative. Architecture was beautiful.

The only disappointment of this visit... It was raining and the Mounties weren't out!! :)Very informative and enjoyable visit to the parliament buildings. Our guide was fab, the building beautiful and the tour well worth while. Would recommend to others.

Enjoyable to see the heart of the political scene in Canada. Peaceful and quiet at night. Always a nice walk along the front of the buildings or enjoying the ever burning flame at night time in front of the buildings.
We enjoyed the tour and were fortunate to see the parade of theheads of parliament. Our guide was good, the tour is free andit is a great place to visit on a rainy day.

the canadian parliament main building has five main areas to visit, the free guided tour takes you to the senate and the house of commons, and the library. the peace tower, and the memorial chamber can be visited on your own after the tour. the elevator ride to the top of the peace tower is worth the wait. the elevator...

I visited Ottawa , but unfortunately I did not make it inside the parliament buildings for a guided tour, something I definitely have to do next time I am there. My husband and I took a guided tour of the Parliament Buildings and learned lots of interesting things! I didn't know there was a fire in the early 1900's and pretty much everything but the library had to be re-built. The library was saved thanks to the two iron doors being shut just in time. The library is majestic! They...

We stayed in Ottawa for three days, and the Parliament tours were closed for the first two due to some foreign dignity's visit. Unless your able to arrive close to opening time (and Ottawa has lots of distractions to delay you!) expect the Parliament to be busy and to have to wait to join a tour. Expect a full security check.There is no charge for the tour or Peace Tower which is a bonus.The views from the Peace tower are great...

THe hills and buildings are full of history, great stories, very interesting, and amazingly built. The parliament has walls made of a stone with incrested fosiles. It's interesting. You get to visit rooms that you only see on television. The change of guards is spectacular, and the light show on parliament hill made me cry!
Loved the sense of history it portrays. Awe inspiring architecture & well maintained. Gives me pride in being Canadian.Sad to see cat sanctuary closed, my second favorite site after the library.

Firstly I feel there should be people walking the grounds answering general questions about parliament and how to get tickets, etc. The line ups for the tour were ridiculous. Was impressed with the amount that you can learn from the tours. There are many affordable (if not FREE) things to do and see. Found it very interesting to hear how things are done in politics. The views from the hill are amazing. This experience was very good, and very educational for parents and the kids. I would go back...
What stunning buildings and a lovely area. I was really impressed with the architecture, grandeur and setting.

Parliament Hill is the place to visit at least twice. During the day take a tour to learn about day-to-day Parliament activities, structure and history. The tour is very informative.I would recommend getting to the Parliament Hill at the eve as well, since the buildings look different (very charming) with lights on them.

As an American living in Canada, I felt obligated to head over to Ottawa to learn some more history about the country that's been my home for the last few years. Visiting Parliament Hill was at the top of my list because I wanted to see for myself how the government worked and also get a better sense of Canadian...
What a beautiful site Parliament Hill is. Enjoyed being able to walk the grounds and soak in the history of the area.

We enjoyed visiting the parliamentary buildings. The Gothic Revival architecture is amazing. The tour took us to the Senate (the House was closed), the library, and the Peace Tower---over 302' high. The Parliamentary Library was the best part of the tour! Beautiful. The changing of the guard was impressive to watch.

A beautiful setting for a fabulous set of Parliament and government buildings overlooking the Ottawa River and Rideau Canal. The Main Block and Peace Tower can be toured fro free and if the House of Commons or Senate is sitting you have an opportunity to sit and watch from the galleries. Security is high.
Architecturally beautiful and the grounds are host to many historically important and interesting sculptures and statues. Definitely worth your time.

At the time of visit, we are not allowed from anywhere around the parliament building as their are lots of construction going on. So I was kind of disappointed because I travelled 5 hours just to see the place. Also weather at the time was bad.
Very much like our own Parliament buildings, although smaller. Nevertheless it is worth the visit. Staying at the Delta puts it within walking distance.

Superb architecture and an excellent tour. We went on a Sunday at the beginning of September and arrived at about 10.30am. Actually sat in the gallery while in session. Very interesting to observe the dynamics of politics first hand. Our guide Louis was excellent.
Historic and picturesque architecture. I wasn't able to take the tour as there was an event going on. But just admiring the beauty of this landmark from the outside is worthwhile.

Ok so we didn't get to see the inside of the buildings. I thought it was hilarious when they told their English speaking visitors to join the French tour because that's the only one available. Isn't Canada bilingual? Why can't they hire bilingual tour guides who can give a French or an English tour on demand? Well, it wasn't really...

Liked that we could walk up and have immediate free entry (subject to strict security controls). Watched some of parliament proceedings. Unfortunately when we went to go up the peace tower the lift had malfunctioned and that meant there was no access that day.
Lots of monuments, flame and the centre block can be visited inside. Peace tower is the only one in Ottawa where you can go up and view in Ottawa, not very high but very good views 360 degrees.

We went to Parliament Hill and the toured the building and Peace tower on a Saturday. Got there about 11:45 and waited in a line for about 30 minutes. We decided to take the 1:20 tour and got in the line to see the Peace tower. We were able to complete our visit to the tower before our 1:20 tour....

Weather was great and it was an opportunity to reacquaint my son with a Canadian landmark. It was very quiet for 4:40 in the afternoon and while it was interesting to see the buildings , the educational experience was limited.

The glass lighted ceilings, the ornate carvings of the doors or posts, the life sized statues, everywhere, the paintings taking up whole walls, pieces of our history--wow. The history of Canada--beautiful. The tour guides, very knowledgeable take you on a walk down Canada's memory lane

Really laid-back atmosphere among the Parliament Buildings watching a ceremony for two regiments celebrating their centenary. Pity the soldiers wearing bearskin hats and looking very British received their orders in French - just didn't seem right!

We attended the 2014 Canadian Police Memorial service on Parliament Hill on 28Sep14. Seeing all of the officers from across the country (and the world) marching across the lawn to remember the fallen was awe inspiring. Police Motorcycles surrounded the hill from so many different services in an impressive display. Hearing the names of the fallen officers read, their headdress...

It still amazes me that you can walk up to the Parliament buildings. I'm very glad you can, though. The grounds and the buildings themselves are beautiful. And the light show in the evenings is well worth seeing.

I felt like a complete tourist when I was in Ottawa. My friend and I explored around the city for over 6 hours and we always had tons to look at. The parliament buildings were amazing to visit if you are into Canadian history as well as architecture. I would definitely go back again, but def go for an inside...
You have go there, take the tour, go up the Peace Tower and enjoy the beautiful city that we live in.
A one time visit but the building itself looks grand. They have visitor timings when you can go inside and see the house of commons in session

This is an impressive grouping of buildings. On an earlier visit, had occasion to be here for Canada Day, which featured the most amazing fireworks show I have ever seen shooting up from behind Parliament.
Very nice buildings and quite historic. They could use a lighting update inside. Other than that it was a highlight of my trip. The library is a must see!
Another must see area day or night. The buildings are amazing and you can walk all around the buildings. I was hoping to see a Canadian Mountie but no such luck.
Had a wonderful tour of the Centre Block building, just make sure to go with lots of time to get through security.

Huge and beautiful building. Was going to stay for a tour but opted out after seeing other parts of the building and realising we still hsd 30min wait. Advise, get the tour ticket and come back as not much to see inside prior to tour. On a separate day free yoga class with lululemon with about 200 people on the...
We visited Parliament Hill as part of our tour & we're hoping to see the fabled Canadian Mounted Police but on this occasion it wasn't to be.
Great Experience,we Canadians take pride in our tours and make everyone as comfortable as possible.Peace tower amazing view
Would have liked to stay longer, however we were travelling with a 9 month old and had to move on after the tour. Definitely worth a stop and I will be back if I get a chance
The parliament hill is a must visit destination for all tourists and even locals who live in Ottawa! It is nice to look around and you should visit the inside of the building! Cheers!
Canadians do a great job taking visitors around their parliament buildings. No charge, but gorgeous buildings leading to splendid views from the Peace Tower. Don't miss it.

The area around the Parliament buidlings was interesting and Old. The old market area is filled with good restaurants of all prices and styles. Our guide gave a very good account of the area and how it grew to be the capital.

The parliament hill and the building itself is beautiful, worth the visit, however I was quite disappointed by the tour. Compared to other parliament, it didn't give a really interesting perspective of what happens in the different room, our guide was talking more about the paintings than the politic importance of the building. I love architecture and this is a Canadian gem not to be missed. Although I have been here many times, I always come back whenever I'm visiting Ottawa. The parliament buildings are at the moment under reconstruction. It spoils the overall impression. Ottawa is dirty and not very nice city.
Very nice guide (was a very very motivated student). Go afterwards to the peace tower and enjoy the view!!!
so we just walked around the building. Worth doing. great views and you might even see someone important walk by
The tickets are free, so nothing to prevent you from the guided 45 minute tour. The building is beautiful and it is very interesting to hear the stories. It is on the top of my list.
Nice tour of the Parliament buildings. Worth a visit. Lines were reasonable and the grounds are beautiful. Lots of outside is under contraction so we'll have to come back when it's done.
Loved the library and changing of the guard, a must see. Very educational, learned things that I did not know or have forgotten from school years.

Excellent tour! Very informative- our guide Andrew was knowledgable and conducted the tour at just the right pace! I only saw the centre block. East block was closed. Get there early! As the crowds mount so does the queue and awaiting times. Get there as early as you can and best day is a Sunday. The tour is informative with plenty of opportunity to ask questions.

Guide was articulate, expressive and knowledgeable. She was very good at herding us in the right direction. Neat bits of history that you wouldn't know about the place. I'll be coming back. You can have a free tour of the Parliament Building which is quite awesome, including an ascent into the clock tower for fantastic views of the city. Very enjoyable and interesting.
lovely architecture , impressively standing on the hill. We listened to someone else's tour guide and enjoyed hearing the history.

This guided tour was great in Ottawa. We went to the old building or East wing tour but there are three different tours. You need to go to a building across from Parliament to schedule early in the day. They are well informed and give you a view of life earlier in Ottawa

Although there is the standard security that comes with the modern era and little parking close by; we love visiting Parliament Hill and the Canadian Parliament Buildings. The staff are friendly, knowledgeable and professional and it's a treat to visit.

Canada's Parliament is an old style building and beautiful as well. You can take guided tours in English or French inside the building and I must say the tour guides are very informative and helpful. Parliament Hill is absolutely the MUST visit when you are in Ottawa. The Peace Tower and surrounding wings are absolutely stunning and could rival the Houses of Parliament in London. My wife & I went on the tour of Parliament. The architecture inside the building is beautiful. The tour guide was knowledgeable with lots of interesting facts. Highly recommend. And the tour is free.

Glad I visited Parliament Hill in Ottawa. The young man from Alberta who was our tour guide was very pleasant and knowledgeable. The buildings are grounds are beautiful. What prevented the experience from being excellent was our tour guide. She made the tour last nearly twice as long as it should have lasted, many times mentioning that she was responsible for designing the tour. There were good bits, but there was a lot of filler.
I just Love the view and the architecture o beautiful Peace flame is a must see I still wish they had the Cats of Parliment Hill they were pretty special

- Ottawa can be typically toured in about 2-2.5 hours flat- Parliament building make for great pics and tours inside the buildings are usually arranged for free.- Great view points behind the parliament buildings- 5-7 min walk to the Rideau Canal- Show your Canadian pride!

There is a light and sound show every evening at 9pm. It is an experience not to be missed! The entire show is projected onto the Parliament Buildings is spectacular colors. The show depicts the history of Ottawa and the change of seasons.
Beautiful old buildings. Lovely to see.The red carpets are so lush. Too much security though, they took my pen knife away.

In Ottawa there is much to see and do, the Parliament is a must. Guides give wonderful history not only the politic as that have served in various roles but the history of the building. Must of the major rooms are available for viewing and on the weekend the library is open also. Going up the peace tower is also...

We were provided an excellent tour in English with a great tour guide, Julia. The tour was free and Julia took our group through the library, the house of commons and their senate. We also got to go up the peace tower which gave 360 degree view of the city. Well worth the time we spent there and highly recommended.
Free tours, although a bit of a wait if you choose to take the elevator up to the peace tower. A must see if you are in downtown Ottawa
Brought my US-born husband here for the first time and he was so intrigued by the historical monuments, the architecture and the city in general.

The seat of power and government in Canada's political world. This is one location you MUST visit while in Canada's capital. I recommend doing a tour to see the grand library and have a glimpse at the floors of both the House of Commons and the Senate. Its a free tour of about 40 mins - not as impressive as UK parliament or old!Good views of Ottawa from the bell towerAll Free

We loved the trails and walkways - both behind the Parliament buildings at the top and the bottom of the hill. Unfortunately, the West block was under construction/restoration which did cause some delays in walking after hours in some parts (after construction site was locked up)

During a nightly walk noticed a large number of people heading up to Parliament Hill grounds. We sat down to see what was going to happen and we enjoy the most amazing light show on the building itself. Spectacular.
The Parliament Hill very beautiful and full of history. Free of charge entrance. Elevator to the top.

You pretty much have to visit Parliament Hill when you come to Ottawa. The tours are free. after labour day, just go to the Parliament Buildings and line up at the visitor entrance starting at 10 AM. July 1 and the lighting up of the Christmas lights are great times. There is always special events going on at the Parliament buildings

We toured the outside ourselves and had a guided tour through Parliament. This was very interesting and the building is beautiful inside and out. Our kids learned a lot. The library was stunning. parliament Hills is one of the best tourist attraction in Ottawa. located in the city centre and easy to reach by public transportation. the tour inside was very interesting if you like more about history and politic. but enjoy the beeautiful builiding surround was also awesome. sitting near the fountain and look around the building was also nice. Be carefull...

Obtain tour tickets early so you know what time your guided tour will start.Parking is free at World Exchange Plaza during the weekends. Short walk to Parliament Hill.The Parliament Hill itself is magnificent and full of history.
You can't be Canadian and not visit Parliament Hill in Ottawa once in your lifetime. It is easy to access and is very welcoming. Tours of the buildings are offered all year around.
Beautiful buildings, great views of the river, and we were lucky enough to see a lightshow and then a fireworks display from behind the Parliament, which was pretty spectacular!
It was our 2nd visit there. Same beautiful buildings. It's just too crowded than before.. If they could only do the restoration faster of the other buildings would be more appealing.

A visit to Ottawa would not be complete without a trip to the Parliament Buildings located in the heart of Downtown. Take the tour and then up to the Peace Tower for a lookout the windows. There is a lot of resurfacing of buildings going on so unfortunately scaffolding will be the main theme of your photographs, but it is still worth a tour, and it's FREE!
It is so well kept, so attractive, the details in these buildings are worth the trip, I could spend hours there pouring over the details. Love it!

We got there the day before the ending of the changing of the guard. You have to get there almost 20-30 minutes early to get a spot (by the east block) to see everything. It is very long and precise but interesting. If you can't stand for a long time it might be difficult(maybe a portable chair). We didn't have...
Beautiful buildings and breathtaking views across the river. A must see! The guided tour is definitely worthwhile if you have never been before.

Heavy construction did not deter our family from being blown away by the power and beauty of parliament hill! The guides that are available around the outside were so friendly and knowledgable - they took the time to answer all questions!

Liked that it's a free tour with bilingual guides who know the history & allow you to take pictures. There is tight security so you need to check your bags & pockets for anything that could be embarrassing.
We love everything there...except hard to find parking...some are crazy drivers...and lots of construction everywhere...my kids enjoy it anyways. They learn a lot especially the amphibus...
The parliament Building are a must se for all Canadians and our visitors. In it you will see the history and energy of our country.

If you visit this beautiful city, don't miss these historical buildings and grounds. We loved the classic architecture and beautifully landscaped grounds of these spectacular structures. There is nothing to dislike about the beauty of the park in front of the Capitol buildings.
I like all the portrait of the queen. In history the king is about brave, strong and ate too much meat.

We enjoyed the tour, which is free and the guides are well informed. We got there early so we could watch the changing of the guards first. You need to go to the tourist info booth across the street to get the tour tickets and they are limited in quantity.
I have been there several times over the last 4-5 years and each time I enjoy it so much. Highly recommended.
Highly recommend taking toe Parliament Tour. Second time and it was even better than the first. Well organized.

Excellent, a must see for any visitors to Ottawa. The guided tour was excellent. The culture, the beauty of the buildings and the history was very moving. The grounds are great for walking around and the view from the North side is breathtaking. Don't miss the opportunity, you will be very pleased and it's all FREE!

One of the highlights on any visit to Ottawa are the buildings on parliament hill. They are historic and beautiful and are best seen live. The tour of the buildings is very informative and shouldn't be missed. If you can manage to visit on Canada day, then you can share the experience on the hill with hundreds of thousands of...

have not been for a long time the building is still breath taking ! no line up s just have to get tickets from across the street and wait for the tour. going to the piece tower is amazing the view of the city is worth the wait for the elevator. Growing up here you forget how pretty this city...
I never went into the building itself but I am often there. It's a nice site to see. Very clean and well maintained at least from the outside.

Very beautiful place. I recommend to visit if you traveling in Ottawa. On summer they have Mozaika thing it's all Canada history on a parliament building
See the eternal flame, the cat playground and the beautiful views of the river behind Parliament Hill.

How can you not? An easy tour. Our tour guide was energetic and friendly; a little thin on real history, but the tour itself was nice, even with the inability to enter the House of Commons due to some function.

Excellent place to walk around. Restaurents and other attactions are around.Discover the history, functions and art of Canadas Parliament with a guided tour of Centre Block. This iconic building is home to the Senate, House of Commons and Library of Parliament. Free tours are available daily.
It's very unique place love the eternal flame they have a great cat family there're were people give donations to feed them great view of the Ottawa river
Excellent and very clean. Super nice day and a bonus for the Imax theater on the other side of the Interprovincial bridge.
It is a beautiful place. There was a 30 mins free tour inside the Parliament building. The wait is a bit long but it was worthy. WOW such a beautiful place.
The tour of both houses , the library and if you are fortunate to be there during question period it is a real bonus .

Visitors who want to take a tour must be a pass from the tourist center directly across the street from Parliament buildings. Our tour was very efficient and informative and enjoyable, even with young kids, it moved fast and they didn't get bored.
It is obvious that the employees in the parliament building enjoy their jobs. Everyone is very informed and happy to answer any of your questions with a smile!

The Parliament buildings are a wonderful example of old world craftsmanship. The stonework and woodwork in the buildings are breathtaking. Make sure to get tour tickets (they are free!) early in the morning so that you can go at your preferred time.
We got to see the guard out this day due to celebrating the world war .There were out on the grounds also bagpipers were there to .Great show !

We recently visited Ottawa and went to see the Parliament. It definitely has a lot of history and the building is really beautiful. I somehow did not like the tour. But, had a good day visiting the place.

Worth going to see, the view is good and the history is interested. For Canada's capital it's on the top of the list. The grounds are nice too.

It is free to go into the Parliament building and do the tour. We went up the Peace Tower too. The views of Ottawa are amazing on a good day you can see loads. On the night there was a history of Canada screening on the Parliament building in lights, music and speech. This is a must see when it...
The building and the grounds were so well kept and very beautiful. The security there was so good, you were safe to go anywhere. A true Canadian heritage/

Second time there in my life, first time 45 years ago so not much to remember for sure! Now looked at and enjoyed the tour FREE even. Lots to see and a great tour guide Marie. We really enjoyed our visit to the parliament buildings. We did get tickets (for free) and had a guided tour. Is a wonderful building. Lots of sculptures around, great view. Its a very nice walk. Looks beautiful in summer with all the flowers.
Free Access, Tour in English or French. Very friendly guide. It is a monument to see without hesitation

Really imposing but impressive building. There was a Parliamentary function whilst we were there, with numerous dignitaries attending, so security was present but not overbearing.We walked all around the area which was clean and well maintained unlike some other big cities.Well worth a visit!
We saw the sound and light show at the Parliament Building and it was wonderfully done. It lasts about 45 minutes and is well worth seeing.
Love the capital buildings! Definitely check out an inside tour of it if you get an opportunity. The view of the city from the peace tour is awesome and you can get great pictures from up there

Makes a photogenic city from both sides of the river having the Parliament buildings standing out. A must see place , Very educational about the Canadian history . beautiful building and architecture .. guided tours .. We visited the Peace Tour (free of charge) which gave a birds-eye view of Ottawa in four directions. The information panels helped to identify buildings or give a bit of history. Even when the clock just above us struck noon, we could barely hear the chimes, which was a good thing for our visitor who was sound sensitive. Guides, security,...
The daily changing of the guard in July and August is a must see. It's free and takes place at 9.45am. Parliament building is beautiful and worth a tour

Walking around the parliament hill was fun. The buildings are very interesting. The new buildings are interesting although an interesting contrast. As with old cities there was a lot of renovation going on with the old parliament buildings and a lot of new construction going on. Still there was much to gawk at.

We watched the Changing of the Guard (which was ok, like a mini version of London, UK). We were then directed across the street to get our tickets for a guided tour through the parliament buildings. Tours are offered in French or English and are free. The tour is 45-60 minutes and the last stop on it is the Peace...

We arrived the tourist centre (90 Wellington St.) at 9:45am for the free tour tickets, the earliest tours we got were the 10:45am tour for the East block, and the lady gave us the 11:50am tour for the Centre block, which was okay as we could walk around outside of the parliament buildings for pictures. Behind the centre block of...
Had an amazing light show at the Parliament building. Started at 2230 hrs and lasted for an hour. Lazer lights were outstanding. This is a nightly show which ends in September

We didn't get inside the building, but we were at the Centennial Flame late afternoon, and at 10 pm. Many people were milling about the flame at night, as there were many people wandering Wellington Street at night. Many had come from the nearby/recent fireworks. It was beautiful, seeing all the historical buildings lit up at night, in the area....

We came late to Ottawa and decided to roam and walked in front of the Parliament building. The place is very nice and quite we felt so safe walking around downtown. RCMP/cop are all the place. Changing of the guard is show to forward to including the parade.

We enjoyed the tour around Parliament and then went up the Peace tower, from where we could enjoy city views and keep dry. It's good that visitors can book tickets, and then explore the city until the given time. The guides seemed fairly knowledgeable and answered the visitors' questions well.

Beautiful architecture and a brief history lesson on Canada in the tours of both the grounds and the interior.Don't miss the Library which is also the only room in the place which wasn't burnt during the fire in 1916. This room is built round so its walls do not touch any other walls in the building. Amazing room with...

This was a fabulous tour with a very knowledgeable and respectful guide. He explained all the expected features thoroughly and also contributed many fun anecdotes and interesting asides. Well worth the trip to Ottawa.

We did the free tours of the center block and outdoors. You go to the building across the street from Parliament to get tickets to the different tours. They allow about 25 ppl per tour so each tour has a specific time and there are different tours in French and English. The tours are all free and last from 45...
Travelling with children we didn't opt for the guided tour, and there was a 45 min wait to climb the peace tower. However, the daily evening light show is an absolute MUST.

I was discouraged by the very long line for tickets at 9 am but came back after lunch and got 4 tickets for the center block (or I should say centre block) tour at 4:20. I wouldn't recommend cutting it that close, but, on the other hand, don't be discouraged by the long lines. The people who work at the...

Been here a few times, I'd recommend to any Canadian to visit. Without sounding too crazy here, this is your country and Ottawa is your capital. It is FILLED with history, so much so I keep finding out something new each time I visit. I'd recommend a tour of the hill and make sure you get inside the chambers. Beautiful...

The Parliament Buildings are a definite must-see in the city. As a resident I take all my out of town guests to Parliament. I try very hard to convince my guests to not take an official tour. On more than one occasion I have found the tour guides to be rude and limited in their knowledge.

I had no idea it would be so hard to get tickets (free) for a tour of Parliament Hill. We arrived at the ticket office (across from Parliament Hill) around 10:30 am and could only get tickets for 3:20 pm. The tour lasted about 40 minutes. The guide was very good, informative and funny. Great tour.

We had an awesome tour guide (Louis). In order to get a tour, you must go across the street to get a ticket (they have tours in French and English). You will go through a security check, so count on about 20 minutes before the actual tour begins. A small price to pay to be safe. The tour guide was...

There's probably not a lot one can add to the already rave reviews of seeing Parliament Hill, other than don't miss it! Plan on arriving early to see the changing of the guards, with pageantry that you don't often see this side of the pond. It's sure to leave you with goosebumps. Stand at the bottom of the hill, towards...
An old building with many beautiful details, it's full of art.I was lucky to see the lighting show at the evening, it was incredible show.
We spent 90 minutes watching and listening to pipes and drums of the changing of the guard. Very impressive! There were guides all around the grounds informing us of what was going on. Great show.
Loved changing of the guard - pomp and ceremony at its best. Tour of parliament is also fascinating and well worthwhile
Very enjoyable tour of these wonderful historic buildings. The view from the Peace Tower is impressive as well. Free of charge, but you'll need to claim your tickets earlier in the day.

Whether you are a Canadian or not, the Parliament tour is worth your time. The tour is informative, and interesting and allows participants to ask any questions they would like. Free tickets for guided tours are available across the street from the Parliament. Time slots for tours are first come, first served, so you should get your tickets early if...

This is definitely a must see along with the Changing of the Guards. Come around 8AM to line up for free tour tickets as they have limited numbers only. You can take pictures almost anywhere inside except the library during a work day. I suggest coming on a weekend tour as that is when they allow people to take pictures...

No matter how often one visits Ottawa you tend to go to this area of the city for the architecture, its purpose , the people, the views across the river and of course one can take a tour inside or arrange in advance to be in the house during question period when parliament is in session .

It looked very grand, We also saw the changing guard ceremony, but that was very slow-moving (in my opinion). I did not have time to stay for the whole ceremony. One of the wings were under major renovation, so you could not see it. The are around it was also blocked off because of construction.

Thoroughly enjoyed our visit to the parliament buildings, it gives you the feeling of being "truly Canadian"...a sense of pride and patriotism...which all of us need ! We had an excellent young student tour guide who was extremely knowledgeable. And make sure you take in the War Memorial and the tour of the Peace Tower...it was a dull, rainy day...

Free but you have to get tickets across the road before hand. Line up for tickets starts by 8:30 or earlier but the doors don't open until 9. The ticket folks said they normally run out by 10:30 at the latest.Tours are well organized and the tour guides pretty much know their stuff. You have to go through security...

Parliament Hill is absolutely beautiful. We made a point to stop here on our way to Montreal and I definitely wish we would have had more time to take the tours and see the changing of the guard. The building is fascinating and the surrounding area seems very historic. There was a lovely choir singing while we were there, so...
Bring your camera and be ready to take the best pictures of beautiful arquitecture. The library is absolutely speechless

Tours of the Parliament Buildings are available, free, but need to be pre-booked in advance to secure a time slot.It is worth making the time as the tour gives a good background to Canadian history and it's parliamentary democracy.The buildings have their own interest and reflect the multi cultural background of Canada.

We went to the night time light show at 9:30 and this was fantastic. This is a great learning experience for the kids to see the Canadian history. This last 30 mins so it is not long. Bring a blanket to sit on the lawn to view the lights.Next morning another must see was the changing of the guards,...

Stayed in Ottawa for two days. Parliament and Peace tower not to be missed even if you are limited in time. Surprisingly it is free guided tour. Try to get there early because there is limited amount of people for visit each day. At 10 am in front of Parliament building is the change of guards. From 11 am to...

A very beautiful building in a inspiring natural setting.It wasn't until I travelled the world that I began to appreciate the wonder that is Canada.I understand why millions would love to emigrate here,even with the long cold winters.Canada is a special place.It is not utopia but there is a spirit here that works toward creating a country that allows for...
Get there for the changing of the guard then take as many of the free tours as they have available. All of the staff is well trained and humorous. The building is spectacular

Tours of the main buildings, the exterior,west wing and the Peace tower are available but the tours fill up quickly so it is good to get to the Wellington St. Visitor center early to get the best selection of tour times. We liked the tour of the building exterior and grounds best. We did it in the pouring rain but...

My family and I did the three Parliament tours (Centre Block, East Block and Grounds) offered when we were there in early July. We found the east block tour to be the most interesting of the three. The east block tour differs from Centre Block because instead of showing you the space in it's current use they have restored them...

I like to watch the Changing of the Guard. It happens twice a day in the summer, in the morning and afternoon. The soldiers are dressed in full ceremonial dress, red coats, tall black hats and a gun. It's a great activity for kids to see. It provides a nice snapshot of Canadian history.

Efficient but it had dried. To her could use some personality and some curve. Tour guide was very competent and very knowledgeable. Probably every Canadian should take a similar tour. Helps to fill in the blanks in on some of our every day questions.Absolutely no obvious parliamentary activity going on when we were there in August. Maybe that is...

Parlaiment Hill on Canada day is exceptional, but on a run of the mill vacation can go over the heads of younger family members. For more matured families, it really is exciting to think that so many decisions that defined our nation were made here, and its definitely worth at least driving past to admire.

You have to get a timed ticket from a booking office opposite the Parliament but that is good as it avoids queues and allows you to organise your day. The tour itself is very well set up. We could not visit the Senate on the day we went but we were able to see their House of Commons, a couple...

Our guide, Christina was great!! Very informative tour. Interesting to see in real life what we often see on TV. The buildings are fascinating in architecture and symbolism. Well worth the time. Take the time to tour the grounds while you're there. There is also a walking path behind the parliament buildings down along the river.
Amazing architecture, and you can enjoy walking the grounds in less than an hour. The buildings are under repair at the moment with completion scheduled early next year
Architecture is amazing and great photo ops. Grounds are great to walk around in. Not much more to say. It is very convient to get too and walk around in. Nothting else to really say.

Great to see the inner workings of Canada's capital and legislative area. While construction is going on in and around the area, parliament itself is unaffected inside. Well worth the waiting time, if any.

Felt like a prisoner the way they herd you, make you wait forever and don't let you see anything. Disgraceful! Will never return again. As a Canadian I feel embarrassed the way they restrict us from seeing our own parliament

Attention to detail and helpfulness at 'Changing of the Guard' that made the early morning arrival and wait for the 10 am event well worth it. A number of guards stood in fully dress uniform in 30 degree heat for hours after event for photo ops.Tour guides very knowledgeable and courteous. Sites clean and easy to navigate.Don't miss...
Library was closed because of a fire alarm issue on the day of our tour. Other than that the tours of the building are amazing and the tour guides are really friendly

What a wonderful selection of interest to get from the Parliament Building ! At 10 PM they have a light show projected on the building that was just amazing and should not be missed. At 10 AM they have the changing of the guards which is quite a ceremony with bagpipes and all. The tour of the building you must...

We did a guided tour of Parliament House. Our guide Kimvy was fantastic! Quite funny at times too. The tickets are free and you pick them up across the road at the information centre. Go early if you would like tickets in the morning as when we arrived they only had late afternoon tickets left. It takes a while to...
The buildings are quite beautiful and more impressive than in photos. Arrive early to watch Canada Day festivities, better yet, catch the preshow rehearsals the night before.

We took the Centre Block tour at 3:30PM on August 2. Simon was our guide and it was well worth the wait (we were delayed due to a special tour being fitted in). We learned a lot and saw a lot of amazing things. Our three kids really liked it too.

If you are visiting Ottawa don't bypass Parliament Hill. It seems there is always something going on. The Changing of the Guard in the morning, Tours of the Parliament Buildings, The light show at night, Other activities that are always changing. Not only that it is free. Just a great way to enjoy the Capital City.
Free tour was quite good, once you get past the herding through security. Tour guide was funny & personable. Be warned, the marble halls lead to tricky acoustics.

The grounds are beautiful and the architecture exquisite!The tour itself is about what you'd expect for a government building tour. Some interesting information is explained for sure. If you're going to be in Ottawa, you may as well stop by and tour the HIll.

Really enjoyed this tour, and the grounds themselves are beautiful. We went around 8:30 (doors open at 9), and got a tour for 9:50. As well, definitely recommend seeing the Mosaika show - it's very well done!

I recommend getting to the Hill bright and early in the morning to get your tour tickets, see the Changing of the Guard, tour the outside statues, and then break for lunch. After lunch, take one or more of the interior guided tours and venture just off the Hill for a look at the nearby exterior sights and monuments such...
Beautiful building and grounds. Tour was free and very informative. If you get a chance do watch the changing of the guards.

The Parliament Buildings is the main business location of Government where the Prime Minister and Heads of Government conduct their business for the entire Canadian Provinces. The Parliament Buildings are located in Ottawa, Ontario and Ottawa is the Capital City of Canada. You can do a tour of the Parliament Buildings, which is a must do while visiting the City....

Although we had spent much time exploring the parliment building and surrounding area durting the day learing about the governmental system in canada, we went back in the evening to see the beautiful and much anticipated mossaic light show.It was well work it, and was a beautiful and exciting presentation of Canadas history.A must to see if you...
The tour was extremely interesting and lasted around an hour. The tour guide was knowledgeable and answered our questions. Loved the building!

From May 1 to early September there is a "Changing of the Guards" at 10am sharp. You can tour the Parliament Buildings for free!! So it's a great outing for all age groups at no cost. When Parliament is in session, you can go into the gallery to watch and listen to the Parliamentarians speak.The grounds are extensive and...

Parliament hill has something going on all day long but at night it lights up with light and music that any age will enjoy. And when your done the Byward market is just a block away with icecream to nightlife and everything else you can think of.

Going on the FREE tour through the Parliament buildings is something that every citizen should do (once they understand Parliamentary and representative democracy, and the difference in the upper- and lower-houses of Parliament). To be able to walk through and stand in the place where Government does its business on your behalf is something that all citizens should do, so...
We strolled the grounds and enjoyed the grand views over the river. Lots to see, and plenty of seats to rest on. The thoughtful provision of portable toilets is a great idea.

Take the tour of Parliament after you see the Changing of the Guard. You won't be disappointed!!! We had the best tour guide ever, Louie! Amazing that you can still tour our government buildings! The library was absolutely beautiful. The tour included the House of Commons and the Senate. The buildings were beautiful and so full of history, but Louie...
Playing tourist in your own town is the best way to fall back in love with your region. This stop is a must for it's history, architecture and over all beauty.

Lovely interior, a must place go in the city. Should Come here in the day & also at night time. Finding parking in the area was difficult. A lot of construction work was going on so it made it difficult.
Unfortunately we did not have enough time to go on a guided tour through the parliament; however we thoroughly enjoyed walking around the grounds and witnessing the changing of the guards ceremony.
The house of commons were under renovations. We were not able to have even a look into the room. We expected to learn more about the building.

I lived in Ottawa as a child, and I remember visiting the Parliament buildings when there was minimal security and a tour was a real tour, not just a forced march in double-time through a few barricaded halls to see 4 or 5 rooms. Chantal took us through the West Block and did a terrific job of tackling questions and explaining the history. Simon was our guide for the Center Block - he was very enthusiastic. The library was breathtaking

What you could see was good, but there was alot of renovations going on. The library is very interesting and beautiful, wish we could take pictures in there. Although they say the tour takes 45 minutes be prepared to add minimum 20 minutes for security check!!
Very cool tour. A lot is under construction right now for their 150 anniversary in 2017. Ask about the tour of the Peace Tower.

Who cares, seriously. Waste of time. Boring and politically excruciating, since the history of Canada has been terrible. Ugh. Dread going there, other than Canada Day, which makes us retreat Confederation.
Always great to see where the heart of the decision making in Canada comes from. A beautifully maintained piece of Canadian history!

We arrived early to Parliament Hill, about 8:30 am, which gave us plenty of time to park on Somerset and Banks (excellent parking price for all day). Then headed to the ticket booth across from Parliament Hill, which was being opened just when we arrived. Everybody was super helpful there. We took the 10:50 tour tickets. Before that, we went...
We took a city tour on an on-off tour. We got off at parliament hill and spent quite a bit of time there. It was a wonderful place to visit.
A bit on the boring side but it is awesome to say that you walked through the parliament buildings and free!!! I'm happy I did it and learned some new information

I am told that the Parliament building in Ottawa is a replica of the one in London and, if not, the resemblance is certainly striking and intentional, all the way up to the "Big Ben" clock in the tower. There are also East and West buildings which are smaller copies, equally ostentatious. The changing of the guard takes place at...

Only got to see the center building, and the group was very big so felt rushed in and out of each room because of back to back to back tours. That being said, it is exquisite and informative and our guide was phenomenal in her knowledge and control of the group. Be prepared to go through security, those who aren't...

make sure to go early in the morning and collect your tour passes... as they are first come first serve...so depending on what time slot you are looking for ...we went there around 9:30, as the change of guards starts at 10:00 and took the 11:00 tour...the guides are knowledgeable and give a deep dive into history of canada...

It's great that our parliament building is open and welcoming to visitors (apparently 4000/ day) we had a wonderful guide who tried to explain the process of parliament in an interesting and memorable way. It is all free to get in but you have to get a ticket from the tourist info center opposite you will be guided around by a guide and will be searched and scanned when you go in which is fair enough as it is a working parliament it is quite interesting I whent up the peace tower which was...

Our tour guide was a great guy... Knew his stuff cold, and presented it very well and concisely, but compared to essentially every other tour I've been on, in ottawa, kingston, hamilton, I didn't learn much. We saw the library. It was very very beautiful, but we were in and out so quickly. A place that beautiful should have lots...
Great free visit good informative guide both houses of parliament seen can take pictures inside great free light show in the evening
Great place to take your kids and teach them about the history of Canada and how our country and government was formed. Beautiful area and great people

As a history teacher, I love this attraction! Free admission, East Block tour for real history buffs and Centre Block tour for anyone who wants to learn about Canada. The guides receive books about the buildings and have some mandatory info that they share but have freedom to pick whatever info strikes their fancy! No tours are ever the same!...
if u see and study lot to learn .history spoken by statues great idea and salute to the LeadersU c.an see the monument and honour for eskimos i think thats with to see

Parliament Hill is open to the public for visits pretty much every day. It is a place that you do not want to miss as there are a lot of activities that happen from time to time. Especially during the summer time at nights, there is the Mosaika show. There is no admission fee, not that I recall, and you...

First, you'll witness the guards march past the flag pole and hear the beautiful bagpipes playing.Then you'll begin the tour indoors, which covers the highlights, and finish by touring the Peace Tower at approximately 11:05 a.m.Walk around the Hill at night as well for great photo opportunities.Enjoy!

Well worth seeing, every night at 10pm apparently outside the parliament building there is a light show / presentation that is displayed against the parliament building and is definitely worth seeing. Its free and lasts about 30 minutes or so, very clever but wont spoil it with anymore details
The East Block tour is great for adult history buffs. Really neat to visit GG, PM and privy council offices

Have been to Ottawa a few times in the past, but never on July 1. This year I was there on Canada Day and wow - what a great experience. The Hill was transformed into an entertainment focus. With teh historic buildings as a backdrop, the National Birthday celebrations came alive. Every Canadian should try to do this once in...

The guide did NOT want to talk about the treatment of the Native Americans (he called them "First Nations"), He kept saying I'll answer questions later, but often did not. The price was excellent, free!

We toured parliament buildings on a Sunday with free tickets from the tourist center. This included the central block and outside tour. The guides were fantastic and we learned so much. Get to the tourist center by 8:30 so you can get in line for the 9:00 opening. Tickets are given out the day of the tour. Go to the...

It's a beautiful capital and the Canadians do a great job presenting it to anyone that takes the time to see it. If Capitol Hill, the Pentagon, and other DC sites interest you, then you'll have a great time walking around here.

It almost goes without saying that there's little point in visiting Ottawa and not spending time at Parliament Hill. The buildings are beautiful, the grounds delightful in good weather and free guided tours are offered of the Centre Block of Parliament year-round. In the summer, one can also get a free guided tour of East Block. For tours, you need...
to see where Canadian parliamentarians work, where politicians make speeches, statements and are interviewed by the press. The guide also provides history of the Canadian parliament and the country.
Lots of pomp and circumstance. Great English Uniforms. If you like ceremonies, you will like this one!

My parents took me when I was a kid. I felt compelled to talk my kids.Free - pick up free tickets at the information centre across the street.We did the east block tour and then the centre block tour.East block tour - quieter and smaller groups. Still interesting for architecture and its history lesson.Centre block tour...

Tour guides were friendly and knowledgeable. This was definitely a must-see/must-do. We took both outside and inside tours of the main parliament building, but honestly, the outside tour isn't much to talk about. We could have walked around it ourselves.

We did this on a very wet day and if I am being honest, it was because it was wet that we chose to do this!Having said the above, we did find it very interesting and it is worth a visit. The guide was knowledgeable but a little rushed but to be fair, the group we were in was...

If you're in Ottawa, you have to visit the Parliament Building. While the building was under a bit of renovation, but we were still able to get a guided tour. Our tour guide was very informative and energetic. While in the building, we also went to the top of the Peace Tower and enjoyed the view of Ottawa from above....

I always find the architect,and history, and the whole scene so very interesting! Unfortunate, the renovations were a disruption, and took away from the scenic beauty, but in the end, it will be better than ever!!

The ottawa parliament building is beautiful and it is currently being updated. Almost half of the site is being blocked to fesses and some exhibit can't be reached. I will recommend getting the quick self tour guide handbook at the front entrance. It will help you to understand the history of each exhibit.

Make sure you visit and go behind the building to see the sunset view - peaceful and mostly not crowded. Just grand and different. There's something to see every corner you turn. It's a shame to see too many construction going on site though.
Canada's Parliament is not as Gorgeous as a European Parliament but its not Boring. and the guides are excellent, we took 2 tours back to back and bother were good and informative
it is better to have a full view from Alexandra bridge.Can still see the fire trace on the war.It is nice to know history from statues there.
Excellent place to learn about canada. Lots of information people who are happy to help and guide. I liked every aspect.
Amazing walking around these old buildings. Guess that's why our taxes are so high looking after this place lol

It was easy to get tickets to go to the centre block, east block and peace tower. Go early in the morning, 9 am, to get in without any line ups. All the young students did a good job of being ambassodors of Canada.

Have visited Parliament Hill a couple of times in the last few years. Very interesting to walk around and take in some Canadian history. Easy access to be able to view the parliament chambers, and don't miss out on seeing the library.

There is a very interesting excursion in the Parliament building, where you can see where the Canadian Parliament work. You can learn more about Canadian political system. And you will see a wonderfully beautiful library. The tour is free.

Beautiful location (evidently, or they wouldn't have chosen it--it's militarily advantageous and pretty too). The main parliament building and East block are wonderful. The West block buildling has been under maintenance construction causing it to be partially or totally covered up for at least 5 years. Free yoga on the lawn once a week at lunch time. Tours are free...

The Canadian government puts on a changing of the guard ceremony every morning at 10am in the summer. It was rainy the day we were there but really warm and because of the light rain it was not busy. All the family really enjoyed the ceremony.

Ottawa's Parliament Hill area has historic buildings, Changing of the Guard show (daily at 10AM), and summer night light & sound show (extremely impressive technology to project intricate lights/patterns on the Parliament's Central Block building).Suggest that you plan a day of touring there as follows:- arrive at/after 9AM at the Capital Visitor Ctr (across the street from the...

I visited here in May 2013 and took the parliament tour. The tour was very informational but lots of wait in lines because of so many visitors. It was under restoration and so not much to see outside and hard to walked around then.We visited again at end of June this year. The Parliament Hill was still under restoration....

This is a must visit site in Ottawa. Being on Parliament hill and taking in all the old and stunning architecture is a great experience. Even if you go without a guide, there is still a wonderful time to be had taking in sights. The lookout area which showcases the Alexandra Bridge is breathtaking. Also, you may just run into...
A visit to Parliament Hill and the surrounding buildings is a must when in town, especially if it is your first visit. I have been many times and will continue to go when ever in town.

This is an historical landmark in Ottawa . I had a chance to watch a light show where you get a festival of lights while learning the history of Canada. It is awesome . Don't miss it, half an hour, and it's free.

Although my wife grew up in Canada, she had never been to Ottawa, and neither had I, an American. We enjoyed our recent visit, and one of the highlights was the Houses of Parliament. The neo-Gothic structure is very impressive, and our guide explained many of the symbolic features which we would not have noticed on our own. A nice...
The real highlight of our time in Ottawa. The light show is amazing. The buildings are old and massive. The change of the guard is also here which is worth a look too. Enjoyed this trip to Ottawa.

You really must go see this area for the buildings and the wonderful architecture. It is absolutely beautiful. You can do an inside tour, which is free, but we didn't do this. We just walked around the outside which presented a lot of photo opportunities. If you like old buildings then this is a must of your things to do...
beautiful buildings, informative free tours in Parliament House, great views from peace tower and overlooking Ottawa river, even has free wifi outside

Our family enjoyed the 1 hour tour of the Parliament Bldg. Timed, free tickets are available starting at 9:00 am at a bldg across the Parliament Bldg. We went up the tower and caught great views. Our tour guide was excellent.

We obtained our free tickets across the street at the visitor center for a scheduled time later in the day. The tour started on time. After passing airport-style security the tour guide efficiently explained the history of the building, form of government, and told interesting stories.

The tour is free but they only take limited number of people through ( 12) , you can get the tickets from the glass building opposite the Parliament. The guides are volunteers. We enjoyed the tour and we learned a lot from it. Really worthwhile spending the 45 minutes here. Loved the library, and the rotunda. You get the chance...
Free admission, even the tours. Security staff extremely courteous and polite. Great view from the "Peace Tower".
Did the outdoor tour and East Block tour the day after Canada day. Saw the Changing of the Guard Ceremony. Eevry Canadian should see it at least once.

I went on a very hot and sunny afternoon with a family member. If this is your first visit to Ottawa, I recommend you visit! There isn't much to do, but lots to see and many picture opportunities. You can go inside, but sadly I didn't get to.I went in the summer, where the building hosts a beautiful light...

This was a wonderful visit. The guide was great, knowledgeable and enthusiastic. Watched the changing of the guard first and then went on the tour. A truly great morning in a lovely city. The only downside was people taking photos in the commemoration room - so disrespectful and ought to be banned. Servicemen and women don't give their lives for...
Canada Day on Parliament Hill is something every Canadian should do once in their lives. Great entertainment, speeches were short and whole ceremony was over in an hour and a half.

We did the free ride up the Peace Tower to get a wonderful view of Ottawa! We also did a walking tour around the grounds. Only downside was it was right before Canada day so there were stages obscuring some views of the wonderful sight.

I have been to Ottawa many times but I have only been inside the Parliament Hill once. The free guided tour is well worth it. Make sure you go to the top of building to get a view of the whole city. The only negative I could not find reasonably priced parking nearby.

The buildings are beautiful and loaded with history. They have tours going out periodically in English and French and, at least when we went, were free of charge! Definitely go on a tour, you will learn and see a lot more than if you just went on your own!
Otttawa is beautiful. It is clean. You feel safe. Very historic. The sculptures are really cool. Don't miss the locks. The boat tour is also great. There is nothing I don't like about Ottawa.

The architecture is beautiful, all the little details inside the building are gorgeous. The tour is informative and on the day we went, lucky us they'd just added two rooms to the tour! The Reading Room and the Salon de la Francophonie. Because we went on a working day, there were no photos allowed to be taken from within the...

This was the high point of our week in Ontario and Quebec. The twenty minute tour provides just enough orientation, and then visitors have the freedom ( with a few stops at security) to sit in on the House of Commons, ascend the Peace Tower . . . We wished we had more time, and would definitely return!

I would recommend checking out the parliament buildings any time, however if you get the chance to visit on July 1st (Canada Day) you will not be disappointed, tons of people, lots of great music and an amazing fireworks show!

Canadian history at its best. Wonderful architecture, tour guide very informative, well organized. Might not be appreciated by very young children.
