The tour is FREE. Very interesting and informative. Security screen is the same as an airport. There are several tours a day. Can get crowded on holidays. Tour is in French or English
If you love historical buildings, these should be on your list of places to see. The grounds are lovely and the view is wonderful.
Parliament Hill is a scenic delight with a magical view of the Gatineau hills, the historic Ottawa river, the city of Ottawa, brilliant stone work on the building and much, much more!

It is an interesting and historical building where from the elected members sit. Yours are good with complete guidance, no charge. One can walk into the Senate and House when not in session. The library is spectacular. Great view behind the building of the Ottawa river. Great view from the clock tower of the city.
You must book a free tour of the Parliament buildings, Senate and House of Commons. Don't forget to go up to the top of the Peace Tower for a great view of the city and surrounding area.

If you ever come to Ottawa, this is a must see place. It's right in the middle of the city and has something for everyone. There is so much to learn and do there. The free tour of Parliment Buliding is done very well. From the clock tower you can see everything around and best of all walk to all...

A great place to visit (free too), especially on a warm rainy evening. It reminds me of London, England in some areas. Bring a picnic and find a place behind the Art Gallery which isn't far away. Up on the hill is a beautiful view of the Parliament Buildings and the city of Gatineau.

This is a must-see! Go early, may be fewer people. A few minutes' wait to get through security. Gothic building is spectacular, Manitoba granite, pretty retro House and Senate chambers that will be getting renovated over the coming years. Try to go up into the peace tower. Not super fun for kids, wouldn't recommend for under 9.

Definitely a must to see. It is educational, interesting and beautiful inside and out. AND Free. Walking distance to other sights around like the Ottawa Canal, Ottawa Locks, Sparks Street, Ottawa Market, Museums and many more!
don't forget to see the changing of the guard each summer morning on Parliament Hill. Also, ake certain to walk around the back to see the view of the Ottawa River and the Gatineau Hills.
Great day trip! Wonderful historical buildings and beautiful view of the Ottawa river from the gazebo on the west side of the building. Just a really nice place to visit.

Great place to learn about history. The guides are well informed and make the tour interesting. Buildings like this will probably not be built anymore since the labour costs would be prohibitive. There are nice walking paths close so it makes a great family outing.

I live in Ottawa all my life and I amm very proud of the Parliament Hil, Buildings, Rideau Canal, Chteau Laurier. Museums which reflects our Canadian History, come and visit Ottawa, you will be impress and happy
Very interesting and educational. You learn a lot about Canadian history and politics. If you go at the right time you can sit in on the legislature and the politicians.
You have to see the hill. Although it is a bit boring for the younger children. Make sure you go up the clock (the peace tower); they will love the view.

It's great for the whole family!! The great part of this tour is it is FREE!! I find it hard to do some things on vacation being a family of 4, that doesn't cost a small fortune! You will get a brief out simple history of these beautiful buildings, they are unbelievable! Going up to the top of the peace...

Not only a wonderful architectural feat ...but, also filled with historic significance ..with well-informed and charming guides to help you enjoy . Do NOT miss the Changing of the arms , on the front lawn.

If you're in Ottawa - this is a must-see! in addition to the historical and political value, the building is an architectural treasure, The view from the Peace Tower is worth waiting for and question period, if you can see it, is an education in itself! Plus, see the changing of the Guard if you visit in the summer.
Whenever someone visits me the first time I always take them them to the Parliament buildings.A lot of history and very educational.I live in Ottawa.
These buildings and the surrounding grounds and statues offer a lot more than meets the eye. If you appreciate architecture, don't miss this chance to see one of Canada's "jewels."

This tour is for free and it is worth seeing. You will see house of Common, house of Lords, Parliament Library and go up the Peace Tower, to enjoy great view of Ottawa. Elevator ride is quite unique, as guide will explain to you, once in it. So, come and see for your self, you won't regret it.

For the political and history buff. If you can get in on a guided tour, it will be far more interesting than visiting on your own. I was given a tour as part of a training program in the government. Guided tours are available to students and tourists.
Historic interest, beautiful architecture, superb guided tours. Canada has an interesting history and the guided tours help you to understand this. The scenery is also beautiful

Every Canadian should visit our nation's capital. The grounds and building are magnificent. Tours provide a great view and history lesson. You come away with a better understanding of what most people only see on TV...Another must see while visiting Ottawa

If you ever come to Ottawa, this is a must see place. I couldn't imagine not visiting here when your so close. There is so much to learn the tour was done very well. I enjoyed this excursion. It has been awhile so I'm not sure how much it cost, if anything.

The main reason for a trip to Ottawa is seeing the Parliament Hill. A great place to see with friends, family, kids, everyone... and best of all its FREE!! Nothing to lose by coming to this gorgeous building and its surroundings. Be sure to look around at all the amazing sights to see and remember to ask for "the hill...

Our young guide Andre provided a quick and excellent review of the history of the building. Try to go up the peace tower while waiting for your tour. Get tickets an hour early then do the tower, the memorial room and perhaps a bit of question period if you can stand the high school antics of our members of parliament.
Excellent sites to see.The art is amazing the tour was great.The only negative part of the experience was security.The girl at the check in room was rude and hard to deal with.No way to treat people.
Take the tour on Parliament hill....they don't say it is free when they ask you to sign up but it is!!

I'm a huge Canadian nut so to get to tour Parliament was just amazing! First off the tour is free! Our tour guide was super knowledgeable and so friendly. All the guards there were really nice! You are allowed to take pics all over except the library so that's a huge plus! Then you get to go into the peace...
This is a very interesting place to visit. There is a lot of history and beauty surrounding these majestic buildings. Great for all ages, and they often host other events at the parliament buildings.
Very interesting tour round parliament, free of charge. The view from the Peace Tower was fabulous. Sadly on a Wednesday the Senate and House of Commons are not open. The library is beautiful.
architecture was amazing. we came in winters so missed changin of guard but the strucrue itslf is gorgeous.

If touring Parliament Hill doesn't make you appreciate being Canadian (or visiting Canada) nothing will. It is iconic and accessible all at the same time. Strongly recommend the guided tours and the trip up the tower.
Very educational tour, tour guide Mickey was very knowledgeable and very entertaining! The architecture thru out the tour was spectacular , even saw the library. Well work the visit and its free!
Nice tour of parliament buildings including Senate and House chambers; well organized, good guide, good access to different rooms. Library is beautiful.

I've lived in Ottawa all my life, and aside from a school trip that I don't really remember, this was the first visit as an adult. The architecture is astounding. We wanted to go up to the Peace Tower, but the wait was too long, so we just wandered around.

Go early in the day to avoid large tour buses, be prepared to head through security and then take in the History Lesson!! Tours are free and interesting, tour guide was great at answering questions. The Library and the Peace Tower are the highlights!!

Our two families with four adults and kids ranging from 8 to 12 loved this tour. We visited the peace tower first, then joined the English-speaking tour. We saw both houses and the halls. The highlight was the library - just stunning. Almost makes you want to run for office just to have access to that space. Worth the time...
very pretty watching the change of guards...line up to get inside buildings was long but once inside lots to see..looking out back window onto the canal beautiful scenery..worth the visit..

The tours are free at the parliament buildings! Matthieu was our tour guide and he was very informative.The architecture of the buildings is amazing. I'd willingly come back for question period.We went up the peace tower which was a first and the view was great. Everyone was warm and welcoming. I'd come back for sure.

Full Of history and things to see and read, our nations Parliament Hill is a place to cherish and visit whether you live close or are visiting the area.Be sure to read the words and inscriptions above the doorways inscribed in the stone lintels...

Took the guided tour of Parliament. Tour guide was very knowledgeable. The tour was shorter than I thought it would be. The clocktower is a must do. The views of Ottawa are spectacular! The House was in session and we were able to get tickets to Question Period. This is a MUST DO!!

Although it has been a few years since our last visit, we still learned new things, and saw more in the beautiful architecture. All tours are free, and the guides are very knowledgeable. I suggest that you go on the weekend, and not during the week while parliament is in session, as the library is closed during sessions. The library...
All these sites were within walking distance of Lord Elgin Hotel there is a lot more to see.. within walking distance or short ride on bus if you don't want to walk, Ask hotel staff about tours.

Great tour of Parliament. Dominic, our guide, was very knowledgeable and pleasant. The library is a must see . . . breathtakingly beautiful! Everything is so well kept and clean. Only disappointment was that we were not allowed to visit the House of Commons as was in session. . . . maybe next time.

If you went to school in Canada, you've likely done the tour before, nothing has changed. Being a photographer, I would have liked a little more time to set up and shoot some photos. The guide was quite knowledgeable and we were able to see most of the building, but unfortunately the peace tower was closed. It was a fairly...

Been to the hill many times. Have brought friends and family at different times. The tours are offered frequently and are informative and interesting. Get times when you can see the house sitting from the balcony. A tour of the clock tower is a good experience with a great view of the city. Tour the grounds and then walk down...

The building was built during World War I, after the first one burnt down, so the architecture is newer, but meant to look old. The library is the only room that survived and all the wood is hand carved. It is absolutely beautiful. It was great to see the Senate room and sit in on the House of Commons. You...
If you're traveling to Ottawa this is a must see, lots of history! It's a great location and easily accessible by public transit, plus there's great shopping just down the road! :)
Check this out while you are in Ottawa - very interesting tour of the interior of the Parliament buildings. Be prepared to go through security on the way in.

It is the focal point for all of the Ottawa region. The fact that the grounds are still accessible by foot is testament to Canada's trustworthy nature. Great statues on the grounds, the view of Gatineau from back of the library, and tons of photographic architecture makes it a necessity for anyone visiting. Beautiful anytime of year.

Definitely recommend doing a tour of Parliament as part of a visit to Ottawa. As a newcomer to Canada I found myself learning a lot about the inner workings of the country's political system whilst taking in the beautiful surroundings of the Parliamentary complex. The tour is free and we arrived early on a Sunday morning as we heard that...
Really nice place to go, city got more places to watch. Also try to parliament hill in the day and in the night.
Take the time and go on a tour and make sure to go up the Bell Tower. The view is amazing. It's well worth the wait.
It's a good tour to do once in your life, especially if you're Canadian. We had a great guide, Laura, who knew how to take questions and got the children in our group asking most of them.
This was on my bucket list. Stayed in Ottawa's city center. Visited parliament hill in the day and in the night. Glad I finally got to see.
We did the tour and also went up the Peace Tower. Tour was excellent, the architecture is beautiful.
It is a beautiful place specially during the fall. All those colors are really great. Everything is awesome!

Having been here before, I got to play tour guide for my friend. We went one day and it was closed, but considering the time it was understandable. We walked the grounds and explored, agreeing to come back the next day. We did the Peace tower (my fave) and the tour. While the tour was about an hour long, it...

The min thing to see here is the changing of the guard. It is popular every day. The guards are dressed just like Her Majesty insists upon, althogh somehow, being Canadian, they are not quite as fearsome as their British counterparts.The buildings are distinguished, and command an imposing view and location over the river.

Let's be honest, Ottawa is not the most picturesque of the major cities in Canada. But the Parliament buildings and the nearby canal offer a very European and gothic adjunct to the otherwise drab scenery around town.

I absolutely loved the tour of Parliament Hill, Anna, the tour guide was simply amazing: enthusiastic, funny, super smart, knows that place by heart and also passionate about what she does, the history was even more interesting told by her and you could almost felt that you were there when all happened; the library is gorgeous as well as the...
if you are an architecture nut, you must see this building. The woodwork, and library alone are worth it!!

I took the free tour which allowed you to visit the infamous library (heard that unless you are going with a tour, no entrance allowed to this place).The tour guide is very knowledgable, after the tour we can go up to the tower. Theres a bit of a queue here, as this is the most touristy spot in Ottawa...

The parliament was everything I ever thought it would be. I really loved it and the tour guide was super nice. The library is beautiful and worth seeing. I thought it was so worth it and you definitely shouldn't miss it if you're in the city :)

The hill is full of ironies but it takes educated eyes to see some insights. The statute of the Queen on horseback, tucked away because it was not viewed favorably by Her Magesty. The statute of Pearson looking over the soulders of Diefenbaker at the Canadian flag as if to say "got you!". Do walk right around the grounds, fun...
Tour of the building was excellent. Loved the history of the parliament buildings. Library was stunning....

A must see if you are in Ottawa, the tour is free and we had a chance to have the full tour since it was a weekend and no sessions were taking place. The House of Commons Chambers, the Senator Chambers and the Library will take your breath away. Before the tour, we had a chance to go up the...

The Library will take your breath away. A true Canadian treasure. The free tour is great, all the guides are super nice and have lots of information. They were all passionate about the building and created a great experience for me.

The attraction itself is excellent - the Parliament buildings are beautiful, interesting and are a must-see for anyone visiting Ottawa. The girl giving the tour was very friendly and fluent in both English and French. Very good for a free attraction especially.The only thing that put a damper on our mood is how the security people treated the elderly...
Took the free tour @ Parliament House. The building is amazing & the view from the peace tower overlooking Ottawa is fantastic
The presenters were great and the building was fascinating, especially the library! Loved the history!

One of the highlights of my trip to Ottawa! I love the architecture..and the docents were really nice. I was there in the Fall so the fall colors made it stand out even more. I took some photos from the other side of the Ottawa River... Gorgeous! Highly recommend it!
Don't stop at taking a few photos of these magnificent buildings from the lawn. Be sure to take the free tour inside.
The history and architecture of the building are very interesting - a trip in the wonky lift is a must for a good view of Ottawa. Friendly despite being the seat of modern government.

We went to just look at the Winter / Christmas lights ~ Beautiful! Visitors from out of town wanted to see the Parliament buildings. We didn't have time to go in day light and our Guests were pleasantly surprised to see an unforgettable Night time view of the Parliament Buildings. Even though it was very cold, it was worth the...

We stopped only for a photograph and a short wander around the building.. If you have time when visiting do try to go around the back of the building for some spectacular views of St.Laurence river and the city

I toured the Centre block with my sister and we had a great time! Staff are kind and knowledgeable of all the questions asked, take the time to answer them and try to incorporate everything into the tour. Make sure to leave time for the Peace Tower, the lines are long but worth it.

Staff was very nice... Even the security guards... The outside is very impressive and for what we got to see it was beautiful. Words can describe it but it will take too long.... Simply put it was breathtaking!What I didn't like is that you have to make a long line to get in. Tours fill out fast and you...

As other reviewers have said this is a really rewarding free guided tour. The organisation is good and the tour interesting. Without doubt the highlight is the library, which is a beautiful area saved, as we were told, from a fire which ravaged the rest of the building. Interestingly the majority of visitors in our group were Canadians demonstrating that...

Once through security the tour was fast, knowledgeable and friendly. Guide was interesting and knowledgeable. Stay up with your tour or security will move you along. House not in session so unable to attend question period. Clock tower closed due to elevator problem. Library and senate chambers visited. Small gift shop. No food services available. Eternal flame and visit to...
Every Canadian should visit and tour the Parliament buildings. I.ve been three times and enjoyed each visit. Learn some Canadian history and see where the Canadian politics take place.
Amazing. Truly beautiful! It's sorry pretty lit up with holiday lights but even during the day it was majestic.
A memorable experience. Knowledgable, friendly guides.beautiful building, amazing architecture.All areas are easily accessed, cloakroom facilities. Free entrance.

We got to check out the Peace Tower quickly before our free tour started, which was a good thing since the elevator was having issues after our tour, so it was closed.Our Tour Guide Matteau (not sure about the spelling on that one, I just remember it was a unique spelling of "Matthew") was awesome! It was clearly not...

Seeing Parliament first-hand really drives home the idea that this is the center of our national government. It is an interesting experience, especially if you enjoy the history of it all. It is worth seeing at least once.

Wonderful building! Try to go on Sundays, they let you take pictures of every room, which doesn't happen in the middle of the week, besides you'll have the entire place for yourself (no politicians or media). The library was my favorite place, looks like an entirely different place.

Make sure you do the guided tour - especially if you have kids as it is very educational. It is best to do the tour on the weekend as you have access to more spots since the House of Commons and Senate are not in session
You can walk around the buildings... great views of the river and bridges. Views of Parliament are great from around the city. I did not go inside, but didn't really need to.
Had not been in many many many years. The security to get in was pretty intense, but once in, it was so beautiful! Thanks so much for the amazing tour. The library alone is well worth it!
The Parliament Hill buildings sits on a hill that overlooks the Ottawa river. The buildings are historical and political. If you re visiting Ottawa, don't miss this opportunity. The visits are free.
Architecturally and historically fascinating , if parliament in session can be politically interesting, and the view from the bell tower is amazing!

We visited Parliament Hill on a Saturday, everything was FREE. Changing of the Guard, parking, and building tours. We really enjoyed this day, we still talk about it as being one of the favorite parts of our trip.
Easily accessible, statues abound in the grounds and the Centennial flame makes an excellent first point of interest when stepping in from Wellington Street.

You need to make the time to see all that is there on Parliament Hill - up to the top of the Peace Tower, the Book of Remembrance, into the House and Senate Chambers, a peak into the newly-renovated Victoria Library and a tour around the grounds - getting a good guide is a big part of the experience as...

The Parliament buildings are beautiful (although one was under construction which was unfortunate). The staff were very knowledgable and friendly and it was a great visit. Will definitely return in the summer.

Visiting the Parliament buildings should be on every Canadians' to-do list. If possible, visit when parliament is in session. It's shocking to see our MPs often acting like children, yelling across the centre aisle and disrupting other MPs responses. You'll also see the official ruling party refusing to give direct answers to many questions from the opposition. The building's history...

Very informative tour, but book or arrive early to ensure you see the Memorial Chamber in the Peace Tower, and go up to the Observation deck for a wonderful 360 view of Ottawa.And a short walk away is underground parking at the World Exchange Plaza. On weekends you can park for free at the employee lots to the north...

Pretty interesting. I'm guessing that there can be a considerable wait to get in during tourist season; we were there in late Oct. and had to wait almost an hour. Fun if you can arrange to go when Parliament in session.

I enjoyed this visit. The parliament building is a rebuild following the fire at the beginning of the 20th century, however the old library is the original and it is beautiful. We weren't allowed to linger long and I would have liked to have spent longer than the 10 mins we had there. There is a very interesting historical commentary...

Formerly open freely to the public, movement and views are now somewhat restricted.This is an outing for adults and children about 10 and older. Otherwise, just stories about dead guys. Except for the best thing on the hill, the statue of the Famous Five, the brave and brilliant women who fought to have women declared Persons so that Mrs....

A must for Canadians and strongly recommended for other nationalities. This free tour starts at 0915 - after a tight security clearance - and runs regularly every day. If Parliament is not sitting, you get a chance to see more. It shows you over a lovely building (particularly the Parliamentary Library) and the views from the Tower are great. Take...

I took my visiting mother-in-law from MN, and my son to Ottawa for the "Canadian" experience. We naturally decided Parliament Hill was the best place for that.The trip into Ottawa was easy with our GPS, but locating parking was terrible!!! The public garages were small and hard to maneuver, once to the top we had to turn around since...

apart from the history theres not much to do here i admit taht the flames look cool and the buildings are nice but other than that theres nothing else if you`re someone who enjoys the history then go here if not then take a quick look and keep going but its free and its a good spot to be romantic

We walked at night after dinner and they are so beautiful and with the lighting and the flame it really looked so impressive. The detail in the stone & wood are absolutely amazing and just to think of all that history and the people that have been there. I am in awe and so proud to be Canadian.

Took our American Guests to see our Parliament buildings last summer, and found the house of Commons in disarray due to some revamping/cleaning that was going on....imagine seeing a vacuum cleaner hose strewn across the floor of the house of commons!!! .... and that was embarrassing. Elevator to the top of the Peace tower also out of service....disappointing! Altogether, this...
If Parliment is in session. Check out Question Period. Best to contact your local MP in advance and they will look after arrangements.

Line up across the street from the parliament building to get yout free tickets. Get there early ish to get a center block tour later in the day. You can choose a time, say early after lunch. However, since you will have some down time waiting for the center block tour, take tickets for the outside walk/tour around the center...
Parliament Hill in Ottawa is the best attraction in the city and easily accessible. You can get a free guided tour if you do your research. It was a wonderful experience.

A visit to the Parliament buildings while in Ottawa is a must. The history that has been made behind the walls of the building is earth shattering. THe entire Parliament hill is worth the visit and it shows the pride that Canadians have.

Of course you must do this if visiting town. Go up the peace tower, the line is not usually that long. It's a great view of the city and a must for all Canadians at least once. I have been several times while living in Ottawa. Usually once every time someone new comes to visit.

If you are not there for a special occasion like Canada Day or Remembrance day plan to pass through to another attraction. I would say it is a must-do if you are a Canadian. There are many worthwhile attractions nearby and plan on an interesting down town Ottawa visit.
Canada's capital has pleasant grounds to walk around and explore. The Centerblock has tours in both English and French. Even if you are not politically savy, the architecture alone is very beautiful.
Absolutely beautiful building filled with history. The Library of Parliament is within and is the crown jewel. The carved woodwork is un parallelled!

The Parliament Buildings are a very interesting tourist attraction, and a great place for families to visit. If you do not wish to see inside the buildings, you can always spend the afternoon wandering around the grounds, viewing the many statues and magnificent architecure. If you do take a tour inside, you have the chance to run into Sir John...
Nowhere else in North America can you see architecture of this type. It is European in nature. In fact between this and Quebec City it is a piece of Europe. Ottawa is so clean and friendly and safe.

My trip to the parliament buildings was with my school. We got a tour of the entire buildings, including the west and east wings. We also viewed the main building, peace tower (and saw the bell), the library, and the house of commons. There is a building for homeless cats on the grounds which is really nice, and some of...

The architecture might get you there, however, you'll remember the interesting stories about the people who have worked there over several generations of politicians. Children will enjoy a trip to the top of the Peace Tower. Adults will want to linger in the library. Plan half a day, which includes the time to get tickets and go through security.

If you are coming to Ottawa, Canadian or someone from Harvard who has just learned that Ottawa is the capital city of Canada the Parliament Building is a fist see on the list of what do see in Ottawa. If you are here in the summer you can see the "changing of the guard" each day. This is a British...

Tours of the Parliament Buildings are a must when visiting Ottawa. It is a walk through history with many interesting aspects regarding the history of Canada. If Parliament is in-session during your visit, you may even get to sit in the visitors gallery and see legislation in action. Well worth the visit.
It's a must see in Ottawa and it's the Icon of the Canada. Where you can see the English heritage in our culture.

The library is the one aspect of the Parliament that survived a fire many years ago. Although the public cannot access the library there is a tour of Parliament that enables the visitor to see the inside of the library. It is wonderful!

Parliament Hill and the whole site is a spectacular place to visit. Whether you visit it for Canada Day (July 1st) to take in the entertainment and fireworks, or visit it year-round to see the inside of these amazingly restored buildings, you will be in awe! The House of Commons, The Senate and the Parliamentary Library are not to be...

I literally only had an hour or so before I had to head to the airport. Wish I had more time, but managed to drive into downtown and find convenient easy pay parking.A short walk later I had made a loop that gave spectacular views of Parliament Hill, the Ottawa River and the Notre Dame Basilica.I would suggest...

If your traveling to Ottawa this is a must. The site is magnificent, don't forget to walk behind the building for breathtaking views of the Ottawa River, Gatineau, and the Gatineau Hills, and the library is worth the visit all on it's own. If you want a quick history of Canadian government and how it works day to day this...
Not only beautiful but also a source of great pride in our history and our future. A must see for all Canadians.

An impressive building with lots of history. The only original part left untouched by a large fire decades ago is the library...an important being in itself. Be sure to go up the peace tower for views of the area. Tour guides will fill you in as to what you're looking at!
This building is a waste of tax payers money. I was expecting some fancy Roller coaster ride bit all I got was History info.

Living very close to Ottawa its always our favourite summer time visit ,as you can watch the changing of the guard on Parliment Hill in the morning, and take a tour the building in the afternoon. For lunch theirs the Byward Market ( loads of resturants) around the corner from the Parliment building , along with the fresh fruit and...

We live in Ottawa, so we are very familiar with this site and still love it. May is a great time to visit, because you're in the city for Tulip Festival and the iron fence behind the Centre Block is lined with lilacs in full bloom, making the view of the Ottawa River even more spectacular and fragrant.The Parliamentary...

I live here and if I take visitors to only one site in Ottawa, it's Parliament. It's worth walking around back when your tour is over--the view of the Ottawa River and the Gatineau Hills is very pretty. There's also a very beautiful walking path along the river, available to the east of the hill. Just walk down beside the...

This is probably the most important attraction to see in Ottawa. Parliament Hill is a beautiful building to see inside and outside and provides rich history of governing system of Canada. There is a free tour of the Centre Block and you are allowed to go up the Peace Tower as well for free. After the tour, take a stroll...

No trip to Ottawa is complete without a trip to Parliament Hill. If you have time, do the tour indoors. If you don't have time, then have a walk around the buildings, take in the view over the river, think about the history...

Guided tours of the Centre Block and East Block (peak season only) are free. You get your ticket under the front main doors with a scheduled time. Return for the tour at the time on your ticket. If you have to wait, go for the ride up the Peace Tower. The views are wonderful. Peak up the elevator shaft on...

Great to see, if you have the luck of going when session are on interesting to see. Also taking the walk up the bell town is good. Lots of history of course - if you come to Ottawa you need to go. Also drive around the Quebec side to see the view of it over the river.

We went on the tour of the Parliament buildings. You pick up your free ticket under the front of the main doors. They give you a card with a time of the tour. We had a hour before our tour so we went up the Peace tower. Our tour was very informative showing House of commons, library and Senate. It...

We walked up to the Peace tower before we joined the guided tour to Parliament Hill. Views from the Peace tower were awesome. The walking tour was informative and interesting. The librarywas just exquisite. We thoroughly enjoyed the tour.

The parliament buildings are very nicely designed with the Peace Tower standing prominently in front modelled on our Big Ben. As i entered the walkway there is a living flame at the entrance which is an excellent photo opportunity. I then entered the main building and passed through similar security as at airports which is understandable considering the importance of...

I went on the free tour when the House of Commons and Senate were not in session so was able to see both chambers, the Peace Tower, National Library and caucus rooms. I have tried to go before but access then was very limited as the representatives were in the building. From the Peace Tower you can see almost 360...
If all you do is walk around centre block and take in the architecture, that would be great, but we went up the peace tower for a fabulous view, went for a tour, and even took in question period.
Absolutely stunning - need to go in and see it! The guides are very nice and knowledgable, definitely worth it. The library is a must.

I live in Ottawa, so therefore I am not a tourist and perhaps more than a little biased when it comes to this attraction. Today, I spent the afternoon on Parliament Hill because it is such a beautiful, quiet, peaceful place to visit and take photographs. I am in awe of the wonderful job of restoration that was recently completed...

A trip to Ottawa is not a trip to Ottawa without going to see Parliament Hill! Being Canadian, I feel every Canadian should see their capital. This was one of the highlights of our trip to Ottawa. After seeing it on TV for many years, it felt surreal to actually be standing in the building and absorbing the history and information. A walk around the grounds is neccessary too.. fantastic views overlooking the river to Gatineau. The tickets for the tour were free, but we had...

I spent many weekends here as a foreign student who was studying at Carleton. The library is a definite must see. But the grounds, the peace and beauty that the monuments and place provide are certainly worth more than one visit. Whenever in town, this is a must visit for me. This is Ottawa!!!!!
This is a lovely building, both interior and exterior. Highly recommend a tour if you have the opportunity. Very interesting.
We went there in the evening and next day to visit the parliament - it is just beautiful and it's great for a walk after dinner and you will have plenty of photo opportunity at any time of the day

The parliament building is a must tour when in Ottawa. We went on weekend so there was more open for public tour. Saw the House of Commons, the senate and the library. Also make sure to go up the Peace Tower - where the added bonus is the great view if Ottawa. Would have been a better view if it...

We found they gave free tours throughout the week and took one. The guides are friendly and they do have a sensible security check system. They take you throughout the building but not into the chambers while Parliament is in session. The Library is the star though. Simply beautiful. The design and stunning turned wood and wrought iron almost defy...
I am invited to say what I like and what I dislike about Ottawa, but this is very difficult, because I dislike nothing about it!

Great Education! Our tour guide (Francois?) was great and made it interesting for everyone and was able to answer all questions asked! :) It's a shame more schools don't take trips there..my elementary nor high school had a trip there..AND it was free!!

I don't care what you're in town for, make the time to walk around the grounds of the Parliament Building. They pair amazing Gothic architecture complete with spires, flying buttresses and carved gargoyles and lions with an even better view. Don't forget to walk around the back of the building, where you will see the Ottawa River, which separates Ontario...
Get there early for a great experience with a good guide. We were there on a Sunday and arrived at 9.25 and got into the 9.50 tour.The Peace Tower is a must for fantastic views over Ottawa.

One of these moments that you feel proud to be a Canadian. So much history that we forget. High light of my trip was the view from the Peace Tower and the ability to attend a session in the House of Commons.
We really enjoyed walking around Parliament Hill. The surrounding scenery is beautiful. Unfortunately we were not able to go inside the buildings but I'm sure they would have been incredible also.
A very knowledgable tour guide. Unfortunatley the peace tower was closed. Able to see both chambers and the foyer. The library is a must for all Canadians to see.
Try to be there for the turning of the pages of the war dead books(11AM). Don't miss the views from the Peace tower. Well worth the wait! Tour was well worth the price(free).

Magnificent views of the river, Parliament, the Library and statues of historic figures. Awe inspiring. The Parliament Hill cats, however, appear to have been relocated. I used to like seeing them too.
Very nice architecture and the tour is ok as well. Its short if you cannot see the House of commons. Check the schedules before going to confirm if its open for tours.
People go in, nothing gets done, but they give an awesome tour! Beautiful buildings too! I liked the buildings, not so much the people in them, mostly because I voted the other way.

Parliament Hill and the buildings are a must on any one's visit to Canada's Capital. Even locals should make a point of visiting it once every season. The grounds are well kept with a fine array of historical monuments surrounding the Centre Block. Make sure you go for a tour of the Centre Block and the Peace Tower. All for...

We decided to visit the Parliament and were not disappointed. The visit was 45 minutes long which is great with children (not younger than 7 years old though). The guide knew so many things and was very easy to talk to, we learned many things and my daughters loved it (especially the library which is gorgeous!). I really recommend it!

Any visitor to Ottawa should take time to see the wide variety of activities on Parliament Hill:- (free) tour the Parliament Building to see the House of Commons, Senate, Parliamentary Library and historical artlifacts;- (free) to watch a Session of Parliament (usually October to May);- on the front lawn (free), watch the Changing of the Guard (check...
Majestic buildings and friendly, helpful staff. The tour group is a little on the large size, so be prepared for a crowd. My 11 year old son really enjoyed it!
This is a must see! Do not miss the opportunity to visit Parliament Hill. Great free tours inside the peace tower and library. Fantastic architecture, enjoy!

I took a summer evening walk around Parliament Hill to look at the buildings and surrounding views. The area is wonderfully historic and I was enthralled with the view looking down on the turbulent river.

This is very interesting. During the summer the tour of the East Block is done with actors so like a play moving from room to room. The Centre block you can visit all year and go sit in on sessions if you want. Lots of security and you have to go through security machines a couple of times.
While we did not go inside the buildings themselves we did get to hear a little about the government and see the Parliament itself.

A visited Parliament Hill a couple of weeks ago. Unfortunately we were too late in the year for the changing of the guards but it was still worth the trip. It was great to see the buildings up close, the architecture is simply beautiful.
I liked this. In all, it took about 2 hours for the visit. Our guide, Philippe, was very nice and he really tried to give us some fun facts. The visit is free so that is always a plus...

Parliament Hill, where it all began so many years ago. Many of us see it on TV, but then you get a chance to stand up close and take it all in, you can not be amazed by the sight. From the green copper roof line, to the historic brick construction, you can't possibly take it in, all in one...

We've visited Parliament a couple times now. We live in Ottawa but we are not from here. Every time we get visitors they want to do the tour. Its free, which is great. It also changes slightly depending on when you go. If the house is sitting then you can't view the area used by the members of parliament. If...
This is a beautiful area to take a walking tour. The buildings and the Rideau Canal are both very fascinating, and the grounds and flower beds are very pretty

You get your tickets across the street. You will need to go through security to get in. If not in session, you will be brought into the chambers where the government conducts the business of running the country. Tours are thorough and informative. You come away smarter and with a good understanding of how the government works, the history of...
This is well worth a visit & a tour to see where decisions for our country are made. Beautiful architecture.

Parliament hill is one of the must sees while visiting Ottawa. It is always helpful to arrange a tour before hand as to ensure you see and hear all about the historical and present day workings of parliament. If you come in summer you can take in the changing of the guard, winter visitors will get to skate on the...

If visiting Ottawa make sure to visit the Parliament Buildings. The architecture inside and out is not to be missed. Check the site first via computer to make sure that the building is not closed. Sometimes the building is shut for special events. Go early to make sure you will be able to get access on the day you are...
Wish I had more time to go in and visit but the sun was out and walking was preferred. What a wonderful building
The parliament is in a very nice building that deserves a visit. The peace tower has a niice view to all Ottawa. The library is also very interesting

I was thoroughly impressed with the idea of offering free visitor tours to walk-in tourists with a knowledgeable tour guide enthusiastically explaining all about the Canadian Parliament. Worth the time and efforts sans any entry fee!

If you have seen enough of Canada sight from outside let's see something from inside! the tour guide will explain everything done inside the political kitchen and how the laws are cooked :)It is really nice to now how the top people in the country are working to make the great Canada what it is now.Piece of Advise:...
Very pleasant place to wander. Excellent architecture and place to sit and let the world go by. Have a look at the "Famous Five"
It's a nice walk if the weather is nice. It's free and the tour guides are really helpful. Also go to the peace tower, because the view from there is beautiful :)
Pictures do not do the Hill justice. The buildings and setting are absolutely magnificent! For added pop go up the Peace Tower on a sunny day and the vista is remarkable

You absolutely can not visit Ottawa without visiting Parliament Hill and Buildings. It's breathtaking. It's a lovely walk, if the weather is cooperative. You have the opportunity for pictures, they have Mounties out and often ready for pictures as well. It's really nice to see history signs posted so it can also be a learning experience. Great for children as...

Don't miss taking the inside tour of the Parliament building if you come to Ottawa. ( However, check ahead to be sure it is open to the public for tours when planning what day to come. We visited on a Sunday and were told that tours would not be available the next two days because foreign heads of state would...
The free tour of the Parilament building and Peace Tower is very good and well-worth the time. We went at 9am to get the first tour at 9.20 am. Views from the Peace Tower are very good.

I have visited the parliament buildings before. they put on a wonderful tour and history of the buildings. We got to see the Italian Prime Minister, Mr. Harper, the red carpet, the band, marching guards and the twenty-one gun salute. If you know a celebrity will be visiting, do get there to see the going on.

Got to see this on our first evening in Ottawa. We were amazed how good it looked lit up especially with the etern flame. We went again the next day and the buildings and statues we saw on the self tour walk we very interesting. There was a pavilion to commemorate police officers who'd been killed in the line of...

Parlament hill is really nice and all but it gets boring fast. there`s a lot of history there but it get`s boring. the flames are cool but other than that it`s just a building that looks big and old. I`d say dont make a full day to just look at this place it will get boring fast

It was a beautiful day which made this site even more attractive. We took a (free) guided tour which was well organized, informative, and just about the right length. Slightly disappointed that they closed access to the Peace Tower 10 minutes early so if you want to do that don't leave it to the last minute. The upside was that...

It would be a waste to admire the picturesque parliament buildings only from the outside when you can get a guided tour free of charge. You can pick up a free ticket for a tour at a time of your choice from the visitor center just across the street. After going through airport-style security, your guide will show you around...

Must do if you visit Ottawa. For none Canadians, if gives you a informative and in depth look into the history of Canada, and how our government works. For a Canadian like me, it gives me pride and pleasure to visit the center of our nations government. The guide, Victoria, was so informative and also proud of what she was...
We took some of our American friends here and they loved it - it made us all even prouder to be Canadians.
I like the Arquitectureand the clean of this buildingI do not like was crodewd and I think is expensive for poor pleople

We had visited the Parliament tour in the past but this visit just walked around the grounds after the changing of the guard when we were told about the sound and light show at night. We came right before dark with folding chairs and found a good location facing the Parliament Building. The sound and light show was better than...

Free tickets can be obtained across the street (or right at the center building on weekends). A very informative and beautiful tour that puts you right in the midst of the workings of contemporary Canadian government. We were lucky enough to have a current Member of Parliament along on our tour, and so we benefited from his occasional comments. But...
But especially at sunset and sunrise for amazing views, and wonderful walking tours. Views over the river are just and amazing as Parliament itself. But the buildings are simply wonderful.
We didn't go into parliament for a tour but we did walk around the grounds and it was lovely. Well worth taking time out and doing.

Was a lot of walking but worth the walk. We had a great tour guide and you could go up to the top of the tower and see the whole city. Gift shop was a little high but the gift were nice. Be sure to take lots of pictures.

Parliament Hill is a must when traveller is visiting Eastern Canada. The best time of visit should be summer after mid July and before September since they have a free sound and light show at night during that time.Tips- Check their website before you go: http://www.parl.gc.ca/Visitors/planning-e.asp#link4. They have a free guide tour everyday from July 2 - Labour...

Our guide knew his history and government. Excellent description and introduction to the building. Unfortunately, we were not permitted in the Parliament chambers because of meetings going on. Be sure to take the elevator to the observation deck of the tower. That space is just below the clock face. Fascinating, valuable view of the river, canal, downtown, and city.

One of the iconic sites of Ottawa; if you come to Ottawa for the first time, you just see these buildings. Beautiful copper roofs and old architecture. And the occasional demonstrator parading around on the outside makes it interesting! There's a nice fire fountain right at the front, lots of green space, and at night there's a nice light show...

As this visit was after Labour Day not certain about tours. However, when we arrived found that you just queued, which was very short. Then through a security check, which was handled well and then waited for the tour to start on the hour.We were taken through various parts of the building and was able to look in the...

It is a must see if you are in Ottawa. The location, architecture and views were great. There were protests everyday when we walked by but they didn't bother anyone. There is a nightly show that was really cool as well. Overall very impressed, glad i went to see them. There are guides that will show you around and tours...
Location and architecture was great. Lots of green space, but not allowed to sit or walk on it. The guides really know their stuff and a trip to the peace tower is well worth it.
I am very impressed with the Canadian Parliament buildings.The people are friendly towards all tourists.
The Parliament building look amazing. They have a guided tour inside for free. It was very informative and intereting.

I brought a group of seniors to tour the parliament hill and building the first week after the US Labor Day. It was simply awesome! We were not able to book a guided tour so we just did a self guided tour. The line to go up to the Peace Tower was not too bad so we were able to...

Visited the working parliament building and had a great tour, including the amazing library and upper chamber, then up the peace tower for incredible views of the city. A great, informative and awe inspiring visit, made all the better due to it being completely free. A must-see if you visit Ottowa
we were attending a wedding receptionat the top of conference centre and we had a lovely vieww of the parliament building
lovely to go into the parliament building and see the political history of Canada so may thing are just like the UK and go up the tower great views of the city

Good free interior guided tour that explains the historical and current government structure as well as aspects of Canada's relationship to the UK and US. We also did the free clock tower visit which was worth the wait even in the rain.FYI - You need to get tickets across the streen from Parliment for a designated tour time. So...

breathtaking, make sure your camera is fully charged! There is extesnive construction currently going on for the west building, but it doesn't really detract from the grounds - there's so much to see! Rent a bike if you're short on time.

I really enjoyed visiting the parliament buildings! We were on a tour and it was an amazing experience. There were great decorations and rooms. The service was really friendly. I enjoyed it. The library was beautiful. It was so neat to see it. If I am back in Ottawa I will return and I recommend the parliament buildings to anyone.

The Parliament buildings are a must with manicured grounds- be sure to take a camera and wear comfortable shoes. You will also see Canada's national police force the RCMP in their scarlet tunics. Tours are free.
Well kept grounds and beautiful Government buildings make Ottawa, the Capitol of Canada, a must-see. It is great to be able to walk around the grounds with no restrictions.

On a recent visit from the UK my wife and I had the fortunate experience to visit the Parliament Buildings which was both spectacular and informative. We manage to visit both chambers and were given an insight into the early interesting history of the birth of Canada. The tour is free and should not missed when visiting the Capital. Also...

Even though I am not a Canadian citizen, I found the tour of the Parliament very interesting. It's amazing how easy access to the building is. Obviously, there is a lot of security, but they are really open to allowing photography and showing off the building. Parliament was not in session when we visited, so we had full access to...
It is so nice to walk around the grounds and see all these amazing architectural buildings. It was filled with all kinds of events for Canada and there was no better place to celebrate!

Every evening in the summer there is a Sound & Light Show at the Parliament Hill main building.Kinda like having a Las Vegas fountain show at the White House, except it's tasteful and educational! Telling the story of how Canada came about and her diversity.Times are:July, 10 pmAugust, 9 :30 pmSeptember, 9 pmDefinitely a...

I loved the whole tour. I didn't pay much attention to the guide...was too busy looking around. The peace tower was beautiful, and the memorial to our solders was humbling. I could have spent all day in there.

From the incredibly well organised ticketing system, security and entry procedures to the excellent guided tour (free) this is an excellent trip full of history and beautiful architecture. Don't miss the excellent portraits which you wiz past in the corridors: each prime minster chooses the artist and incudes something from his hometown in the picture - try to spot it!

Where we come from, most people don't know where Ottawa is, let alone visit. For this reason, we looked forward to taking a tour of Parliament and visiting the area. With our limited time, we took a tour of both the Centre block and the East block. Tours are easily done with the signs directing you where to get tickets....
Interestingly you can visit parliment as if you are roaming around some public place, havent seen such freedom at any other place [not the one I visited before Canada]

Visiting capital of Canada is definetly worth! its more calm then other big cities like Toronto or Montreal but the architecture will get you! Parliment complex is very beautiful and behind it you can see the Ottawa river flowing . There were also free beawers in the garden around the parliment building!
Great tours of centre and east block. Get your tickets early as they do run out. The tours are FREE.

A great place to visit, lots of space to stroll and enjoy the buildings and views. Go around the back of the buildings for terrific views over the Ottawa River and beyond. See the Centennial Flame, get a free tour of the buildings, and don't miss the Mosaika, a free sound and light show on summer evenings, magical. Good washroom...
Found the free tour really fascinating and educational. It was long enough, and the guide was very knowledgeable and approachable.

Every Canadian in particular should visit the parliament buildings at least once. While we all can be cynical about government, visiting somehow gives you a little more appreciation for having a democracy. It is too easy to disconnect and be critical of something you don't experience. The buildings are amazing, the library is remarkable and is a must see. Watch...
Liked the tour, loved the Afghanistan tribute or exhibit (not sure what to call it) the peace tower and memorial room were something to see

Absolutely outstanding tour of the inside of Parliament Buildings - our young tour guide was doing his last tour and he gave it his everything though I imagine every tour is a great one. Such an amazing tour to learn about our forefathers and the history of how and when the various provinces came together to make what we know...

We did both the outside tour and the inside tour for the full Parliament experience.The outside most covers the architecture history of the various buildings and stories about the statues around the grounds. The interior tour covers some architecture, but mostly government and it's processes. Library is breath taking!Each tour was over an hour and the only dull...
You would need to be in line by 8:30 to get free tour tickets as they are limited and go away soon. Pick center building tour. It takes about 2 hr for the tour.

The exterior of the building is an impressive sight, but step inside and you'll be in awe. I recommend that you take the free guided tour that is offered so that you can gain an understanding of how the parliamentary system works.
Very British in character - shades of Changing of the Guard at Buckingham Palace but with a Canuck twist.

The atmosphere is great, the joy and excitement of Canadians from all walks of life reunite at Parliament Hill every 1st of July to Celebrate Canada Day. Fireworks and shows are amazing. The place to be.... When it comes to food you need to be a little patient because all the restaurants will be full.... and will take a while...

The Parliament buildings inside and out are impressive. We had a guided tour which was very interesting. Parliament should have been in session but fortunately for us, due to a political problem, the start had been delayed so we got to see inside the chambers. Don't miss the stunning library.

This is the seat of Canada's government. Take the free tour and visit all of the important Parliment's offices and rooms. The docents are well informed and no question goes unanswered. We found this to be one of the highlights in Ottawa.
If you do the inner tour of the center building, you MUST go I the library. It is beautiful! Walk around the perimeter for great views of the building and of the canal and the province of Quebec.

The tour was free and full of helpful information. They even let you go into the Senate and House of Commons. The building was full of amazing architecture and history. I cannot recommend going up to the peace tower I waited almost an hour for a view of Ottawa, while it was cool it was not worth the hour I...

Getting a tour of the Parliament in Ottawa was worth it! I was mostly impressed with the library as well as the peace tower from where you can take beautiful landscape pictures of the city. Please note that the tour tickets have to be taken from an office across the street from the Parliament buildings.

Great tour! Try to get the free tickets before noon as they seem to be taken up by 1PM. Tour is about 45 min in length with the option to go up the Peace Tower afterwards (another 30-45 min depending on the line).

I wanted to take my grandson to see the Parliament buildings and have a tour through them so that he could appreciate Canada a bit more....it was great and the light show that takes place every evening was great too!

I've had the opportunity to tour the Centre Block Building in 2001 and 2008. Tickets are free. The tour guides are very personable and knowledgeable. The Neo-Gothic stonework is stunning. While you can only look in the chamber of the House of Commons, you are taken into the Senate Chamber, the Red Chamber. The Library of Parliament, the only part...

An absolute must see for a newbie to Ottawa. You see more if the Govt is not in session. But since holiday dates are not set for that reason, que sera,sera.You get tickets in advance in the building right across from Parliament - gives you a tour time later in the day. Go early and then do something else...

It was truly a great feeling to be on the actual grounds and inside the actual building of Canada's parliament. It's hard to explain, but once you are there, you begin to appreciate the significance of this place to our great country. I can't wait to go again!
Very interesting free tour conducted by knowledgable guide. We learnt a lot about Canadian politics.
We didn't visit inside, so I can't say much. All buildings look so much nicer close up. This was walking distance from our hotel.

On Saturday of a long weekend we visited the Sound and Light show - Amazing !! I have seen shows in Athens and at the pyramids but this really takes the cake and not just because I am Canadian. The show highlights the history of Canada and its people in an imaginative way and emphasizes the breadth of the country...

I visited this wonderful building recently. There were many things going on that day so the tour was different than usual. We got to see The Reading Room that I hadn't been in before. I always see something different even though I have been many times.We were lucky enough to be able to take advantage of very short lines...

Love the pomp and pageantry , toe tapping and very colourful, everyday at 10:00 am. The tour of the Peace tower was informative and the memorial book excellent. Be sure to take a walk around the grounds and view from the back in he park.

Very easy to get tickets. What a way to bring history to life. The guided tour is quick and efficient.It moves quickly but is well orchestrated. Much better than readying a book on the workings of Parliament.

We did not do the tour or go up in the Peace Tower but just walking around was nice, and the views of the Ottawa River behind the Parliament building are awesome. If you go to the National Gallery nearby (10-15 minute walk) you can walk up to an area that overlooks the Hill from the other side of the...

Visited the Houses of Parliament wit my cousins from overseas and the 45min tour was succinct, informative and enjoyable. The view from the Peace Tower was great but, unfortunately, I couldn't walk up.

The guided tour of the parliament was one of the highlight of our trip to Ottawa. You can get your ticket at the Hill Center across the street from the Parliament. The tours are offered either in English or French.We were able to visit the House of Commons, the library, the meeting room, and the Senates. All were very...

Free tours in the day showing loads of inside, well-informed, and then free to walk around outside. Then a great (free, again) light show in the evening. What's not to like?! An excellent centre to the Captial.

We were visiting the parliament with kids and all had a good time.You must get your tickets early as the tour has limited spots and the tickets usually run out by early afternoon.The tour is free and when you get the ticket for the tour, you dont have to wait there, just come back at the appointed time....
A great display of lights and images shone on the entire size of the Parliament buildings. It was spectacular & the people gathered on the lawn were all friendly & so peaceful.

We didn't have time to try any tours we just walked around a bit randomly. There are lots of plaques to read and there is a FREE tour of Parliament Hill that we found out about as we were heading back. GORGEOUS views, public wash-rooms by the Rideau Canal Museum. Area was very clean and we felt safe. There are...

We had an amazing tour guide - Colin from Quebec. The tour was extremely interesting, entertaining and educational. A great way to get a brief education on the history of Canada. The building is very impressive and beautiful. There is a nice view from the tower at the end.

Regrettably I missed the mosaica show due to sketchy weather but I did the 60 minute indoor tour. You have to go across the street to the south to pick up a free ticket with a tour time. The tour was 60 minutes long and ends at the Peace Tower. Very entertaining and informative. I think our guide really enjoyed...

We took the free tour because my kids and I needed to fill some time and honestly it was free. We are US citizens so don't know much about Canadian hostory. Very impressed with the knowledge of the guide, entertaining stories that even my kids found enjoyable and gorgeous architecture. Recommend it if you have time
Lots of history and a fantastic view of Ottawa. However the line ups are very long and it took almost 1.5 hours before we reached the viewing platform. The view however was worth the wait.

Had Katherine as our tour guide. She was wonderful. Full of facts, sprinked with humour. Amazing architecture, I would go back for another tour. The highlight was definitely the library, it was gorgeous. Saw where Harper, Mulcair and Justin Trudeau sat in the Commons. Lots of beautiful portraits, nice commentary by Katherine on the history behind some of the backgrounds...

We took the guided tour of the Parliament Buildings Centre Block. The guide was excellent and answered all our questions. This is the main attraction for any first time visitor and a must. We went early and watched the changing of the guards before the tour. Also, do the peace tower while you are there. Well worth it!
Lots to learn about Canadian Government history and how it is structured. The building architecture is very cool.

Plan to spend a lot of time on Parliament Hill. There are many statues and monuments on the grounds. Get a guide of Parliament Hill from the Visitor Information Center or an information kiosk. These are very helpful, especially if you are not from Canada. Don't miss:1) The free tour of the Central Block including the Peace Tower. Timed...
Was able to see the Changing of the Guards, the Mosaika night show, tour Parliament, go up the Peace Tower. Amazing building and informed docents. Great visit.

Visiting from England, we wanted to see the Canadian parliament buildings on our tour or the area. As we entered the building the security staff looked at us, ordering us to put our bags in the x-ray machine and to go threw the metal detector. They were just so rude. Putting that behind us we followed a tour guide that...

The majesty - the history - the architecture - the mystery of knowing that so much of our life was created here; that so many great people walked these grounds and did what they did to enhance our democracy and freedom

A fascinating history of the country and the city in particular in one tour. Both chambers are very opulent yet with all the modern trappings - desks, microphones, sockets etc. All appear very workable.The library, located at the rear of Centre Block, is just stunning. Located in the chapter house it's walls and stacks are lined with wood panelling...
Very informative guide, answered all questions and gave good background. The tower was not open on the day visited

The light show in the evening consists of lights shone onto side of parliement with a narrative of the history of Canada, a very pleasant way to spend an hour in the evening.The tour of parliement building was informative but not too hard going, tickets had to be obtained in advance ( we booked a late afternoon tour earlier...
Great place to start your day in Ottawa. Get there early to see the changing of the guard.Imposing buildings and wonderful gardens. Great views down to the river.

From the changing of the guard, to a guided tour of the interior and exterior of Parliament, there is something magical about wandering around the centre of our country's government.The tickets are free and available just across the street. I would suggest going to get them in the morning as they are limited in quantity.

Tip: free tours. Book in advance in the tourist office across the parliament.Five years ago we visited the parliament and the center building. This time we visited theeast building. It's a tour about the History of Canada centered in 1872. It was very interesting. We learned about political figures. Our guide was very nice and knowledgeable.

From a distance it looks as if one is going to a Cathedral rather than the Parliament building. A collection of three very impressive buildings surrounding a large expanse of lawn. All look as I'f erected in the 17th century and look great.A must see when visiting Montreal. The main Parliament building is open for visitors when parliament is...

It is worth taking a Parliament tour as it is free. The interiors are very nice and there is a tour guide. It takes ages to go through security though so allow plenty of time. And yes you need to book it first.

There is so much to see and learn. Our tour guide was great. The biggest problem is booking your tour. There is a tour booking site immediately across from parliament hill and you have to go there first and can only go on the day that you want to go on the tour. Had to stand in line for over...

We had a great tour guide who spoke loudly and clearly and had great energy. There were lots of great stories and trivia and a 'job' for the younger kids to keep them engaged. Another must do activity - and go see the Peace Tower, too! It's all free, too!Don't forget all of the outdoor stuff around Parliament, too....
Well organized plenty of help and information on site. Changing of the guard @10am everyday is must see event. Watch out for spectacular light and firework shows during the summer

Just the architecture alone is worth the whole trip. The tours are very informative, the buildings are very impressive. Some of the buildings on the hill are undergoing exterior renovations, so may put a damper on photos.
I was so impressed got a behind the scenes tour,the library is totally amazing ,the art in the senate and house of commons is truly superb.... Something for everyone.
We loved the tour of the Parliament Buildings. Go early so you can pick your tour times. Tours are free!Another must see is the Mosaika light show at night! Take a blanket to sit on!

My husband and I took advantage of the free guided tour of the Parliment building in May 2013. You get your tickets across the street from Parliment and they tell you where to meet your guide and what time. Inside there is airport type security but that's no big deal. The tour is quite short but you ate able to...
Architecture was fabulous, exhibits we great. The sundown light show was not to be missed, as it dazzles the eye and also tells the story of Canada brilliantly.

Well worth the visit. The buildings are beautiful and it gives you a real sense ofpride in our wonderful country. To peek in at the Library and where Parliamenttakes place is to feel very patriotic. Also take the elevator up to the top andlook around at Ottawa and across the river to Gatineau. The whole groundsare...

Tour of Parliament Building is wonderful! Tour guide, Dana, was excellent! Disliked the fact our tour bus could not drop us off closer to building. Seniors on bus had a difficult time climbing steps (too many).
Loved it. Great if you are a proud Canadian or an interested traveler. Something for everyone. Especially see the changing of the guard and mosaica.
Don't miss the tours of the centre and east/west blocks, if open - also, the changing of the guard every morning just before 10:00 AM is worth the visit. Arrive early as it fills up with people.

Beautiful setting, historic building, meaningful landmark. The Peace Tower boasts regular carillon concerts and a fantastic view from the top. The grounds are beautiful, with sculptures of historic figures. Tours are well worth the time.

I got a self-guided tour map from one the many tourist info booths located on the site, and leisurely walked all along the parameter of the parliament buildings. Got my ticket for the tour -- if you want to take an early morning tour, get to the ticket office early! (I got there at 11-ish) and got the last ticket...
Loved it, and the kids loved it. A bit of a pain to find a clear view but a really nice way to start the morning.

The Parliament buildings and the Centennial Flame were beautiful! I highly recommend that you walk around to the back of the buildings. There's a gorgeous gazebo that allows you to rest your feet and take in the scenery. We didn't have time (or energy) to take the tour, but we really enjoyed seeing this attraction.

Be sure to pick up free tickets across the street for tour. The tour guides are well-informed, professional, knowledgeable and fun. The tour is informative without becoming boring. A devote "must" on an Ottawa visit.

Start out early to see the changing of the guard. It's very interesting although a tad bit long. Next get your free tickets to tour the buildings themselves. First you have to pick up free ticket at 90 wellington street (building across) from Parliament Hill before you go there. Go early to get tickets for that days tours to make sure they're available. And definitely plan on the nighttime laser show.

Lots to see, really informative. The library and House of Commons (in the main building) were the highlights. The guide was great.Takes about 20 minutes to get everyone through security, so be prepared.

Being on Parliament hill is completely inspiring. Just the,sight of the buildings gives me a feeling of pride in my country. The Gothic buildings of Parliament Hill were very impressive. I took a guided tour of Parliament, which was very informative.My tour group arrived on Saturday before the 11:00 changing of the guard. I was very impressed with the spectacle of the large contingency of guardsmen. It is well worth seeing.

It was very interesting to walk through Parliament and see the Canadian government building. There was a speical exhibit in the lobby. The Changing of the Guard in front of the building at 10 am was very impressive.

Every Canadian should visit our Parliament buildings on a regular basis when in the area. From the front of parliament (from parliament hill) this place reminds toy a little of the UK parliament. But the best view is from across the bridge next to the museum of civilization. The buildings are so beautiful to look at. Unfortunately this is the second time in two years we have been here and there is always construction on the hill. Be sure to walk around all buildings to view the statues of important people in Canada's history.
Free tours, breathtaking workmanship, just wish had more time with the tours- seems 45 mins on each tour is not enough, especially the Center block tour. S much to see and take it all in.

Visiting or even walking by the Parliament Buildings is always so pleasant and at the same time brings you back in history. A guided tour through the Parliament is insightful. Don't miss it when visiting Ottawa.

Wow, to visit the great hall where all our MPs do their animated debating. The circular library was amazing... over 1,000,000 books, almost as big as my collection. Jokes. Parliament has some great buildings and architecture. They also have a changing of the Guard at 10am (weather permitting). Tours are available and visits to the Peace Tower. The Peace Tower offers amazing views of the city and across the river to Quebec.

This is a must for every Canadian. The tour is great and explains everything to you. It is in French or English. You need to make a reservation for your tour. Interesting buildings and lovely grounds. Great views across to Quebec. Lots of people take a picnic and spend the day there.

Fireworks, stunning architecture, history....simply breathtaking. this attraction is must see for any visitor to get a sense of the history and culture of this great capital.Really and truly worth a visit.
changing of the guards a must see in summer and tulips in the spring kinda cool. nice views of hull and Rideau canal and the Ottawa river

Very impressive buildings and location. The light show is amazing. Changing of the guard is worth seeing but be aware that the ceremony that we watched took nearly 45 minutes so if you have difficulty standing for long periods you may wish to get there early and put down a chair.

If you are in Ottawa a trip up to the Parliament Buildings is well worth the effort. If you can get a tour while you are there I would recommend that you take it.
When your in Ottawa,you have to see this place...Nice to see the RCMP guards...Nice to see 24 Susexx...Every Canadian needs to see his countries capitol...

Parliament, wow, you see it on t.v, but too see it in real life is surreal, we enjoyed the night show of lights, that gives the history of Canada with a light show. I took some amazing pictures here, and the buildings surrounding Parliament are historic.

Visiting Ottawa from Delaware. A terrific and innovative telling of Canada's story. Great light show with cool special effects.

The buildings are beautiful and the grounds are kept very clean and neat. There is a lot of special events that take place in front on the greens. Check to see what is going on while you are there. We did not take the tour inside because of time limitations. Sorry about not doing that.
Beautiful buildings filled with pride and history. Take the tour of the buildings and don't miss the library.

Both the 'hill' and changing of the guard are a must for visitors to Ottawa. Tour parliament and also get a walk through the parliament library as it is beautiful. Free and worth the time spent.Enjoy.
My son really enjoyed the light show at parliament hill. I highly recommend the experience we sat on the lawn and we awed by the effects.

Great place to visit. Knowledgeable guides, good overview of Canada's short, peaceful, proud history and government.

its cool to see inside the parliament and the library, cool story behind the building as well.when you get up to the peace tower, you get to see awesome scenery from up there.

this is a historical walk with guides describing the history of Canadian politics............very interesting but can be demanding if you have difficulty standing or walking but well worth the time and efforts. Great to visit the parliament buildings, we live in Ottawa and every time we have guests from out of town we take the time to visit again. A great reminder of where we come from, where we are going and why Canada. Is a great country to live in.

Great visit, historical and building beautiful. Centre of Ottawa and surrounding area gorgeous. Lots to see and do. Don't miss the world famous canal. Byward market full of fun, restaurants and food vendors.
