A must see while in Ottawa! The changing of the guards was an added bonus...10am every day from June until August.

I went to Ottawa for 3 days in July/August 2013. I would highly recommend the tour of the Parliament buildings when you are there. The tours are free, but you need to line up ahead of time at across the street in another building. The tickets are handed out starting at 9:00 am and when I got there at 9:15,...

We visited the Parliament in July. It is a very imposing structure to view - very similar to the British Parliament. To do a guided tour, you need to book the free tickets available in a building opposite to the parliament. They will give you a time slot. At that time, you need to show up at a specific spot...

I'm an Ottawa native so I may be somewhat biased. The Paliament Hill and Buildings are an excellent place to start your Ottawa vacation or 'staycation'. The free inside guided tour and Peace Tower are highly recommended and visitors will gain insight into Canada's history and political system. During summer months the nightly Mosaica "Sound and Light" show is fantastic....
Guided tour of Parliament is well worth it. I absolutely LOVE the library. The woodworking in there is amazing. Stained glass and statues are breathtaking.

Beautiful.. lots of history we took many pictures and enjoyed the experience.. do not miss it The only thing is that there were too many steps and it was hard for my mom to see everthing.. we did what she could handle
The Parliament and buildings are beautiful. We took the tour of the Parliament. It was very interesting. We learned a lot. The architecture is absolutely phenomenal.
Short tour around parliament buildings the peace tower was closed the day we visited.The whispering wall is fun and RCMP cops acted like tour guides very friendly and posed in pics.
Front steps are not accessible to strollers or wheelchairs. Ramps may be on the side but we didn't have time to find out.

Loved the changing of the Guard on parliament hill - it was a great spectacle - the marching was so professional and impressive. Loved all the statues around that area, and also the soldiers at the Eternal Flame
The guides were completely bilingual and knowledgeable. They were able to answer any question that tourists asked.

Free tour, but you must come early and age tickets across the street. Stop in for your tickets during the changing of the guard because the office is jammed immediately after and the tickets fly out.The tour is about an hour and includes the House of Commons and the Senate, other areas of the building and the history of...

If you are in Ottawa, please you must visit Parliament Hill and buildings.They have free tours for the building. The tour guides are very good and give you in depth information about the history of the building and all the rooms in the building. This tour is about one hour. It is very informative tour for kids and adults...
Get your tickets across the street for the free tour of the Parliament buildings. A definite must see & the library is stunningly beautiful. The whole tour is a highlight and well executed.

Walked around Parliament Hill. Great views. Stopped by RCMP cop (worry!). He just wanted to tell us all about the place and the characters who have been there. Really interesting stories about the Chateau Laurier as well. The Parliament Hill Patrol rocks.
Was a great tour but have to say I did feel at times like cattle being shipped through the building - Peace tower should be included in the tour!

We are so lucky to be able to get so close to Parliament. We visited during summer break so the tours take you through all of the "Action" spots. Soo very beautiful & historic ... a must see for anyone visiting Ottawa.

One of the best Parliament buildings in the world. The changing guard is ok show. However, we had a chance to take picture with the guard. The parliament ground is very nice place to enjoy the day in Ottawa. Very recommended attractions.
Our tour guide was great. Loved our tour and our guide was able to answer all questions. Also saw changing of the guards which I highly recommend.
This was a really nice tour, the only complaint is that the group was so large that if you got stuck in the back it was hard to hear or see what they were saying.

The free tour was really great - not too long, but do get to see a fair bit of the place. Mind the time slot you are given We and a few others arrived at designated meeting spot as per booking clerk at least five minutes early and the guide had already left! We managed to catch up due to...

Been to Ottawa so many times and this year was the first year that I have seen it not wrapped in scaffolding. Nice to see once and say you have actually been here to the nation's capital. Typical tourist area in the summer.

The tour guides are exceptional. The buildings are magnificent in terms of archetecture and the tour is not lengthy but is very informative. Library was a highlight as was the Peace Tower.Go July 1, Canada Day, for a great time ,wonderful atmosphere and friendly locals.

Take the tour to see the houses of both the Commons and the Senate, and some of the beauty of the building that holds them. The restored Library is especially lovely. Take the elevator to the top of the tower for spectacular views of the surrounding country.

I love the Hill like any good citizen of Ottawa. I try to stay away from it on tourist trap days like Canada Day and the like - but its a good way to waste an afternoon with friends taking pictures with statutes and the like (not to mention all the history behind it and all those good things...)But....

Our guide Bruce was humorous and informative, he got the balance just right between providing information, and facts, and making the history alive and relevant. I wasn't sure what to expect of a free tour, but would wholeheartedly recommend this to adults and families too.

We got to Parliaoment Hill at 10:30 A. M. and were unable to get in. You needed a tour pass and the wait was hours long. I was not aware that you needed a pass as the last time I was there, you just went in and toured yourself

We did the typical tourist visit to the Governor's house and parliament surroundings. Very modern buildings and infrastructures mixed with the traditional ones.We enjoyed a lot the governors house tour, and it was free. Easy free parking close by.
The tour is recommended as it gives you lots of background information. going up the peace tower was neat but not worth waiting in line for

Walked up the Parliament hill. Beautiful building & scenic views of River and Alexandra Bridge from the top. Plenty of picture perfects spots along with an opportunity to come close to some good architect work.

Don't miss taking a tour of this historic and stunning compound. The guides were excellent-- friendly and very well trained. The tickets are free, but the tours are limited in size. We were not rushed and all questions were answered. The building is fully accessible for the disabled. Don't miss walking around the entire building. There are entrances for the...

Line up early to get the times you want (at the tourism building across the street). Allow about an hour total for the 45 minute tour plus security. Centre block tour was fantastic, quick and informative, with a knowledgable and entertaining guide. Photos allowed except for the stunning library. A must see for visitors to the capital region, try to...
Did a drive by of all the parliment buildings as we were too tired from all the walking previously and could take beautiful pictures of the historic achitechture and breathtaking landscaping.
We got to see the Senate Chamber but not the House, which was in session. Would have like to see parliament in session.

I went to Ottawa with my family for 6 days, and the Parliament Buildings were one of the first stops on our list. There were tours of the main building in both English and French. There were tours leaving every half an hour and the price was the best-FREE! The guide told us lots about the Parliament Buildings. Very good...
Took the gf for her first time. Sadly the senate and tower were closed. Either way tour guide compensated for it.

Wow - our family thoroughly enjoyed all the free tours of the hill. Don't delay to pick up your free tickets at the building directly across from Parliament - they are scooped up fast. We arrived early to watch the changing of the guard. This was VERY impressive. Our kids really enjoyed the Hill.

I am a political nerd so I absolutely love Parliament to start with, but there is so much there that I think it is a site that is suited to almost any visitor. The guides are incredibly knowledgeable and few places rival the beauty of the gothic buildings of Parliament.

definitely take the free tour of the parliament - about 45 minutes and you get to see the meeting rooms for parliament; the architecture is worth the tour alone but also lots of good info on the government

Everyone goes to the center block and that is a MUST. But the West block should be included as there are three rooms done in a historic style - original Gov. General, John A. Mac Donalds offices and the privy council office. Very good guides in both buildings.

Took the family to the hill to see our parliament. was a great experience and found that I learned a few things too. Great walking inside and out. My favorite was the National Library.Visit when you can, well worth it.
The kids will love it if they can stay awake. Try to go!!! Beware of the smoking canadians...they are all over town!!!

At 10:00 p.m. there is a free light show that takes place at the parliament buildings. It's quite nice and educational. The kids really liked it.One thing I'd like to see is for shops to stay open downtown later. We roamed around from 8:30 until the show started and everything was closed. For a summer Saturday night that was...
Short enough tour to let you see everything. The library is a cool sight but unfortunately, you cannot take pics of the library.
There nothing not to like about our Parliament Buildings. They are outstanding. We liked the beauty and symbolism of of the PB.

If the weather is nice this is a great place to spend the morning- if you want to see changing of the guards, or the evening if you want to see the MosAika show. I recommend doing both, you won't be disappointed.

Our visit to Parliament was a wonderful experience which allowed us the chance to understand how the democratic process of government occurs in Canada and how it links to the relationship with Brirtain, forged in a difficult period of the greater North American historical period. The tour guide was extremely knowledgable about the political issues and the architecture of the...
Go on a tour and Check out the light show at 10 PM. This is such a beautiful beguiling. The light show lasts about 20-30 minutes and everyone I know that checked it out enjoyed it...

**** FREE TICKETS**** I had been to Ottawa before but I had never been able to get tickets to see the parliament building.First of all, the best time to be outside the place where they give out the tickets is around 8:30-8:45am - that guarantees you'll get a ticket for your preferred time.I suggest you get your ticket...

Not much to say about this, but a great historic event to see and observe. We did visit and see the changing of the guard on a very hot and humid day; two of the guards fainted during the event, I'm assuming this is not normal. We toured the building after the guard changing. The tour guide (Max) was super...

Walking around the grounds is lovely but going in for a guided tour is completely worth the wait. Tours are given in several languages and it's a great way to learn about Canadian history, our government and the wonderful architecture. The guides are so well trained they know the answer to pretty much everything.

The free tour of the main building was excellent. Our tour guide was very knowledgeable and spoke clearly. The architecture was beautiful. It was really interesting to see Parliament from the inside and learn its history. Make sure to get your tickets early morning which are available in the building across the street. We left the changing of the guard...
Get your tickets early for the tours. It's worth seeing the inside of this historical building. The tour guides were excellent.

We went there early in the morning, taking good pictures and earned the bonus of watching a terrific guard changing ceremony. Then we took a free English guided tour in the Parliament with exceptional knowledge gained about the politics and history of Canada. The surprise, however, was an unexpected self tour to the Peace Tower within the Parliament afterwards. Magnificent...

On the sidelines of the Ottawa River this area is beautiful and well cared for. A very large square surrounded by buildings such as the Parliament of Canada, Library of Parliament and other Canadian government in Gothic architecture. It was a bit chilly on the day we visited junho/13 now, but nothing to stop touring and see the beauty of...
Amazing, what our money is paying for! Statues interesting. Everyone needs to see these buildings. It was okay, the changing of the guards was good.
Very good place to visit and take photos, i suggest to go with a guide explaining to you all the details.
just a beautiful historic building, makes you proud to be Canadian.Our guide was well informed and answered question as they were presented to her.

Parliament was one of the first attraction we did at night and then in morning after my Nature museum visit. It is extremely interesting as being a historic and political building. A must-see for anyone visiting our country's capital.

The tour was very interesting and the tour guide was very helpful. You have to get tickets across the street so go early. I was really nice to see the inside of the centre parliament building. It was a good hour tour with air conditioning. It worked as a way to get out of the heat and as a nice...

Repeating what some have already said, it is a bit of a hassle to get the ticket, get through security, and then be "herded" through the building. The building and chambers are impressive but not awe-inspiring. In summary, one could read about the law-making process and skip the building tour and commentary which is difficult to hear due to the...

First of all FREE . The tour guide was a young man from Edmonton Alberta working in Ottawa for the summer and he was excellent. We learned a lot about our government and really enjoyed seeing where our parliamentarians worked. A trip up the peace tower was well worth the short line ups.
It was a nice walk around the parliament building, from where you have a beautiful view from the river. We took a double deck bus from a square near by, it was a great!
This free tour was informative and interesting, showed lots of beautiful architecture, and the old library was phenomenal! We did the centre block tour, very enjoyable!

Absolutely English ! The architecture of the building of Ottawa's Parliament and the clock tower reminds me Big-Ben of London or towns like Cambridge. Even the statue of Queen Elizabeth II , on her hourse is there. I thing is the no 1 attraction of Ottawa and is worth the visit.

My friend and I went on a tour of the centre and east block of the parliament buildings. Both tours are free however you still need a ticket. Tickets are located right across the road from the buildings. If you can't find it there are tons of tourist info people around with question marks on their shirts to show you...

We arrived at 9:45 a.m. for the changing of the guard which starts at 10:00. So having seen the old guard march in, the new guard march in,...

On this tour you will learn a lot about Canadian Policitcs and the government. On our East Block tour, Rebecca, our tour guide, was very informative and funny! It was interesting to see John A. MacDonald's office. It was also interesting to see how the building looked like in 1867.In the Centre Block tour, Jessica, our tour guide, was...

Get your free timed-entry self-guided tour ticket to the Peace Tower across the street at the Visitor Information Center. Guided tours of the other buildings in English should be offered more often. They fill up fast. It is a great view from the top of the Peace Tower and a meaningful visit to the chapel also where books with names...

Ottawa is the capitol of Canada and has a grand Parliament and square. The changing of the guards happens every morning (weather permitting) at around 10:00 am. Get there no later than 9:45 am. The guards from the previous day march in with a band, and then the new guards march in with an even bigger band and parade right...
We enjoyed the colorful changing of the guard at 10 a.m. even though it was raining. The government building are impressive.

Having got our free tickets for our timed tour, we met at the appointed spot at the due time just after 11.00am with a very pleasant young guide and a relatively small group - maybe 30.Downhill after that - waiting in a short line to get through security ( no complaints about the need ) was very slow; some...

I was amazed at how much we got to see for a free tour. If you're looking for interaction and excitement this may not be the best place, but it was very cool looking and I learned a lot about Canadian politics and government. Even just standing outside on the grounds was awe inspiring. Definitely worth a visit!

My husband and I were visiting Montreal and decided to leave a few days early and take in the sites in Ottawa. What a pleasant surprise. We stood in a very short line at the visitors center at 9 am and got free tour tickets to parliament. The young guides were all well versed in Canadian history and conducted the...

Had friends up from the States visiting, we got to be there tourist guides for several days. Parliament was one of the first attraction we brought them to. We went up the clock tower and enjoyed the view from up high. We walked the grounds, went down underneath Sappers Bridge and watched the changing of the guards for the War...
We saw Karlee Ray Jepson sing "Call me Maybe" was very cool - Terri Clarke was great --love her!!we say Karlee Ray Jepson sing "Call me Maybe" was very cool - Terri Clarke was great --love her!!

We had a great day here. We collected our free tour tickets by 10am at the Hill Centre (opp. Parliament) for a 2.05pm tour. Extremely interesting, from an historic and political standpoint. A must-see for anyone visiting our country's capital.

I took the free tour of the Centre Block with my friend's children (ages 7 through 14). The tour guide was funny, and took into account the wide age range in his tour. The tour itself is shorter than is let on. On busy days, there is no time to linger in any given area as there are so many...
A great city and wonderful historic buildings. The interior of the Parliament Buildings is even more impressive than the exterior.
Combine a visit to the changing of the guards with a tour of the Centre Block for a great taste of Canadian history.

Parliament hill is Ottawa. If you come to visit Ottawa, you need to visit Parliament Hill and see the building from the inner side. The tours are free but you need to pick up your ticket in advance. There are several tours a day, so you should be able to join one of them. However, your visit will be short....
It is free, organized and fun. You just need to arrive earlier to get the free pass. Staff are nice too.

If you come to Ottawa or live in Ottawa and have never been to the Parliment Buildings, you're doing it wrong. Tours are fairly often, and the Peace tower is actually easy to do on it's own. We do this tour each time we're in Ottawa. It's informative, interesting. and educational. My favourite room is the library with it's intricate carvings. The tour is free.

I took advantage of the stroll at your own pace through Parliament over the Christmas break and thoroughly enjoyed it. The Christmas trees and decorations, surmounted by the opulence of Parliament is breathtaking. The tours are free all year round, and I highly recommend going when you have access to the Senate (the most opulent chamber on the Hill with...
Exterior was covered with scaffolding for renovations. Couldn't find an angle to get a single good picture. Did not have time to take the tour.
The building was beautiful inside and the tour was well done. Make sure to arrive fairly early to get the free tickets from the building across the street.

This is a very interesting way to get to know more about our Canadian political system and history. The buildings are spectacular and well worth visiting just for the architecture alone. The tours are very informative and kept everyone interested. Our guide Jessica was amazing - full of information and energy and good humour. Don't forget to tour the Peace...

We went to the Information Centre at 0930 on Monday 24 June, and had a wide choice of times to pick for the free tour of the Parliament. We selected late morning as we knew the the first Changing of the Guard was taking place at 1000.The tour and indeed the whole morning were just like being in London,...
Been on this tour before, first time with my kids. Still a very impressive building with lots of Canadian content and history.
The starting place of it all..very interesting tour which lasted about 1 hour.. go early for your tickets!!

Get your ticket across the street and come back at the allocated time to tour the Parliamnet buildings with a great interpreter.The tour guide showed up on time and gave us advice for getting through security ( metal detector and bag scanner). Then he showed us the main parts of the building, with some funny tidbits of trivia. He...

We arrived at 4pm July 29th, of course Tour Tickets were sold out...so we Lined up at 8:30 the next morning. Which was a smart move as the line just grew. Normally its not as busy but being Canada Day weekend and all it was a great experience.
The tour I went on was very informative and I loved the Mounties in their uniform. A long wait in line fot the tour so it is better to get there early

Give yourself three hours...maybe more during high tourist season. Lots of good walking, lots to see! Afterwards, maybe stop into the Fairmont (Laurier) and check out some of the really cool things there. Have a beer in the lounge. We liked doing that :)

I went on this tour solo, when I was in town on business.Tour office at 90 Wellington opened at 9:00am. I got there about 15 minutes before. I was probably about 50th person in line. My complaint: only one person workingMost folks were getting tickets for AFTER the 10:00am changing of the guard, so I got the 9:20am...

Totally worth the time! Very very gorgeous. Makes me proud to be Canadian :)I went on Canada day to share in the festivities and then again the next day to see it during the day, it was so worth it. If you're only in Ottawa for a short time, the Hill should be your first stop for sure!

Great tour offered for folks to visit Canada's parliament buildings. Guides were very pleasant, knowledgeable and helpful. This tour is free, but must be booked in person (not online) and only on the same day, so you cannot book ahead. GT is the best tour guide ever. He is very well spoken and really knows his stuff about Canadian history. He is a true gentleman.
You can do a free tour of the parliament building if you go and get the free tickets at the hill center right across the street. After you can go up the peace tower.

This was my second visit to the Parliament buildings. We went on a tour of the Centre Block.I like the free tour and I was happy that I went in remembering my prior visit and exited learning so much more that it felt like a different experience. Krista was a wonderful and knowledgeable tour guide who took the time...

Ottawa really is a stunning city, matched only by Vancouver. :-)The heart of our capital city is parliament Hill. It is simply stunning! Gorgeous manicured grass hill with well maintained buildings. Great tours are available and the street performers are unreal!We spent the afternoon there.
beautiful parks, grand old buildings, interesting architecture, all filled with history and a sense of importance. What's not to like?

I spent 3 days touring the Ottawa region. What a beautiful place! The sites around Parliament Hill were awesome. We took a tour of the Parliament Buildings, which was free. The stone work and architecture were amazing and going up to the Peace Tower gave a beautiful view. We saw the War Memorial and tomb of the unknown soldier.We...

The free tour is fantastic. Arrive at the Visitor's Center across the street at about 9:00 to pick up tickets, and you'll be the only person in line, which means you will have your pick of tour times. I strongly recommend the tour, which is the only way to get inside Parliament Hill. You can walk the grounds, but you...

You need to go across the street from Parliament Hill at get tickets to do the tour, it takes about 30 minutes. Good to get there early , we were there at 9am, lineups looked like they were forming. The commons wasn't sitting when we were there so we got to go right out on the floor. Young guy giving...
If this is your first visit to the Capital you should not miss taking the tour. It is full of history and really shows off our country and our system of government

It is the main thing in the city, So beautiful and romantic, it gives the city its romantic feel. We went there to see the changing of the guard. It is good to see this once, there were a bilingual person explaining to us whats going on during the process. We went later to the backside of the building and...
MAKE SURE YOU GO UP THE PEACE TOWER, GREAT VIEWS OF THE AREA, too bad we have to go through security but this the norm today. The tour is too short but lots of people to accommodate.
Fantastic tour. An amazing set of building rich in history. A must place to visit if you go to Ottawaw.
Took a walk around the grounds, very nice area good to get a look at the centre of government. Some interesting monuments and good views in the grounds.

Quite popular, expect a bit of queuing,but interesting, and the students operating the show are enthusiastic. 2hours should do for the visit, also worthwhile walking around the building to see the statues and views.

I thoroughly enjoyed the FREE tour of the Canadian Parliament buildings that I took recently. This was particularly interesting for me because I enjoy politics and I found the debate in the House of Commons quite interesting.My young son was a bit bored but i am still happy that he got to see how our government works.

Oh, the glory of the government epitomized through the grandeur of stone, glass and working art that is Canada's Parliament. When I last visited in 2001, the place was shrouded in construction and renovation work. It still is. When will the work-site additions to the view end? Who knows?If you are in groups of 10 or more, you have...

Loved the guided tour giving details into the history of the buildng and parliament.It was good that we could depart from the guide and go into the chamber to hear a debate as well.Terrific history and lovely architecture.

This was our third trip and tour to the Pariliament Buildings. I was disappointed in this tour as it was quite watered down. Previously the tour guides discussed the architecture, went into detail about the carvings in the foyers, pointed out the significance of the stained glass windows and explained the Canadian parliamentary system..I will always be in love...

Tickets to the free Parliament Hill tour (centre building of the three) must be obtained at the small building directly across the street. No tickets, no admission. The tour itself is shorter than I remembered from my last visit three years ago. Our guide was personable, very friendly, and kept up a high enthusiasm level, but we had to wait...

Go early in the day to the gray building across the street and get your free tickets. That way you can get a better selection of times for your tour. The tour is free, informative and you can get some great photos form the top of the Peace Tower. This is great way to spend some time with your family...

You can get guided tour tickets for free from the reception on the other side of the road, me and my partner got ours and ended up waiting 2 hours on the grass outside the parliament building which was ok as it was a beautiful day, it took about 30 mins to get through security and begin the tour which...

FIRST, you must go in the building facing the Parliament, across the street. There, you get your free reservation tickets for the time you would like to visit on that day. Be in front on Parliament 5-10 minutes before and proceed to security check with your group and guide. The Library is worth the tour. Splendid! We got to see...

We picked up our tickets for the free tour across the street in front of the Parliament buildings. It was a Monday morning so not one person was in the line up. We only had to wait 15 minutes before our tour started. Security however took almost an hour for us to get into the building. The tour itself took...
Best part- library, live House of Commons session and the Senate room.. The carvings, art is amazing... Its a Must watch in Ottawa..

I am from the US and I was lucky enough to spend about two months in Ottawa as part of my job.My visit was educational and transforming. I learned a lot about our friends the the north and about myself. I really enjoyed my time there and have brought back many cherished memories.One of the highlights of my...

The Hill and surrounding buildings are lovely (especially with snow in the winter). Do wear comfortable shoes as there can be lots of walking if you fancy exploring. The tour is a must but be sure to go early to avoid the crowds and to ensure you get a ticket!

This review is about the free tour for Parliament Buildings.Ticketing place at 90 Wellington street opens at 9:00 AM. We arrived at 9:08 AM and were greeted by a long line. History is alive within the Parliament building. My visit was spectacular because I asked a lot of questions and received excellent answers from my guide. While our tour wasn't able to go inside the House or Senate, we were able to look in and imagine all the interesting things that take place when they are in session. I was particularly...

We walked the grounds around the Parliament building before going in. The views are breathtaking - but it was the statues in the area that drew my attention. A self-guided history lesson! The work on them is fantastic - and I really loved the education I got from reading about each section.I'm sorry we didn't hit the building first...

Who can go to the nation's capital and not visit the seat of government? You are steps away from many other attractions including National Art Gallery, the Supreme Court, Byward Market and only across the river from the Museum of Civilization.

If you are visiting Ottawa I wouldn't miss Parliament. I would recommend visiting as early in the day as possible. Visited on a Sunday morning with a group of senior citizens (had reservation) and by going early we were able to view the clock tower and library. Don't miss the library! The view from the clock tower is amazing but...

This review is based on my first visit to Ottawa. We planned a trip combining the tulip festival. We took the parliament tour and peace tower tour. This review is based on my second visit in two years and since it is free I would recommend the tour to anyone visiting parliament hill. Get your tickets across the street, try to avoid in on weekend though as the lines can be very crowded. Hey, free is good.

You never know who you will run into here. But as intersting as the machinations of parliment are the artisry and historical facts here are the true feature. Try to get tickets to sit in on question period and watch our elected representatives parry back & forth. Politics boring?? Not here
marching bands were excellent ... red coats and great music... daily in the morning ... the tour of the Parliament was excellent and free

the free tour of the Parilament Buildings was great, the gem is the Library where the architecture and the atmosphere just feels like perfection. Every Canadian should visit, and of course every visitor to Canada should drop by too. The daily morning soldiers parade was excellent too.

A free way to immerse yourself in the heart of Canadian history. The guide was knowledgeable and gave us plenty of time to take photographs. There was a lot of history to absorb but it was well worth it. The views from the peace tower are second to none in Ottawa. The library is one of the most beautiful I...

I wish we had a chance to explore it better, but our excursion had to be cancelled in the middle because of some events. Loved the library a lot. Nice building, loved the view from the tower! Excellent staff working as guides!
History, History, History, what can one say about Canada Parliment Building, wonders of the world, if not wonders of Canada

The Parliament Hill is the cynosure of the city and is located centrally. The Parliament, The Peace Tower and The Supreme Court of Canada is located on this hillock that sits on the highest point of the city. The view of the Parliament Hill from the Alexandra Bridge is fascinating in the evening with the setting sun in the background.

Taking a free tour inside the Parliament is a must in Ottawa. You get to see the whole city from the top of the peace tour. You could enter the house and listen to debates being done by the senators. It's fascinating. The house itself is a heritage structure and you need to go inside to believe it.

The Canadian Parliament is a must see when visiting Ottawa. The buildings are just stunning and beautiful and so inviting. The grounds are beautiful and well kept and people are free to hang out. One can get a tour of the Parliament including a visit to the top of the Peace Tower. You'll see some amazing views of Ottawa. Tours...
the architecture and history in the building is worth the tour. best advice we received was go in the morning to get ticket and then return for a later tour.
We drove from Niagara Falls to Ottawa and lived there for 3 days and 2 nights. I prefer the night view of the buildings. That's amazing and dignified. I think I will visit it again.
If you haven't gone through the Parliament Buildings, you have to give yourself the chance. There is whispers of a spirit that makes a trip at night interesting!

didn't get the chance to go inside this trip, but had the full treatment a number of years ago when we had a family reunion in Ottawa. More than what you see on tv. Gorgeous at night, with brilliant lights.

Walk to the back of the Parliament buildings and enjoy the view of the River. The tour of the buildings is worth the time and effort. After all, it is Canada's capital! and the seat of our Parliament. Visit the Centennial flame, enjoy the archicture, feel the history.
Great to look at and visit once. You should go once during the day, and once at night when they turn on the lights. It'll be a different experience both times.
I never realized the buildings were so pretty. So much detail and so beautiful ho they back onto the Ottawa river + there is the Canal system and the locks. Really enjoyed visiting them.

What a beautiful building and lots of history. We managed to get in on the last tour of the day. We were unable to get into the Senate or the House of Commons to take photos as they were in use. So we where showed a photograph. The library was also off limits for photos this room was worth taking...

It's the ol' colony's Big Ben ... yeah, it's like Big Ben, but, it's in Canada! So, if you want to see where it all started, then do yourself a favor and take the full tour. If you're canadian you can't afford not to!
When in Ottawa you must take in the sights of Ottawa's historical and national monuments. From afar they resemble hollywood pictures. Up close they are striking and beautiful.
This tour is brilliant. It combines history with current events. It is very emotional for a Canadian and makes one swell with pride.

only thing was line ups a bit long but it was worth it everyone was interested in almost everything liked the view from the tower and also like the room with names of wars that Canada particapated very interesting

They're open 7 days a week, but not open during Diplomatic visits (such was the case on Apr 25 when the Prime Minster of Trinidad and Tobago was on-site), and also not during Question and Answer period (as was the case the following morning). We were in town for 2.5 days and couldn't get in for a tour, though I...

You want an awesome Canada Day celebration....go to Ottawa!! But in the winter....not so much. There was lots of construction and many of the paths were blocked. Signage at the monuments and were weather worn and unreadable.

I was looking forward to this visit but it was rather disappointing. After the security measures at the entrance (similar to airport checkup) the tour guide took us to a hallway and he showed us a towel that he took out of his shoulder bag, on that towel was a printing of the parliament! which he used to explain to...

It is a nice building to see, but it doesn't take a long time to make the turn if you stay outside. It is a nice place during summer to go make a picnic on the hill. Most of the time there is construction on the site.
I drive by everyday of the week and still love to look at the buildings. Maybe the renovation of it all will end one day......

It was great walking around and taking pictures of the many beautiful sights on Parliament Hill. The building itself is nice, but there's also the eternal flame and the surrounding Coats of Arms of each province, which was really cool. The indoor tours were awesome, and the canal was impressive. Kudos to Canada for a great experience!

You paid for it so you might as well have a good look! Take a relaxing walk all around the parliament buildings. Check out the details in all the nooks and crannies of the building. Some sections are renovated. Others need renovation and others are under renovation. Beautiful views of the Ottawa river and Gatineau Hills.

You will not find as many historical places in Canada as in Europe. This is evident. But Parliament Buildings are a positive exception to this rule. It's a very attractive and well-organized place. Don't miss a monument to the 1-st President of Canada (to the left from the building) and a nice monument to the women of Canada ( approximately...

Never fails to take a nice relaxing walk behind the Parliament buildings...view facing the river is breathtaking. Best in summer where you can eat your lunch in the sun, near the trees. Very peaceful and natural setting.

It's a very beautiful building, the House was not in session so couldn't see that. Went up to the Peace Tower, they only let 7 people in at a time, so the wait can be long and it's very, very HOT...when you are at the top it's a very small 'look-out', go if you have the time and patience!You...

Living so far away from Ottawa, it's easy to feel disconnected from our country's capital and the history that it embodies. Visiting the very grand and attractive Parliament Buildings evokes a certain pride in Canada and being a Canadian. And the night "light and music" show "Mosaica" on the Buildings is not to be missed!

The Parliament tour is a great experience, Around 45 minutes in length and free, can't be missed while in Ottawa. I was amazed by the gorgeous architecture of our capital building. On a Saturday the tour included going inside the library, senate, and view from a window of the the house of commons. The tour is very informative, and you...

My second visit was not as enjoyable as the first visit to this fabulous government building which included greater access to the various rooms a visit to the top of the clock tower. I highly recommend a visit to this building but call ahead for information on tours and access to the various section of the building. Ask about visiting...

The tour of the Parliament buildings was a fantastic experience. The Peace Tower and Memorial were great to see. We had the pleasure of doing the guided tour on a Saturday so had access to all areas. Our tour guide was friendly and knowledgeable and even the security guards made the afternoon memorable with their wit and knowledge.The library...

Great place to stop and check out some Canadian history. Take the tour through the Parliament or just walk around the grounds. Either way you are going to see some history as well as some great views of the river

The grounds are great! It was snow covered but I could imagine in the summer coming for a picnic here. The atmosphere was very pleasant. There was security but that's to be expected. The eternal flame was cool to see! I've been inside before but this visit - it was closed to go inside. Definitely a place I will come...

We did not arrive in time to visit the Parliament Buildings but we walked around outside. They are amazing plus the statues around them are equally as interesting. If you visit, look for the whispering wall -try it..its amazing!
Guided tour of the building is a must! The library is fantastic. The mounties on patrol are very friendly and offered us pins and flags
The place reminds me of London. Superb building ...heard clock chimed too! only flaw was that there were some construction or renovation to one of it.

its something everyone needs to see at least once. The foundation of our great country is our deep democracy. Many people in the world can only dream of the freedoms and liberties that we have in Canada. get out and take an active look at how the government is run.
great tour and loved the library. very old but rich looking. never know who you'll see in those great halls of marble

I love sitting on parliament Hill in the summer, it is perfect, we've done picnics, workouts, tanning in the sun! its a great place to be at in the summer!on wednesdays at 12 in the summer, there is also free yoga for an hour! great idea!

whether you visit from the outside or do the actual tour inside, it is very interesting and holds a very important part of our present and history. ALL canadians who come to Ottawa should take the time to see the Parliament buildings!

To see the hill from the river side check out Astrolabe Park - a big hill you can walk up. It is easy to gaze at this place and think back in time to when it was established and consider all that went here as a new nation discovered and established itself. The Ottawa river rolls on - not hard...

Thoroughly enjoyed seeing the capital buildings - parliament, etc. All had some fair degree of restoration or remodeling going on so there were cloaks of cover over some towers and facades with scaffolding giving a somewhat interrupted busy look to what was otherwise historic Scottish masonry structure. Lovely anyway - such edifices don't go without maintenance - but if you...

Arrived at 9:30am, when they open, for a tour but after waiting around in the outer lobby for 15 minutes, were told that the tours were limited to 10 people max and the next available tour would be at 3pm. What can I say - our tax dollars at work.

This was an interesting tour, with some great architecture and history explained. The guide was great (did intro in English and French, but the rest was only in English).It is a pity the security guards were bored and liked telling people off for taking photos, when the guide said it was ok.
Don't miss going up the Elevator during the day to the Peace Tower- superb views! Then at night, return for the LIght show and continue to walk around

Free tour with knowledgeable tour guide. We were lucky enough to go on a day during constituency week so we were able to see all parts of the Parliament Building. The Library was my favourite part of the tour. Being able to go to the top of the peace tower was an added bonus to get a lovely view of...

Great tour for the whole family.After going through security check, we waited for our 10:20 tour to start. Our guide spoke English and French, introduced and talked about the rooms with clarity and gave us a chance to ask questions before moving to the next room. What was nice was that we were allowed to take snapshots except for...
Nice to see the inside of the parliament Building and to see a live debate in progress. Free entry . Suitable for all the family.

Get your free tour tickets first thing in the morning and do all available tours. You can easily spend a day here. The tour of the Centre Block is, of course, the main attraction but we really enjoyed our tour of the grounds and of the East Block as well; the guides were great. There are many statues of famous...

Impressive architecture, great yet short tour, OK gift shop, overall interesting visit. Luckily, all the rooms were open for visiting during our tour, so we got to see the Senate room and the library amongst others and to snap pictures (which normally isn't allowed).The lineup for the tower was too long, so we gave up and left.Make sure...
I live in Ottawa and always feel so proud when I see "The Hill" as we affectionately refer to it. A must see if you are Canadian.
I live here and always appreciate the beauty and majesty of the buildings. The tours are pretty good.
Construction at the moment giving the Parliament Buildings a less pleasing effect than usual. Still a very imposing site in Canada's capital city. Always a highlight.

All Canadians should be proud of these beautiful buildings, and that one of our signature pieces of architecture is called the Peace Tower. Couldn`t even tell you how often I`ve been in here (maybe the schoolkids don`t get brought here every year, but my memory tells me we were), and I learn or notice something new every single time. The...
Took in the public tour of the buildings. Very informative and great value (free). Was people from Russia and China and they were impressed too.A must for all tourist

It is free to go on a 45 minute tour of the Canadian Parliament building, or if you just want to self-tour, you can go up the Peace Tower and see the Memorial Chamber on your own. So nice not to be ripped off as a tourist, and brilliant to see the inside of the Parliament.

I had been to Parliament in the past a few times but never actually gone inside and did the tour. The tour is free (you pay for it in your taxes lol), and I highly recommend doing it if you get a chance. It was very informative and the buildings themselves are extremely cool. I did not even know that...
Magnificent buildings in a gorgeous landscape. History, beauty, and great views. Just look at the picture and go there.

Visit the bell near the 'new' Parliament Buildings to learn about the fire that ravaged the 'old'. Check out the gothic fences which are maintained by classically trained blacksmiths. The soaring towers and copper roofs give us hope and lift our spirits.As James Doohan (Scotty on Star Trek-The Original Series) said in his talk at the Star Trek convention...

What can I say...I'm Canadian, why wouldn't I love this place. Beautiful buildings and very, very well kept. Take the tour inside the peace tower as well as the elevator up to the top....you won't regret it!

The Parliament Buildings are such an important part of our heritage, it is great to see them up close. If walking, there are plenty of other great stuff to see in the area too. When we went to see this, we also got to go inside some of the other buildings such as the House Of Commons... very cool.
Highly recommended...learned a lot about the history of the buildings and of Canada. The view of Ottawa from the Bell Tower was extraordinary and the architecture and its history were amazing!!

Free entrance and tour. If you go saturday and sunday you can visit all parliament since the Senate and House of Commons aren't sitting. We went during the weekend so we could see everything and the tour took half an hour, the right amount of time.

It is always nice to show out of towners the building. Those walls have so much history and they are letting you know that they who they are and will continue to be for centuries to come since Canadians take pride in up keeping them.
It is always nice to feel the energy of the Hill. The ground are as always well kept. Kiddo to the ground keepers for a job well done.
They look so majestic from the river if you are cruising past. Or if you are at the Museum of Civilization across the river and look over, one can see the Peace tower and the Library.

It looks majestic with the lawns in front of it for people to walk on. The sound of the bells in the Peace Tower reminding people that we are a free country. Also the State building in Washington has no grass just concrete roads around it which takes away from its beauty, what a shame. We are so lucky.

A must see if you visit Ottawa.Keep in mind the tours are very busy, so you should look up the times and prepare to arrive early.Lots of picture opportunities with the Gatineau skyline just behind and across the river, and the buildings themselves are amazing. A great piece of our culture here in Canada.

A must to see if you are visiting Ottawa. Centrally located near the market, the canal, shopping and restaurants. Great place to have a picnic or practice yoga on Sunday mornings. Changing of the guards is great to witness as well.

Informative. After the tour you can go up to the the of the peace tower by elevator. The tour is great you get to see the House of Commons,the senate,the library which is the highlight. Go you won't regret it

Every Canadian, and even every non-Canadian visiting Ottawa has to visit Parliament. It's a beautiful building, the tour is ver informative, and it's free! But be forewarned - you have to go through an airport-style security check before you enter the building. Is is the seat of government, after all! I have been here many times over my 66 years, probably a dozen plus since I live five hours away by road. Every time I visit I see something I missed before & I marvel at the work that has been done over the years since the fire that left just the Library standing. The Peace Tower with the clock...
The tour was great. Strange that they send you up the Peace tower when the elevator ride is so slow that you can barely get back down in time for the tour itself.

As group (the Ontario Student Trustees' Association), we were supposed to get a private tour of Parliament Hill through a friend of a friend of a local MP. I couldn't even imagined that it could be that luxurious, I'm not a poor man but this was beyond expectation. huge halls with marbles all around, great art works here and there. must visit if you are in ottawa

Just to walk the grounds of Parliment Hill to see the history of former Prime Ministers is amazing. The time and dates stamped on the statues and thinking about my past high school history classes gives one a sense of bieng back in time. To watch music shows, military bands etc perform on the hill is 2nd to none. The...

Nice place to walk around. Nice architecture and many statues to see. A good perspective on Canadian history. Also, nice view of Hull and the surrounding museums. Also, you can see the Rideau Locks and the Rideau. Canal where it joins the Ottawa river. If you get a chance get a tour of the Parliament buildings and for higher view...

Every Canadian absolutely must go to Parliament Hill to see it. The building is gorgeous, the grounds easy to get onto and move around, even with the security. Don't go expecting to see the Prime Minister, but go to see the whole experience. A definite must see when in Ottawa

We were able to tour Parliament Hill while Parliament was in session and we were most impressed by the grandeur of this historic building. Our tour guide was most professional and informative. The trip up into the Peace Tower observatory was great fun, as we were able to see some of the carillon bells on the way up. The views...

What an impressive building the Capital is. The stone, the carvings, the artwork is beautiful. The tour was informative and fun. We often tour other country's landmarks, it was a nice change to visit and be so proud of our country and the incredible structures we have built.
The changing of the guard is a must see. The guard are dressed in full uniform just like in London England. Guided tours are given for free.

The majesty of these buildings speak for themselves..!! Proud to of had the opportunity to visit the Parliament Buildings and had a chance to go up in the Peace Tower. The tour wasn't as long as I had thought but informative and wonderful none-the-less. Eternal Flame is beautiful. If you're in Ottawa, a must see!!! ..oh and if you know...

We did the free tour of Parliament. I think it is something that every Canadian should do. So much history and meaning. It was nice to see a glimpse of our political system and the building is very beautiful.

I was not inside the Parliament buidlings, because it was to late and they were closed, but instead that I got amazing views of the city. You just need to go around the main buidlings and enjoy the tranquility of Ottawa. I don't know how it it looks in the summer, but in winter the views from the Parliament Hill...

The sun was setting as we walked around Parliament Hill. I took some amazing photos of the buildings, the Rideau Canal, the bridge to Quebec and Ottawa itself. Great stroll if you are staying downtown.

We went to visit Parliment just for the fact that we have never been and who doesn't visit Parliment while in Ottawa. The tour was informative and the tour guide made it interesting for the kids. A bit of advise, call ahead to get tour times. The wait can be very boring for kids since you are very limited as...

This is one of the most impressive Parliament building I've seen - our free tour took us into the House of Commons, The Senate, The Library. Taking of photos is allowed although security is high. We visited on a Sunday when Parliament wasn't in session so could see everything. The Peace Tower is worth a visit as there're stunning views...

Ottawa being the capital of Canada and Parliament Hill being the seat of government in Ottawa, this is a MUST SEE place in Canada.There are volunteers who bring crowds around and give a history of the place and interesting facts about Parliament Hill. There is a beautiful view from the back of the building which shows other parks and...
I been there few times but my friend and I just took some pics outside. I know when MPS are sitting you can get tour and see inside.

Highly recommend taking the tour. We took the tour not long after 9am on Sunday and there was no line but still about 30 people in our group. And we did not have more than a 4 minute wait for the elevator ride up the tower.

A place to see so many fine Politicians and Senators all in one area, with politics all around,,a feel of a factory running on full hot steam is evident when one is present here..as business of the day is conducted quickly and briskly on account of the brisk and unpredictable weather in January which has no impact when surrounded by...

As Canadians I love that we are allowed access to walk around the Hill at any time. We walked the perimeter at midnight , it was so beautiful, tranquil and the back of the Hill has the most amazing view.
For such a young country we certainly pride ourselves with our legislative buildings. Truly great to see in person the magnitude of it all.
I really recommend to go o this attraction because it can really teach you about go government. This is not a free roam building in this building you need to follow the guided tour.

Tips below.If you're not familiar with Canadian history or politics, it would be a waste of time to go inside the parliament buildings. But, if you ARE interested in Canadian politics, it would be cool to get a tour of the main buildings and visit the House of Commons and the Senate. Also, if you go inside, definitely go...
Nothing to see but the buildings under renovation while a bunch or "fairy" protestors danced around the entrance (no idea what they were protesting)...
Everything was beautiful.Winter in Ottawa cold and crisp.Ice sculptures amazing Rideau Canal glistening
Remarkable architecture and sprawling grounds....quite amazing views from the site looking onto the Ottawa river and beyond to Quebec.

I've reviewed the Parliament Buildings separately from Parliament Hill because I feel that the former is specifically relating to the actual buildings, while the latter relates to the surrounding area.The landscaping is not anything to write home about, but there are statues scattered everywhere that are interesting to look at. Considering that this is the locus of federal political power as well as an architectural gem and a part of Canadian history, to my mind a visit to Ottawa isn't complete without a visit here.A ticket is required for entry, but there is no cost (they have them to break up the crowds into manageable chunks). During the summer...

A must see if visiting Ottawa, along with skating on the Rideau canal. The free tour is very informative, and the architecture is amazing. The library looks spectacular, both from the inside and out. You'll need to walk around to the back of Centre block to see what I mean. Make sure to take the elevator up to the top...

Although we had to wait an hour to get in, we were treated to a very informative tour of the House of Commons, the Senate and the spectacular library. We also got to visit the Vimy Room which is a memorial to all of Canada's war dead and it was very powerful. We went to the top of the Peace...
Beautiful Architecture on a Clear Day. However, if you go inside, beware the "gaurds" can be rude, and flippant, if you breathe the worng way or move the wrong way

We visited the Parliament buildings in July 2012. I would recommend this visit to everyone. You can book a specific tour to suit your itinerary. The guides are very knowledgable, helpful and pleasant. The information and stories are well worth listening to and the architecture is amazing.The views from the top of the building are lovely. I would definitely...

Amazing architecture and history. Tours are well worth while and very interesting.Although I live in Ottawa,I enjoy visiting the Parliament grounds every year,and do the tour every few years.A must see if first time visitor to Ottawa

Would it not be nice it the debates in the house were as beautiful and amazing as this place where the government of Canada meets?We enjoyed our return visit as much as the first.Canada can be proud of their "House of Parliament".It is a privilige to give this place 5*'s and more stars than I gave the...

The buildings themselves are worth the visit, check out the library and the tower is a must, the only drawback is the reality of a full body scan before going up the peace tower, I guess that's progress, it's a shame here in Canada we have to worry this much.

This was a fantastic opportunity to see inside the historic Parliment buildings. The tour guide was friendly and knew a lot about the arcitecture and workings of the Canadian government. The tour was free and takes about 45mins.

My title sums it up pretty well. As a contractor, my father influenced my love of architecture since a young age. The history in those walls are interesting enough on its own, let alone the beautiful craftsmanship that has gone into the building itself. Carving after carving, into wood and stone alike kept me enthralled. The archways, domed ceilings, and...

The pariliament buildings were beautiful to tour. I would have liked a bit more narrative from our tour guide, ie history, anecdotes, etc plus a little more time to view the portraits instead of just walking by. Basically toured the House of commons, the senate, the library and the rotunda, in about 40 min.Cannot really wander around as security people...
We did not take a guided tour, but the information office gave us a guide book, we followed a non guided tour, which was great we could do it in our own time.
So powerful! This is where our country is governed. Spectacular buildings and such a beautiful location. Truly need to go there!
We happened to get in on a tour and it was really worth it. We learned a lot and the building is so beautiful

My colleague and i did a tour of the Parliament Building...it was absolutely amazing! We got to go up and view the tower and got a personal tour (it was very cold and only a couple of people showed up so our tour was very interactive and personal.)I recommend anyone who is visiting Ottawa to go and do a...
We went and viewed the Parliament Buildings while in Ottawa, so close to where we were during our trip. This was definately worth checking out.
They were close to the hotel and beautiful to see. The architecture around the area is beautiful as is the location being right on the Rideau
If you haven't seen the Parliament buildings on a trip to Ottawa, you must; they're beautiful and it's very interesting to see where government functions.
I enjoyed the atmosphere, landscape and know that this is where political parties meet and make federal decisions.
Saw the PM's office and the first PM's office. Marvelous. Visits are free and well organized...offered in french and english.

We walked in the gates of the parliament grounds and a police car pulled up and turned around. The window wound down and we were summoned to the police car. I thought Holy Heck what have we done.A Royal Canadian Mounted Police officer jumped out of the car and asked us where we were from and what we were...

Needless to say, this is the best attraction of the capital city of Canada. You can take a free guided tour and take a photo in most rooms. The library is the most beautiful part, but you can't take a picture there. After the tour, go up the Peace Tower and get a nice view of Ottawa.

This majestic piece of Canadian history stands out as a must see. You can enter its halls and be moved by their old world charm. Walk around the grounds and view the green landscape with the canals and Ottawa rives as a backdrop. Do not miss this. A must see.

I enjoyed being able to walk at my own pace around these majestic buildings. The views over the Ottawa River are also beautiful. There are some interesting statues and sculptures but it is the massive stone buildings that maintain your attention. I did not attempt to visit inside any of the buildings and am not sure if this is possible.

We like walking around the Parliament Buildings. We love looking at the views and the statues. It is a very relaxing place to be. We also liked visiting the cats..but we have learned that place is closing. The cats will be getting new homes so that will be nice. You can also take a free tour of the buildings so...

The buildings are on the hill. If you've seen one you've seen the other. That being said, it is a bit sureal being there. Seen the buildings/hill many times over the years (on TV) but was glad to actually be there...especially on Canada Day.
I couldn't stop taking pictures of these beautiul buildings. The grounds were meticulously maintained as well. We were there for Canada day and it was amazing.
The Christmas lights were amazing. Beautiful architecture, it's always fun to see the Parliament buildings.

It was an amazing experience to visit a full tour through Parliament. Since we went on a weekend, we were able to take a full tour. We were pleased to find out that they had tours both in English and in French. The rooms were saw were absolutely gorgeous and we learned a great deal about Canadian government from our...

Cross the Sapper's Bridge over the Rideau Canal, through ancient iron gates, and you will be greeted by colorful crocuses and daffodils along the path, to the magnificent front lawn of Parliament Hill.That first view of these magnificent buildings is spectacular. The Peace Tower and Canadian flag waving in the blue sky, over the old Clock is the centerpiece...

Its been awhile since I last toured the Buildings but the history of all previous and present governments are on display with a large library and the view from the top is amazing. Its a must see if visiting Ottawa.
Usually try to get to the Canada Day Party on Parliament Hill. The crowds are enormous and lots of fun is had by all and by all ages.
A must see if you come to Ottawa, very imformative and cultural, a lasting memory great to educate yourself and children

A must see for everyone; very enjoyable history lesson in the beautiful surroundings.Guided tour of the Parliament Buildings and the Peace Tower is very informative and interesting, the grounds are lovely, stunning views from the hill, amazing backdrop for photos.

The East Block is located on Parliament Hill in Ottawa. Tours are FREE and available during peak summer tourist months. The East Block was the traditional location of the Prime Minister's Office, although the working offices are now in a building accross the street. Guides and character actors tour guests through offices preserved from when notable Prime Ministers worked there.

From the classic stone work to the patina'd copper roof to the eternal flame and the summer pagentry of the Changing of the Guard and all tyhe festivals including Canada Day This is the heart of Canada. I drive by here mst days on my way to and from work, and always fills me with pride
Truly a spectacular place to go to. It's simply a must see. Bring a camera, you will definitely want to take pictures, and be sure to visit it again at night for it is lit gorgeously.
It's an amazing building. The free tours are comprehensive and very informative. The entire building is one enormous piece of art. One of my highlights in my 10 day trip to Canada.

What an amazing, ever changing yet constant beauty. Want to hang out on the grass...go ahead. Want to see a concert, it`ll come. Want to dance, sing, cry, laugh, sleep or whatever you want...you can do it here.
Wonderful set of buildings and always find it interesting to go inside - in spite of all the security. I have been in to see the vote several times and this is a very interesting process

We are lucky to have such a spectacular setting for our legislative buildings. The buildings themselves are the best and magical at Christmas time when all the decorations are up. Loved the statues and honour the fact that this is Indian land

Great tour of the Canadian Government. Must visit if you are in Ottawa. The tour is FREE, and is only about 45~ minutes. Guides are very knowledgeable. Kids might not enjoy it all that much. Library room is BEAUTIFUL, too bad no pictures there.

Beautiful city with amazing architecture. I was amazed to see the beautiful architecture of these parliament buildings.We had some time for overnight and decided to explore the place. There is a lot to walk around to explore all the structures.I liked these unique architectural buildings during my visit.
The tour was offered in both French and English. The tour guide was very informative and friendly. The Parliament Building itself was very nice especially the magnificent Library

There are plenty of statues to look at (mostly past prime ministers, but also some of the Queen and other historical figures such as the Famous 5), along with nice views of the Ottawa River and the canal locks.If you're there during the summer, make sure to check out the stairs down to the walking path near the river....

A relative visited in July, so we took him to do all the usual touristy things. He's deaf, so we had to call ahead for a sign language interpreter. It was a little difficult to set up a date (I think there's only one interpreter, so it's based on her schedule), but once the reservation was made, it wasn't a...

They have nice sound and light shows at night during the summer. They also have activities during Canada Day. It is well taken care of and guarded by the RCMP. There are a few places to visit in the back, including a shelter for cats.
Gotta go if in Ottawa. A must see if you are in Ottawa, even if just from afar. Nicely lit during the holidays!

This is must visit place in every season. Try to arrive early in the morning to avoid the long line-up. After the 3rd visit, I finally got a chance to come up the tower and enjoy the historical view. Nicely decorated on Christmas.

I was in aw!!! It was so beautiful, and decorated for Christmas which was unbeleivable! I got all choked up and teary, patriotic I guess. Go see it do not skip this. It was a great learning experience and every Canadian should visit while in Ottawa. and it's FREE!!!!!!!

Walk around, make a eish at the centenial fountain. Take a tour, orvtake on a show. Walk around and meet RCMP on their horses. Ak them a question, go around back of center block nd meet the cat of parliament. Read and dmire statues. Marvel at the beauty. Centre building is where parliament is, westbandveast block where opposition have theiir...

Take a tour, marvel at the building, love that library. Shoulder to shoulder with the ministers. Learn about the parliament, meet past Prime Ministers in portrait. This is where decision are made. Sit and take a parliament session.

You can't review this place without kudos to the guides and security personnel who are so warm and welcoming. They seem truly happy to show off this beautiful piece of Canadian culture and history.The library literally took my breath away with its majesty and beauty. Just love the fact that the guides do not allow talking in the library...

Went for the turning of the book of remeberance page stayed for the tour. Growing up in Ottawa I never visited until I moved away. Fantastic. Must see for all Canadians, and visitors alike. My tour guide obviously cared a lot for the buildings and made the tour very personal feeling.
School trip with a bunch of Grade 5s, very well handled and lots of really good info for the required show & tell sessions!
School trip with a bunch of Grade 5s, very well handled and lots of really good info for the required show & tell sessions!
The Peace Tower is well worth the short wait. Quite moving to see the books of soldiers who died for Canada and the stain glass windows are magnificent

The Parliament Hill is for sure a heartwarming stop you can make. Observe the fire fountain, the exchange of the guard ceremony, the clock tower, the senate, the house of commons, the library and much more on this guided political journey.

Canada's parliment is one of the countries most historic buildings and they are a must for anyone who has not visited them or Ottawa. Sign up for the tour as it gives you a history lesson too and lets you into areas you otherwise would not be able to see.

A free tour of the hallowed halls of Canada's Parliament House is not only a history lesson, but a fascinating walk back in time, where you are taken to the top of the Peace Tower with wonderful views, through the amazing library, which, fortunately, was saved from earlier fires, and ale to view the replica of London's Big Ben.Views...
see where our country and laws all started and continue. The kids loved the portraits of the Prime ministers
You can't go to the nation's capital and not stop by the Parliament buildings. Truly historical and very interesting.

Everyone should do a tour of Parliment building, it's just beautiful inside. The interrior design is so intricate and detailed and full of meaning and history. The library was just gorgeous and so lucky it got preserved. The foyers are wonderful even the halls are richely decorated. The tour is free and only 1hr, though you do have to pass...

It's called a light show but really it is a multimedia extravaganza. There's video, cartoons, music and clever optical illusions. The effort put into this show is amazing. I wish I'd had a better camera so I could really do it justice. You have to see it at least once.
Nice to see, nothing special though :) I am used to more ancient kind of buildings. However it is nice to see such a place surrounded by flowers!
I really enjoyed the summer light show at Parliament Hill. I had heard it was boring and dull but I guess I'm just a nerd enough to enjoy!
the buildings are awesome, very different from the rest of Ottawa. The view for the Pace Tower is awesome.

This tour is for FREE! I thought almost everything except "Tim Hortons" was expensive in Canada. The tour lasts for about 60 minutes and must not be missed if you ever have the good fortune to visit Ottowa. Tours are in both English and French. Our guide was very enthusiastic and really eager to pass on her knowledge. Take a...

Lived in Ottawa for several years and did a tour as part of my "bucket list" before moving. Great experience overall. Try to go on a day when the House of Commons is sitting so you can go to the Public Galleries to watch a debate. Schedule in an extra 1 hour for this b/c it's fascinating (and frustrating)!
so beautiful - so Canada! Pristine and well organized - just like a Canadian should be! LOL Really well maintained --
Very concise and informative tour. I have taken it twice and both times the tour guides were top notch and knowledgeable about all aspects of the buildings and the workings of Canadian government.
It snowed on that day however, we were still happy to be there. Ottawa is unlike any other city ... it's Canada's capital and we're very proud of it.

The tour of Parliament is free. A very knowledgeable young history student was the host and excellent in all ways.I arrived early, and was able to take the lift/elevator to the top of the Peace Tower to read about the history of the tower, and take panoramic photos.As I waited for the tour to begin, I chatted to...
So clean! Everyone in and around the area is more than willing to help in directions. Loved the whole area.
A look at some of the great historical rooms use by parliament many years ago. We were told this would be the last summer for tours as they are shutting it down due to budget cuts. Sad.
There is so much construction going on around the buildings right now that you can't see very much and you certainly can't get any good photos.

Bit of a wait to get in, but was great and very informative. Beautiful architecture to look at! The library is especially beautiful, and there are many paintings, stained glass windows and statuary to look at.

What a place it is to go to work every day! interesting architecture and the library is an absolute must to see as well as the upper and lower chambers... To walk in those hallways where the prime ministers walk for the past century... is just amazing to be a part of canadian history... an absolute must to see in...

The buildings are beautiful and this should be a great experience, but you are made to feel unwelcome. I certainly didn't feel I was a welcome visitor to the peoples house and was disappointed at the way we were required to queue and then be herded through like sheep on a restricted access tour. Nowhere near the positive experience of...

East Block holds significance history with the Senate. Part of the trio of bldgs making up Parliament Hill. My foreign students - China, Brazil and Japan had a great time once the decided that it looks like a face on the tours of both East and West Blocks.

If you visit ottawa, you have to visit the parliament buildings. The tour is offered in both english and french, and it is very cool You get to learn so much and you will see the parliament first hand.

It has been quite some time since we last visited our capital and without the kids we were able to do some things we normally wouldn't including the Parliament Buildings. The tour was very good and we got to see all the important areas including the House, the Senate and the Library. Very interesting and it makes you proud to...
Lovely views, gorgeous architecture, and a piece of Canadian history. Makes for a really nice walk at night or during the day.
This made for beautiful photos and memories. You could walk right up to the buildings and see the intricate architecture. Just awesome.
If in Ottawa, do go and visit Parliament Hill. I went for a quick tour, and you can walk all the way behind the main building and enjoy spectacular views of the Ottawa river.Very cool.
Lovely site with great view of the river. There is a little bit of construction going on, but the sites overlooking the river and the view of Champlain were very compelling

Wonderful Architecture. Friendly tour guides, but the tour could have used a little more meat. Tour was free. The parliament library was gorgeous, the peace tower was neat, and the chamber was breathtakingly beautiful, equally moving or more moving than anything we have in America save Gettysburg Battlefield.
Nice building with a chance to tour it (through a guided tour). Worth seeing.The queues for the tours can be a bit long though.

The tour is interesting and the Parliament is beautiful. One thing that spoiled the tour a bit was the fact that the House of Commons was in session, so we couldn't see it with our own eyes. Just saw a short film on a TV and also the tour guide showed it on a piece of cloth which she held...
Great attraction if you're staying in the city. However, it is difficult to find parking close to this location, and parking can be costly in the city in general
These are impressive buildings, especially the library. The tour we joined was interesting and informative. There was a great view of Ottawa from the top of the Peace Tower. Well worth a visit.

The old warning goes, "There are two things you should never watch being made -- sausages and laws." Despite the devious arguments and partisan wrangling we witnessed during Question Period, we still found our tour of the Parliament Buildings, including sitting in on Question Period in the House of Commons, fascinating and enjoyable.Be prepared, though, for more security checks...
Impressive building and very popular with the tourists. We didn't do the guided tour. The tourists doing exercises on Wednesday in front of the building is a spectacular sight.

This year 2012 I was back to see where the heart of our government works after 40 years. Was even better then I remembered. They used the main building as a screen and played out the history of Canada on it. You have to see it in person to believe it. I will never forget it.
This was a very educational stop and we had a very entertaining guide, which made it fun. She shared a lot of interesting facts and stories, which we quite enjoyed.
We didn't have time to do a tour of Parliament, but walking around the buildings and seeing the sights associated was a great experience.

I love Canada. I am not Canadian but attended college in Ontario for 3 years in my youth, so I was very happy to visit the Capital for the first time ever.Canadians should be proud of the capital and Parliament Hill says the right things about Canadians and Canada. It is impressive without being showy. It is serious without...

The Parliament buildings are nice for a walk around and there are many historical statues and plaques to read, but my favourite part of the parliament buildings are at sunset. At the back of the buildings there is a viewing platform over the river which is spectacular for photographs.
