For a free way to while away a 1-2 hours in Ottawa, you've got to visit Parliament Hill and take some time to admire the intricate Gothic architecture and frame the perfect artistic photo of the Eternal Flame in front of the main parliamentary building.When you're done wondering around outside, pop indoors for a free tour of the building...

After having been to Washington DC I did not think I would be impressed with Parliament Hill. And I really was sadly surprised that I wasn't. It had a very laid back type of atmosphere and minimalistic decor. I would have at least expected Mounties to guard the premises and during the week they would have their red tunics on....

The tour was really fast (lasted about 40 min), but very interesting. They give you a little folder when you get there to guide you through the buildings. Great view from the clock tower! And it's free!
The security lineup to get in is a necessay bother. However, it is worth it. Do go up the Peace Tower. The grounds are pretty and the buildings are important to visit.

The parliament Buildings sit up on a hill & are a sight to see.The firelit fountain in front is quite beautiful.You can walk all around the buildings & at the back look out over the Ottawa river to Gatineau Quebec.There is ,also, a memorial set up for our soldiers lost in the Afghan war that is very moving & allows...

The Parliament buildings are a similar style to Englands.The inside are stone, woodwork & structure is very amazing.My favourite room was the library with breathtaking woodwork.Please don't miss these important buildings.

Everytime I visit Parliament Hill I am reminded of the great history of Canada. I love the sprawling buildings and the Peace Tower. Great green lawn and eternal flame make it feel like a place for people to gather.
We had a tour of the building. Since it wasn't in session we got to go to the library in the Parliament building. It was excellent. The guided tour was good. The only pain was going through security.

If you only have time to walk the grounds of Parliament Hill, don't miss it. The sculptures are amazing, the views from the back just lovely, the memorial monuments inspiring. New female visitors always have Tea portrait taken. You'll see what I mean.

A tour of our parliament buildings is a must see. The decor and architecture inside are truly breathtaking. Not to mention the Library which is unbelievable. and the carvings. and the floors. and the ceilings. One hardly knows where to look.

The parliament hill worth a tour on foot all around as it has many path and they have. Good view on he river and different views on the biildings.Just sit on the grass and wait few hours to hear the clock or see people visiting or protesting.
Every visit makes me understand more and more the history and present of canada.I like the guided tour and the library which is awesome.Visiting the peace tower is also an excellent attaction

The tour was about 45 minutes long and our tour guide was really good. The group we were in was the largest allowed but she was great! The tour itself is fascinating, especially considering we got to see the House of Commons and the House of Lords as we went on a Sunday (if you went during the week you...

We did a free tour of the Peace Tower and Memorial Chamber as the usual guided tours were all fully booked. I would highly recommend it: you get to see inside the Parliament building which is really lovely and take the elevator to the top of the Peace Tower which has amazing views. Definitely worth doing!

It was great to spend 45 minutes inside the Parliament building and see the two Houses and the Library. It is an impressive building that every Canadian should visit when they happen to be in Ottawa. The guide was enthusiastic and informative.

We went for question period which is quite a show.Question period starts at 2:15pm but you canget in about 1:30 and you will see other topics being debated. Stay a bit after question period as well and see petitions being presented.We really enjoyed seeing them in action.
The tour was a bit regimented, but being the national capitol, they are very busy. Amazing building!!
Peace tower, chambers and library are the core of the visit, the view of Ottawa and Gatineau from top of peace tower is so nice.

The buildings at Parliament Hill are beautiful and the way they have been built is so worth a look inside. The ceilings are simply amazing in some areas as is the library which is like something out of a movie. This area of the building at Parliament Hill is simply amazing. We did a tour at Parliament Hill which was...

Take time to see this place inside and out. We took a tour (fortunately Parliament was not in session so we saw lots of rooms). In addition, there is beautiful statuary on the grounds and beautiful overlooks of the river from the back.
It's quite something. Thinking about all the tourists who come to Ottawa to visit Parliament Hill and other attractions makes me feel lucky to come from here. I'm proud to be from Ottawa.

We left the tour with a sense of pride and a newappreciation for our capital--well organized, clocktower was very impressive--great views of the city andGatineau. Guides were informative and polite.A must do --in Ottawa.
Very impressive set of buildings, had the opportunity to do a very nice and free guided tour inside the Parliament.Too bad we could not stay much or take picture inside the library :(
very interesting, takes 45 min. go up to the tower, perfect view around. go as early as possible, saves waiting time. very friendly and informative guides.

Be sure to walk behind the buildings for a spectacular view of the Ottawa river and Hull. Even with some of the buildings under construction, capitol hill is incredible and an amazing piece of history.
These are very historical buildings, with an English style of architecture. The construction on these buildings is very artistic. A place to visit
Walking the grounds is fun in itself. So many great bronze statues to enjoy. Inside is also lovely, especially the library.

The buildings are very impressive. Typical castle-like European style. You will be amazed by the beautiful decoration and the details. The guided tour is very helpful for you to learn how to appreciate the talent of the architecture. It's art and history instead of construction.The guided tour is free. So it's very busy over weekend or holidays. Try to...
Had an excellent tour by very friendly and knowledgeable guide. Choose time when it was not in session so was able to see the Senate,House of Commons and library which is not always accessible.

Very busy but that was to be expected. Took a few tours that went over alot things. The view from the tower was amazing as was the views outside on ground level. If you go make sure you see the light show at night
tour with two teenage girls, the tour guide's enthusiasm for Canadian politics gave them a great role model, as a young woman, and left them feeling that politics were kind of cool.

We went to visit Ottawa over the long weekend with our two younger kids, age 6 and 9, and very quite stunned by the beauty of this particular historic site.Built in 1870 the Parliament hill complex is definitely one of the most amazing in North America. The views that open from the hill towards Ottawa river and Quebec are...

Very organized system. During the summer months, you go to the white tent right on the grounds and receive timed tickets for free. There are three tour options and you can do as many as you like. We did the East and Central block tour, we decided to skip the grounds tour. Both tours were very interesting and informative. As...

I visited Parliament Hill on October 1, 2012, and took the free tour. My review is written from the perspective of an American tourist, who is not deeply versed in Canadian Civics.Christalle, our guide was very knowledgeable and her pride in her country's government beamed as she led us around the building, showing us the Senate Chamber and the...

We found the tour very enjoyable. Our tour guide seemed to enjoy his job and had a lot of information (We did the tour of the Center Block only). Library was beautiful. We also enjoyed walking around the grounds on our own. The map is easy to follow. Pleased to say we did manage to see a cat in the...
The hill is worth the visit, lots of history here. Take lots of pictures, for added excitement take the tour inside the centre block building. great view of the river from the back.

This tour is very structured, security screening as you enter. Very clear where you can go and where you cant. Have to stay with the group. Lots of history on Canadian Govt and current govt structure. Peace tower and library are the best parts of the tour. You can walk the grounds outside as well. Lots of RCMP around so...

The Parliament Buildings are a wonderful architectural feature of Ottawa. They are old and significant wear/tear can be seen and observed, hence the perpetual construction and scaffolding around the buildings, as continuous restoration is underway. There are FREE guided tours of the different wings of the building, you just need to book a time and select which tour, then join...

A tour of parliament hill is not complete unless you can see the members of parliament in action. If they are in session when you visit make sure you include attendance at question period in your experience. This is about a 1 hour session in the afternoon when opposition members get to "take pot shots" at the various shortcomings of...
took the free tour of parliament bld and was very impressed with the beauty...the tower was very impressive and moving with the dedications to the fallen soldiers..
I visited in July so the Canada Day stage was set up on Parliament Hill but the vista overlooking Quebec is worth the walk up the hill.
There are limited number of tours done daily, I suggest visiting early in the morning if your intent is to tour the inside.

Ottawa is the most beautiful city of Canada and the Parliament Buildings (Peace Tower or Clock Tower) it is great. Go and take the free tour to the Library don't missed it, and then go by yourself to the Clock in the same building.

We aren't normally interested in Parliament buildings but Ottowa is stunning. We did the inside tour and it is really worth seeing. It is beautifully built and restored from a fire they had. There is amzing craftsmenship in the stone and wood and portraits. Wouldn't mind working there myself.

Pretty buildings, great pomp, mediocre tour. It was hard to have such a flat introduction to such an important part of the public history of Canada. Our guide was very nice, but had little passion for the information and did not engage us.The buildings are ornate, but we didn't learn the import and history of their origin.I would...
We got the last English language tour of the summer with a wonderful young guide. Because it was Labor Day we got to see more of the building than usual and it is very impressive.

The parliament buildings are a must see if you are visiting Ottawa, just walking the grounds is a good way to spend a half hour. You can also sign up for the walking tour inside the buildings which is free.
Unfortunately, we were unable to access the building due to a protest being held outside! However, it is well worth seeing even the outside of this building!

I am in love with our parliament. Whenever friends come to visit, we always take a wander around - they are just so beautiful! Now, as a PoliSci student my classmates and I can be found often frequenting question period when we don't have class. I would definitely recumbent it to both locals and those passing through!

I love the blend of French and English architecture. Appears very British on one side but definitely has a French flavour on the other. The buildings are beautifully preserved. Something for Canadians to be proud of. Interesting place to visit.

+ The symbol of the city+ Important monument for its political role, its size and its view over there on the city of Hull (in Qubec). Ottawa is in Ontario.+ Sounds and lights show at 9PM on the wall of the Parliament Hill.

Loved the old castle look to the buildings. Unfortunately we were not able to tour the inside as they were closed for the day. If you like history and a sense of national political power, this is the place for you. Not Washington DC, but a lot more casual and surrounding area has a lot of restaurants and things to...

Living in Ottawa we tend to take the Parliament Buildings for granted. But visiting it will help Canadians put what they see on TV in perspective. It is part of who we are. It is also one of the free things that can be done in the Capital

During my recent stay in Ottawa, I made three trips to Parliament Hill. On the first trip, I did not go into the buildings but merely walked around these impressive structures, taking pictures of the buildings and the monuments that surround them. On my second trip - at 9:00 AM on a Sunday - I took a tour of the...

Truly a beautiful sight - restoration was in progress so that marred the views a bit but we walked all the way around and then also walked over to Major's Hill Park for even more amazing views across the water. Drove across the Alexandra Bridge for more views. We also got to see a demonstration on the steps of Parliment...

Very worthwhile visiting and it is free! We turned up and were able to join a giuded tour straight away. However, on the day we visited, it was our giude's very first tour on his very first day so he did struggle a bit to get out all the information . Also, we did not see the House of Commons...
need to see the night show of the mosaic of Canada - it is very very well done to music. it is attended by a huge crowd.
We would definitely recommend touring the Parliament Buildings. The tour guide we had was excellent.

Learning about Canadian History and this centre of it should be a must for all Canadians. Walking amongst the lifesize portraits of the Canadian Prime Ministers instills a sense of pride in one's country.

Although we missed the changing of the guards, we still enjoyed the surrounds of parliament hill. It's an amazingly beautiful place which was a hive of action. I would highly recommend this to all visiting ottawa

I loved the architecture, and the information shared by our knowledgeable tour guide Karine. I felt badly that she had to contend with a very vocal child during our tour, as it made it difficult for everyone to hear and appreciate the information being shared. The only disappointment was not being able to access the House of Commons, as the...
We went the day after labour day and there were no line ups. However this meant lots of the special presentations etc were finished.
After dark light show is a must see! Beautiful display on the buildings while learning some history.

Changing of the guard is a lot of fun, especially for us yanks who have never been to London. As close as many of us will get to the full beef eater uniforms and ceremony. Nice way to start the day. Unfortunately the tours of the buildings themselves were closed the day we were there :( But the architecture, statue...

Took the little one for a bit of Canadian hisotry this weekend and visited the Parliament in Ottawa - our guide, Gala, was very knowledgeable and fun.We even got the opportunity to visit the Parliament library - what a beautiful section of the building! It is usually closed to the public during the week, but open for visitors on...

The tour is ok but they certainly don"t go out of the way to show all the splendors of parliament hill. I did however like seeing the memorial book and inquired on two family individuals that died during the first and second world wars...they were helpful on getting a copy of the page that contains their names..
If you visit the parliament building have a little sit in the park andalong will come some little chipmunks well worth watching.

If you take a tour while parliment is not in session you may just get to sit in the House! The library is a must see and so is the senate room. If you have an appreciation for decorative arts this building has lots to offer!
Walked by it on my way to the weekend market, and couldn't help but feel proud of what it represents. Awesome images.

I am sure parliament is fantastic to see, but between the fact that most everything was closed to us (since we showed up on a Sunday) coupled with the torrential rain and grey skies, it was a somewhat weak experience, but nothing to do with the buildings per se, just my own personal experience. Make sure you go around the...

On my trip to Canada, I visited Parliament Hill in Ottawa where Canada's federal government resides. We walked the grounds and went inside The Centre Block where a guide shows us around - and gave us a lot of detailed information about the history and the work that goes on there every day. The Centre Block is home to the...
It seemed to be a meeting place for all - yoga on the front lawns (for literally hundreds); a place to view the illuminations on the Parliament building; the centre of the city's attractions.

The Houses of Parliament building is based on the London Houses of Parliament but seems so much more 'friendly' and accessible (yoga for 100's on the front lawn - but not in London!) Our guide, Emily, gave a concise and cheery tour and we thoroughly enjoyed the visit.
If your going to Ottawa, you just can't miss it: The whole city is surrunding the parliament hill.Great building both outsiide and inside. Great panorama from the back of the main building!

If you enjoy going around building's like this , seeing the place of work of Canadas "Rulers" , then this is the place for you ! Many interesting facts can be learned about the people that govern Canada!Building is similar to Englands Parliament but smaller !
Nice to wander around and see the architecture, lines were a bit long but since it was free couldn't really complain.

My favourite summer events have been the Wednesday noon yoga and Mosaika. Nice too feel that Parliament Hill is for the people (particularly when the folks inside seem to have forgotten that government should be for the people)

Did the center block tour. Busy Sunday, so we had to wait a couple hours but it gave us a chance to do some window shopping and eat truck food.The tour guide was very sharp. She had interesting stories about the different rooms we saw. She was very engaged and very pleasant.Peace tower lineup was too long for...
In the summer there is a light show on the parliament buildings each evening. Plan to attend as it is quite effective and something to see.
I loved it. A good place to know about culture, history and visit espectacular architecture views and places. I will recommend all my friends to visit this wonderful place.

I have lived in Ottawa my whole life and visited the Parliament Buildings multiple times but realized I had never taken the kids. This summer I "dragged" them downtown one hot morning.The tour is a little long for kids but the Peace Tower (separate lineup) is pretty interesting. You will have to go through security and only groups of...

We visited the parliament buildings on july 24th. We enjoyed the free guided tours inside the buildings, and were really surprised about how good it was. It was very informative and beautiful, and our tourguide, Lucas, was awesome!

Watched MosAika on buildings at night very cool but expected fireworks too for Labour Day on the Sunday night but none. Went back during day to hike around and see flame, monuments and statues but lots of construction. Lots of helpful blue shirts. Skipped inside tours but did them previous year and kids really enjoyed.

Parliament Hill is chock full of history and statues of historical figures with information on how they affected Canada's growth as a country. Lots of great places to take photos. A free guidebook is available at the Visitor's tent with maps and more info. Don't forget to visit the Cat Sanctuary!

Did the Centre Block tour, which gets you inside and you see the Senate, the House of Commons, and the library. Walking tour is about an hour long, plus security inside - and free of charge! Great to see some of our country's history.

We booked a tour on the spot and were on our way within 20 minutes. Our guide was well educated in Canadian politics so easily explained everything we saw and spoke loud enough that we could all hear. I've lived in Canada all my life but knew embarrasingly little about its history and how our government runs. This tour gave...

We watched the changing of the guard, toured the East Wing, then did the Main tour and peace tower. Took us all day! Not worth the wait for the one elevator to the peace tower. The best is the Library tour included in the centre block tour. I've seen it many times, as I was raised there, but it still...
Again, I think I've been there every other year or so for the past 50 years. It has become too restrictive.
Not really. I guess I've just been to Parliament Hill quite often and as the years go by there is less to see.

I did not go in the Parliament buildings- not sure if tourists are allowed. But! It was amazing to look at / walk around them. During the day they looked very royal and historic and at night they were illuminated and resembled something right out of Disney World.
This is a don't miss show. It's our 2nd time and we sat 45min. just to see it again. We didn't go into the buildings this time but we were there in the evening.
You have to arrive early in the morning and reserve yourself on the tour before it's sold out. A great tour that every Canadian needs to do!
Loved the buildings and learning about the government and people of Canda. Guided tour was great and they answer all questions with ease.
The guided tours are free and informative. Walking around the grounds provides both history and a great view of the Ottawa river.
I enjoyed the outside sites but there is not alot you are allowed into. You can go in the Peace Tower but I was interested in seeing more... no can do. A little disappointed.

The beautiful architecture was better in person and the tour guides seemed very knowledgeable and humourous (Centre & West block). I had no idea that the libray was so stunning and it actually made me gasp when I first saw it.

We liked the light show projected onto the buildings at night,also the historical nature of the buildings, & the ease of access. We also enjoyed the parks around the buildings, & the lookout over the locks from the back.

The East Block of the Canadian Parliament buildings is one of the most densely packed and momentous historical sites in Canada. Our tour, led by a knowledgeable and pleasant guide visited the offices of John A. MacDonald (Father of Confederation), the Governor General's office and, most impressive, the Cabinet Chamber in active use until the late seventies. In this large...
Don't miss the library, which is surely one of the most beautiful in the world? The archectural detail is incredible!

OK If you want to visit Ottawa, do not forget to visit the parliament buildings. You will see so much artistic details. The guides also are very knowledgeable. If you are ask to wait half an hour or an hour for a tour, please wait. You will not regret this. If you have a chance of visiting the west block,...

The Parliament Buildings are very nice. We was on a guided tour in the Centre Block and in the library. The admission is free, but you have to obtain the tickets with exact tour times on the right side of the Centre Block in a white tent which was open from 9 am. Do not bring to much pack with...

The Parliament Hill was a fascinating park, with the beautiful architecture of the Parliament Buildings. It is very nice to walk around it, the scenery is very nice to the Civilization Museum as well. There are a lot of program on the hill including the different tours to the Parliamnet Building and the Changing of the Guards.

Original woodwork in the Privy Council chamber of white pine. Very interesting history and original articles from the offices of Canada's first Prime Minister. One of my favourite places on Parliament Hill in Ottawa

Walked around after a conference and boy was it relaxing and enjoyable.Beautiful scenery, paths and gardens.Great for couples, solo travellers as well as photographers.Found a hidden path that leads to the lake and beautiful photo shots of the areas surrounding Parliament Hill and Ottawa.Be sure to go on a day full of sunshine to see this...
Have gone on the tour before but always love it. Tour guide was great and the group included non Canadians do the questions were great.
You would enjoy your visit if not because of the much admired architecture would be the fine view and the natural beauty of the place
Great free tours of interior and exterior. Knowledgeable tour guides. Make sure to go up the Peace Tower to get great view of city.
Enjoyed the light program at night. We need to understand that part of being Canadian is that we can access our nation governments grounds and have a high quality program.
We enjoyed the light show twice. Took in the tour of the east building and the main building, and enjoyed getting a better understanding central Canada

Did the tour of the east block and main center block that included the peace tower and the library.Lots of history and great architecture to see. The tour guides are very knowledgeable and quite nice. In order to do the tour go to a big white tent on the right side of the parliament buildings and they'll give you...

9:30 every summer night, the southern face of the whole Parliament building backdrops a free, half-hour-long, literally-brilliant sound & light show -- so larger than life that I wilfully will not describe the *few* moments I felt, 'Huh?' I must recommend, also, the free tour of the East building -- but, based upon my delight, four years ago. Last week,...

Really fun to see and the buildings are beautiful. We saw the Guard change ceremony and it was really fun. They really make an event out of it. We also saw the evening time light show which was really entertaining. Then we had a tour of the inside of the main Parliament building and it is stunning. Loved seeing this.

Lots of space to walk around and enjoy. The nightly free light show during the summer is fantastic!! People are friendly- even the police!The only downside is that there always seems to be work being done on the buildings. Hence, the ugly scaffolding.

Parliament Hill is always a beautiful place to visit. Wonderful views from the Hill overlooking the City and the Ottawa River behind. The Sound and Light Show (Mosaika) at night set against the buildings is quite spectacular! Also, don't forget to see the Changing of the Guards!
Beautiful architecture at the confluence of 3 Rivers. Spectacular views from the top of the Peace Tower! A must see!

Did a daytime tour of buildings. Very interesting. Guide was awesome. What a view from top of the tower. Caught the evening light show - it was great. Had our attention for the whole time. it was amazing
The architecture was wonderful. Enjoyed my visit there. Did not take long to tour. Grounds were lovely to walk around.
Guides are fantastic and friendly. House of Commons and House of Lords is very impressive as are each of the lobby areas.
The most fantastic laser light display of the history of Canada and it's people. As an Albertan found that western Canada did not feature much in the 30 minutes. SHOW IS FREE.
Wonderful, educational tour, great guide, beautiful buildings, don't miss the peace tower. Our teenagers thought it was cool.
Visiting it was very interesting, both East Block and Central Block (very organized in assigning tour). Beautiful the Sound and Light show in the evening!
we have one of the best parliament buildings in the world!! a must see for all canadians and visitors

Great tour and tour guide and it was free! Was very busy the day we were there so a bit crowded but Jenny did a great job of keeping us corralled! Very proud to be Canadian after seeing the Buildings and the other areas in Ottawa.
Explored the Parliament buildings and joined the free ongoing tours which are located onsite. The tour guides were very informed and gave a great historical perspective of Canada.
Free tours of the inside & outside of the building. very interesting for older children. Staff very friendly & informative. would recommend this.

it's free if your on a budget, well worth a look. Staff very nice & helpful, answer all your questions. Nice to learn more about canada & understand what actually goes on there. And good to know the Queen seems to be just a figure head & she does not pass law herself, it is done on her behalf.

I love the tours of parliament, they are free and very interesting. You have to go through airport like security so leave all metal and pocket knives behind, though they give them back at the end of the tour. The only thing I disliked was the screaming kids. This is not really a tour for 5 year olds and under....

Every morning they have a ceromony in full dress which lasts about an hour, including marching bands. This is very interesting, but fortunatley we were there for the FORTISIMO which is of an evening, consisting of military bands from several countries, and this was extremely good, followed by a light show on the parliment buidings. This was free of charge...

We had a very good guide and we learnt a lot about the history of the building and the prominent people down the years. To think it is completely free, us Brits need a lesson in treating visitors to our heritage without an extortionate fee. It is definately worth seeing when your in Ottawa

While there we got to see the light show at night on the main block of Parliament. What a terrific show. The hill has lots of grass and for the show, you stood or sat on the hill to watch the show which was about 1/2 hour.

This was a fabulous overview. The most unique thing about this was that the building was destroyed by fire except for the back circular building which housed all the books and archives of the government. It seems that when the fire was burning the person in this part of the building closed and locked this section before he got out,...
What a feeling to explore Parliament Hill in person! Despite the construction we got to see the Changing of the Guard, explore the entire hill and learn more history through statues and artifacts!

We took the tour of the Center Block and it was so worth it! I'd read about it, taught it as a teacher for the grade 5 curriculum, seen little movies about it, but to see it with my own eyes and to learn more about it first hand was the best thing I ever did!

worth taking the kids to Ottawa for....the memorial room is beautiful. The internal arcitecture and the outside ambiance and self guided tour was wonderful. What a glorious way to spend a day. We walked the property on the way "home" to our hotel every day.....beautiful.
We went to see the Sound and Light Show, Mosaika, that is being shown during this summer. It was a great presentation of the history of Canada and a great way to spend an evening.
Not only for the information you will learn about the workings of Canadian government, but take the tour to see the architecture. It's breathaking!

Just visited the Parliament Buildings this morning. We went on the complimentary tour offered (head to the white tent on the right of the building). They have the tours in English and French. We went to the French one, and our tour guide Chantal was fantastic. She had a witty sense of humour and made history engaging.The tour was...

Make sure you go early to pick up your tickets if there are more than two of you. In the summer time they do go quite fast. I would highly recommend going to see both East and Centre Blocks. The East block is very historical and it was a smaller group of people they took through at a time which...
A must-see in Ottawa, of course. Our guide was interesting and friendly. The building itself is pretty.
Wonderful presentation of Canadian identity and history. Great work of art and technological feat. Really great!

We travelled into the city and started off with trying to find a parking spot, which is not easy in Ottawa or other larger sities. This proved to be an expensive we hadnt counted on. The Parliament buildings were most interesting, with guided tours if you wanted them, we chose not too.

We only had time to tour the East block and chose that one because we were told that this would be closed to the public in the next year or so. This is where the Senate staff and senators have their offices, the office of the Privy Council is there too. We saw Sir John A. MacDonald's office that they...
Loved seeing all the buildings of parliament. So cool to be surrounded by these big, beautiful buildings!
Excellent place to visit and there was a light show at night on the Parliament walls. Great views of the city
Set on a dramatic hill overlooking the Ottawa River. A must-see.It's Gothic Revival Buildings serves as the home of the Parliament of Canada.

The Central Block Tour is very good. Coming from the Washington DC area, it is so rewarding to compare the capitals and governments. I learned so much about Canadian government and history from this tour. Alex was our tour guide, and he did a fantastic job. Huge plus - all of the parliament tours are free!
Showing our French exchange student our Parliament Buildings was a pleasure. When you live so far away from the Capital it is easy to forget how lovely they really are.

This is an amazing light show tracing the history of Canada. It is projected onto the facade of the parliament building in Ottawa. I believe that it ends in early September, but it is a real treat. We sat on the lawn and there was a prelude to the light show that started about one-half hour earlier. The show itself...

Unfortunately the Saturday we were planning to visit the buildings, they were closed for.... well something. But, the Changing of the Guard, architecture, status, staff to answer questions, all worth the time. Very pretty. Perhaps next time will be able to take the tours inside.

Very nice to learn the history of Canada! Did the free tours of the center building and the outdoor tour. The center building contains the most important rooms where bills are passed, the outdoor tour describes the history behind the statues. Very informative and interesting.
Must see changing of the guard in summer months. Photo op with guards and mounties! Take a tour of Parliment, free and informative. Buildings and grounds are beautiful.
The tours are free and worth the time for any Canadian who wants to see where our country's decisions are made!
The inside is beautiful. We were able to go right to the top where the bells are. Library was outrageously beautiful. Very very nice.
This was an excellent tour that we took. The library is just gorgeous. I'm certain that it has changed over the years but I do believe it is still a must see.
Such Beauty in this city!!!This was first on our agenda to see in ottawa and we are glad we did !!We did the walk in tour when we went which dose not cost that much
Looks good from outside but they were closed on the only day we were able to visit. You should call ahead to verify they are open during your stay if this visit is important to you.

The Parliament Buildings were closed to the public the day we were there, but the grounds are wonderful, the changing of the guard ceremony was worth seeing and the view out the back was very pretty, looking across the Ottawa River. There is a sanctuary for cats, on the rear left side, so if your'e into cats, you'll like that....
A Canadian gem! You should defintely check out the Mosaika in the summer at night. Our tour guide Erin during the daytime was excellent
Very Impressive! Especially liked the bagpipes leading the way to the reviewing ground. The only thing missing was that the brass band didn't do "O Canada".

the parliament buildings on three sides of the square are impressive. however at the front is a large and unguarded flame that kids could easily climb upon. There didn't seem to be any sense of health and safety associated with it.
The buildings tell the story of the Canadians and their hstory reflected in light on the actual Parliament Buildings, there is no charge and is a great show, well worth standing for about an hour.

The kids loved the band and the uniforms of the guard - too young to understand the significance of it, it was more like a parade to them. The only thing was they say the changing is at 10 which I guess is the offical switch, but it starts at 9:45 and people are lined up before then, next time...
Wonderful lightshow each night. Free to public. Relaxed atmosphere. Do take a blanket to sit on as it is a late show each night and the grass is watered so you could get damp.

This building has just as much history as the Hill and Parliament but is often overlooked. Not sure why its only open in the summer. It is wonderfully kept... to see the old offices of Canada's prime ministers and other senior cabinet officials. How they heated the place. Communications "systems".. wow... very insightful and so well preserved. Its a secret...
The Gothic type buildings are unlike anything in Canada.. Shows alot about the history of Canada and our roots.. A must see in Ottawa
Very well run tours. Great college kids as guides. The library alone is worth the visit? We can learn a few things from them.

Enjoyed it very much ,first class show nice effects and sound was great,my only complaint was it seemed to be 50% Quebec while its only one of 10 provinces in Canada,also I don't speak french so I was at a loss.....But I still enjoyed the show great for kids .........
I love it here. It is our epicentre and reminds us that in Canada, we have something so special, vast and a delight, if we can only see more of it.

The Parliament Buildings are old friends and they look better than ever, imposing and impressive something to be proud of. The flame is always a thrill and a special moment. The Guards change is neat and the way they march up is wonderful and striking. It is such a special place, the heart I suppose of our country, that is...
We are able to wander around the buildings and grounds unhindered in any way, able to enjoy the scenery, atmosphere, architecture and history. Try doing that at Capitol Hill or the White House.

Been a lot of years since I was there and hubby had never been so this was our first stop. Could not get the tour we wanted, but then it is Aug and prime time tourist season. So we got there in the line up first thing the next morning, did the 9:20 AM tour and finished up in time...

Considering this was a free tour it was great! The tours are free so be prepared to get to the tents early to get the tickets. Unfortunatly we weren't but we decided to do the french tour anyways. The library was probably one of the most memorable sites in there.
In the summertime at 10am is the changing of the guard, it's an impressive sight and we went several times. In the evenings in the summer there is a music and light show.
Though under quite a bit of construction, this was a fantastic trip for us to view the buildings. You cannot help but feel connected to history when you walk through these buildings.
Great tour takes about 45 mins to visit the House of Commons, Senate, and the Parliament library. Great architecture and history of Canada's government.

The visit was educational and interesting.I recommend this for anyone who is visiting Ottawa. The grounds are amazing, the buildings do not fail to impress, and there is always something new to learn about the workings of Parliament.
We took a tour of parliament and it was great! Nice l sound and light show in the evenings, the clock tour was interesting.
Very interesting...and insipiring. Well thought out tours with knowledgable guides. On a busy summer morning I was impressed at how effficiently the staff handles the numbers of tourists.
5 minutes from the hotel, the Parliament changing of the guard, free and a must do.Allow 30 minutes at 10 am.

We have seen such displays at such places a Disney World in Florida, and not sure if this was a weekend thing or a regular deature, but really enjoyed the light show in hte evening. It did great justice to the rich history of our neighbor ot the north! Found the architecture of the grounds very interesting and different from...

Bonus visits to both houses of Parliament were nice due to our visiting on a Saturday, a happy accident. We had to delay our servel days in Ottawa due to other circumstances of our trip, but woudl recommend the weekwned to get to full tour. We are from the USA and have visited Washinton DC, but the Canadians do a...
The lighting show which is projected on the Parliament building tells you the story about Canada and at the end a good feeling being Canadian. Amazing show. Must see.

This area is always busy although that is self explanitory it definetely makes it harder to enjoy the attraction when there is so many people around. Overall it is very pretty and the fireworks there are always fantastic.

I never tire of the Changing of the Guards. Held during the summer every day (can't imagine 35C+ temps in those hats/outfits) - starts a 10h00 sharp. Also, free tours of our Parliament Buildings can be done. No hassles like you have in the USA for visiting government attractions- just be honest - and you'll be fine!
Like: nice buildings, friendly guideDislike: waiting very lng for a tour from 40 minutes. Thats the ason why it took an hour.
It was great! Really enjoyed the show. Get there early for a seat or take chairs with you. It really represented Canada and all that it is.
It is free, no long waiting lines, friendly guides and you can learn about Canadian history. Do not miss Changing of the Guard at 10:00, you feel a bit like being back in London

Interesting architecture. Some great views from around the hill. The area behind the buildings that houses stray cats is good to check out and nice that it is permitted. Used to be an elderly guy that feeds then and donations are accepted.

To tour this place is definitely a must as the guides, very much professional will enlighten you both on the process of legislature but also oncanafian history as well which is fascinating considering that this is the largest country in the world!!!

We took the tour inside Parliament Hill. It was beautiful. Our tour guide was excellent who not only explained about the building but also allowed us to ask questions which she had an answer for every question. She was young and very knowledgable.

We enjoyed the tour of the center block of the parliament buildings. We went into both the house of commons and the senate. We also viewed the library (which was stunning) and travelled up to the top of the peace tower. Our tour guide Alexander eagerly answered all our questions with both humor and knowledge of topic. It was a...

can't argue the price, since it's free!they tell you a lot of interesting facts and try to get people personally involved in the tourthe only issue i had was the attitude i received while wearing my hat into one of the rooms (not a big deal to ask me to take it off) but when they asked and...
Architecture is amazing. Everything is clean and bright. Assistance is easy to find. Worth spending a lot of time seeing it.
Great view, wide lense is recommend if you would like to capture whole building. But now there are some construction and renovation on aside building.
Every morning around 10 am there has a ceremony hold in the meadow. Nice it's free and enjoy. The building around the plaza are gorgeous!
Mot reviewers said it's excellent. To me, just a normal average capital building with some history and VIP inside.

If you will be travelling to Ottawa, definitely take the time to go on a tour of Parliament. They offer guided tours for FREE, for both the outdoor grounds as well as the inside. While you must be with a guide to visist the inside, you are free to roam the outside grounds as you wish. However, the tour guides...
Great way to learn the history of Canada and enjoy the outdoors in the summer evening in Ottowa. Enjoy all the surroundings while waiting for the show to start.

Went on Civic Holiday (first monday in August) and was able to view and take pictures of more rooms (even the library!) than one is normally allowed to since there were no workers there to stop us. Of course there was still security around. Had a great tour guide who seemed to love her job.
This was a spectacular light and sound show using the parliament buildings as a screen. it was very entertaining and attended by hundreds of people.

Our day began with the Changing of the Guard (inspired by our English friends across the pond, no doubt), which takes place every day at 10:00 AM on the dot. Very cool and definitely worth watching. Afterwards, we up to the Peace Tower, where a panoramic view of Ottawa and Gatineau made for impressive scenery photo ops. The grounds were...
the buildings are gorgeous and the views of the river are breathtaking. Definitely a must see, this weekend they were doing lots of parades etc...so that made it even more special

We asked our kids what part of the Canada Day experience they liked the most. My daughter, having just finished elementary studies on the Canadian Government, was enthralled with this experience, as was my younger son. The tour guides where excellent; look for your opportunity to see all the features of the tour, as some days have restrictions!
We enjoyed walking around this area. Safe and clean , right in City . There is a changing of the guard for those who have not see this before

Nice guided tour! The guide was awesome! Explained a lot of stuff very useful, mainly if your coutry is not a monarchy! Nice place to go! The visit in the Mosaic show that happend on Summer every night is a must-do. It tells the story by projecting it on the Parliament, very nice!

My comments on Parliament Hill should have been entered here. The hill on which the Parliament buildings are located has many fine statues including a horse-mounted Queen Elizabeth II. The Changing of the Guard ceremony takes place at 11.00 a.m. each summer morning. Very colourful!

This fine building, rebuilt after a devastating fire around 1915, but happily including the original library, also contains a splendid calligraphic record of every Canadian that has perished in each conflict since Confederation, appropriately housed in the Peace Tower, built and named after the aforementioned fire.,
Loved the tour but they are a bit rushed so you need to be prepared to move on quickly. the wait for the peace tower is worth the wait.
This seat of power is also a very beautiful site to visit. The architecture, grounds and central location will require a least a day to enjoy.

Took my 9 year old son to visit the Parliament. He enjoyed it very much, as did I (though I don't think my 5 year old would have enjoyed it). The guided tour is free, though there is a bit of waiting while the group goes through security. We especially enjoyed seeing the House of Commons, the library and the...
Beautiful building. Line up was long to go up to Peace Tower so we had to pass due to limited time. The evening light show was beautiful to watch.

10 PM - great show for all ages, come earlier to get a nice spot and bring your chairs with you.daytime - they have so many different tours - you need a full day to see everything, may be not even one.

I took this tour twice in French during recent years and I enjoyed both visits thoroughly. I recommend that you combine your visit to the National Gallery across the river with a tour of the parliament buildings. The visit to the parliament building was a necessary part of my time spent in Ottawa and I did get more out of...
Mosika is a wonderful exhibition of Canadian history done by lights and music using the Parliament building as a screen
We walked to Parliament Hill to see the light show at 10pm. This outdoor light show and video was free and inspiring. I truly loved it. Awesome job!
These old buildings are so well maintained!! Ottawa is a gorgeous city! Makes us proud to be Canadian. Great for photographers

They are doing away with guided tours of some of the historic buildings on Parliament Hill in the name of cost efficiency! There is no other interpretive/historical opportunity that I know of; misplaced economies. It's a nice place to walk around but nothing has been done to make it particularly attractive.

Every night at 10pm during the summer time, there is a sound and light show at Parliament Hill. This year its entitled "Mosaika" and it sure is something to see. Make sure you bring a blanket or chairs to sit on as the Parliament Hill lawn is often wet around then. Also, there are day tours around Parliament Hill, you...

The architecture is stunning. The place crawls with history and if you can get a guided tour, especially after hours, quite something. Question period is a circus and well worth the price of admission. Lots of memorable and occasionally obscene heckling. Hard to believe that adults can behave this way.

Did the outdoor tour and our guide was really fantastic - lots of interesting facts. The kids were hot and tired to start, so wasn't sure how it would go given it was outdoors and a very sunny day, but our guide did a great job of making it interesting and engaging. We ended up staying on for the indoor...
We watched the changing of the guards, very interesting. There were lots of police, guards, and guides, and people who were there to help you and show where to go.

the craftmenship of the making of this buildings is beautiful inside and out. The clock tower has a beautiful view. The tours are very interesting and they are all free to see. The changing of the guards was fun to watch.

Our first night in Ottawa we walked to Parliament Hilll and walked around a while then stayed for the light show. Then the next morning we walked back and enjoyed seeing the statues and view in the daylight. Then we watched the Changing of the Guards ceremony. Shortly after that we went for a guided tour of Centre Block at...
Everything, My daughter and I and my husband went there for the day, we really enjoyed it, it is something nice to see..... you won't be sorry you went and checked it out.......... .

There is a light show three or four times a week at the Parliament buildings.I guess it is fantastic but unfortunately it was cancelled every night I was there....but the grounds are lovely and looking at Ottawa from the gazebo out back of them is really something. We watched a storm approach the capital from the top of this hill,it...
I was lucky and had a small group when I went through. The guide was very well informed and made the tour very interesting. Take time to see the Peace tower and visit the official cat house.....
It was an impressive building, lovely monuments. Lovely green gardens. At night at 10 pm they do a display of lights which is beautiful. Walking distance of the hotel.
Excellent bilingual guide. The changing of the guard was interesting as well. My daughter enjoyed visiting the cats of parliment hill.

I live in Ottawa and pass buy Parliament Hill on a daily basis. Even from a local guy, it's pretty impressive. You can even book a tour of the inside (I've never done it before). There's a beautiful bike path right behind parliament (next to the ottawa river) that connects to the Rideau Canal via the locks.
Everyone should visit Parliament Hill. The peace tower has great views. The Parliamentary Library is an absolute must see. The tours are well done and well organized.

The grounds are nice to walk around and they have several great views looking out over the city. In the summer, there is a free light show on the Buildings which begins at 10pm and lasts about 45 mins.

Visited once in autumn, once in summer and will deffinatly be going again. Peace tower was great despite the fact it was overcast. The architecture, history and stories about the place and people are fantastic, the guides always try there best to answer everything, once even asking other staff not on our tour so she could answer someones question. Also...

The price is right, but make sure you go before the end of the changing of the guards or you will have to wait a long time. We fortunately heeded this advice and got a 10:20am tour. The tour guide was knowledgeable and pleasant and we went up Peace Tower at the end of the tour which was a highlight...

Very nice tour overall except for some of the poor behaviour of the attendees. One family tried to sneak into the tour after being told it was full and this other group of 3-4 men just wouldn't shut up even when the tour guide politely requested several times. Some larger guy finally told them to zip it and the rest...

Best part is its is free! There are lots of tours times and they are language based so there is no lengthy trnaslations throughout the tours. The groups are fairly small and lots of good information.Security is fairly fast and efficient.
The changing of the Guards was a must but not thrilling. The first 15mins is when the best stuff happens so book your parliment tour at 1020 perfect to see the changing and avoid the rush after
Parliament hill and the surrounding area are nice to just roam around and take in the views and surrounding area.
We took all three public tours and watched the changing of the guard. Very interesting and informative for folks like us from the US.

I attended a music conference and actually sang on the Hill. But while we waited to sing, I enjoyed walking around with a native Ottawan who showed me the cat sanctuary and we had a lovely picnic in the shade. We watched as tourists took pictures of the mountie stationed nearby.

is a nice feeling to know about a historic building that represent so much for all canadians. The back side facing Gatineu will reward you with a nice view of the city and the bridges connecting the two provinces.

Don't hate it because it 'houses' people you don't necessarily like -- walk it, tour it, photograph it and read all the signage of the many scultures on site. It's something to be very proud of, on many levels.
Not a lot to see inside unless you are visiting a Senator. The architecture is interesting and it makes up the suite of buildings on Parliament Hill.

The Parliamentary library is a must see on this tour, but each of the houses were stunning. Tours book out early, so make sure you book a time to return later in the day. Tours are conducted in both French and English.
Make sure to walk around all sides of these buildings because the view from the riverside is not to be missed.

Walking on the Hill one finds many statues of important persons in the history of Canada. Walking around the Centre Block gives a good view of the city of Ottawa, the Ottawa River, and the cities in Qubec across the river.
We took a guided tour and found it very interesting to be inside the building, especially the House of Commons. Tour guide was very good.

The parliament buildings are a sight to behold but you won't get the full scope of the importance of the buildings unless you get a tour and learn more about the history of the buildings and how things work today,We realized a little too late that if you want to see the Center Block which is the biggest part...
Great place to visit and tour. Wonderful building to see - so much history. Changing of the guard during the summer is always fun.
Every Canadian should visit this attraction at least once in their lives.

The tour took just over an hour and covered most of the important parts of the building, but it felt rushed. Our guide was very nice and answered all of our questions. The highlight for me was the library, the only original part of the building still standing after fire destroyed most everything else.Tickets were free (available from the...
Didn't appreciate having to pay for a tour of a public building, but it is what it is. The nightly light show was fabulous!

Peace Tower was an excellent visit. Only one drawback. My mom is in a wheelchair. There were five of us total. I had to take my mom to the top of the tower alone. No one else could go while she was there. It's a safety issue, but I don't know why the whole family couldn't share the experience together....

The tours are wonderful and highly recommend them. The staff at the ticket booth will help you select times so that you can see everything you want plus the changing of the guard in an efficient manner.

The Parliament Buildings present a fascinating blend of art and statesmanship.There are THREE tours available( in English and French and sometimes they overlap) for the Centre Block and other TWO blocks but we chose Centre Block.There was another tour of the Lawns, available. The architecture and interiors of the building create an air of dignity. There are decorations , paintings...

Beautiful walking trails along the Canal and through the parks around the buildings they are very pituresque from every angle. Ottawa is a very clean city. The Byward Market is Great too! Many choices for a bite to eat or great pubs if you are thirsty. Side Note: Dogs are allowed on the Hill so long as they are leashed...not...

We walked up to the info tent at 3 and got 5 tickets for the 3:30 tour - no muss no fuss. Reviews in other forums made it seem very difficult to access to the tours but we didn't have an issue.We travelled with three kids and they stayed interested the entire time we were guided through Centre Block....
The buildings are full of Canadian history and beautiful work of arts, Worth spending time

Really checking out the stonework inside is amazing. They are still carving every night. Each piece tells a story or reflects some aspect of Canada. The guides are great but you learn something different from each one. I've taken the tour many times over the years and learn new facts with each visit. Definitely a must do for visitors to...

interesting but nothing spectacular. tours are backed up one after the other, and despite the security screening process to get you in, once you are through the doors all concepts of security seem to go out of the window - silly really.

It is well worth your time to try to schedule a visit to the Question Period in Parliament. The Canadian government is much more functional than the US government since they have a broader range of parties and opinions, not to mention the fact that the debate is often conducted in both French and English. While big American money is...
Fab views, beautiful architecture around this area.

We did not tour inside due to lack of time, (in hindsight - wish we had of) however, the views from around the Parliament buildings are magnificent from a 360 degree perspective. The spaciousness of the city and it's magnificent buildings cannot fail to impress. I particularly liked the playing of the Parliament tower bells to popular tunes. While we...
Lots of walking and picture takings. A little bit boring but relevant and an important stop for all Canadians.

It is truly awe inspiring to visit. Seeing the Parliament Buildings, both inside and from the outside, in person is much better than any photographs I've seen. I was amazed by how low key the security is. Make sure you're there for 10 AM to see the changing of the guard.

Our guide was new maybe, but she lacked the necessary gravitas for the job. Equally, many questions she could not answer and what would have helped was a guide who could bring the place alive with anecdotes and stories as opposed to rushing you through and saying 'Any questions?' before driving you on like a dog sleigh....only the moosh, moosh...
Excellent production on Parliament Hill at 10 p.m.

You MUST visit!Go up the Peace Tower for some great vistas of Ottawa-Gatineau. Visit the Memorial Chamber and ask the guide some questions - very knowledgeable young people.Take a free tour of Centre Block! So worth the time! Our guide spoke so clearly and concisely and answered all questions very competently. Be aware, though, that the Harper government...
Although you know what they look like, they are tremendous whenyou see them in person. Beautiful from all sides.
great access to the buildings interior, good picture shots of special areas

Definitely worth an onsite visit and use of the tour guide. Interesting, well organized and deserving of a visit.View from the tower is 360* of the city of Ottawa.Every time I come to Ottawa I visit this site.

Business is conducted here. The tour was not what I had expected. We were herded through security and marched around in a tight group. You see a bit of the interior, but I thought the exterior of the building was better. A tour of the outside would have been better.

The parliament buildings are Canadian history. The first thing that is striking is how large the buildings are. A photo doesn't capture that. If you can get into a tour, the Parliamentary library is worth a look, as well as the House of Commons and the Senate.
Very impressive. A must see on a trip to Ottawa. Make sure you see the changing of the gaurd. Very impressive!
The building is truly amazing, and the view especially from the water is quite outstanding
it was amazing to see this gorgeous old building inside & out. The Peace Tower was our fave
Beautiful Gothic style which enhances the city. Great place for a Kodak moment
Easy to walk around the beautiful old buildings. Suggest doing the walk at night and during the day.

We visit the Parliament on a rainy day. By the time we get around there was not any english,spanih tours, only in Frenh and was the last one. The only way to get inside the Parliamnet is by official guided free tour. After clearing the security checl point the guide took the group inside the building. I can follow some...
Ten AM each day there is a changing of the guard which was great - with a marching band! Must see
Get there early, as tickets can sell out. Tours are by language. Also, be sure to take the elevator to the top of the tower. Very cool vantage point!

Only stayed outside for Fireworks for Canada Day, it wasn't as grand as I thought it would be considering it's the capital city.Had some neat fireworks in the shape of the Maple Leaf but that was as nice as it gets.The concert there was nice though.

It's the kind of thing you'll probably do only once in your lifetime :-) You have to take a guided, approx. 1-hour tour, in French or English, which is given only during the week. Tickets are free and timed every 5 minutes or so. No cheating, as you have to hand in your colour-coded ticket at the right time :-)...
Excellent tour and spectacular attraction. Don't miss the Cats of Parliament!

Just had a wander round the outside - very impressive building, hadn't expected it at all. You can walk right round it and the view from the back over the river is impressive. The bell chimes are also nice to sit and listen too.

As an American, I was given quiet a history lesson when I visited parliment. I will definitely be back to show my family was an awesome building and grounds. The tour was great and we were able to see so much more than I imagined we could visit. This is something that all Canadians should be very proud to show...
Never get tired of visiting ph, a lays something new to see, check out the feral cat display,,,

Its amazing that you can walk around a national Parliament, in such a relaxed way that you can enjoy all the views without to much security! If you can find RCMP Mounty Ross on his patrols his stories will make your day!
It's a sight to behold that every Canadian and tourist to Ottawa should see.
Canada's greatest landmark. Direct connection to the Commonwealth. Beautiful Architecture inside and out.

Being an american I was not sure what to expect for Canada Day. A huge thumbs Up Canada. What a party. It was maybe the best event of that kind i have ever seen. Great festivities, friendly people, affordable, and very well organized. The Parliament Building a just amazing to look at all the detail in the stone work. Real...

We did the Parliament Buildings indepth this time, from the tour outside, The House of Commons, The Senate, The Peace Tower, The War Memorial Room...loved it all. We allowed all afternoon to visit and even in the rain enjoyed it thoroughly. I cam away Proud to be Canadian!

I visited the Parliament Buildings for the first time in May and left feeling very proud to be Canadian. Love the Gothic buildingsThey have some light show going on at night which I found delitefulSo very nice

The Parliament Buildings are a must-see if you're visiting Ottawa. A true delight for the architecture buffs of the world. Canada's Crown Jewel has to be the Parliament Library -- absolutely breathtaking! the architecture is very elegant and the tour is not only free but very interesting.
We loved it, really good group of beautiful and great monuments
We loved it! We had an amazing time with change of guard and the spectacle.
Such pomp and circumstance. If you can plan to attend the ceremony it is really worth making a side trip for.
Take the tour, it provides plenty of history and interesting things about the building itself.
Beautiful walk through the grounds after very heavy snow storm. We enjoyed a late night walk star gazing and enjoying our magnificent Parliament Hill in the still of our stormy Canadian winters.

We toured the Parliament buildings, including the House of Commons, the Senate, the Loibrary, and the Peace Tower. We passed many security checkpoints, so be patient. One of Ottawa's key landmarks we visited downtown. I also encourage you to go to the Rideau Centre and the byward market for some good restaurants downtown.
Access, space and design, especially in the sunshine!

We were at a convention in Ottawa and visited the Clock Tower at the parliament buildings in Ottawa. There is a great view of the River at the top of the tower with pictures pointing out all the important buildings nearby. It was worth the wait in the line up.A bonus I was not aware of was the elevator...
the landscaping was gorgeous and well kept lawns the tribute fountain was inspiring
very interesting to learn the workings of Parliament

Ottowa is a great city to wander around and the Parliament Hill area is very picturesque - lovely buildings ad great views from the back of the main parliament building over Victoria Island and Gatineau - you can get free walking maps from the Ottowa tourist guides who wander the streets and who were really helpful!
Amazing views and the tour is awesome. The elevator ride to the top took a little while but was well worth it.
It would have been nice to have gotten pictures at night time. Next time I travel to Ottawa I will.
I always see them on television, but have never seen them personally. But, now I have and it was breathtaking.
A great place to walk on a sunny day, and admire the architecture.
Just walk around the area- or better yet rent a bike and cover more ground. The buildings are beautiful.
I've never been on a tour of Parliament so the inside tour is worth taking! It's totally free as well.

The buildings are beautiful to look at and I feel like you have to at least stop by and get your picture taken in front of them or take a quick look. We wanted to go up the Peace Tower, but didn't end up having time.

Wonderful! So neat to be there, see the city from the roof and sit in on the House of Commons. It was wonderful! I would totally recommend this tour. It will make you proud to be a Canadian. Too bad Senate was in session so we could not visit that part but I am glad to hear that they are...
Doesn't take too long, and a great review of Canadian politics.
It is a beautiful building to spend time in. Very elegant and interesting and the grounds are just beautiful. Well worth a visit for anyone visiting Ottawa.
A brilliant way to spend a day. The buildings are quite stunning inside and out as are the grounds. Lots of history.
Spent an afternoon walking around the Hill. Perfect weather, little or no crowds and dog friendly atmosphere. Appreciate the splendor of our Nation's Capitol

Our tour guide was a local girl returnign home for the summer off from university. She knew her stuff and was perky and cute in a non-annoying way.Was a real treat to see the inside of Parliament, see the history of the building, and hear funny little stories about it's history. Defintely a place that makes you feel patriotic!...
What a lovely ornate building , well worth a visit
Our Germany friends enjoyed the people practicing yoga on the grounds of the peace tower. It was very strange to experience such a behaviour in front of the Parliament hill.

The east block is essentially a part of the overall Parliament complex in downtown Ottawa. It reflects another era of the founding of Canada as well as the centre of democratic governance. Formerly housing offices of Sir John A. MacDonald and other eminent Canadians. If you're coming to Ottawa for the first time then take the Parliamentary tour and see...
Amazing architecture and of such great historical signifigance.
Check this out you can see some of the best views of Ottawa from the Parliment tower! So worth the line if there is one.
Went there later in the evening so no crowds. Was very peaceful and serene to see the old construction and view from the hill. Loved it!

There's lots of construction happening right now (June 2012), but the grounds were open and there are LOTS of informed guides around to answer questions about the buildings and monuments. GREAT view of the Canal from the back gate.
The light show "Musika" is amazing. Amazing how they make that building light up. Beautiful and entertaining.
Free tour was brilliant initially our motivation was mainly to get us out of the rain however the tour was alot more insightful and enlightening than we could of hoped for thoroughly recommend
Where else can you get so close to the place of government !The architecture is just beautiful, the grounds always clean and nicely groomed. I never get tired of it !
Wonderful tour in English or French. Beautiful building, well organized tours.During the tour of the clock tower the elevator goes sideways

Having lived in Ottawa all my life, I've always taken Parliament Hill forgranted. I've always referred to it as the House of Hot Air...lol. Did a tour of the Parliament Building.Not surprisingly, saw a lot of suits, but the scenery itself is very beautiuful and well kept

We enjoyed the tour and were able to see all as it wasa Saturday and parliment wasn't in. Peace Tower wasexcellent, helped us find our Uncle that was lost while serving in the Air Force in the memorial book. Easy to do in half day

The tours of Parliament are offered in both official languages. Some guides have more knowledge of trivia than others, but all the tours are interesting. On the grounds are statues of various Prime Ministers and the "Famous Five". Tucked away at the back are the cat houses.

I didn't allow enough time and so was unable to go on an inside tour because there was a 3 hour wait for the next available tour - so organise yours well in advance!
Very beautiful grounds!Go for a walk all the way around the building too!
Short and didn't get to see too much as the house was in session
Really beautiful buildings in the heart of Ottawa. If you are visiting the town for the first time, you must take time to visit these.

Parliament Hill is a wonderful and an important place in Canada that is Worth seeing. IT is one of the National Historic Sites, and it has a lot of background information on our Canadian Ancestors. People love coming to Ottawa to visit this Beautiful Luxurious place each year. This is a 'Must See' area!
I never get tired of seeing the iconic buildings when visiting the Nation's Capital.

The tour was a bit boring but none the less it was fun to visit. Some security guards attitude were very poor

It just makes you want to walk or jog or just sit and look at it. It is the peaceful. We drive to work every morning and use Colonel By and it calms us right down before work. Beautiful to look at, lines too long for the Peace Tower.

Take the guided tour, very informative. You see alot of history as well there are memory books in honor of all the fallen soldiers over the last wars. If you have relatives that gave their lives, you can find out which page they are on, and the last time I was there I was able to get a copy of...

We really enjoyed the tour of the parliament buildings but were very disappointed to learn that there was no changing of the guard ceremony and no where on a weekend in May could one see a full dressed Mountie in Red uniform.......
Great place to visit. The view from the top of the Peace Tower is stunning...
Beautiful buildings . I personally liked the architecture . One of the best site to see in Ottawa.
Beautiful buildings, park-like atmosphere. NO entry fee, I was not in the mood for HISTORY so we did not go in. From the outside though, it was beautiful.

You see it on TV, or in pictures, but nothing compares to in real life. .. the parliments are an amazing site to see for anyone who travels to Ottawa!
Great site to take in. Lots to see, plenty of walking a must for every Canadien!
At the very least great place for pictures.We were there on a holiday and dont know if tours were available
Seeing these buildings was amazing .It really gave us that feeling that were Canadian and proud of it .We just wondered the grounds and enjoyed the views .Truly an amazing site and worth the visit ,

First time in Ottawa and naturaly i visited the Parliament Buildings. Beautiful!!!! Just stunning realy.
Beautiful buildings, very interesting, very old, historic

Great did know I could walk that much lol...........
great visit, too muche construction work but things have to be fixed....

Loved the Library. I was overwhelmed with the amount of literature that was available and also the architecture of the building itself was fabulous.

Visitors always enjoy seeing the Parliment buildings and especially the Library and Peace Tower. Worth the short wait for a tour.
Visiting the grounds of Parliament Hill, and taking a tour of the Parliament Buildings is a must for any Canadian, or visitor. This was a highlight of our visit.
Amazed by the wonderful view, lots of nice kids playing and also a little problem which was promptly solved by the most sympathetic and respectful policemen I have seen in my life.
The tours are interesting,but we had to wait a few hours and the guide was off like a racehorse.

The Parliament Buildings are beautifully maintained and loaded with Canadian history. Tour guides point out the highlights in French or English. It's a must if you are Canadian or visiting Canada for the first time. Located right down town near numerous other attractions.
They are beautiful to look at and you can feel the history of our great country speaking to you from these buildings.
Really worth a tour, informative and fun. Also nice to stop at Hotel Laurier next door.
Lovely old buildings and beautiful grounds. Well worth the time to walk around. Many tours offered if you want to do the building tours too.
It is humbling to visit the seat of government. Even though we elect them, the laws of our country are born here. Good view too.
It is humbling to visit the seat of government. Even though we elect them, the laws of our country are born here.
we took the tour, the peace tower, the senate, and sat for a while in the parliament gallery. Very interesting
It is just a beautiful building to see and part of our history, the eternal flame is nice. A lovely place to take pictures.
We were able to catch the daily parade in the summer wich was great and we were also able to see the show on the buildings at night which was excellent.
Enjoyed the tour of the parliament building. it was a great little piece of history

We really enjoyed exploring Parliament Hill. Buildings were very interesting, lots of statues etc. The locks were also fascinating. Our daughter was most impressed when we saw a very cute ground hog running around on our way back down the hill.
The guided tour of Parliament house was very interesting and free!You were allowed to take photos and the guide was more than happy to amswer any questions. Gift shop had some very unique souvenirs!

Darn cold day. Walked for many KMs. Stood in front of Parliament and tossed a coin in the confederation torch. My father was on the committee that selected the Canadian Flag with Pearson. Nice moment remembering the good times with Dad.

If you're a tourist in Ottawa, Parliament Hill is a no-brainer. You basically have to go.It's got great views and great architecture. The tours of Parliament are generally great, and the walk around the hill along the river is really beautiful - you can see why they chose this spot for Canada's parliament buildings.A must-see.
Thanks to a very interesting and devoted guide we had a most interesting tour of the Parliament Buildings.

The views of the parliament buildings, the numerous statues, the flowers, the Ottawa River, the Rideau Canal, and the Museum of Civilization in Hull, are unique.
Every Canadian, and every foreign visitor has to visit this place. The guided tours are excellent, and you get a great sense of the myths and symbols of Canada by touring the buildings.
The paintings, the architecture and woodwork, the gargoyles, the library!!!!, the war memorial, the Peace Tower, the walking tour of the statues!

Just a beautiful area to walk, bike,jog around. A very large area, beautifully landscaped, many interesting sculptures, bronze statues, beautiful mature trees. Clean, crisp, inviting...what Canada is all about !!
close to hotel and they had a bonfire during the night...

You're in the Nation's capital... you have to go for a (FREE!) tour of the Parliament Hill - Centre Block! There is no tour schedule, but run fairly regularly. Tours last from about 20-60 minutes. I really enjoyed the tour of Parliament Hill. We went on a Sunday so we had full access to everything that was on the tour. The buildings are really impressive, so much detailed work done inside. The tour guide was very knowledgable.
I have done the tour of parliament many times now and I always enjoy it. So rich in history, and each guide has their own little trivia bits to add so I learn something new each time.

We visited Parliament Hill and Parliament Buildings during March. We enjoyed the FREE guided tour very much. You can visit the top of the Peace Tower and the rooms of both chambers, among other things. These buildings are stately reflections of Canada's past and present. They are grand and impressive, especially at night when they are lit. Whether you do a tour or just pass by, this is Ottawa. Lovely.
It was nice to see old building and history right in front to you.
Nice area to wander around, plenty to see, and free to boot. Came away with a much better appreciation of Canadian History.

I hadn't been to the Parliament buildings for many years, and took my son on a recent visit to Ottawa. Part of what I liked was we visited in April and the crowds weren't too big. We were a little early for our tour so we visited the Peace Tower before it started and it was a highlight.The tour...

If you go when it is not busy, take the tour so that you can go into the library. It is beautiful. Be sure to go up the Peace Tower. The view of Ottawa and Hull is great.
