the tour was free and the building beautiful.the view from the Freedom Tower was worth it.
Walk around the property and took the tour inside. Can't believe the beautiful art, architecture and history of this place. Stunning library as well.

The tour guides are impartial and often have good insight into what really goes on in the halls of Parliament.The buildings are wonderful and really convey a sense of Canada's history.Check before you visit because access to some of the buildings may be limited because of restoration work that is underway.
The grounds are beautifuland the views are majestic.I always like to see the protesters they remind me of our freedom of speech in Canada.
The buildings are beautiful and it's a nice area to walk around

be sure to go behind the parliament buildings for a good view of the river
A piece of history that you should see at least once, the library is wonderfull.

Absolutely beautiful with the steep copper roofs. The library in theback is absolutely beautiful. I highly recommend taking a cruisedown the Ottawa River. You get an excellent view of othergovernment buildings.
Great way to see Ottawa, Ontario and the Gatineau/Hull, Quebec

Area is beautiful and the people in Ottawa are very nice

Ottawa offers great food selection near by and the parliment buildings and grounds are beautiful. You will want to plan to spend several hours just walking the grounds on a nice summer day. It has to be seen to be believed. A must for every Canadian. I never tired of showing the Parliament Buildings to friends from out of town.

We went through the security so we could have a chance to sit in the gallery of the Canadian Parliament. What a special, enlightening experience as an American to be able to see another country's government in action. Very worthwhile especially if you are interested in such things. I could have sat there for hours.
Nice to see, but the wind was wicked! We also took the guided tour and checked out the view from the Peace Tower
We did the guided tour, which is free. And we checked out the view from the Peace Tower.

The "not to be missed" attraction in Ottawa. Beautiful grounds, amazing neo-gothic parliament buildings, increadible views of the Ottawa River and surroundings. Everyone should take the time see the Parliament Buildings. It's a great way to spend sunny day in Ottawa. It's amazing how big it really is when your right next to it.
Very impressive! It's the best area for thousands & thousands of people to celebrate Canada Day. I miss the Trudeau era!

Ottawa recoils and energy that is unique to only Ottawa. Be prepared for airport style security. The tour includes the library, senate, and house of commons. The library is beautiful with its ceiling and beautiful wooden structures. A tour well worth going on - but go there early to pick up your ticket or you may not get one!
It was awesome downtown Ottawa. We bar hopped ate viewed the sights. It was great

too cramped and busy. musty smell and cool drafts.

The tour was great. The tour guide knew alot of great facts and answered all our questions. We went on a Saturday so we were able to see all the different rooms.

wonderful to see the heritage buildings and the architecture. embarrassing and dissappointing to sit in the house and watch our disinterested mps behave so badly!!

beautiful views of the Ottawa river and museum of civilization across the river in Quebec.

Entire family enjoyed the tour of Parliment. Tour was 45 minutes - the right amount of time. We learned some interesting facts about the Canadian gov't. Beautiful building on the outside and inside. Walk by at night to see it lit up.
This is a fascinating part of every Canadian's heritage, and well worth the visit. Allow some extra time to explore the area round the buildings.
Parliament is a must see when visiting Ottawa. To see and experience the history of our great country is well worth the trip.
Always more interesting to return as an adult, the grounds are beautiful
Had been when i was younger with school. Appreciate the buildings, structure, history more as an adult
Check ahead to see if the buildings are open and if you need tickets for a tour. We were able to walk in about a meter but got sent out for not having tickets.
Beautiful building and rooms but the guide seemed more interested in keeping us in line that teaching us how the Canadian government worked. Library was really impressive.
What can I say - it is our nations showcase and it is reflects everything that is Canada - Powerful, Creative, Bold in its architecture and reflective of a historic past!1 A must see
old style castle like buildingscanadian flag every wherebeautiful view of the canal and the river at the back.gas burning fountain (makes great for pics)awesome scenery and history
Really great FREE tour of our Capital buildings. The library is stunning. Even the kids enjoyed themselves. Wonderful view from the Peace tower.

Its an interesting place, if you're of age or mind set to appreciate it. Having kids there is about as much fun as going to the dentist. If you can make it a couples thing or visit on your own then go for it. But lack of activity and interactiveness makes it agonizing for those with children.

The buildings dominate from several points of view around the river, across the river and in the city. They are also open for guided tours - the woodcarvings and marquetry in the Library are true gems.

Having lived in Ottawa for over a year I found Parliment Hill to be very enjoyable and relaxing. The pride as a Canadian I felt for our history, present and future was undeniable. Every Canadian should take the time to enjoy the Hill once, preferably around Canada Day. It is the one time that Ottawa truly comes to life. The...
After 4 pm on a Saturday is a great time to walk around Parliament - we were the only ones there. Saw the cat hostel - worth a visit.
Lots of heritage buildings to see. And the grounds are nice to walk on as well
It was nice to see where all the political happening are going on. It was informative and the building is beautiful.

Once you got into the building the tour was very informative. It took a hour to get a ticket and then another hour to start the tour. However, you could wait in a line to go up in the Peace Tower. The Peace Tower was very special. Once on the tour the time went very quickly (about 1.5 hours). We...
Whether you are concerned with the politics inside or not, the building itself is a beautiful piece of architecture and the history is interesting.
A splendid free, and accompanied tour with a knowledgable host. beautiful building with many interesting historical facts within. Well worth a visit!!
In the summer they show projection videos at night on the parliament buildings on our history or other themes. they are pretty spectacular
the water front is a site to see. view it from the quebec side and you'll see the whole thing from a perfect vantage point.
What an impressive Capitol City. The buildings are great. The location is amazing. They were closed on Sunday so we didn't get a chance to tour them. Next time.

To visit the Parliament buildings is to spend time viewing historical andarchitectural buildingwith the flavor of London England. If you chance upon the changing of the guards on Parliament, you will be enthralled. Don't miss it.
Loved the design and the art, from marble sculpting to oil on canvus master peaces. Dry tour tho, never the less far more interesting than I would have thought before having gone on tour.
Beautiful to visit for two reasons, our history and the ornate sculpted columns and decorations close to the ceilings.
Great architecture and history. Tours and views are great. The grounds are impressive and well maintained. Worth a trip to see what it's all about.
Probably best to visit when parliament is not in session so you can visit more areas of the Center Block
We Canadians should be mighty proud of these buildings.

The entire experience of understanding Canada can perhaps be best seen and experienced by visiting Parliament Hill and the House of Commons, situated in the center of Ottawa. Boarded by the beautiful Ottawa river to the north, Chateau Laurier Hotel to the east, The Supreme Court of Canada to the west, and the downtown core of Canada's capital city Ottawa...
Check out the Parliament Buildings at night for the free light show. An inside, daytime tour is available but not recommended to those with a low threshold for boredom.
Worth a visit,take the tour (free) through the parliament.

wonderful opportunity to see the Nations capital, and where it all happens. Would recommend the tour, guides very knowledgeable. Unfortuately, could not get into House of Commons, or Senate, or the Peace tower, this was disappointing, but did get to see inside the beautiful library and the rotunda.

Most recent visit was opening night of Winterlude, with fireworks silhouetting the Peace Tower, crowds of people wrapped up against the cold, and the Maple Leaf flapping above it all. Can walk around the parade grounds and feel part of the great Canadian heritage.
Fantastic old buildings but unfortunately are currently undergoing lots of renovations.Great to go see the Parliamentary library

I was with a group and we attended Question Period in the House Of Commons followed by a tour with a guide. It was a very memorable experience, and I highly recommed it to anyone with an interest in Canadian History or Government. The building archetecture is stunning!
is definately the GEM of the Hill. The only true original artefact left from the original building and refurbished with execellence.

Essential Ottawa. Lots to explore. Typically quite touristy. Bring your camera, views from the front and back are impressive. Gothic architecture, which is constantly being renovated, is quite pretty. Bonus: At certain times of the year in the evenings there are light shows projected onto the buildings which are a nice treat for either a couple or a family to...
During the summer its always nice to relax. 5 minutes from byward market, just beside outaouais river, you can see flowers and have a pic nic!
Very cool to see! A must for photographers to get some good shots of gothic architecture

Parliament sits in the heart of downtown but still offers a beautiful view of the river behind and many gardens surrounding. And the buildings themselves are stately and regal. Makes me a proud Canadian just to see it!

We have not toured the interiors of this group of buildings, but several times while we were in Ottawa for the Tulip Festival in May, we walked around quite a bit. There are a couple of vantage points, on each side of the river, offering dramatic vistas (the banks down to the river are very high & steep). If there...

This year 2011 / 2012 there was once again a wonderful display of christmas lights on the Hill. Set in a snow covered landscape the illuminations were spectactular. Worth while visiting any time of the year.

Its free to visit the Parliaments buildings and well worth your time. The buidlings itself. the round library and the carvings and pictures, and of course all the history make this a worthwhile place to visit.

Elegant building. Check out the Library for sure... a round building with a stunning dome and three tiers of hand carved pine bookshelves. Lots of Canadiana details in the carvings. A work of art. It was recently restored.

HIstory, grand architecture. See the Parilamentary Library. Beautiful hand crafter pine bookcases, three tiers high. Gorgeous dome. Stunning Victorian architecture.See the views across the river at the back of the Parl. Buildings looking north across the Ottawa River toward the Gatineau Hills. A jewel.
take the tour of the clock tower its well worth it
We arrived at 3 PM and they only had tours in French left so we passed. Maybe we should have taken it so at least we could have walked around. Beautiful building and grounds.

Attractions need not cost anything. Parliament is downtown and a close walk to the mall, restaurants/bars (i.e. Byward market) or the river. Bring a blanket and have a picnic in the park. Walk/bike/roller blade along the river's extended pathways and make Parliament a stop along the way. Sneak a stroll in with a visit to the museum of civilization or...
The grandeur is amazing, beautiful buildings and a great history.

I cannot think of many seats of goverment that are so accessible to the general public. It has wonderful architecure, gardens and walkways. There are some hidden gems as you follow the pathways towards the river. The views are simply great.

A must see of our beautiful Parliament Buildings. You can go for a 45-minute free tour of the inside. You'll go through security like the airport. You'll visit the Senate Chambers, pass by portraits of past Prime Ministers,House of Commons, hallway whee Pierre Trudeaus body lay in state plus Obama walked here.

Nice. Lots of statues around the ground such as various Prime Ministers (I like the statue of Lester B. Pearson watching over our Parliament) Queen Elizabeth on a horse, "Women are Persons" celebrating landmark victory of women struggle for equality.
Beautiful Architecture with lots of hidden treasures and secrets. Although security can throw you death stares...its quite interesting
great view. Cool cats. Great during summer nights to see Mosaika
Just picturesque and very historical for every Canadian Beautiful walk outside.
Very informative tour and the architecture is amazing!
Historic building but must go on a tour. Not allowed to walk around by yourself
The view behind these buildings is as nice as the front and inside
History is made here, the buildings and grounds are beautiful. Don't forget to catch the changing of the guards on the grounds during the summer at 10:00 a.m.

Here, you see where all the politics action happens. Many building but you can only visit the center block which has the original wood library and the peace tower (where you can view Ottawa and gatineau).You cannot drive on the hill and there is no parking, you can walk on it.Some events takes place here such as canada...

We love to walk around the parliment buildings in all seasons. They are magnificent. We wait to take the tours in the off season though when demand and crowds are smaller. We learn something each time and so do the kids. They love it when the cover a segment of Canadian politics in school as they have their memories of...
In the morning, there is the Changing of the Guard, after dark a wonderful light show is a must see.
A tour of the Parliament buildings and enjoy the beautiful site and learn about it
Pretty to see, lovely to walk around. There are kitties who live all around the Hill, very friendly!

My husband and I really enjoyed the tour of the Centre Block. It was interesting to learn the history of the buildings, see the House of Commons, and the Senate Chambers. And since we were there just after Christmas it was still beautifully decorated for the holidays. Definitely recommend1

Well worth the free guided tour. The Parliamentary Library is worth the visit alone. Go to the top of the Peace Tower for a great view of the city. The grounds around the buildings have many statues and are particularly nice in summer.
very boring tour you are treated and herded around just like cattle

We learned that tours for the Center Block of the Parliament Building on the last day of the year was until 3pm and we got there before noontime only to be informed that there were no more tours for the day. Got to see only the building lobby.
Unless you want the tour, it's just a pretty building.
The Parliament Buildings represent Canadian dedication to preserving our heritage buildings and are impressive.

A well informed young lady took us on a tour of the Parliament Buildings and the Peace Tower. It was very interesting to hear the history of the building, and its various additions. It's very beautiful inside, especially the library. If you want to go make sure you book a time in advance...it's very popular!
The ultimate showpiece of architecture and history in Ottawa
Apart from the great architecture, the views are amazing and the photo oportunities are breath taking.

Take a free guided tour. Very informative and very worth while. You may have to wait for a tour during high season, but worth the wait. The buildings themselves are quite impressive and an excellent photo oportunity
Free and an insite to the way government operates. The library is exquisite.

There is no fee to enter, but the visitor's entrance was situated awkwardly to one side. You enter the premise and go through a security checking area, similar to the airport screening area but you go through this tiny room where there were tons of security guards just staring at you.After that, you walk through a path. Not too...
the weather wasn't very friendly during our visit - it was raining!
The inside is beautiful and the view from the Peace Tower was amazing - there were no crowds due to the snow but that made the view even better.
It was nice to see what another country's capital buildings.
Beautiful gardens and a spectacular view of the Ottawa River from behind the Parliament Buildings. There is no where else to be on Canada Day. Great entertainment and fireworks.
The tour of the Parliament Buildings includes a visit to the library which is truly amazing piece of architecture. It is the only part of the structure that is original and did not burn.

The grounds are beautiful.Stake a stroll.in the summer you can see the change of the guard.Its centrally located near lots of restaurants.A must see during your visit to Ottawa.Its especially nice on Canada Day.Everyone should experience Canada day at least once in their lifetime.What a party?

Come and see your tax dollars at work.Take a tour.Sit in the gallery watch democracy at work. I was there when the constitution was repatriated.Visit the peace tower.Visit your Member of Parliament in his/her - ask them to take you to lunch.This is the crucible of democratic debate.Have fun.
What a wonderful heart of Canadian government. The location is spectacular, the architecure is amazing. Washington has nothing on this!
We have taken the tour every time we are in Ottawa and we will continue to do so.

As a history and political science student, this was a must-see for me. Even if you are not interested in politics or history, the tours are at a very basic level and are very interactive and interesting. If you are from Canada, you must see this at least once in your life. You can also travel up the clock tower...

Such an important part of history.The buildings themselves are superb. The great detail that has been kept in tact is remarkable.The tours are free!Might be a tad boring for very young children.Even if you aren`t political, the actual buildings are great to see.The grounds and gardens are also very impressive. You can walk all the...

The grounds are very beautiful and have many objects of interest. In spring and summer there are beautiful flowers all beautifully displayed. Another interest is the feral cats that live there. All kinds of cats, wander freely, have little houses and can usually be admired basking in the sun, playing, etc., and some are very friendly and will even come...

The buildings are beautiful inside, and the guided tours are great. It is not as accessible now as it once was, and you must be screened on entry. However, it is well worth this small inconvenience. Beautiful architecture, portraits, etc. Do not come to Canada's Capital without seeing it. Location is very central to shopping, other museums, Conference Centre, Canal,...

We took a tour, which you must do if you have time! The library is a total highlight, and seeing the buildings decorated for Christmas added some joy to the tour. Our tour guide was wonderful, one of the best guides we've ever had, and she handled tough political questions (our tour had an argumentative guy who wanted to argue...
The library is magnificent. Saw the Senate, Peace Tower and Commemorative Chapel. Get there first thing in the morning as it can get crowded and you have to book to go on a tour.
Centre Block and the Peace Tower are a place every Canadian should visit! Guides are generally excellent and open to questions. East Block is not open in the off-season, unfortunately.

It is free to visit the Parliament buildings. If you get there early you can get tickets to have a tour inside but even walking around the grounds is nice. Take the tour - it is well worth it to hear the guides interpretation!

The tour takes about one hour and is free. You will see the house of commons, senate (including the Queen's thrown) and the library. You can also go up in the Peace Tower which is over 300 feet tall. From the top of the tower you can see most of Ottawa. Great history lesson for kids (and parents too).
Enjoyed the tax payer funded light show - snow flakes projected all over the building. A great winter evening walk, but there's a cold wind, so bundle up.

Make sure you get your tour tickets early during the day - they hand them out after 9 a.m., and they are free, but often all tour tickets are gone before 2 p.m. Worthwhile to visit and to learn about the Canadian Parliament system (don't miss out the great exhibit in the waiting area of how the system works....). Recommended...
We enjoyed exploring every nook and cranny... and the evening sound and light display. amazing!!!
The kids loved the library (only open on weekends when no parliamentarians around). It was a good walking trip and very interesting.Also, we enjoyed the sound and light show at nightfall outside.
The political heart of the country, its classic architecture and beautiful location and setting should not be missed.
we found difficult to stop and find a parking... no activity for New Year day... to bad!

Still FREE and still Great. Old Canadian architecture and construction where the leaders of the great nationof Canada debate the concerns of its citizens, not always in the best interest of it citizen! Government  cant please everybody!
Tours are free and interactive. You see and learn so much about how our country represents it's citizens! Go Canada!
the grounds are not so heavily covered by security, one can enjoy the beauty of the location.

One of the best views can be seen from atop the Peace Tower. If you do not wish to do that then at least go atop the banks at the rear of the building and look upon the waterways. There is centre block, east and west blocks. It is so worth the visit.
The Peace tower was immaculate and had a great view of the city. It was pretty cool to see the Museum of Civilization across the lake.

I must confess ..I 've been to Ottawa in all 4 seasons, but I hope this review will help you.If you think that Canada is nothing more then a bag of hockey pucks and polar bears then you have not...visited Canada..and especially Ottawa.The Parliament Buildings are located in the heart of Ottawa, everything and I mean everything is...
tour was interesting and informativeguides and staff were friendly and knowledgableall services were available in both french and english
Again NAC keeps this place spotless, never a piece of trash to be found (except for inside the building). Nice way to spend a day walking about in Ottawa.
Nice building, booooring people.. not much life in this place. It's like a museum where people try to work.. LOL

Parliament hill is an horror of free-masonic symbols with it's gargoyles, eternal flame, its peace tower with the clock, its collection of portraits of free-mason ex prime ministers. Avoid this creepy place. Since september 2001 the place is full of paranoid RCMPs.

I was in Ottawa recently for a business trip, and I was very fortunate to have some free time, so I decided to visit the Parliament Buildings and the Peace Tower. I am happy to report that the experience was memorable, and I would highly recommend any visitors to see these historic buildings when they visit Ottawa.
Excellent architecture and presence well deserving of our country's seats of power.Be sure to check out the Bell Tower and the north views of the Ottawa River and Quebec.
all dressed up for christmas very.colourful and a nice atmoshpere

* Nowdays, getting into a building like this can be pretty tough in the US and elsewhere. So, I was pleasantly surprised at how easy and accessible it was.* I think the crowds were missing [still fairly large groups were going through on a Saturday] as it was winter. I'd reccommend a visit if you are there in winter....
The building is beautiful and the guides are really great, it's a must-do!
Wether you go on your own, with family or with a large group, every Canadian should see up close the outside/inside of this great building and learn about the process of our government.
No visit to Ottawa is complete without a visit to Parliament Hill, a wish at the Eternal Flame and a tour inside. But be prepared to go through heavy security screening to get inside for the tour.
Good trails, excellent to walk around and absorb the surroundings. You get to see a lot of people walking/ jogging. Very peaceful & relaxing.

Very good and well organized tour taking you through the central building. You get to visit the library, House of Commons and the Senate house (depending on whether it is in session or not). Since we visited during the festive season, all the halls are adorned with decorations and multiple Christamas trees and lights. Definitely a must see in Ottawa....

It was my first trip to Parliament Hill and it was quite a Good Experience.I didn't have the chance for the guided tour however I did get the 'best' as I actually did sit in the gallery for 'Question Time.' It was quite enlightening watching the debates. I surely recommend a visit.

It was my first trip to Parliament Hill and it was quite a Good Experience.I didn't have the chance for the guided tour however I did get the 'best' as I actually did sit in the gallery for 'Question Time.' It was quite enlightening watching the debates. I surely recommend a visit.

Nice to see our seat of government and how beautiful the building is. The guides were all friendly and eager to answer any question. A tour takes about 45 minutes, so leaves you lots of time to explore more of the city.Go on the weekend to avoid class trips (crowds) and get to see a bit more of the...

What is a trip to Ottawa without seeing the Parliament Buildings? The buildings are rich in history and architecture. Regardless of the weather or whether or not you go inside, a visit to the Parliament Buildings won't disappoint you. After all, don't you want to see where all the Federal Government discussions / decisions are argued!
For the busy week ends, the Parliment buildings tours sell out quickly; so get there early to book yours. There are always things going on in the summer; so expect a free concert or some such event.
we were able to enjoy the tour & see how things operate in the house of commons.We took some amazing pictures...great family experience.
We liked it all. The buildings are so pretigious, the monuments incredible. Very clean city all around and the people are so nice, nothing like Toronto.
THis building can be toured and the interior is just as fabulous as the exterior. You can see where parliament sits, library and reception areas all beautifully outfitted in rick wood detailing.
We lucked out and saw a session in the house of commons. We were travelling with a small baby and all the gear, but the security staff were exceptionally pleasant and helpful!

Just recently we were driving by Parliament with some friends who commented that they have seen a lot of beautiful buildings in the world but none more beautiful than our very own Parliament Buildings. We never get tired of walking around the Parliament Buildings. The Library is a must see. The tour is very interesting.
we always go here when in Ottawa. They look so different in the different seasons

This is a "must see". The view from the Peace Tower is priceless. If one is able to get tickets for "Question Period", it is an odd experience. The buildings are very Canadian and historically awesome

I was happy to know that there is actually one attraction to do in Canada! Yes, you can go and take one of the many daily free guided tours to the Parliament of Canada (both in English and French).Guides are very well informed and are wiling to answer any question. At the Parliament buildings of Canada on the banks of the Ottawa river you can have a free outdoor tour of the art that abounds on the surrounding grounds.

Free comprehensive and interestiing tours of Parliament buildings including the senate. Peace Tower, Carillon, view of Ottawa and beautiful library. Uniquely Canadian, well preserved. I have been many, many times and it always so well done.

The guides on the tour are bilingual which is good. I would advise you pick a day the house is not sitting to get best of the tour and check the times so you can get to climb the Peace tower as it closes a half hour before the last tour.The must see of the tour is the Library,...
very historic building. good guides. very informative in many languages.will bring my kids the next time.
Impressive, especially wreaths laid for Remembrance Day.
All Canadians should go and see this! The history and beauty of the grounds and the building itself is worth a see.Make sure to bring your camera!
It's the Canadian Parliament. If you're Canadian you should go. Whether walking the grounds or taking a tour of the interior it is a beautiful thing to see!
quite massive. Lots of history and architecture is breath-taking

If you are in Ottawa and have 45 mins to spare, do NOT hesitate to take advantage of the bi-lingual tours offered here. As a Canadian you will be richer for the experience. If you are from abroad you can catch a glimpse of our heritage and the beauty of our diverse history. Tours are free but you must go...

We enjoyed our tour guide who is a student at the University majoring in History. We learned a lot from her, and she even tested us at the end of the tour! The peace tower has an amazing view of the city. Make sure you see it!

My first visit to Parliament in 20 years was memorable because the Zombie Walk had congregated on the Hill the day we went! It was very entertaining. The Parliament buildings themselves were closed unfortunately, but the walk around them was very nice.
A beautiful building inside and out. Interesting tour (free). It was a highlight.
Along with the Parliament Buildings, the Hill is the heart of Ottawa. From there is possible to see the Quebec side and enjoy the company of beavers.

The building are a great Gothic artwork. It is worth to wait to go inside both the House of Commons and the Senate.The best time to go is during elections, when the rooms are empty and the visitor are allowed to go inside.
Educational and interesting tour.!!!BRING YOUR FAMILY...ALL AGES

I love the Parliament Buildings. The best part is the Parliamentary Library. Not only is it the oldest part of the building, the architecture is beautiful. Also to be seen are the doors that saved the library from the fire the destroyed the rest of the building. The statuary around the building are interesting including the Famous Five.

No visit to Ottawa is complete without a visit to the beautiful Parliament building based on the gothic design of Parliament in London which shares a similar history (originally built in wood, burnt down, replaced in stone) The architecture is stunning and I really enjoyed the free tour followed by sitting in on Prime Ministers Question time in the House...
Yes, this is a beautiful site from which one has beautiful sights. The building itself is remarkable, especially the library at the rear, and the views from the back are very good.
A very interesting and beautiful building with many fine architectural features.

Only saw the building from the outside, but they were cool to see up close and to get picture of and with. Great pieces of architecture and of Canada's history. The ground are very well kept and in the summer its a very nice walk around them and parliament hill.
Its a good historical walk and being there in the summer you get to take advantage of the nice weather and the gardens. Lots of photo opportunities here. Free to walk around and explore the outside.
Amazing to think of history in the making - all of the decisions that made Canada what it is. The handmade carvings throughout are incredible. Question period was fascinating.
Toured Parliament Hill, and the Peace tower also went to Question period which was very interesting. Be prepared very tight security RCMP everywhere!
The views from the tower were magnificent and it was free to get in if you didn't want to see the rest of Parliament. We really enjoyed all the sculptures around the hill too.

The Parliament building is architecturally marvellous - a no-expense-spared, over-the-top prestige creation build to symbolise a nation and its pride. We can't believe that we didn't know about the show they put on at night on the parliament buildings, well done.

I went for an evening stroll of Parliament and city center. What an added treat to be greated with and amazing light show with the Parliament building as the backdrop. We always have a first and last walk of Parliament Hill every trip, and this was no exception. This was the most incredibly sunny and warm October weekend we've experienced on our girlfiends getaways. Beautiful!!!
This is a beautiful place, the guided tour is really nice and unexpensive, also the person guiding the tour seemed really passionate about what she was showing to us.
We went here nearly every day, the views are beautiful.
first time to Ottawa, very busy at the hill , lots of tour buses. Nice to visit the place from where our country is run. Ottawa is a beautiful city

Our tour guide Kirsten was great and she skillfully guided the group through the beautiful rooms. What an impressive building with so much interesting history.

The buildings are so amazing. It is quite an educational experience for the kids as well. Make sure you walk around the whole outside of the Buildings. I love the look of this place, especially after the 1 billion $ refurb! It is gorgeous. After visiting Parliament Hill, my gf asked me what else there was to do? I suggested a bar in the market area!

We visited Ottawa from London and went on one of the free tours of the parliament building while we were there. Amazing to see where our countries descions are made, views from the peace tower are incredible a must see if visisting Ottawa or if in the city

Went on a beautiful sunday afternoon. The Parliament buildings are an easy walking distance from down town. Get there in time to see the changing of the gaurds! but don't get there too early, because waiting is no fun.The green copper roofs are great!

The Gothic buildings at Parliament Hill are very impressive and we enjoyed a sunny summer afternoon strolling around the surrounding grounds and admiring the buildings. The Parliament in Ottawa is one of the most exquisite buildings you'll find in the world. It's a functional Gothic style building. The Parliament library is amazing too. A very impressive part of Ottawa. The architecture is very grand and the grounds of the Parliament building are very well kept and pretty.Enjoyed wandering around the grounds and enjoying the scenery, ran out of time for the tour but enjoyed what time we spent here. Lots of statues - night show is excellent.
